name: JOHN
line: Yeah, I’m not desperate to root around some bloke’s dirty underwear.

name: JOHN
line: What, some sort of code?

name: SHERLOCK
line: Obviously.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Why were they painted? If you want to communicate, why not use e-mail?

name: JOHN
line: Well, maybe he wasn’t answering.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Oh good. You follow.

name: JOHN
line: No.

name: SHERLOCK
line: What kind of a message would everyone try to avoid?

name: SHERLOCK
line: What about this morning – those letters you were looking at?

name: JOHN
line: Bills.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Yes. He was being threatened.

name: s VOICE
line: ... and see if you can get prints off this glass.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Ah, Sergeant. We haven’t met.

name: MAN
line: Yeah, I know who you are; and I’d prefer it if you didn’t tamper with any of the evidence.

name: SHERLOCK
line: I’ve phoned Lestrade. Is he on his way?

name: MAN
line: He’s busy. I’m in charge. And it’s not Sergeant; it’s Detective Inspector. Dimmock.

name: DIMMOCK
line: We’re obviously looking at a suicide.

name: JOHN
line: That does seem the only explanation of all the facts.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Wrong. It’s one possible explanation of some of the facts.

name: SHERLOCK
line: You’ve got a solution that you like, but you’re choosing to ignore anything you see that doesn’t comply with it.

name: DIMMOCK
line: Like?

name: SHERLOCK
line: The wound was on the right side of his head.

name: DIMMOCK
line: And?

name: SHERLOCK
line: Van Coon was left-handed.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Requires quite a bit of contortion.

name: DIMMOCK
line: Left-handed?

name: SHERLOCK
line: Coffee table on the left-hand side; coffee mug handle pointing to the left. Power sockets: habitually used the ones on the left ...

name: SHERLOCK
line: Pen and paper on the left-hand side of the phone because he picked it up with his right and took down messages with his left. D’you want me to go on?

name: SHERLOCK
line: Oh, I might as well; I’m almost at the bottom of the list.

name: SHERLOCK
line: It’s highly unlikely that a left-handed man would shoot himself in the right side of his head.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Conclusion: someone broke in here and murdered him. Only explanation of all the facts.

name: DIMMOCK
line: But the gun: why ...

name: DIMMOCK
line: What?

name: JOHN
line: Today at the bank. Sort of a warning.

name: SHERLOCK
line: He fired a shot when his attacker came in.

name: DIMMOCK
line: And the bullet?

name: SHERLOCK
line: Went through the open window.

name: DIMMOCK
line: Oh, come on! What are the chances of that?!

name: SHERLOCK
line: Wait until you get the ballistics report. The bullet in his brain wasn’t fired from his gun. I guarantee it.

name: DIMMOCK
line: But if his door was locked from the inside, how did the killer get in?

name: SHERLOCK
line: It was a threat. That’s what the graffiti meant.

name: SEBASTIAN
line: I’m kind of in a meeting. Can you make an appointment with my secretary?

name: SHERLOCK
line: I don’t think this can wait. Sorry, Sebastian. One of your traders – someone who worked in your office – was killed.

name: SEBASTIAN
line: What?

name: JOHN
line: Van Coon. The police are at his flat.

name: SEBASTIAN
line: Harrow; Oxford. Very bright guy. Worked in Asia for a while, so ...

name: JOHN
line: ... you gave him the Hong Kong accounts.

name: JOHN
line: Who’d wanna kill him?

name: SEBASTIAN
line: We all make enemies.

name: JOHN
line: You don’t all end up with a bullet through your temple.

name: SEBASTIAN
line: Not usually. ’Scuse me.

name: SEBASTIAN
line: It’s my Chairman. The police have been on to him. Apparently they’re telling him it was a suicide.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Well, they’ve got it wrong, Sebastian. He was murdered.

name: SEBASTIAN
line: Well, I’m afraid they don’t see it like that.

name: SEBASTIAN
line: ... and neither does my boss. I hired you to do a job. Don’t get side-tracked.

name: JOHN
line: I thought bankers were all supposed to be heartless bastards(!)

name: s note
line: those who’ve read the early draft script of this episode which was released online some time ago may know that it was intended that the frenetic drumbeat which we hear as the man turns around was actually meant to be heard by the man. In this finished version of the episode I don’t think that’s clear, and certainly I assumed until I read the draft script that it was simply dramatic backing music. Also, unless the killer was carrying a drum around with him, or had a boombox strapped to his back, I’m not sure how it could have happened anyway ...]

name: DIRECTOR
line: I need you to get over to Crispians.

name: DIRECTOR
line: Two Ming vases up for auction – Chenghua. Will you appraise them?

name: ANDY
line: Er, er, Soo Lin should go. She’s the expert.

name: DIRECTOR
line: Soo Lin has resigned her job. I need you.

name: SARAH
line: Just locum work.

name: JOHN
line: No, that’s fine.

name: SARAH
line: You’re, um ... well, you’re a bit over-qualified.

name: SARAH
line: Well, we’ve got two away on holiday this week, and one’s just left to have a baby. Might be a bit mundane for you.

name: JOHN
line: Er, no; mundane is good sometimes. Mundane works.

name: JOHN
line: And a doctor.

name: SARAH
line: Anything else you can do?

name: JOHN
line: I learned the clarinet at school.

name: SARAH
line: Oh! (She laughs.) Well, I look forward to it!

name: JOHN
line: What? When?

name: SHERLOCK
line: ’Bout an hour ago.

name: JOHN
line: Didn’t notice I’d gone out, then.

name: JOHN
line: Yeah, I went to see about a job at that surgery.

name: SHERLOCK
line: How was it?

name: SHERLOCK
line: Who?

name: SHERLOCK
line: “She”?

name: SHERLOCK
line: Here, have a look.

name: JOHN
line: Hmm?

name: and the article reads
line: An intruder who can walk through walls murdered a man in his London apartment last night. Brian Lukis, 41, a freelance journalist from Earl’s Court was found shot in his fourth floor flat but all his doors and windows were locked and there were no apparent signs of a break in. A police spokesman said they are still uncertain how the assailant broke in...)

name: JOHN
line: The ‘intruder who can walk through walls.’

name: SHERLOCK
line: Happened last night. Journalist shot dead in his flat; doors locked, windows bolted from the inside – exactly the same as Van Coon.

name: SHERLOCK
line: He’s killed another one.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Brian Lukis, freelance journalist. Murdered in his flat ...

name: SHERLOCK
line: ... doors locked from the inside.

name: JOHN
line: You’ve gotta admit, it’s similar.

name: JOHN
line: Both men killed by someone who can ... (he hesitates momentarily as if unable to believe what he’s about to say, but perseveres onwards) ... walk through solid walls.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Inspector, do you seriously believe that Eddie Van Coon was just another City suicide?

name: SHERLOCK
line: You have seen the ballistics report, I suppose?

name: SHERLOCK
line: And the shot that killed him: was it fired from his own gun?

name: SHERLOCK
line: No. So this investigation might move a bit quicker if you were to take my word as gospel.

name: SHERLOCK
line: I’ve just handed you a murder enquiry. (Louder, nodding towards the picture of Lukis on the computer) Five minutes in his flat.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Four floors up. That’s why they think they’re safe. Put a chain across the door and bolt it shut; think they’re impregnable.

name: SHERLOCK
line: They don’t reckon for one second that there’s another way in.

name: DIMMOCK
line: I don’t understand.

name: DIMMOCK
line: What are you doing?

name: SHERLOCK
line: He clings to the walls like an insect.

name: DIMMOCK
line: What?!

name: SHERLOCK
line: Climbed up the side of the walls, ran along the roof, dropped in through this skylight.

name: DIMMOCK
line: You’re not serious! Like Spiderman?(!)

name: SHERLOCK
line: He scaled six floors of a Docklands apartment building, jumped the balcony to kill Van Coon.

name: SHERLOCK
line: And of course that’s how he got into the bank. He ran along the window ledge and onto the terrace.

name: SHERLOCK
line: We have to find out what connects these two men.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Date stamped on the book is the same day that he died.

name: JOHN
line: Sherlock.

name: SHERLOCK
line: So, the killer goes to the bank, leaves a threatening cipher for Van Coon; Van Coon panics, returns to his apartment, locks himself in.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Hours later, he dies.

name: JOHN
line: The killer finds Lukis at the library; he writes the cipher on the shelf where he knows it’ll be seen; Lukis goes home.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Late that night, he dies too.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Only the cipher can tell us.

name: SHERLOCK
line: The world’s run on codes and ciphers, John. From the million-pound security system at the bank, to the PIN machine you took exception to, cryptography inhabits our every waking moment.

name: JOHN
line: Yes, okay, but ...

name: SHERLOCK
line: ... but it’s all computer-generated: electronic codes, electronic ciphering methods. This is different. It’s an ancient device. Modern code-breaking methods won’t unravel it.

name: JOHN
line: Where are we headed?

name: SHERLOCK
line: I need to ask some advice.

name: JOHN
line: What?! Sorry?!

name: SHERLOCK
line: You heard me perfectly. I’m not saying it again.

name: JOHN
line: You need advice?

name: SHERLOCK
line: On painting, yes. I need to talk to an expert.

name: RAZ
line: Part of a new exhibition.

name: RAZ
line: I call it Urban Bloodlust Frenzy.

name: JOHN
line: Catchy(!)

name: RAZ
line: Can we do this while I’m workin’?

name: SHERLOCK
line: Know the author?

name: RAZ
line: Recognise the paint. It’s like Michigan; hardcore propellant. I’d say zinc.

name: SHERLOCK
line: What about the symbols: d’you recognise them?

name: SHERLOCK
line: Two men have been murdered, Raz. Deciphering this is the key to finding out who killed them.

name: RAZ
line: What, and this is all you’ve got to go on? It’s hardly much, now, is it?

name: SHERLOCK
line: Are you gonna help us or not?

name: RAZ
line: I’ll ask around.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Somebody must know something about it.

name: COMMUNITY OFFICER
line: What the hell do you think you’re doing? This gallery is a listed public building.

name: JOHN
line: No, no, wait, wait. It’s not me who painted that.

name: JOHN
line: I was just holding this for ...

name: COMMUNITY OFFICER
line: Bit of an enthusiast, are we?

name: ANDY
line: She was right in the middle of an important piece of restoration. Why would she suddenly resign?

name: DIRECTOR
line: Family problems. She said so in her letter.

name: ANDY
line: But she doesn’t have a family. She came to this country on her own.

name: DIRECTOR
line: Andy ...

name: ANDY
line: Look, those teapots, those ceramics: they’ve become her obsession. She’s been working on restoring them for weeks. I-I can’t believe that she would just abandon them.

name: DIRECTOR
line: Perhaps she was getting a bit of unwanted attention.

name: JOHN
line: Just formalities: fingerprints, charge sheet; and I’ve gotta be in Magistrates Court on Tuesday.

name: This symbol
line: I still can’t place it.

name: SHERLOCK
line: No, I need you to go to the police station ...

name: SHERLOCK
line: ... ask about the journalist.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Gonna go and see Van Coon’s P.A. If we retrace their steps, somewhere they’ll coincide.

name: JOHN
line: Scotland Yard.

name: TAXI DRIVER
line: Right.

name: AMANDA
line: Flew back from Dalian Friday. Looks like he had back-to-back meetings with the sales team.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Can you print me up a copy?

name: AMANDA
line: Sure.

name: SHERLOCK
line: What about the day he died? Can you tell me where he was?

name: AMANDA
line: I have all his receipts.

name: DIMMOCK
line: Your friend ...

name: JOHN
line: Listen: whatever you say, I’m behind you one hundred percent.

name: DIMMOCK
line: ... he’s an arrogant sod.

name: JOHN
line: Well, that was mild! People say a lot worse than that.

name: DIMMOCK
line: This is what you wanted, isn’t it? The journalist’s diary?

name: SHERLOCK
line: What kind of a boss was he, Amanda? Appreciative?

name: AMANDA
line: Um, no. That’s not a word I’d use. The only things Eddie appreciated had a big price tag.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Like that hand cream. He bought that for you, didn’t he?

name: SHERLOCK
line: Look at this one. Got a taxi from home on the day he died. Eighteen pounds fifty.

name: AMANDA
line: That would get him to the office.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Not rush hour; check the time. Mid-morning. Eighteen would get him as far as ...

name: AMANDA
line: The West End. I remember him saying.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Underground. Printed at one in Piccadilly.

name: AMANDA
line: So he got a Tube back to the office. Why would he get a taxi into town and then the Tube back?

name: AMANDA
line: Delivering?

name: SHERLOCK
line: To somewhere near Piccadilly Station. Dropped the package, delivered it and then ...

name: SHERLOCK
line: ... stopped on his way. He got peckish.

name: SHERLOCK
line: So you bought your lunch from here en route to the station, but where were you headed from? Where did the taxi drop you ...?

name: JOHN
line: Right.

name: JOHN
line: Sherlock ...

name: SHERLOCK
line: ... credit card bills, receipts. He flew back from China, then he came here.

name: JOHN
line: Sherlock ...

name: SHERLOCK
line: Somewhere in this street; somewhere near. I don’t know where, but ...

name: SHERLOCK
line: How can you tell?

name: JOHN
line: Lukis’ diary. (He shows Sherlock the entry.) He was here too. He wrote down the address.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Oh.

name: JOHN
line: Hello.

name: SHOP KEEPER
line: You want lucky cat?

name: JOHN
line: No, thanks. No.

name: SHOP KEEPER
line: Ten pound. Ten pound!

name: JOHN
line: No.

name: SHOP KEEPER
line: I think your wife, she will like!

name: JOHN
line: No, thank you.

name: JOHN
line: Sherlock.

name: JOHN
line: The label there.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Yes, I see it.

name: JOHN
line: Exactly the same as the cipher.

name: SHERLOCK
line: It’s an ancient number system! Hangzhou.

name: SHERLOCK
line: These days, only street traders use it. Those were numbers written on the wall at the bank and at the library.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Numbers written in an ancient Chinese dialect.

name: JOHN
line: It’s a fifteen! What we thought was the artist’s tag – it’s a number fifteen.

name: SHERLOCK
line: And the blindfold – the horizontal line? That was a number as well.

name: JOHN
line: We’ve found it!

name: JOHN
line: Two men travel back from China. Both head straight for the Lucky Cat emporium. What did they see?

name: SHERLOCK
line: It’s not what they saw; it’s what they both brought back in those suitcases.

name: JOHN
line: And you don’t mean duty free.

name: JOHN
line: Thank you.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Think about what Sebastian told us; about Van Coon – about how he stayed afloat in the market.

name: JOHN
line: Lost five million ...

name: SHERLOCK
line: ... made it back in a week.

name: JOHN
line: Mmm.

name: SHERLOCK
line: That’s how he made such easy money.

name: JOHN
line: He was a smuggler. Mmm.

name: SHERLOCK
line: A guy like him – it would have been perfect.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Business man ...

name: JOHN
line: Mmm-hmm.

name: SHERLOCK
line: ... making frequent trips to Asia. And Lukis was the same ...

name: SHERLOCK
line: ... a journalist writing about China.

name: JOHN
line: Mmm.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Both of them smuggled stuff out, and the Lucky Cat was their drop-off.

name: JOHN
line: But why did they die? I mean, it doesn’t make sense. If they both turn up at the shop and deliver the goods, why would someone threaten them and kill them after the event, after they’d finished the job?

name: SHERLOCK
line: What if one of them was light-fingered?

name: JOHN
line: How d’you mean?

name: SHERLOCK
line: Stole something; something from the hoard.

name: JOHN
line: And the killer doesn’t know which of them took it, so he threatens them both. Right.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Remind me ...

name: SHERLOCK
line: ... when was the last time that it rained?

name: SHERLOCK
line: It’s been here since Monday.

name: SHERLOCK
line: No-one’s been in that flat for at least three days.

name: JOHN
line: Could’ve gone on holiday.

name: SHERLOCK
line: D’you leave your windows open when you go on holiday?

name: JOHN
line: Sherlock!

name: SHERLOCK
line: Someone else has been here.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Somebody else broke into the flat and knocked over the vase just like I did.

name: JOHN
line: Can you not keep doing this, please?

name: SHERLOCK
line: I’m not the first.

name: JOHN
line: What?

name: JOHN
line: What are you saying?

name: JOHN
line: I’m wasting my breath.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Our acrobat.

name: SHERLOCK
line: But why didn’t he close the window when he left ...?

name: SHERLOCK
line: Oh, stupid. Stupid. Obvious. He’s still here.

name: JOHN
line: Any time you want to include me.

name: JOHN
line: “... my MASSIVE INTELLECT!”

name: SHERLOCK
line: The, uh, milk’s gone off and the washing’s starting to smell. Somebody left here in a hurry three days ago.

name: JOHN
line: Somebody?

name: JOHN
line: But how, exactly?

name: On the back of it is written
Printed in the bottom right hand corner is
JOHN
line: You’ve gone all croaky. Are you getting a cold?

name: SHERLOCK
line: When was the last time that you saw her?

name: ANDY
line: Three days ago, um, here at the museum.

name: ANDY
line: This morning they told me she’d resigned just like that.

name: ANDY
line: Just left her work unfinished.

name: ANDY
line: She does this demonstration for the tourists – a-a tea ceremony. So she would have packed up her things and just put them in here.

name: SHERLOCK
line: We have to get to Soo Lin Yao.

name: JOHN
line: If she’s still alive.

name: RAZ
line: Sherlock!

name: JOHN
line: Oh, look who it is.

name: JOHN
line: Tuesday morning, all you’ve gotta do is turn up and say the bag was yours.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Forget about your court date.

name: GIRL
line: Dude, that was rad!

name: SHERLOCK
line: If you want to hide a tree, then a forest is the best place to do it, wouldn’t you say? People would just walk straight past, not knowing, unable to decipher the message.

name: RAZ
line: There. I spotted it earlier.

name: SHERLOCK
line: They have been in here. (To Raz) And that’s the exact same paint?

name: RAZ
line: Yeah.

name: SHERLOCK
line: John, if we’re going to decipher this code, we’re gonna need to look for more evidence.

name: JOHN
line: It’s been painted over!

name: JOHN
line: I don’t understand. It-it was here ... (he stumbles backwards) ... ten minutes ago. I saw it. A whole load of graffiti!

name: SHERLOCK
line: Somebody doesn’t want me to see it.

name: JOHN
line: Hey, Sherlock, what are you doing ...?

name: SHERLOCK
line: Shh, John, concentrate. I need you to concentrate. Close your eyes.

name: JOHN
line: No, what? Why? Why?

name: JOHN
line: What are you doing?!

name: SHERLOCK
line: I need you to maximise your visual memory. Try to picture what you saw. Can you picture it?

name: JOHN
line: Yeah.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Can you remember it?

name: JOHN
line: Yes, definitely.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Can you remember the pattern?

name: JOHN
line: Yes!

name: SHERLOCK
line: How much can you remember it?

name: JOHN
line: Well, don’t worry ...

name: JOHN
line: Yeah, well, don’t worry – I remember all of it.

name: JOHN
line: Yeah, well at least I would ... (he pulls himself free) ... if I can get to my pockets!

name: JOHN
line: I took a photograph.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Always in pairs, John.

name: JOHN
line: Hmm?

name: SHERLOCK
line: Numbers come with partners.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Why did he paint it so near the tracks?

name: SHERLOCK
line: Thousands of people pass by there every day.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Of course! He wants information. He’s trying to communicate with his people in the underworld. Whatever was stolen, he wants it back.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Somewhere here in the code.

name: SHERLOCK
line: We can’t crack this without Soo Lin Yao.

name: JOHN
line: Oh, good(!)

name: SHERLOCK
line: Two men who travelled back from China were murdered, and their killer left them messages in the Hangzhou numerals.

name: JOHN
line: Soo Lin Yao’s in danger. Now, that cipher – it was just the same pattern as the others. He means to kill her as well.

name: ANDY
line: Look, I’ve tried everywhere: um, friends, colleagues. I-I don’t know where she’s gone. I mean, she could be a thousand miles away.

name: JOHN
line: What are you looking at?

name: ANDY
line: Th-the pots were her obsession. Um, they need urgent work. If-if they dry out, then the clay can start to crumble. Apparently you have to just keep making tea in them.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Yesterday, only one of those pots was shining. Now there are two.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Fancy a biscuit with that?

name: SHERLOCK
line: Centuries old. Don’t wanna break that.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Hello.

name: SOO LIN
line: You saw the cipher. Then you know he is coming for me.

name: SHERLOCK
line: You’ve been clever to avoid him so far.

name: SOO LIN
line: I had to finish ... to finish this work. It’s only a matter of time. I know he will find me.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Who is he? Have you met him before?

name: SHERLOCK
line: The cipher.

name: SOO LIN
line: Only he would do this. Zhi Zhu.

name: JOHN
line: Zhi Zhu?

name: SHERLOCK
line: The Spider.

name: SOO LIN
line: You know this mark?

name: SHERLOCK
line: Yes. It’s the mark of a Tong.

name: JOHN
line: Hmm?

name: SHERLOCK
line: Ancient crime syndicate based in China.

name: SOO LIN
line: Every foot soldier bears the mark; everyone who hauls for them.

name: JOHN
line: “Hauls”?

name: JOHN
line: Y-you mean you were a smuggler?

name: SOO LIN
line: I was fifteen. My parents were dead. I had no livelihood; no way of surviving day to day except to work for the bosses.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Who are they?

name: SOO LIN
line: They are called the Black Lotus. By the time I was sixteen, I was taking thousands of pounds’ worth of drugs across the border into Hong Kong. But I managed to leave that life behind me. I came to England.

name: SOO LIN
line: They gave me a job here. Everything was good; a new life.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Then he came looking for you.

name: SOO LIN
line: Yes.

name: SOO LIN
line: I had hoped after five years maybe they would have forgotten me, but they never really let you leave. A small community like ours – they are never very far away.

name: SOO LIN
line: He came to my flat. He asked me to help him to track down something that was stolen.

name: JOHN
line: And you’ve no idea what it was?

name: SOO LIN
line: I refused to help.

name: SOO LIN
line: Oh yes.

name: SOO LIN
line: He’s my brother.

name: SOO LIN
line: Two orphans. We had no choice. We could work for the Black Lotus, or starve on the streets like beggars.

name: SOO LIN
line: My brother has become their puppet, in the power of the one they call Shan – the Black Lotus general.

name: SOO LIN
line: I turned my brother away. He said I had betrayed him. Next day I came to work and the cipher was waiting.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Can you decipher these?

name: SOO LIN
line: These are numbers.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Yes, I know.

name: Here
line: the line across the man’s eyes – it’s the Chinese number one.

name: SOO LIN
line: All the smugglers know it. It’s based upon a book ...

name: JOHN
line: Sh-Sherlock. Sherlock, wait!

name: JOHN
line: Come here.

name: JOHN
line: Get in. Get in!

name: JOHN
line: I have to go and help. Bolt the door after me.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Thank you(!)

name: SOO LIN
line: 亮 [Liang.]

name: SOO LIN
line: 大哥 [Big brother.]

name: SOO LIN
line: 请你 [Please ...]

name: JOHN
line: Oh my God.

name: JOHN
line: How many murders is it gonna take before you start believing that this maniac’s out there?

name: JOHN
line: A young girl was gunned down tonight. That’s three victims in three days. You’re supposed to be finding him.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Brian Lukis and Eddie Van Coon were working for a gang of international smugglers – a gang called the Black Lotus operating here in London right under your nose.

name: DIMMOCK
line: Can you prove that?

name: SHERLOCK
line: What are you thinking: pork or the pasta?

name: MOLLY
line: Oh, it’s you!

name: SHERLOCK
line: This place is never going to trouble Egon Ronay, is it?

name: SHERLOCK
line: I’d stick with the pasta. Don’t wanna be doing roast pork – not if you’re slicing up cadavers.

name: MOLLY

name: it seems that the stage is not going to be used
line: a circle of candles has been laid out in the middle of the floor, about thirty feet in diameter. The room is dimly lit. The patrons are gathering around the circle but there are no seats. Apparently the number of tickets has been limited and there’s room for everyone to stand around the circle with a clear view. Sarah and John stand side by side while Sherlock stands behind them with his back to them, looking all around the room and peering up to the ceiling. John talks quietly over his shoulder to his flatmate, turning his head away from Sarah so that she can’t hear.
