line: Sherlock. Sherlock!

name: SHERLOCK
line: Hmm? What? (He looks around at the mess of broken glass and scattered paperwork as if he has forgotten it – which he probably has.) Oh, yeah. Fine. Gas leak, apparently.

name: SHERLOCK
line: I can’t.

name: MYCROFT
line: “Can’t”?

name: SHERLOCK
line: The stuff I’ve got on is just too big. I can’t spare the time.

name: MYCROFT
line: Never mind your usual trivia. This is of national importance.

name: MYCROFT
line: I’m afraid my brother can be very intransigent.

name: SHERLOCK
line: If you’re so keen, why don’t you investigate it?

name: MYCROFT
line: No-no-no-no-no. I can’t possibly be away from the office for any length of time – not with the Korean elections so ...

name: MYCROFT
line: Well, you don’t need to know about that, do you?

name: MYCROFT
line: Besides, a case like this – it requires ... (he grimaces in distaste) ... legwork.

name: SHERLOCK
line: How’s Sarah, John? How was the lilo?

name: SHERLOCK
line: Oh yes, of course.

name: MYCROFT
line: Sherlock’s business seems to be booming since you and he became ... pals.

name: JOHN
line: I’m never bored.

name: MYCROFT
line: Andrew West, known as Westie to his friends.

name: MYCROFT
line: A civil servant, found dead on the tracks at Battersea Station this morning with his head smashed in.

name: JOHN
line: Jumped in front of a train?

name: MYCROFT
line: Seems the logical assumption.

name: MYCROFT
line: “But”?

name: JOHN
line: Well, you wouldn’t be here if it was just an accident.

name: MYCROFT
line: The M.O.D. is working on a new missile defence system – the Bruce-Partington Programme, it’s called.

name: MYCROFT
line: The plans for it were on a memory stick.

name: JOHN
line: That wasn’t very clever.

name: JOHN
line: Oh.

name: MYCROFT
line: But it is secret. And missing.

name: JOHN
line: Top secret?

name: MYCROFT
line: Very. We think West must have taken the memory stick. We can’t possibly risk it falling into the wrong hands.

name: MYCROFT
line: You’ve got to find those plans, Sherlock. Don’t make me order you.

name: SHERLOCK
line: I’d like to see you try.

name: MYCROFT
line: Goodbye, John.

name: MYCROFT
line: See you very soon.

name: JOHN
line: Why’d you lie?

name: JOHN
line: You’ve got nothing on – not a single case. That’s why the wall took a pounding. Why did you tell your brother you were busy?

name: JOHN
line: Oh! (He nods.) Oh, I see.

name: JOHN
line: Sibling rivalry. Now we’re getting somewhere.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Of course. How could I refuse?

name: SHERLOCK
line: Lestrade. I’ve been summoned. Coming?

name: JOHN
line: If you want me to.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Of course.

name: SHERLOCK
line: I’d be lost without my blogger.

name: LESTRADE
line: You like the funny cases, don’t you? The surprising ones.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Obviously.

name: LESTRADE
line: You’ll love this. That explosion ...

name: LESTRADE
line: No.

name: SHERLOCK
line: No?

name: LESTRADE
line: No. Made to look like one.

name: JOHN
line: What?

name: LESTRADE
line: Hardly anything left of the place except a strong box – a very strong box – and inside it was this.

name: SHERLOCK
line: You haven’t opened it?

name: LESTRADE
line: It’s addressed to you, isn’t it?

name: LESTRADE
line: We’ve X-rayed it. It’s not booby-trapped.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Nice stationery. Bohemian.

name: LESTRADE
line: What?

name: SHERLOCK
line: From the Czech Republic. No fingerprints?

name: LESTRADE
line: No.

name: JOHN
line: “She”?

name: SHERLOCK
line: Obviously.

name: LESTRADE
line: What, from the Study in Pink?

name: SHERLOCK
line: Well, obviously it’s not the same phone but it’s supposed to look like ...

name: SHERLOCK
line: The Study in Pink? You read his blog?

name: LESTRADE
line: Course I read his blog! We all do. D’you really not know that the Earth goes round the Sun?

name: SHERLOCK
line: It isn’t the same phone. This one’s brand new.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Someone’s gone to a lot of trouble to make it look like the same phone, which means your blog has a far wider readership.

name: VOICE ALERT
line: You have one new message.

name: JOHN
line: Is that it?

name: SHERLOCK
line: No. That’s not it.

name: LESTRADE
line: What the hell are we supposed to make of that? An estate agent’s photo and the bloody Greenwich pips!

name: JOHN
line: A warning?

name: SHERLOCK
line: Some secret societies used to send dried melon seeds, orange pips, things like that. Five pips. They’re warning us it’s gonna happen again.

name: SHERLOCK
line: And I’ve seen this place before.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Mrs Hudson!

name: MRS HUDSON
line: You had a look, didn’t you, Sherlock, when you first came to see about your flat.

name: MRS HUDSON
line: No, can’t be. That’s the only key.

name: MRS HUDSON
line: I can’t get anyone interested in this flat. It’s the damp, I expect. That’s the curse of basements.

name: MRS HUDSON
line: I had a place once when I was first married. Black mould all up the walls ...

name: The room looks exactly as it did in the photograph on the phone with one exception
line: there is a pair of trainers placed neatly side by side in the middle of the floor, their toes pointed towards the door. John stops and looks at them before stating the bleedin’ obvious.

name: JOHN
line: Shoes.

name: JOHN
line: He’s a bomber, remember.

name: s VOICE
line: H-hello ... sexy.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Who’s this?

name: SHERLOCK
line: Who’s talking? Why are you crying?

name: WOMAN
line: ... and this ... stupid ... bitch ... is reading it out.

name: JOHN
line: What?

name: SHERLOCK
line: Nothing.

name: JOHN
line: No, what did you mean?

name: WOMAN
line: Twelve hours to solve ... my puzzle, Sherlock ...

name: WOMAN
line: ... or I’m going ... to be ... so naughty.

name: JOHN
line: So, who d’you suppose it was?

name: JOHN
line: The woman on the phone – the crying woman.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Oh, she doesn’t matter. She’s just a hostage. No lead there.

name: SHERLOCK
line: You’re not going to be much use to her.

name: JOHN
line: Are-are they trying to trace it, trace the call?

name: SHERLOCK
line: The bomber’s too smart for that.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Pass me my phone.

name: JOHN
line: Where is it?

name: SHERLOCK
line: Jacket.

name: JOHN
line: Text from your brother.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Delete it.

name: JOHN
line: Delete it?

name: SHERLOCK
line: Missile plans are out of the country now. Nothing we can do about it.

name: RE
line: BRUCE-PARTINGTON PLANS

name: JOHN
line: Well, Mycroft thinks there is. He’s texted you eight times. Must be important.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Then why didn’t he cancel his dental appointment?

name: SHERLOCK
line: Mycroft never texts if he can talk. Look, Andrew West stole the missile plans, tried to sell them, got his head smashed in for his pains. End of story. The only mystery is this: why is my brother so determined to bore me when somebody else is being so delightfully interesting?

name: SHERLOCK
line: What for?

name: SHERLOCK
line: This hospital’s full of people dying, Doctor. Why don’t you go and cry by their bedside and see what good it does them?

name: MOLLY
line: Any luck?

name: JIM
line: Oh, sorry. I didn’t ...

name: MOLLY
line: Jim! Hi!

name: MOLLY
line: Come in! Come in!

name: MOLLY
line: Jim, this is Sherlock Holmes.

name: JIM
line: Ah!

name: JOHN
line: John Watson. Hi.

name: JIM
line: Hi.

name: JIM
line: So you’re Sherlock Holmes. Molly’s told me all about you. You on one of your cases?

name: MOLLY
line: Jim works in I.T. upstairs. That’s how we met. Office romance.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Gay.

name: MOLLY
line: Sorry, what?

name: SHERLOCK
line: Nothing. (He smiles round falsely at Jim.) Um, hey.

name: JIM
line: Well, I’d better be off. I’ll see you at The Fox, ’bout six-ish?

name: MOLLY
line: Yeah!

name: JIM
line: ’Bye.

name: JOHN
line: You too.

name: MOLLY
line: What d’you mean, gay? We’re together.

name: MOLLY
line: Two and a half.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Nuh, three.

name: JOHN
line: Sherlock ...

name: JOHN
line: Because he puts a bit of product in his hair? I put product in my hair.

name: SHERLOCK
line: You wash your hair. There’s a difference. No-no – tinted eyelashes; clear signs of taurine cream around the frown lines; those tired clubber’s eyes. Then there’s his underwear.

name: MOLLY
line: His underwear?

name: SHERLOCK
line: Visible above the waistline – very visible; very particular brand.

name: SHERLOCK
line: That, plus the extremely suggestive fact that he just left his number under this dish here ... (he shows her the card that Jim left under the dish) ... and I’d say you’d better break it off now and save yourself the pain.

name: JOHN
line: Charming. Well done.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Just saving her time. Isn’t that kinder?

name: JOHN
line: “Kinder”? No, no, Sherlock. That wasn’t kind.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Go on, then.

name: JOHN
line: Mmm?

name: SHERLOCK
line: You know what I do. Off you go.

name: JOHN
line: No.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Go on.

name: JOHN
line: I’m not gonna stand here so you can humiliate me while I try and disseminate ...

name: JOHN
line: Yeah, right(!)

name: SHERLOCK
line: Really.

name: JOHN
line: Fine.

name: JOHN
line: I dunno – they’re just a pair of shoes. (He immediately corrects himself.) Trainers.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Good.

name: JOHN
line: Umm ... they’re in good nick. I’d say they were pretty new ... except the sole has been well-worn, so the owner must have had them for a while.

name: JOHN
line: Uh, they’re very eighties – probably one of those retro designs.

name: SHERLOCK
line: You’re on sparkling form. What else?

name: JOHN
line: Well, they’re quite big, so a man’s.

name: SHERLOCK
line: But ...?

name: JOHN
line: Uh ... (he looks again at the shoe he’s holding, then puts it down) ... that’s it.

name: SHERLOCK
line: That’s it?

name: JOHN
line: How did I do?

name: SHERLOCK
line: Well, John; really well.

name: SHERLOCK
line: I mean, you missed almost everything of importance, but, um, you know ...

name: SHERLOCK
line: The owner loved these. Scrubbed them clean, whitened them where they got discoloured. Changed the laces three ... no, four times.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Even so, there are traces of his flaky skin where his fingers have come into contact with them, so he suffered from eczema. Shoes are well-worn, more so on the inside, which means the owner had weak arches. British-made, twenty years old.

name: SHERLOCK
line: They’re not retro – they’re original.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Limited edition: two blue stripes, nineteen eighty-nine.

name: JOHN
line: But there’s still mud on them. They look new.

name: JOHN
line: How do you know?

name: SHERLOCK
line: South of the river, too. So, the kid who owned these trainers came to London from Sussex twenty years ago and left them behind.

name: JOHN
line: So what happened to him?

name: SHERLOCK
line: Something bad.

name: SHERLOCK
line: He loved those shoes, remember. He’d never leave them filthy. Wouldn’t leave them go unless he had to. So: a child with big feet gets ...

name: JOHN
line: What?

name: JOHN
line: Sorry, who?

name: JOHN
line: What is it?

name: SHERLOCK
line: It’s where I began.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Nineteen eighty-nine, a young kid – champion swimmer – came up from Brighton for a school sports tournament; drowned in the pool. Tragic accident.

name: SHERLOCK
line: You wouldn’t remember it. Why should you?

name: JOHN
line: But you remember.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Yes.

name: JOHN
line: Something fishy about it?

name: SHERLOCK
line: Nobody thought so – nobody except me. I was only a kid myself. I read about it in the papers.

name: JOHN
line: Started young, didn’t you?

name: SHERLOCK
line: The boy, Carl Powers, had some kind of fit in the water, but by the time they got him out it was too late. But there was something wrong; something I couldn’t get out of my head.

name: JOHN
line: What?

name: SHERLOCK
line: His shoes.

name: JOHN
line: What about them?

name: SHERLOCK
line: They weren’t there. I made a fuss; I tried to get the police interested, but nobody seemed to think it was important. He’d left all the rest of his clothes in his locker, but there was no sign of his shoes ...

name: SHERLOCK
line: ... until now.

name: JOHN
line: Can I help?

name: JOHN
line: I want to help. There’s only five hours left.

name: JOHN
line: It’s your brother. He’s texting me now.

name: JOHN
line: How does he know my number?

name: JOHN
line: Look, he did say ‘national importance.’

name: SHERLOCK
line: How quaint.

name: JOHN
line: What is?

name: SHERLOCK
line: You are. Queen and country.

name: SHERLOCK
line: I’m not ignoring it. Putting my best man onto it right now.

name: JOHN
line: Right. Good.

name: JOHN
line: Who’s that?

name: MYCROFT
line: John. How nice. I was hoping you wouldn’t be long.

name: MYCROFT
line: How can I help you?

name: JOHN
line: Thank you. (He sits.) Um, well, I was wanting to ... um, your brother sent me to collect more facts about the stolen plans, the missile plans.

name: MYCROFT
line: Did he?

name: JOHN
line: Yes.

name: JOHN
line: He’s investigating now.

name: JOHN
line: He’s, er, investigating away.

name: JOHN
line: Um, I just wondered what else you can tell me about the dead man.

name: MYCROFT
line: Uh, twenty-seven; a clerk at Vauxhall Cross – er, MI6. He was involved in the Bruce-Partington Programme in a minor capacity. Security checks A-OK; no known terrorist affiliations or sympathies ...

name: MYCROFT
line: Last seen by his fiancée at ten thirty yesterday evening.

name: WESTIE
line: Lucy, love, I’ve gotta go out. I’ve gotta see someone.

name: LUCY
line: Westie!

name: JOHN
line: Right. He was found at Battersea, yes? So he got on the train.

name: MYCROFT
line: No.

name: JOHN
line: What?

name: MYCROFT
line: He had an Oyster card ...

name: MYCROFT
line: ... but it hadn’t been used.

name: JOHN
line: Must have bought a ticket.

name: JOHN
line: Then ...

name: MYCROFT
line: Then how did he end up with a bashed-in brain on the tracks at Battersea? That is the question – the one I was rather hoping Sherlock would provide an answer to. How’s he getting on?

name: JOHN
line: He-he’s fine, yes. Oh, and-and it is going ... very well. It’s, um, you know – he’s completely focussed on it.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Poison.

name: MRS HUDSON
line: What you going on about?

name: SHERLOCK
line: Clostridium botulinum!

name: SHERLOCK
line: It’s one of the deadliest poisons on the planet!

name: SHERLOCK
line: Carl Powers!

name: JOHN
line: Oh, wait, are you saying he was murdered?

name: SHERLOCK
line: Remember the shoelaces?

name: JOHN
line: Mmm.

name: SHERLOCK
line: The boy suffered from eczema. It’d be the easiest thing in the world to introduce the poison into his medication. Two hours later he comes up to London, the poison takes effect, paralyses the muscles and he drowns.

name: JOHN
line: What – how-how come the autopsy didn’t pick that up?

name: SHERLOCK
line: It’s virtually undetectable. Nobody would have been looking for it.

name: and he now begins to type into the message box
He bends down and continues to type
SHERLOCK
line: That’s why they had to go.

name: JOHN
line: So how do we let the bomber know ...

name: SHERLOCK
line: Get his attention ...

name: JOHN
line: Mm-hm.

name: JOHN
line: The killer kept the shoes all these years.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Yes. (He looks at John.) Meaning ...

name: JOHN
line: He’s our bomber.

name: WOMAN
line: Well done, you. Come and get me.

name: LESTRADE
line: She lives in Cornwall. Two men broke in wearing masks, forced her to drive to the car park and decked her out in enough explosives to take down a house.

name: LESTRADE
line: Told her to phone you. She had to read out from this pager.

name: SHERLOCK
line: And if she deviated by one word, the sniper would set her off.

name: JOHN
line: Or if you hadn’t solved the case.

name: JOHN
line: “Elegant”?

name: LESTRADE
line: But what was the point? Why would anyone do this?

name: SHERLOCK
line: Oh – I can’t be the only person in the world that gets bored.

name: VOICE ALERT
line: You have one new message.

name: JOHN
line: Four pips.

name: SHERLOCK
line: First test passed, it would seem. Here’s the second.

name: SHERLOCK
line: It’s abandoned, wouldn’t you say?

name: LESTRADE
line: I’ll see if it’s been reported.

name: DONOVAN
line: Freak, it’s for you.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Hello?

name: YOUNG MAN
line: It’s okay that you’ve gone to the police.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Who is this? Is this you again?

name: YOUNG MAN
line: But don’t rely on them.

name: YOUNG MAN
line: Clever you, guessing about Carl Powers.

name: YOUNG MAN
line: I never liked him.

name: YOUNG MAN
line: Carl laughed at me, so I stopped him laughing.

name: YOUNG MAN
line: This is about you and me.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Who are you?

name: SHERLOCK
line: What’s that noise?

name: YOUNG MAN
line: The sounds of life, Sherlock.

name: YOUNG MAN
line: ... I can soon fix that.

name: YOUNG MAN
line: You solved my last puzzle in nine hours. This time you have eight.

name: LESTRADE
line: Okay ... Great.

name: LESTRADE
line: We’ve found it.

name: LESTRADE
line: Told his wife he was going away on a business trip, but he never arrived.

name: DONOVAN
line: You’re still hanging round him.

name: JOHN
line: Yeah, well ...

name: DONOVAN
line: Opposites attract, I suppose.

name: JOHN
line: No, we’re not ...

name: DONOVAN
line: You should get yourself a hobby – stamps, maybe. Model trains. Safer.

name: LESTRADE
line: Before you ask, yes, it’s Monkford’s blood. The DNA checks out.

name: SHERLOCK
line: No body.

name: DONOVAN
line: Not yet.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Mrs Monkford?

name: MRS MONKFORD
line: Yes.

name: MRS MONKFORD
line: Sorry, but I’ve already spoken with two policemen.

name: JOHN
line: No, we’re not from the police; we’re ...

name: SHERLOCK
line: Sherlock Holmes. Very old friend of your husband’s. We, um ...

name: SHERLOCK
line: ... we grew up together.

name: MRS MONKFORD
line: I’m sorry, who? I don’t think he ever mentioned you.

name: SHERLOCK
line: I mean, I just can’t believe it. I only saw him the other day. Same old Ian – not a care in the world.

name: MRS MONKFORD
line: Sorry, but my husband has been depressed for months. Who are you?

name: SHERLOCK
line: Really strange that he hired a car. Why would he do that? It’s a bit suspicious, isn’t it?

name: MRS MONKFORD
line: No, it isn’t. He forgot to renew the tax on the car, that’s all.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Oh, well, that was Ian! That was Ian all over!

name: MRS MONKFORD
line: No it wasn’t.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Wasn’t it? Interesting.

name: MRS MONKFORD
line: Who was I talking to?

name: JOHN
line: Sorry, what?

name: SHERLOCK
line: I referred to her husband in the past tense. She joined in. Bit premature – they’ve only just found the car.

name: JOHN
line: You think she murdered her husband?

name: SHERLOCK
line: Definitely not. That’s not a mistake a murderer would make.

name: JOHN
line: I see. No, I don’t. What am I seeing?

name: DONOVAN
line: Fishing! Try fishing!

name: JOHN
line: Where now?

name: SHERLOCK
line: Janus Cars.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Just found this in the glove compartment.

name: EWERT
line: Can’t see how I can help you gentlemen.

name: JOHN
line: Mr Monkford hired the car from you yesterday.

name: EWERT
line: Yeah. Lovely motor. Mazda RX-8. Wouldn’t mind one of them myself!

name: SHERLOCK
line: Is that one?

name: EWERT
line: No, they’re all Jags. Yeah, I can see you’re not a car man, eh?

name: SHERLOCK
line: But, er, surely you can afford one – a Mazda, I mean?

name: EWERT
line: Yeah, it’s a fair point. But you know how it is: it’s like working in a sweetshop. Once you start picking at the liquorice allsorts, when does it all stop, eh?

name: JOHN
line: But you didn’t know Mr Monkford?

name: EWERT
line: No, he was just a client. Came in here and hired one of my cars. No idea what happened to him. Poor sod.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Nice holiday, Mr Ewert?

name: EWERT
line: Eh?

name: SHERLOCK
line: You’ve been away, haven’t you?

name: EWERT
line: Oh, the-the ... (He gestures towards his tanned face.) No, it’s, er, sunbeds, I’m afraid, yeah. Too busy to get away. My wife would love it, though – bit of sun.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Have you got any change for the cigarette machine?

name: EWERT
line: What?

name: SHERLOCK
line: Well, I noticed one on the way in and I haven’t got any change.

name: SHERLOCK
line: I’m gasping.

name: EWERT
line: Um, well ... (He reaches into his trouser pocket and takes out his wallet.) Hmm.

name: EWERT
line: No, sorry.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Oh well. Thank you very much for your time, Mr Ewert.

name: SHERLOCK
line: You’ve been very helpful. Come on, John.

name: JOHN
line: I-I’ve got change if you still want to, uh ...

name: JOHN
line: So what was that all about?

name: SHERLOCK
line: I needed to look inside his wallet.

name: JOHN
line: Why?

name: SHERLOCK
line: Mr Ewert’s a liar.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Hello?

name: SHERLOCK
line: Why would you be giving me a clue?

name: YOUNG MAN
line: Why does anyone do anything? Because I’m bored. We were made for each other, Sherlock.

name: SHERLOCK
line: How much blood was on that seat, would you say?

name: LESTRADE
line: How much? About a pint.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Not ‘about.’ Exactly a pint. That was their first mistake. The blood’s definitely Ian Monkford’s but it’s been frozen.

name: LESTRADE
line: Frozen?

name: SHERLOCK
line: There are clear signs. I think Ian Monkford gave a pint of his blood some time ago and that’s what they spread on the seats.

name: JOHN
line: Who did?

name: SHERLOCK
line: Janus Cars. The clue’s in the name.

name: JOHN
line: The god with two faces.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Exactly.

name: JOHN
line: Mmm.

name: JOHN
line: So where is he?

name: LESTRADE
line: Colombia?!

name: SHERLOCK
line: Mr Ewert of Janus Cars had a twenty thousand Colombian peso note in his wallet ...

name: SHERLOCK
line: ... Quite a bit of change, too. He told us he hadn’t been abroad recently, but when I asked him about the cars, I could see his tan line clearly.

name: SHERLOCK
line: No-one wears a shirt on a sunbed. That, plus his arm.

name: LESTRADE
line: His arm?

name: SHERLOCK
line: Kept scratching it. Obviously irritating him, and bleeding.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Why? Because he’d recently had a booster jab. Hep-B, probably. Difficult to tell at that distance. Conclusion: he’d just come back from settling Ian Monkford into his new life in Colombia. Mrs Monkford cashes in the life insurance and she splits it with Janus Cars.

name: JOHN
line: M-Mrs Monkford?

name: SHERLOCK
line: Oh yes. She’s in on it too.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Now go and arrest them, Inspector. That’s what you do best.

name: SHERLOCK
line: We need to let our friendly bomber know that the case is solved.

name: SHERLOCK
line: I am on fire!

name: Sherlock types a new message onto The Science of Deduction
SHERLOCK
line: Feeling better?

name: JOHN
line: Mmm. You realise we’ve hardly stopped for breath since this thing started?

name: JOHN
line: Has it occurred to you ...?

name: SHERLOCK
line: Probably.

name: JOHN
line: No – has it occurred to you that the bomber’s playing a game with you? The envelope; breaking into the other flat; the dead kid’s shoes – it’s all meant for you.

name: JOHN
line: Is it him, then? Moriarty?

name: SHERLOCK
line: Perhaps.

name: SHERLOCK
line: That could be anybody.

name: JOHN
line: Well, it could be, yeah. Lucky for you, I’ve been more than a little unemployed.

name: SHERLOCK
line: How d’you mean?

name: JOHN
line: Lucky for you, Mrs Hudson and I watch far too much telly.

name: CONNIE
line: Thank you, Tyra! Doesn’t she look lovely, everybody, now?

name: CONNIE
line: Anyway, speaking of silk purses and sows’ ears ...

name: SHERLOCK
line: Hello?

name: OLD WOMAN
line: This one ... is a bit ... defective. Sorry.

name: OLD WOMAN
line: She’s blind. This is ... a funny one.

name: OLD WOMAN
line: I’ll give you ... twelve hours.

name: OLD WOMAN
line: I like ... to watch you ... dance.

name: a voiceover replaces her voice and a news headline at the bottom of the screen reads
line: Make-over Queen Connie Prince dead at 48.)

name: NEWS READER
line: ... continuing into the sudden death of the popular TV personality, Connie Prince. Miss Prince, famous for her make-over programmes, was found dead two days ago by her brother in the house they shared in Hampstead ...

name: LESTRADE
line: Connie Prince, fifty-four. She had one of those make-over shows on the telly. Did you see it?

name: SHERLOCK
line: No.

name: LESTRADE
line: Very popular. She was going places.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Not any more. So: dead two days. According to one of her staff, Raoul de Santos, she cut her hand on a rusty nail in the garden. Nasty wound.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Tetanus bacteria enters the bloodstream – good night Vienna.

name: JOHN
line: I suppose.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Something’s wrong with this picture.

name: LESTRADE
line: Eh?

name: SHERLOCK
line: Can’t be as simple as it seems, otherwise the bomber wouldn’t be directing us towards it. Something’s wrong.

name: SHERLOCK
line: John?

name: JOHN
line: Mmm.

name: SHERLOCK
line: The cut on her hand: it’s deep; would have bled a lot, right?

name: JOHN
line: Yeah.

name: SHERLOCK
line: But the wound’s clean – very clean, and fresh.

name: SHERLOCK
line: How long would the bacteria have been incubating inside her?

name: JOHN
line: Eight, ten days.

name: JOHN
line: The cut was made later.

name: LESTRADE
line: After she was dead?

name: SHERLOCK
line: Must have been. The only question is, how did the tetanus enter the dead woman’s system?

name: SHERLOCK
line: You want to help, right?

name: JOHN
line: Of course.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Connie Prince’s background – family history, everything. Give me data.

name: JOHN
line: Right.

name: LESTRADE
line: There’s something else that we haven’t thought of.

name: LESTRADE
line: Yes. Why is he doing this, the bomber?

name: LESTRADE
line: If this woman’s death was suspicious, why point it out?

name: LESTRADE
line: ... who press-gangs suicide bombers?

name: SHERLOCK
line: Bad Samaritan.

name: LESTRADE
line: I’m – I’m serious, Sherlock. Listen: I’m cutting you slack here; I’m trusting you – but out there somewhere, some poor bastard’s covered in Semtex and is just waiting for you to solve the puzzle. So just tell me: what are we dealing with?

name: SHERLOCK
line: Something new.

name: The wall behind the sofa is covered with paperwork
line: maps, photographs of Connie Prince – both when she was alive and pictures taken in the morgue – photos of Carl Powers, press cuttings and various sheets of paper with notes scribbled on them. Pieces of string are pinned between some of the exhibits, linking them together. Sherlock is pacing back and forth in front of the sofa while Lestrade stands nearby.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Carl Powers, killed twenty years ago. The bomber knew him; admitted that he knew him. The bomber’s iPhone was in stationery from the Czech Republic. First hostage from Cornwall; the second from London; the third from Yorkshire, judging by her accent. What’s he doing – working his way round the world? Showing off?

name: OLD WOMAN
line: You’re enjoying this, aren’t you? Joining the ... dots.

name: OLD WOMAN
line: Three hours: boom ... boom.

name: KENNY
line: We’re devastated. Of course we are.

name: RAOUL
line: Can I get you anything, sir?

name: JOHN
line: Er, no. No, thanks.

name: KENNY
line: Raoul is my rock. I don’t think I could have managed.

name: KENNY
line: We didn’t always see eye to eye, but my sister was very dear to me.

name: JOHN
line: And – and to the public, Mr Prince.

name: KENNY
line: Oh, she was adored. I’ve seen her take girls who looked like the back end of Routemasters and turn them into princesses.

name: KENNY
line: Still, it’s a relief in a way to know that she’s beyond this vale of tears.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Great. ... Thank you. Thanks again.

name: MRS HUDSON
line: It was a real shame. I liked her. She taught you how to do your colours.

name: LESTRADE
line: Colours?

name: MRS HUDSON
line: You know ... (she gestures down at her clothes) ... what goes best with what. I should never wear cerise, apparently. Drains me.

name: LESTRADE
line: Who was that?

name: SHERLOCK
line: Well, Home Secretary, actually. Owes me a favour.

name: MRS HUDSON
line: People can hardly move their faces. It’s silly, isn’t it?!

name: MRS HUDSON
line: Did you ever see her show?

name: SHERLOCK
line: Not until now.

name: CONNIE
line: You look pasty, love!

name: KENNY
line: Ah. (He looks at the audience.) Rained every day but one!

name: MRS HUDSON
line: That’s the brother. No love lost there, if you can believe the papers.

name: SHERLOCK
line: So I gather. I’ve just been having a very fruitful chat with people who loved this show. Fan sites – indispensible for gossip.

name: CONNIE
line: Off! Off! Off! Off!

name: JOHN
line: It’s more common than people think. The tetanus is in the soil, people cut themselves on rose bushes, garden forks, that sort of thing. If left un...

name: JOHN
line: ...treated ...

name: KENNY
line: I don’t know what I’m going to do now.

name: KENNY
line: I mean, she’s left me this place, which is lovely ...

name: KENNY
line: ... but it’s not the same without her.

name: KENNY
line: No.

name: JOHN
line: Right.

name: SHERLOCK
line: John.

name: SHERLOCK
line: I’ll remember.

name: JOHN
line: That’ll be him.

name: KENNY
line: What?

name: SHERLOCK
line: Ah, Mr Prince, isn’t it?

name: KENNY
line: Yes.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Very good to meet you.

name: KENNY
line: Yes; thank you.

name: SHERLOCK
line: So sorry to hear about ...

name: KENNY
line: Yes, yes, very kind.

name: JOHN
line: Shall we, er ...

name: JOHN
line: Yes.

name: JOHN
line: Um, yes.

name: JOHN
line: Can you ...?

name: KENNY
line: Not too close. I’m raw from crying.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Oh, who’s this?

name: KENNY
line: Sekhmet. Named after the Egyptian goddess.

name: SHERLOCK
line: How nice(!) Was she Connie’s?

name: KENNY
line: Yes.

name: KENNY
line: Little present from yours truly.

name: JOHN
line: Sherlock? Uh, light reading?

name: SHERLOCK
line: Oh, um ...

name: SHERLOCK
line: Two point eight.

name: KENNY
line: Bloody hell. What do you think you’re playing at?!

name: SHERLOCK
line: Sorry.

name: KENNY
line: You’re like Laurel and bloody Hardy, you two. What’s going on?

name: JOHN
line: Actually, I think we’ve got what we came for. Excuse us.

name: KENNY
line: What?

name: JOHN
line: Sherlock.

name: SHERLOCK
line: What?

name: KENNY
line: But you’ve not taken anything!

name: JOHN
line: Yes! Ooh, yes!

name: JOHN
line: What? No, yes. Yeah, it is. It must be. It’s how they got the tetanus into her system. Its paws stink of disinfectant.

name: JOHN
line: No, he coated it onto the paws of her cat. It’s a new pet – bound to be a bit jumpy around her. A scratch is almost inevitable. She wouldn’t have ...

name: JOHN
line: He murdered his sister for her money.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Did he?

name: SHERLOCK
line: No. It was revenge.

name: JOHN
line: Revenge? Who wanted revenge?

name: SHERLOCK
line: Raoul, the houseboy. Kenny Prince was the butt of his sister’s jokes, week in, week out, a virtual bullying campaign. Finally he had enough; fell out with her badly. It’s all on the website. She threatened to disinherit Kenny. Raoul had grown accustomed to a certain lifestyle, so ...

name: JOHN
line: What about the disinfectant, then, on the cat’s claws?

name: SHERLOCK
line: Raoul keeps a very clean house. You came through the kitchen door, saw the state of that floor, scrubbed to within an inch of its life. You smell of disinfectant now. No, the cat doesn’t come into it.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Raoul’s internet records do, though. Hope we can get a cab from here.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Raoul de Santos is your killer. Kenny Prince’s houseboy. Second autopsy shows it wasn’t tetanus that poisoned Connie Prince – it was botulinum toxin.

name: SHERLOCK
line: We’ve been here before. Carl Powers? Tut-tut. Our bomber’s repeated himself.

name: LESTRADE
line: So how’d he do it?

name: SHERLOCK
line: Botox injection.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Botox is a diluted form of botulinum. Among other things, Raoul de Santos was employed to give Connie her regular facial injections. My contact at the Home Office gave me the complete records of Raoul’s internet purchases. (He points to the folder.) He’s been bulk ordering Botox for months.

name: LESTRADE
line: You sure about this?

name: SHERLOCK
line: I’m sure.

name: LESTRADE
line: All right – my office.

name: JOHN
line: Hey, Sherlock. How long?

name: SHERLOCK
line: What?

name: JOHN
line: How long have you known?

name: SHERLOCK
line: Well, this one was quite simple, actually, and like I said, the bomber repeated himself. That was a mistake.

name: JOHN
line: No, but Sherl... The hostage... the old woman. She’s been there all this time.

name: Sherlock types into the message box
SHERLOCK
line: Hello?

name: OLD WOMAN
line: He was so ... His voice ...

name: OLD WOMAN
line: He sounded so ... soft.

name: JOHN
line: What’s happened?

name: NEWS READER
line: The explosion, which ripped through several floors, killing twelve people ...

name: NEWS READER
line: ... is said to have been caused by a faulty gas main. A spokesman from the utilities company ...

name: JOHN
line: He certainly gets about.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Well, obviously I lost that round – although technically I did solve the case.

name: SHERLOCK
line: He killed the old lady because she started to describe him.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Just once, he put himself in the firing line.

name: JOHN
line: What d’you mean?

name: SHERLOCK
line: Well, usually, he must stay above it all. He organises these things but no-one ever has direct contact.

name: JOHN
line: What ... like the Connie Prince murder – he-he arranged that? So people come to him wanting their crimes fixed up, like booking a holiday?

name: JOHN
line: Huh.

name: The headline on the screen reads
line: “Connie Prince: man arrested.” Raoul is shoved into the back of a police car. John looks round at Sherlock, who is looking down at the pink phone.)

name: SHERLOCK
line: Taking his time this time.

name: JOHN
line: Anything on the Carl Powers case?

name: SHERLOCK
line: Nothing. All the living classmates check out spotless. No connection.

name: JOHN
line: Maybe the killer was older than Carl?

name: SHERLOCK
line: The thought had occurred.

name: JOHN
line: So why’s he doing this, then – playing this game with you? D’you think he wants to be caught?

name: SHERLOCK
line: I think he wants to be distracted.

name: JOHN
line: I hope you’ll be very happy together.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Sorry, what?

name: JOHN
line: There are lives at stake, Sherlock – actual human lives... Just – just so I know, do you care about that at all?

name: JOHN
line: Nope.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Then I’ll continue not to make that mistake.

name: JOHN
line: And you find that easy, do you?

name: SHERLOCK
line: Yes, very. Is that news to you?

name: JOHN
line: No. (He smiles bitterly.) No.

name: SHERLOCK
line: I’ve disappointed you.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Don’t make people into heroes, John. Heroes don’t exist, and if they did, I wouldn’t be one of them.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Excellent!

name: SHERLOCK
line: View of the Thames. South Bank – somewhere between Southwark Bridge and Waterloo.

name: SHERLOCK
line: You check the papers; I’ll look online ...

name: SHERLOCK
line: Oh, you’re angry with me, so you won’t help.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Not much cop, this caring lark.

name: Sherlock dismisses John from his mind and begins a search on his phone
JOHN
line: Two kids stabbed in Stoke Newington.

name: JOHN
line: Ah. Man found on the train line – Andrew West.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Nothing!

name: SHERLOCK
line: It’s me. Have you found anything on the South Bank between Waterloo Bridge and Southwark Bridge?

name: LESTRADE
line: D’you reckon this is connected, then? The bomber?

name: SHERLOCK
line: Must be. Odd, though ... (he holds up the pink phone) ... he hasn’t been in touch.

name: LESTRADE
line: But we must assume that some poor bugger’s primed to explode, yeah?

name: SHERLOCK
line: Yes.

name: LESTRADE
line: Any ideas?

name: SHERLOCK
line: Seven ... so far.

name: LESTRADE
line: Seven?!

name: JOHN
line: He’s dead about twenty-four hours – maybe a bit longer. (He looks up at Lestrade.) Did he drown?

name: LESTRADE
line: Apparently not. Not enough of the Thames in his lungs. Asphyxiated.

name: JOHN
line: Yes, I’d agree.

name: then selects the latter option and the screen changes to
JOHN
line: There’s quite a bit of bruising around the nose and mouth. More bruises here and here.

name: Sherlock shifts to a new search
JOHN
line: In his late thirties, I’d say. Not in the best condition.

name: SHERLOCK
line: He’s been in the river a long while. The water’s destroyed most of the data.

name: SHERLOCK
line: But I’ll tell you one thing: that lost Vermeer painting’s a fake.

name: LESTRADE
line: What?

name: SHERLOCK
line: We need to identify the corpse. Find out about his friends and associates ...

name: LESTRADE
line: Wait-wait-wait-wait-wait. What painting? What are you – what are you on about?

name: SHERLOCK
line: It’s all over the place. Haven’t you seen the posters? Dutch Old Master, supposed to have been destroyed centuries ago; now it’s turned up. Worth thirty million pounds.

name: LESTRADE
line: Okay. So what has that got to do with the stiff?

name: LESTRADE
line: Golem?

name: JOHN
line: It’s a horror story, isn’t it? What are you saying?

name: SHERLOCK
line: Jewish folk story. A gigantic man made of clay. It’s also the name of an assassin – real name Oskar Dzundza – one of the deadliest assassins in the world.

name: SHERLOCK
line: That is his trademark style.

name: LESTRADE
line: So this is a hit?

name: SHERLOCK
line: Definitely. The Golem squeezes the life out of his victims with his bare hands.

name: LESTRADE
line: But what has this gotta do with that painting? I don’t see ...

name: JOHN
line: All right, all right, girls, calm down. Sherlock? D’you wanna take us through it?

name: SHERLOCK
line: What do we know about this corpse? The killer’s not left us with much – just the shirt and the trousers. They’re pretty formal – maybe he was going out for the night, but the trousers are heavy-duty, polyester, nasty, same as the shirt – cheap. They’re both too big for him, so some kind of standard-issue uniform. Dressed for work, then. What kind of work? There’s a hook on his belt for a walkie-talkie.

name: LESTRADE
line: Tube driver?

name: JOHN
line: Security guard?

name: SHERLOCK
line: More likely. That’ll be borne out by his backside.

name: LESTRADE
line: Backside?!

name: SHERLOCK
line: Flabby. You’d think that he’d led a sedentary life, yet the soles of his feet and the nascent varicose veins in his legs show otherwise. So, a lot of walking and a lot of sitting around. Security guard’s looking good. And the watch helps, too. The alarm shows he did regular night shifts.

name: LESTRADE
line: Why regular? Maybe he just set his alarm like that the night before he died.

name: SHERLOCK
line: No-no-no, the buttons are stiff, hardly touched. He set his alarm like that a long time ago. His routine never varied. But there’s something else. The killer must have been interrupted, otherwise he would have stripped the corpse completely. There was some kind of badge or insignia on the shirt front that he tore off, suggesting the dead man worked somewhere recognisable, some kind of institution.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Found this inside his trouser pockets.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Sodden by the river but still recognisably ...

name: SHERLOCK
line: Ticket stubs. He worked in a museum or gallery. Did a quick check – the Hickman Gallery has reported one of its attendants as missing.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Alex Woodbridge. Tonight they unveil the re-discovered masterpiece. Now why would anyone want to pay the Golem to suffocate a perfectly ordinary gallery attendant? Inference: the dead man knew something about it – something that would stop the owner getting paid thirty million pounds. The picture’s a fake.

name: LESTRADE
line: And a Happy New Year!

name: JOHN
line: Poor sod.

name: LESTRADE
line: I’d better get my feelers out for this Golem character.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Pointless. You’ll never find him. But I know a man who can.

name: LESTRADE
line: Who?

name: SHERLOCK
line: Why hasn’t he phoned? He’s broken his pattern. Why?

name: SHERLOCK
line: Waterloo Bridge.

name: JOHN
line: Where now? The Gallery?

name: SHERLOCK
line: In a bit.

name: JOHN
line: The Hickman’s contemporary art, isn’t it? Why have they got hold of an Old Master?

name: SHERLOCK
line: Dunno. Dangerous to jump to conclusions. Need data.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Stop!

name: SHERLOCK
line: You wait here. I won’t be a moment.

name: HOMELESS GIRL
line: Change? Any change?

name: SHERLOCK
line: What for?

name: HOMELESS GIRL
line: Cup of tea, of course.

name: JOHN
line: What are you doing?

name: SHERLOCK
line: Investing.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Now we go to the Gallery.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Have you got any cash?

name: SHERLOCK
line: No. I need you to find out all you can about the gallery attendant. Lestrade will give you the address.

name: JOHN
line: Okay.

name: JULIE
line: We’d been sharing about a year. Just sharing.

name: JOHN
line: Mmm.

name: JOHN
line: May I?

name: JULIE
line: Yeah.

name: JOHN
line: Sorry.

name: JOHN
line: Stargazer, was he?

name: JULIE
line: God, yeah. Mad about it. It’s all he ever did in his spare time.

name: JULIE
line: He was a nice guy, Alex. I liked him.

name: JULIE
line: He was, er, never much of a one for hoovering.

name: JOHN
line: What about art? Did he know anything about that?

name: JOHN
line: Hmm.

name: JOHN
line: Has anyone else been round asking about Alex?

name: JULIE
line: No. We had a break-in, though.

name: JULIE
line: Last night. There was nothing taken. Oh – there was a message left for Alex on the landline.

name: JOHN
line: Who was it from?

name: JULIE
line: Well, I can play it for you if you like. I’ll get the phone.

name: JOHN
line: Please.

name: s VOICE
line: Oh, should I speak now? Alex? Love, it’s Professor Cairns. Listen, you were right. You were bloody right! Give us a call when ...

name: JOHN
line: Professor Cairns?

name: JULIE
line: No, no idea, sorry.

name: JOHN
line: Mm. Can I try and ring back?

name: JULIE
line: Well, no good. I mean, I’ve had other calls since – sympathy ones, you know.

name: He gets out the phone and looks at the message which reads
RE
line: BRUCE-PARTINGTON PLANS

name: MISS WENCESLAS
line: Yes. Lovely. Now get back to work. We open tonight.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Doesn’t it bother you?

name: MISS WENCESLAS
line: What?

name: SHERLOCK
line: That the painting’s a fake.

name: SHERLOCK
line: It’s a fake. It has to be. It’s the only possible explanation.

name: SHERLOCK
line: You’re in charge, aren’t you, Miss Wenceslas?

name: MISS WENCESLAS
line: Who are you?

name: MISS WENCESLAS
line: Golem? What the hell are you talking about?

name: SHERLOCK
line: Or are you working for someone else? Did you fake it for them?

name: MISS WENCESLAS
line: It’s not a fake.

name: SHERLOCK
line: It is a fake. Don’t know why, but there’s something wrong with it. There has to be.

name: MISS WENCESLAS
line: What the hell are you on about? You know, I could have you sacked on the spot.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Not a problem.

name: MISS WENCESLAS
line: No?

name: SHERLOCK
line: No. I don’t work here, you see. Just popped in to give you a bit of friendly advice.

name: MISS WENCESLAS
line: How did you get in?

name: MISS WENCESLAS
line: I want to know.

name: SHERLOCK
line: The art of disguise is knowing how to hide in plain sight.

name: MISS WENCESLAS
line: Who are you?

name: SHERLOCK
line: Sherlock Holmes.

name: MISS WENCESLAS
line: Am I supposed to be impressed?

name: SHERLOCK
line: You should be.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Have a nice day!

name: LUCY
line: He wouldn’t. He just wouldn’t.

name: LUCY
line: Westie wasn’t a traitor. It’s a horrible thing to say!

name: JOHN
line: I’m sorry, but you must understand that’s ...

name: LUCY
line: That’s what they think, isn’t it, his bosses?

name: LUCY
line: Everyone’s got debts; and Westie wouldn’t wanna clear them by selling out his country.

name: JOHN
line: Can you, um, can you tell me exactly what happened that night?

name: LUCY
line: We were having a night in, just watching a DVD.

name: LUCY
line: He normally falls asleep, you know, but he sat through this one. He was quiet.

name: LUCY
line: Out of the blue, he said he just had to go and see someone.

name: JOHN
line: And you’ve no idea who?

name: JOE
line: Oh, hi, Luce. You okay, love?

name: LUCY
line: Yeah.

name: JOE
line: Who’s this?

name: JOHN
line: John Watson. Hi.

name: JOHN
line: Uh, sort of, yeah.

name: JOE
line: Well, tell ’em to get off their arses, will you? It’s bloody ridiculous.

name: JOHN
line: I’ll do my best.

name: JOHN
line: Well, er, thanks very much for your help; and again, I’m very, very sorry.

name: LUCY
line: He didn’t steal those things, Mr Watson.

name: LUCY
line: I knew Westie. He was a good man. (She starts to cry.) He was my good man.

name: Edit
line: John walks away, looking like one awesome BAMF and melting ovaries everywhere. There, fixed it for you me.)

name: HOMELESS GIRL
line: Spare change? Any spare change?

name: JOHN
line: Alex Woodbridge didn’t know anything special about art.

name: SHERLOCK
line: And?

name: JOHN
line: And ...

name: SHERLOCK
line: Is that it? No habits, hobbies, personality?

name: JOHN
line: No, give us a chance! He was an amateur astronomer.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Hold that cab.

name: HOMELESS GIRL
line: Spare change, sir?

name: SHERLOCK
line: Don’t mind if I do.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Fortunately, I haven’t been idle.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Come on.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Beautiful, isn’t it?

name: JOHN
line: I thought you didn’t care about things like that.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Doesn’t mean I can’t appreciate it.

name: JOHN
line: Listen: Alex Woodbridge had a message on the answerphone at his flat – a Professor Cairns?

name: SHERLOCK
line: This way.

name: JOHN
line: Nice(!) Nice part of town. Er, any time you wanna explain.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Homeless network – really is indispensible.

name: SHERLOCK
line: My eyes and ears all over the city.

name: JOHN
line: Oh, that’s clever. So you scratch their backs and ...

name: SHERLOCK
line: Yes, then I disinfect myself.

name: JOHN
line: Sherlock!

name: SHERLOCK
line: Come on!

name: JOHN
line: Oh shi...

name: JOHN
line: I wish I’d ...

name: SHERLOCK
line: No, no, no, no! It’ll take us weeks to find him again.

name: JOHN
line: Or not. I have an idea where he might be going.

name: SHERLOCK
line: What?

name: JOHN
line: I told you: someone left Alex Woodbridge a message. There can’t be that many Professor Cairns in the book. Come on.

name: NARRATOR
line: Titan is the largest moon.

name: NARRATOR
line: Many are actually long dead ...

name: CAIRNS
line: Tom? Is that you?

name: NARRATOR
line: ... exploded into supernovas.

name: NARRATOR
line: ... discovered by Urbain Le Verrier in 1846.

name: NARRATOR
line: ... composed mainly of hydrogen. Their light takes so long to reach us ...

name: SHERLOCK
line: Golem!

name: SHERLOCK
line: John!

name: JOHN
line: I can’t see him. I’ll go round. I’ll go!

name: JOHN
line: Golem!

name: JOHN
line: Let him go, or I will kill you.

name: NARRATOR
line: ... long dead, exploded into supernovas.

name: SHERLOCK
line: It’s a fake. It has to be.

name: MISS WENCESLAS
line: That painting has been subjected to every test known to science.

name: SHERLOCK
line: It’s a very good fake, then.

name: SHERLOCK
line: You know about this, don’t you? This is you, isn’t it?

name: MISS WENCESLAS
line: Inspector, my time is being wasted. Would you mind showing yourself and your friends out?

name: SHERLOCK
line: The painting is a fake.

name: SHERLOCK
line: It’s a fake. That’s why Woodbridge and Cairns were killed.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Oh, come on. Proving it’s just the detail. The painting is a fake. I’ve solved it. I’ve figured it out. It’s a fake! That’s the answer. That’s why they were killed.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Okay, I’ll prove it. Give me time. Will you give me time?

name: s VOICE
line: Ten ...

name: JOHN
line: What did he say?

name: SHERLOCK
line: “Ten.”

name: s VOICE
line: Nine ...

name: LESTRADE
line: Jesus!

name: SHERLOCK
line: The painting is a fake, but how can I prove it? How? How?

name: s VOICE
line: Eight ...

name: s VOICE
line: Seven ...

name: SHERLOCK
line: No, shut up. Don’t say anything. It only works if I figure it out.

name: s VOICE
line: Six ...

name: SHERLOCK
line: Woodbridge knew, but how?

name: s VOICE
line: Five ...

name: LESTRADE
line: It’s speeding up!

name: SHERLOCK
line: Oh!

name: s VOICE
line: Four ...

name: SHERLOCK
line: In the planetarium! You heard it too. Oh, that is brilliant! That is gorgeous!

name: s VOICE
line: Three ...

name: JOHN
line: What’s brilliant? What is?

name: SHERLOCK
line: This is beautiful. I love this!

name: s VOICE
line: Two ...

name: SHERLOCK
line: The Van Buren Supernova!

name: s VOICE
line: Please. Is somebody there?

name: s VOICE
line: Somebody help me!

name: SHERLOCK
line: The Van Buren Supernova, so-called. (He holds up his phone over his shoulder so that Miss Wenceslas can see the screen.) Exploding star, only appeared in the sky in eighteen fifty-eight.

name: JOHN
line: So how could it have been painted in the sixteen forties?

name: JOHN
line: Oh.

name: and looks at the message which reads
JOHN
line: Oh Sherl...

name: SHERLOCK
line: You know, it’s interesting. Bohemian stationery, an assassin named after a Prague legend, and you, Miss Wenceslas. This whole case has a distinctly Czech feeling about it. Is that where this leads?

name: SHERLOCK
line: What are we looking at, Inspector?

name: MISS WENCESLAS
line: I just wanted my share – the thirty million.

name: MISS WENCESLAS
line: I found a little old man in Argentina. Genius. I mean, really: brushwork immaculate, could fool anyone.

name: MISS WENCESLAS
line: It’s true! I mean, it took a long time, but eventually I was put in touch with people ... his people.

name: MISS WENCESLAS
line: Well, there was never any real contact; just messages ... whispers.

name: SHERLOCK
line: And did those whispers have a name?

name: MISS WENCESLAS
line: Moriarty.

name: JOHN
line: So this is where West was found?

name: TUBE GUARD
line: Yeah.

name: JOHN
line: Uh-huh.

name: TUBE GUARD
line: You gonna be long?

name: JOHN
line: I might be.

name: TUBE GUARD
line: You with the police, then?

name: JOHN
line: Sort of.

name: TUBE GUARD
line: I hate ’em.

name: JOHN
line: The police?

name: TUBE GUARD
line: No. Jumpers.

name: TUBE GUARD
line: People who chuck themselves in front of trains.

name: TUBE GUARD
line: Selfish bastards.

name: JOHN
line: Well, that’s one way of looking at it.

name: TUBE GUARD
line: I mean it. It’s all right for them. It’s over in a split second – strawberry jam all over the lines. What about the drivers, hmm? They’ve gotta live with it, haven’t they?

name: JOHN
line: Yeah, speaking of strawberry jam, there’s no blood on the line. (He stands up again.) Has it been cleaned off?

name: TUBE GUARD
line: No, there wasn’t that much.

name: JOHN
line: You said his head was smashed in.

name: TUBE GUARD
line: Well, it was, but there wasn’t much blood.

name: JOHN
line: Okay.

name: TUBE GUARD
line: Well, I’ll leave you to it then.

name: TUBE GUARD
line: Just give us a shout when you’re off.

name: JOHN
line: Right.

name: JOHN
line: Right: so, uh, Andrew West got on the train somewhere – or did he? There’s no ticket on the body. Then how did he end up here?

name: JOHN
line: Yes!

name: SHERLOCK
line: Knew you’d get there eventually. West wasn’t killed here; that’s why there was so little blood.

name: JOHN
line: How long have you been following me?

name: SHERLOCK
line: Since the start. You don’t think I’d give up on a case like this just to spite my brother, do you?

name: SHERLOCK
line: Come on. Got a bit of burglary to do.

name: SHERLOCK
line: The missile defence plans haven’t left the country, otherwise Mycroft’s people would have heard about it. Despite what people think, we do still have a Secret Service.

name: JOHN
line: Yeah, I know. I’ve met them.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Which means whoever stole the memory stick can’t sell it or doesn’t know what to do with it. My money’s on the latter. We’re here.

name: JOHN
line: Where?

name: JOHN
line: Sherlock! What if there’s someone in?

name: SHERLOCK
line: There isn’t.

name: JOHN
line: Where are we?

name: SHERLOCK
line: Oh, sorry, didn’t I say? Joe Harrison’s flat.

name: JOHN
line: Joe ...?

name: SHERLOCK
line: Brother of West’s fiancée.

name: SHERLOCK
line: He stole the memory stick; killed his prospective brother-in-law.

name: JOHN
line: Then why’d he do it?

name: SHERLOCK
line: Let’s ask him.

name: JOHN
line: Don’t.

name: JOE
line: It wasn’t meant to ...

name: JOE
line: God. (He rubs his hand over his face.) What’s Lucy gonna say? Jesus.

name: JOHN
line: Why did you kill him?

name: JOE
line: It was an accident.

name: JOE
line: I swear it was.

name: JOE
line: I started dealing drugs. I mean, the bike thing’s a great cover, right? I dunno – I dunno how it started; I just got out of my depth. I owed people thousands – serious people. Then at Westie’s engagement do, he starts talking about his job.

name: JOE
line: I mean, usually he’s so careful; but that night after a few pints he really opened up. He told me about these missile plans – beyond top secret. He showed me the memory stick; he waved it in front of me. You hear about these things getting lost, ending up on rubbish tips and what-not. And there it was, and I thought ... well, I thought it could be worth a fortune.

name: JOE
line: It was pretty easy to get the thing off him, he was so plastered. Next time I saw him, I could tell by the look on his face that he knew.

name: JOHN
line: What happened?

name: JOE
line: I was gonna call an ambulance, but it was too late.

name: JOE
line: I just didn’t have a clue what to do, so I dragged him in ’ere, and I just sat in the dark, thinking.

name: SHERLOCK
line: When a neat little idea popped into your head.

name: JOHN
line: And points.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Exactly.

name: JOHN
line: D’you still have it, then? The memory stick?

name: SHERLOCK
line: Fetch it for me – if you wouldn’t mind.

name: JOHN
line: Well, maybe that’s over, too. We’ve heard nothing from the bomber.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Five pips, remember, John? It’s a countdown. We’ve only had four.

name: SHERLOCK
line: No, no, no! Of course he’s not the boy’s father! (He gestures at the screen.) Look at the turn-ups on his jeans!

name: JOHN
line: Knew it was dangerous.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Hmm?

name: JOHN
line: Getting you into crap telly.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Hmm. Not a patch on Connie Prince.

name: JOHN
line: Have you given Mycroft the memory stick yet?

name: SHERLOCK
line: Yep. He was over the moon. Threatened me with a knighthood – again.

name: JOHN
line: You know, I’m still waiting.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Hmm?

name: JOHN
line: For you to admit that a little knowledge of the solar system and you’d have cleared up the fake painting a lot quicker.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Didn’t do you any good, did it?

name: JOHN
line: No, but I’m not the world’s only consulting detective.

name: JOHN
line: I won’t be in for tea. I’m going to Sarah’s. There’s still some of that risotto left in the fridge.

name: JOHN
line: Uh, milk. We need milk.

name: SHERLOCK
line: I’ll get some.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Really.

name: JOHN
line: And some beans, then?

name: JOHN
line: Evening. (Sherlock’s raised hand begins to lower slowly but otherwise he doesn’t move, still staring over his shoulder in utter disbelief.) JOHN: This is a turn-up, isn’t it, Sherlock? SHERLOCK (softly, shocked): John. What the hell ...? JOHN: Bet you never saw this coming. (Finally Sherlock manages to move, and starts to walk slowly towards the man he had believed to be his friend until now. The shock and bewilderment on his face make him look about twelve years old. Then, with a look of despair which matches Sherlock’s, John takes his hands from his pockets and pulls open his jacket to reveal the bomb strapped to his chest. From somewhere in the upper gallery, the point from a sniper’s laser immediately begins to dance around over the bomb.) JOHN: What ... would you like me ... to make him say ... next? (Sherlock continues to step towards him but now he is looking everywhere but at John as he tries to see who else is in the area.) JOHN (obviously narrating words spoken into an earpiece): Gottle o’ geer ... gottle o’ geer ... gottle o’ geer. (His voice almost breaks on the last phrase.) SHERLOCK: Stop it. JOHN (narrating): Nice touch, this: the pool where little Carl died. I stopped him. (He tries not to cringe as he listens to the next words.) I can stop John Watson too. (He looks down at the laser point on his chest.) Stop his heart. SHERLOCK (turning on the spot while he tries to look in all directions): Who are you? (A door opens at the far end of the pool and a soft male voice with an Irish accent speaks from that direction.) VOICE: I gave you my number. (We get a brief glimpse of a man wearing a suit and tie, but currently he is mostly obscured by a column.) VOICE (plaintively): I thought you might call. (Sherlock turns towards the new arrival, who now slowly walks out into the open. It’s Jim, Molly’s boyfriend. But this isn’t the fumble-fingered casually-dressed Londoner who did indeed leave his number for Sherlock in the lab at Bart’s; this is a sharply-dressed man with immaculate hair and a murderous look on his face. With his hands in his pockets, he casually begins to stroll alongside the deep end of the pool, heading towards Sherlock and John. All hint of plaintiveness has now gone from his voice.) JIM: Is that a British Army Browning L9A1 in your pocket ... (Sherlock reaches down to his trouser pocket and removes a pistol from it.) JIM: ... or are you just pleased to see me? SHERLOCK (raising the pistol and aiming it towards Jim): Both. (Jim stops and looks back at him, unafraid.) JIM: Jim Moriarty. Hi! (Sherlock tilts his head while he looks more closely at the man. Jim acts as if he needs to remind Sherlock who he is.) JIM: Jim? Jim from the hospital? (He begins to walk alongside the deep end again. Sherlock brings up his other hand to support the one aiming the gun. Jim bites his lip as if disappointed.) JIM: Oh. Did I really make such a fleeting impression? But then, I suppose, that was rather the point. (He turns to face Sherlock just as the sniper’s laser flickers over John’s upper chest. Sherlock briefly turns his head towards John, a questioning look on his face.) JIM (starting to walk again): Don’t be silly. Someone else is holding the rifle. I don’t like getting my hands dirty. (He reaches the corner of the pool and stops.) JIM: I’ve given you a glimpse, Sherlock, just a teensy glimpse of what I’ve got going on out there in the big bad world. I’m a specialist, you see ... (He looks surprised, as if he has only just realised the connection.) JIM: ... like you! SHERLOCK: “Dear Jim. Please will you fix it for me to get rid of my lover’s nasty sister?” (Starting to walk forward again, Jim grins, clearly recognising the TV show and catchphrase that Sherlock is quoting.) [See footnotes] SHERLOCK: “Dear Jim. Please will you fix it for me to disappear to South America?” JIM (stopping again): Just so. SHERLOCK: Consulting criminal. (softly) Brilliant. JIM (smiling proudly): Isn’t it? No-one ever gets to me – and no-one ever will. SHERLOCK (cocking the pistol): I did. JIM: You’ve come the closest. Now you’re in my way. SHERLOCK: Thank you. JIM: Didn’t mean it as a compliment. SHERLOCK: Yes you did. JIM (shrugging): Yeah, okay, I did. But the flirting’s over, Sherlock ... (His voice becomes high-pitched and sing-song.) Daddy’s had enough now! (He again starts to stroll closer.) JIM (back to his normal tone): I’ve shown you what I can do. I cut loose all those people, all those little problems, even thirty million quid just to get you to come out and play. (John is starting to feel the strain and closes his eyes briefly. Sherlock’s eyes can’t help but flicker across to him a couple of times as he tries to keep his focus on the man approaching them.) JIM: So take this as a friendly warning, my dear. Back off. (He smiles.) JIM: Although I have loved this – this little game of ours. (He puts on his London accent for a moment.) Playing Jim from I.T. (He switches back to his Irish accent.) Playing gay. Did you like the little touch with the underwear? SHERLOCK: People have died. JIM: That’s what people DO! (He screams the last word furiously, his personality changing in an instant.) SHERLOCK (softly): I will stop you. JIM (calmer again): No you won’t. (Sherlock looks across to John.) SHERLOCK: You all right? (John deliberately keeps his gaze away from his friend, presumably having been given instructions earlier about not talking to him. Jim walks forward again and reaches his side.) JIM: You can talk, Johnny-boy. Go ahead. (Refusing to specifically obey Jim’s orders, John meets Sherlock’s eyes and nods once. Sherlock takes one hand off the pistol and holds out the memory stick towards Jim.) SHERLOCK: Take it. JIM: Huh? Oh! That! (He strolls past John and reaches out for the stick, grinning.) JIM: The missile plans! (He takes the stick from Sherlock’s fingers and brings it to his mouth, kissing it. Behind him, John is silently murmuring to himself, perhaps trying to keep himself focussed, perhaps winding himself up to take action, or maybe just expressing his surprise or disappointment that Sherlock lied to him about giving the plans to Mycroft. Jim lowers the memory stick and looks at it.) JIM (sing-song): Boring! (He shakes his head.) JIM: I could have got them anywhere. (He nonchalantly tosses the stick into the pool. Seeing his opportunity, John races forward and slams himself against Jim’s back, wrapping one arm around his neck and the other around his chest. Sherlock backs up a step in surprise but keeps the pistol raised and aimed at Jim.) JOHN: Sherlock, run! (Jim laughs in delight.) JIM: Good! Very good. (Sherlock doesn’t move, still aiming his gun at Jim’s head but now starting to look up a little anxiously, as if wondering what action the hidden sniper might take.) JOHN (savagely): If your sniper pulls that trigger, Mr Moriarty, then we both go up. JIM (calmly, to Sherlock): Isn’t he sweet? I can see why you like having him around. But then people do get so sentimental about their pets. (Grimacing angrily, John pulls him even closer onto the bomb which is now sandwiched between them. Jim scowls round at him.) JIM: They’re so touchingly loyal. But, oops! (He grins briefly at John, then looks towards Sherlock.) JIM: You’ve rather shown your hand there, Doctor Watson. (He chuckles as a new laser point appears in the middle of Sherlock’s forehead. John stares in horror as Jim looks round at him expectantly. Sherlock, either seeing the edge of the laser beam shining from the gallery or realising what’s happening from John’s expression, shakes his head slightly.) JIM (sing-song): Gotcha! (He chuckles as John releases his grip on him and steps back, holding his hands up to signal to the sniper that he won’t be trying anything else. Jim glances round at him, then turns back towards Sherlock while brushing his hands down his suit to straighten it. He gestures to it indignantly.) JIM: Westwood! [See footnotes.] (He lowers his hands and stands calmly in front of Sherlock who is still aiming the pistol at his head.) JIM: D’you know what happens if you don’t leave me alone, Sherlock, to you? SHERLOCK (sounding bored): Oh, let me guess: I get killed. JIM: Kill you? (He grimaces.) N-no, don’t be obvious. I mean, I’m gonna kill you anyway some day. I don’t wanna rush it, though. I’m saving it up for something special. No-no-no-no-no. If you don’t stop prying, I’ll burn you. (He runs his eyes briefly down Sherlock’s body, then meets his eyes again and his voice becomes vicious.) JIM: I’ll burn the heart out of you. (His face is a snarl as he says the word ‘heart’ but at the end of the sentence he looks almost regretful.) SHERLOCK (softly): I have been reliably informed that I don’t have one. JIM: But we both know that’s not quite true. (Sherlock blinks involuntarily. Jim looks down, smiling, then shrugs.) JIM: Well, I’d better be off. (He nonchalantly looks around, perhaps checking his exit route, before turning back to Sherlock.) JIM: Well, so nice to have had a proper chat. (Sherlock raises the pistol higher and extends it closer to Jim’s head.) SHERLOCK: What if I was to shoot you now – right now? JIM (completely unperturbed): Then you could cherish the look of surprise on my face. (He opens his eyes and mouth wide, mimicking shock, then grins at Sherlock.) JIM: ’Cause I’d be surprised, Sherlock; really I would. (He screws up his nose.) JIM: And just a teensy bit disappointed. And of course you wouldn’t be able to cherish it for very long. (Slowly he begins to turn away.) JIM: Ciao, Sherlock Holmes. (Looking back at Sherlock with some distaste, he walks calmly towards the side door through which John came earlier. Sherlock slowly steps forward to keep him in view.) SHERLOCK: Catch ... you ... later. (The door opens and Jim’s voice can be heard, high-pitched and sing-song.) JIM: No you won’t! (The door closes. Sherlock doesn’t move for a few seconds, his gun still aimed towards the door, then his gaze drifts across to John and he instantly bends, putting the pistol on the floor, then drops to his knees in front of John [hush now ...] and starts unfastening the vest to which the bomb is attached.) SHERLOCK: All right? (John tilts his head back, breathing heavily [I said hush now ...].) SHERLOCK (urgently): Are you all right? JOHN: Yeah-yeah, I’m fine. (Having unfastened the vest, Sherlock jumps up and hurries round behind John, starting to pull off the jacket and the bomb vest.) JOHN: I’m fine. (Sherlock, also breathing too fast, continues tugging at the jacket and vest.) JOHN: Sherlock. (Finally Sherlock manages to roughly strip the jacket and vest off John’s arms.) JOHN: Sh-Sherlock! (Sherlock bends and skims the items as far away along the floor as he can, while John staggers at the vehemence with which his friend just ripped them off him.) JOHN (softly): Jesus. (He reaches up and pulls the earpiece from his ear, breathing heavily as delayed shock begins to hit him. Sherlock turns and stares at him for a moment, then hurries back to pick up the pistol before racing towards the door through which Moriarty left. John’s knees buckle and he staggers towards the nearest support, the edge of one of the changing cubicles.) JOHN: Oh, Christ. (He turns and drops down into a squat, bracing his back against the cubicle’s edge while he blows out a long breath and tries to calm himself down. Sherlock comes back in, having apparently seen no sign of Moriarty outside. He starts to pace up and down near John, so hyper and distracted that he doesn’t even realise that he is scratching his head with the business end of a loaded and cocked pistol.) JOHN (breathlessly): Are you okay? SHERLOCK (quick fire, still pacing and scratching his head with the gun): Me? Yeah, I’m fine, I’m fine. Fine. (He turns to John, wide-eyed and breathless.) SHERLOCK: That, er ... thing that you, er, that you did – that, um ... (he clears his throat) ... you offered to do. That was, um ... good. JOHN (staring blankly ahead of himself): I’m glad no-one saw that. (Sherlock had temporarily lowered his hand long enough not to be risking accidentally shooting himself in the head, although he had terrible jitters as he held the gun down by his side. Now he lifts the gun again and rubs his chin while looking down at John in confusion.) SHERLOCK: Hmm? JOHN (still not meeting his eyes): You, ripping my clothes off in a darkened swimming pool. People might talk. (Sherlock shrugs.) SHERLOCK: People do little else. (He looks down at John, then grins. John snorts laughter and then leans forward and prepares to stand up. But before he can move, the beam from a sniper’s laser begins to dance over his chest. John looks down at it and his face fills with horror.) JOHN (anguished): Oh ... (A door near the deep end of the pool opens and Jim comes through, clapping his hands together and turning to face our heroes.) JIM (cheerfully): Sorry, boys! I’m soooooo changeable! (John grimaces in disbelief. Sherlock keeps his back to Jim, looking up into the gallery to try and judge how many snipers there might be up there. It’s becoming clear that there are quite a few because there are at least two laser points hovering over John, and at least three more travelling over Sherlock’s body. Jim laughs and spreads his arms wide.) JIM: It is a weakness with me but, to be fair to myself, it is my only weakness. (He lowers his hands and puts them in his pockets. Sherlock turns his head and looks down at John, who lifts his own head to meet his gaze.) JIM: You can’t be allowed to continue. You just can’t. I would try to convince you but ... (he laughs and his voice becomes higher pitched again) ... everything I have to say has already crossed your mind! (Sherlock, who had looked away from John for a moment, now turns and looks down at him again, his face showing no emotion but his eyes screaming a silent request. John responds instantly with a tiny nod, giving him full permission to do whatever he deems necessary.) SHERLOCK (turning to face Jim): Probably my answer has crossed yours. (He raises the pistol and aims it at him. Jim smiles confidently with no fear in his expression. Slowly Sherlock lowers the pistol downwards until it’s pointing directly at the bomb jacket. All three sets of eyes lock onto the jacket, John breathing heavily, Sherlock calm. Jim tilts his head, looking a little anxious for the first time. As Sherlock holds his hand steady, continuing to aim towards the jacket, Jim lifts his head and locks eyes with his nemesis. Sherlock gazes back at him and Jim begins to smile. Sherlock’s eyes narrow slightly.)  And the scream that went up from the viewers in August 2010 as the end credits began to roll still echoes around the universe to this day.

name: British readers in particular
line: (1) “Dear Jim”: Sherlock is mock-quoting a standard format from a very well-known TV show called “Jim’ll Fix It” which ran on the BBC from 1975 to 1994 and was hosted by Jimmy Savile. Viewers – mostly children – would write to the show and would always begin their letter, “Dear Jim, please can you fix it for me to ...” and would ask for their wildest dream to be met, e.g. to be a train driver for a day, or to meet their favourite athlete, or to work in a chocolate factory for a few hours. Nowadays we would all be writing in and saying, “Dear Jim, please can you fix it for me to meet Benedict Cumberbatch/Martin Freeman,” or “... to be the make-up girl on the next season of ‘Sherlock’,” or “... to be Steve Thompson’s beta reader and point out all his plot inconsistencies to him,” etc. [What? Don’t look at me like that third request is from me ...] In a rather unfortunate piece of timing, within the last couple of weeks (in mid-October 2012 when this transcript was published) the reputation of the late Jimmy Savile has plummeted after terrible allegations have recently surfaced about his behaviour during his years at the BBC. If you haven’t heard of this show before, now is not the time to be googling it.  (2) “Westwood”: Jim is wearing a suit designed by Dame Vivienne Westwood, which will therefore have been very expensive, hence his mock-indignation at John ruffling it up. He directs the comment to Sherlock rather than to John because he knows that Sherlock is more likely to be appreciative of the expense of his clothing.

name: JIM
line: D’you mind if I get that?

name: JIM
line: Hello? ... Yes, of course it is. What do you want?

name: JIM
line: Sorry. Wrong day to die.

name: JIM
line: You’ll be hearing from me, Sherlock.

name: JOHN
line: What happened there?

name: SHERLOCK
line: Someone changed his mind. The question is: who?

name: IRENE
line: Well now. Have you been wicked, Your Highness?

name: SULTRY FEMALE VOICE
line: Yes, Miss Adler.

name: SHERLOCK
line: What are you typing?

name: JOHN
line: Blog.

name: SHERLOCK
line: About?

name: JOHN
line: Us.

name: SHERLOCK
line: You mean me.

name: JOHN
line: Why?

name: SHERLOCK
line: Well, you’re typing a lot.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Right then. (He walks towards the door.) So, what have we got?

name: MAN
line: My wife seems to be spending a very long time at the office.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Boring.

name: WOMAN
line: I think my husband might be having an affair.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Yes.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Boring.

name: GEEKY YOUNG MAN
line: But then all the comic books started coming true.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Oh. Interesting.

name: SHERLOCK
line: ‘Geek Interpreter.’ What’s that?

name: JOHN
line: It’s the title.

name: SHERLOCK
line: What does it need a title for?

name: SHERLOCK
line: Do people actually read your blog?

name: JOHN
line: Where d’you think our clients come from?

name: SHERLOCK
line: I have a website.

name: JOHN
line: In which you enumerate two hundred and forty different types of tobacco ash. Nobody’s reading your website.

name: JOHN
line: Right then: dyed blonde hair; no obvious cause of death except for these speckles, whatever they are.

name: JOHN
line: What?

name: SHERLOCK
line: “The Speckled Blonde”?!

name: LITTLE GIRL
line: They wouldn’t let us see Granddad when he was dead. Is that ’cause he’d gone to heaven?

name: SHERLOCK
line: People don’t really go to heaven when they die. They’re taken to a special room and burned.

name: LESTRADE
line: There was a plane crash in Dusseldorf yesterday. Everyone dead.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Suspected terrorist bomb. We do watch the news.

name: JOHN
line: You said, “Boring,” and turned over.

name: s note
line: Much as I would love to confirm that “You ... turned over” means that Sherlock turned over in bed, where he and John were watching the news, I reluctantly have to confirm that – in this context – it does sadly mean “You ... changed the channel.” Sorry.]

name: JOHN
line: Lucky escape(!)

name: SHERLOCK
line: Okay, four ideas.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Maybe two ideas.

name: JOHN
line: People want to know you’re human.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Why?

name: JOHN
line: ’Cause they’re interested.

name: SHERLOCK
line: No they’re not. Why are they?

name: JOHN

line: She’s not interested in blackmail. She wants ... protection for some reason. I take it you’ve stood down the police investigation into the shooting at her house?

name: MYCROFT
line: How can we do anything while she has the photographs? Our hands are tied.

name: SHERLOCK
line: She’d applaud your choice of words.

name: SHERLOCK
line: You see how this works: that camera phone is her “Get out of jail free” card. You have to leave her alone. Treat her like royalty, Mycroft.

name: JOHN
line: Though not the way she treats royalty.

name: JOHN
line: What was that?

name: JOHN
line: But what was that noise?

name: He looks at the message which reads
SHERLOCK
line: Did you know there were other people after her too, Mycroft, before you sent John and I in there? CIA-trained killers, at an excellent guess.

name: JOHN
line: Yeah, thanks for that, Mycroft.

name: MYCROFT
line: Oh, shut up, Mrs Hudson.

name: MYCROFT
line: Apologies.

name: MRS HUDSON
line: Thank you.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Though do, in fact, shut up.

name: MRS HUDSON
line: Ooh. It’s a bit rude, that noise, isn’t it?

name: Sherlock looks at the latest message which reads
SHERLOCK
line: There’s nothing you can do and nothing she will do as far as I can see.

name: MYCROFT
line: I can put maximum surveillance on her.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Why bother? You can follow her on Twitter. I believe her user name is “TheWhipHand.”

name: MYCROFT
line: Yes. Most amusing.

name: MYCROFT
line: ’Scuse me.

name: JOHN
line: Why does your phone make that noise?

name: SHERLOCK
line: What noise?

name: JOHN
line: That noise – the one it just made.

name: SHERLOCK
line: It’s a text alert. It means I’ve got a text.

name: JOHN
line: Hmm. Your texts don’t usually make that noise.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Well, somebody got hold of the phone and apparently, as a joke, personalised their text alert noise.

name: JOHN
line: Hmm. So every time they text you ...

name: SHERLOCK
line: It would seem so.

name: MRS HUDSON
line: Could you turn that phone down a bit? At my time of life, it’s ...

name: JOHN
line: I’m wondering who could have got hold of your phone, because it would have been in your coat, wouldn’t it?

name: SHERLOCK
line: I’ll leave you to your deductions.

name: JOHN
line: I’m not stupid, you know.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Where do you get that idea?

name: MYCROFT
line: Bond Air is go, that’s decided. Check with the Coventry lot. Talk later.

name: SHERLOCK
line: What else does she have?

name: SHERLOCK
line: Irene Adler. The Americans wouldn’t be interested in her for a couple of compromising photographs. There’s more.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Much more.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Something big’s coming, isn’t it?

name: MYCROFT
line: Irene Adler is no longer any concern of yours. From now on you will stay out of this.

name: MYCROFT
line: Yes, Sherlock, you will.

name: MYCROFT
line: Now, if you’ll excuse me, I have a long and arduous apology to make to a very old friend.

name: MRS HUDSON
line: Lovely! Sherlock, that was lovely!

name: JOHN
line: Marvellous!

name: MRS HUDSON
line: I wish you could have worn the antlers!

name: SHERLOCK
line: Some things are best left to the imagination, Mrs Hudson.

name: JOHN
line: Uh, no, no, no, no, no. He’s not good with names.

name: SHERLOCK
line: No-no-no, I can get this.

name: SHERLOCK
line: No, Sarah was the doctor; and then there was the one with the spots; and then the one with the nose; and then ... who was after the boring teacher?

name: JEANETTE
line: Nobody.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Jeanette! (He grins falsely at her.) Ah, process of elimination.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Oh, dear Lord.

name: MOLLY
line: Hello, everyone. Sorry, hello.

name: MOLLY
line: Er, it said on the door just to come up.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Oh, everybody’s saying hullo to each other. How wonderful(!)

name: LESTRADE
line: Wow!

name: MOLLY
line: Having a Christmas drinkies, then?

name: MRS HUDSON
line: It’s the one day of the year where the boys have to be nice to me, so it’s almost worth it!

name: JOHN
line: Have a seat.

name: SHERLOCK
line: John?

name: JOHN
line: Mmm?

name: LESTRADE
line: Molly? (She turns to him.) Want a drink?

name: SHERLOCK
line: The counter on your blog: still says one thousand eight hundred and ninety-five.

name: SHERLOCK
line: And you’ve got a photograph of me wearing that hat!

name: JOHN
line: People like the hat.

name: SHERLOCK
line: No they don’t. What people?

name: MOLLY
line: How’s the hip?

name: MRS HUDSON
line: Ooh, it’s atrocious, but thanks for asking.

name: MOLLY
line: I’ve seen much worse, but then I do post-mortems.

name: MOLLY
line: Oh, God. Sorry.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Don’t make jokes, Molly.

name: MOLLY
line: No. Sorry.

name: MOLLY
