[And, really, “Sherlock” production team, could you not take just a couple more minutes to make your newspaper articles more professional-looking, write sensible English and check the bleedin’ spelling?!]

name: and the text reads
line: “Sherlock Holmes was last night being hailed a hero yet again for masterminding the daring escape of the kidnapped man. // Scotland Yard had to secretly bring in their special weapon (in the form of Mr Holmes) yet again. The case has drawn a huge amount of attention as the nation became divided about the outcome of the kidnapping. Bankers are certainly not the nations [sic] sweethearts any more, but Mr. Holmes certainly seems to be. As huge crowds gathered for the press conference, Mr Holmes was presented with a gift from ...” and then the text disappears offscreen.

name: FATHER
line: Back together with my family after my terrifying ordeal; and we have one person to thank for my deliverance – Sherlock Holmes.

name: JOHN
line: Shh.

name: New article
line: “Ricoletti evades capture”. Your transcriber is already nearing page three of this transcript and is only two and a half minutes into the episode so let’s leave out the text of the article, but it suggests that the man named in the headline was responsible for the banker’s kidnap. We cut to Scotland Yard where D.I. Greg Lestrade is addressing a press conference. Sherlock and John stand nearby, and D.S. Sally Donovan and Doctor WhoCaresWhatHisFirstNameIs Anderson are at the back of the room.)

name: LESTRADE
line: Peter Ricoletti: number one on Interpol’s Most Wanted list since 1982. But we got him; and there’s one person we have to thank for giving us the decisive leads ... with all his customary diplomacy and tact(!)

name: JOHN
line: Sarcasm.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Yes.

name: LESTRADE
line: We all chipped in.

name: FIRST REPORTER
line: Put the hat on!

name: SECOND REPORTER
line: Put the hat on!

name: LESTRADE
line: Yeah, Sherlock, put it on!

name: prints a World Exclusive on its front page
line: “Boffin Sherlock solves another” with the strapline: “Hero ’Tec cracks ‘unsolvable’ case”.)

name: JOHN
line: Everybody gets one.

name: SHERLOCK
line: One what?

name: JOHN
line: Tabloid nickname: ‘SuBo’; ‘Nasty Nick.’ Shouldn’t worry – I’ll probably get one soon.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Page five, column six, first sentence.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Why is it always the hat photograph?

name: SHERLOCK
line: What sort of hat is it anyway?

name: JOHN
line: “Bachelor”? What the hell are they implying?

name: SHERLOCK
line: You stalk a deer with a hat? What are you gonna do – throw it?

name: SHERLOCK
line: Some sort of death frisbee?

name: JOHN
line: Okay, this is too much. We need to be more careful.

name: SHERLOCK
line: It’s got flaps ... ear flaps. It’s an ear hat, John.

name: SHERLOCK
line: What do you mean, “more careful”?

name: JOHN
line: I mean this isn’t a deerstalker now; it’s a Sherlock Holmes hat. I mean that you’re not exactly a private detective any more. (He holds his thumb and forefinger an inch apart.) You’re this far from famous.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Oh, it’ll pass.

name: JOHN
line: It’d better pass. The press will turn, Sherlock. They always turn, and they’ll turn on you.

name: SHERLOCK
line: It really bothers you.

name: JOHN
line: What?

name: SHERLOCK
line: What people say.

name: JOHN
line: Yes.

name: SHERLOCK
line: About me? I don’t understand – why would it upset you?

name: JOHN
line: Just try to keep a low profile. Find yourself a little case this week. Stay out of the news.

name: JOHN
line: It’s your phone.

name: JOHN
line: So, did you just talk to him for a really long time?

name: SHERLOCK
line: Oh. Henry Fishgard never committed suicide.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Bow Street Runners: missed everything.

name: JOHN
line: Pressing case, is it?(!)

name: SHERLOCK
line: They’re all pressing ’til they’re solved.

name: SECURITY MAN
line: Put this in your bag, please.

name: SECURITY MAN
line: Excuse me, sir.

name: SECURITY MAN
line: Any metal objects – keys, mobile phones?

name: SECURITY MAN
line: You can go through.

name: SECURITY MAN
line: Thank you.

name: PRISON GOVERNOR
line: What do you say: refuse them all parole and bring back the rope(!) Let’s begin.

name: SECURITY GUARD
line: Sir, I’m gonna have to ask you to leave.

name: DONOVAN
line: Sir, there’s been a break-in.

name: DONOVAN
line: You’ll want it.

name: BANK DIRECTOR
line: The vault!

name: LESTRADE
line: Hacked into the Tower of bloody London security?! How?!

name: LESTRADE
line: Tell them we’re already on our way.

name: DONOVAN
line: There’s been another one; another break-in.

name: DONOVAN
line: Bank of England!

name: PRISON WARDER
line: Sir, security’s down, sir. It’s failing!

name: LESTRADE
line: What is it now?

name: DONOVAN
line: Pentonville Prison!

name: LESTRADE
line: Oh no!

name: JOHN
line: Here.

name: JOHN
line: Sherlock ...

name: SHERLOCK
line: Not now.

name: The message on the screen reads
LESTRADE
line: That glass is tougher than anything.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Not tougher than crystallised carbon. He used a diamond.

name: and has run it on its front page with the headline
line: “Crime of the Century?” The rest of the text reads: “Questions are being asked in parliament as to how the Tower of London, Pentonville Prison and the Bank of England were all broken into at the same time by the same man – James Moriarty. // There are unconfirmed reports that Scotland Yard’s favourite sleuth Mr Sherlock Holmes has been called in to help the team piece together the most audacious crime ... Turn to page 5”.

name: reads
line: “Jewel Thief on trial at Bailey” and the first few paragraphs read: “Crown Jewel thief is to be tried at the Old Bailey and Sherlock Holmes is named as a witness for the prosecution. // Master criminal Moriarty taunted Holmes with his graffitied GET SHERLOCK at the scene of the crime. The crime is attracting huge attention internationally too. // Irish born Moriarty – of no fixed abode, seems to be taunting the master detective. // Boffin Holmes, accompanied by confirmed bachelor John Watson – refused to comment. // Crowds gathered yesterday for what is being described as the trial of the century.” [After that the text keeps repeating. Do the production team not know that we have the ability to freeze frame and read these articles because we are ludicrously obsessive and will not only notice the repetition but the annoying mixed up use of dashes and commas?!]

name: The picture is of Sherlock putting on the deerstalker hat at the Scotland Yard press conference and the text reads
line: “In a twist worthy of a Conan Doyle novella, Mr Sherlock Holmes was yesterday revealed to be an expert witness at the trial of ‘Jim’ Moriarty. Described by many commentators as the trial of the century, the case has all the ingredients of a block buster film. The royal family, Scotland yard [sic], the world of finance and greed, the ‘underclass’ of prisoners out to reek [sic] revenge as they enjoy their own fifteen minutes of freedom. The case is riddled with irony and intrigue but perhaps reflects a deeper malaise that seems to be at the heart of a society. // Mr Holmes, a man of few words, declined to comment when asked his involvement in the case. It is understood that a woefully depleted Scotland ...” [and then the text goes off the screen].

name: JOHN
line: Ready?

name: SHERLOCK
line: Yes.

name: JOHN
line: Get in.

name: JOHN
line: Remember ...

name: JOHN
line: Remember what they told you: don’t try to be clever ...

name: JOHN
line: ... and please, just keep it simple and brief.

name: SHERLOCK
line: God forbid the star witness at the trial should come across as intelligent.

name: JOHN
line: ‘Intelligent,’ fine; let’s give ‘smart-arse’ a wide berth.

name: SHERLOCK
line: I’ll just be myself.

name: ITN REPORTER
line: ... here today standing outside ...

name: SKY NEWS REPORTER
line: ... This is the trial of the century ...

name: BBC NEWS REPORTER
line: ... the trial of James Moriarty ...

name: SKY NEWS REPORTER
line: ... James Moriarty, earlier today accused of attempt...

name: ITN REPORTER
line: ... of attempting to steal the Crown Jewels ...

name: BBC NEWS REPORTER
line: ... at the Old Bailey we have Reichenbach Hero Sherlock Holmes ...

name: JIM
line: Would you mind slipping your hand into my pocket?

name: JIM
line: Thanks.

name: TANNOY ANNOUNCEMENT
line: Crown versus Moriarty – please proceed to Court Ten.

name: KITTY
line: You’re him.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Wrong toilet.

name: KITTY
line: I’m a big fan.

name: KITTY
line: I read your cases; follow them all. (She steps closer, gazing at him adoringly.) Sign my shirt, would you?

name: SHERLOCK
line: There are two types of fans.

name: KITTY
line: Oh?

name: SHERLOCK
line: “Catch me before I kill again” – Type A ...

name: KITTY
line: Uh-huh. What’s Type B?

name: SHERLOCK
line: “Your bedroom’s just a taxi ride away.”

name: KITTY
line: Guess which one I am.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Neither.

name: SHERLOCK
line: No. You’re not a fan at all.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Those marks on your forearm: edge of a desk. You’ve been typing in a hurry, probably. Pressure on; facing a deadline.

name: SHERLOCK
line: And there’s a smudge of ink on your wrist; and a bulge in your left jacket pocket.

name: KITTY
line: Bit of a giveaway.

name: SHERLOCK
line: The smudge is deliberate, to see if I’m as good as they say I am.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Hmm. Oil-based, used in newspaper print, but drawn on with an index finger; your finger.

name: KITTY
line: Hmm!

name: SHERLOCK
line: Journalist. Unlikely you’d get your hands dirty at the press. You put that there to test me.

name: KITTY
line: Wow, I’m liking you!

name: SHERLOCK
line: You mean I’d make a great feature: “Sherlock Holmes – the man beneath the hat.”

name: KITTY
line: Kitty ... (she takes off the hat) ... Riley. Pleased to meet you.

name: SHERLOCK
line: No. I’m just saving you the trouble of asking. No, I won’t give you an interview; no, I don’t want the money.

name: KITTY
line: You and John Watson – just platonic? Can I put you down for a “no” there, as well?

name: KITTY
line: There’s all sorts of gossip in the press about you. Sooner or later you’re gonna need someone on your side ...

name: KITTY
line: ... someone to set the record straight.

name: KITTY
line: I’m smart, and you can trust me, totally.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Smart, okay: investigative journalist. Good. Well, look at me and tell me what you see.

name: SHERLOCK
line: If you’re that skilful, you don’t need an interview. You can just read what you need.

name: SHERLOCK
line: No? Okay, my turn.

name: And your nails
line: you can’t afford to do them that often. I see someone who’s hungry. I don’t see smart, and I definitely don’t see trustworthy, but I’ll give you a quote if you like – three little words.

name: PROSECUTING BARRISTER
line: A “consulting criminal.”

name: SHERLOCK
line: Yes.

name: PROSECUTING BARRISTER
line: Your words. Can you expand on that answer?

name: SHERLOCK
line: James Moriarty is for hire.

name: PROSECUTING BARRISTER
line: A tradesman?

name: SHERLOCK
line: Yes.

name: PROSECUTING BARRISTER
line: But not the sort who’d fix your heating.

name: SHERLOCK
line: No, the sort who’d plant a bomb or stage an assassination, but I’m sure he’d make a pretty decent job of your boiler.

name: PROSECUTING BARRISTER
line: Would you describe him as ...

name: PROSECUTING BARRISTER
line: What?

name: SHERLOCK
line: Can’t do that. You’re leading the witness. (He looks towards the defending barrister.) He’ll object and the judge will uphold.

name: JUDGE
line: Mr Holmes.

name: JUDGE
line: Mr Holmes, we’re fine without your help.

name: PROSECUTING BARRISTER
line: How would you describe this man – his character?

name: SHERLOCK
line: First mistake. (He raises his eyes and locks his gaze onto Jim.) James Moriarty isn’t a man at all – he’s a spider; a spider at the centre of a web – a criminal web with a thousand threads and he knows precisely how each and every single one of them dances.

name: PROSECUTING BARRISTER
line: And how long ...

name: SHERLOCK
line: How long have I known him? Not really your best line of enquiry. We met twice, five minutes in total. I pulled a gun; he tried to blow me up. (Sarcastically) I felt we had a special something.

name: JUDGE
line: Miss Sorrel, are you seriously claiming this man is an expert, after knowing the accused for just five minutes?

name: SHERLOCK
line: Two minutes would have made me an expert. Five was ample.

name: JUDGE
line: Mr Holmes, that’s a matter for the jury.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Oh, really?

name: SHERLOCK
line: One librarian; two teachers; two high-pressured jobs, probably the City.

name: SHERLOCK
line: The foreman’s a medical secretary, trained abroad judging by her shorthand.

name: JUDGE
line: Mr Holmes!

name: SHERLOCK
line: Would you like to know who ate the wafer?

name: JUDGE
line: Keep your answers brief and to the point. Anything else will be treated as contempt.

name: JUDGE
line: Do you think you could survive for just a few minutes without showing off?

name: JOHN
line: What did I say? I said, “Don’t get clever.”

name: SHERLOCK
line: I can’t just turn it on and off like a tap.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Well?

name: JOHN
line: Well what?

name: SHERLOCK
line: You were there for the whole thing, up in the gallery, start to finish.

name: JOHN
line: Like you said it would be. (Referring to Jim’s defending barrister) He sat on his backside, never even stirred.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Moriarty’s not mounting any defence.

name: JOHN
line: Bank of England, Tower of London, Pentonville. Three of the most secure places in the country and six weeks ago Moriarty breaks in, no-one knows how or why.

name: JOHN
line: All we know is ...

name: SHERLOCK
line: ... he ended up in custody.

name: JOHN
line: Don’t do that.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Do what?

name: JOHN
line: The look.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Look?

name: JOHN
line: You’re doing the look again.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Well, I can’t see it, can I?

name: SHERLOCK
line: It’s my face.

name: JOHN
line: Yes, and it’s doing a thing. You’re doing a “we both know what’s really going on here” face.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Well, we do.

name: JOHN
line: No. I don’t, which is why I find The Face so annoying.

name: SHERLOCK
line: If Moriarty wanted the Jewels, he’d have them. If he wanted those prisoners free, they’d be out on the streets. The only reason he’s still in a prison cell right now is because he chose to be there.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Somehow this is part of his scheme.

name: JUDGE
line: Mr Crayhill, can we have your first witness?

name: DEFENDING BARRISTER
line: Your Honour, we’re not calling any witnesses.

name: JUDGE
line: I don’t follow. You’ve entered a plea of Not Guilty.

name: DEFENDING BARRISTER
line: Nevertheless, my client is offering no evidence. The defence rests.

name: JUDGE
line: Ladies and gentlemen of the jury. James Moriarty stands accused of several counts of attempted burglary, crimes which – if he’s found guilty – will elicit a very long custodial sentence; and yet his legal team has chosen to offer no evidence whatsoever to support their plea. I find myself in the unusual position of recommending a verdict wholeheartedly. You must find him guilty.

name: JUDGE
line: You must find him guilty.

name: CLERK
line: They’re coming back.

name: JOHN
line: That’s six minutes.

name: CLERK
line: Surprised it took them that long, to be honest. There’s a queue for the loo.

name: CLERK
line: Have you reached a verdict on which you all agree?

name: SHERLOCK
line: Most people knock. (He shrugs.) But then you’re not most people, I suppose.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Kettle’s just boiled.

name: JIM
line: Johann Sebastian would be appalled.

name: JIM
line: May I?

name: JIM
line: You know when he was on his death bed, Bach, he heard his son at the piano playing one of his pieces. The boy stopped before he got to the end ...

name: SHERLOCK
line: ... and the dying man jumped out of his bed, ran straight to the piano and finished it.

name: JIM
line: Couldn’t cope with an unfinished melody.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Neither can you. That’s why you’ve come.

name: JIM
line: But be honest: you’re just a tiny bit pleased.

name: SHERLOCK
line: What, with the verdict?

name: JIM
line: With me ... (softly) ... back on the streets. (He gazes up into Sherlock’s eyes, smiling.) Every fairytale needs a good old-fashioned villain.

name: JIM
line: You need me, or you’re nothing. Because we’re just alike, you and I – except you’re boring.

name: JIM
line: You’re on the side of the angels.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Got to the jury, of course.

name: JIM
line: I got into the Tower of London; you think I can’t worm my way into twelve hotel rooms?

name: SHERLOCK
line: Cable network.

name: SHERLOCK
line: So how’re you going to do it ...

name: SHERLOCK
line: ... burn me?

name: JIM
line: What’s the final problem?

name: JIM
line: I did tell you ... (sing-song but still softly) ... but did you listen?

name: JIM
line: Oh, that’s clever; that’s very clever; awfully clever.

name: JIM
line: Speaking of clever, have you told your little friends yet?

name: SHERLOCK
line: Told them what?

name: JIM
line: Why I broke into all those places and never took anything.

name: SHERLOCK
line: No.

name: JIM
line: But you understand.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Obviously.

name: JIM
line: Off you go, then.

name: SHERLOCK
line: You want me to tell you what you already know?

name: JIM
line: No; I want you to prove that you know it.

name: SHERLOCK
line: You didn’t take anything because you don’t need to.

name: SHERLOCK
line: You’ll never need to take anything ever again.

name: JIM
line: Very good. Because ...?

name: SHERLOCK
line: Because nothing ... nothing in the Bank of England, the Tower of London or Pentonville Prison could possibly match the value of the key that could get you into all three.

name: JIM
line: I can open any door anywhere with a few tiny lines of computer code. No such thing as a private bank account now – they’re all mine. No such thing as secrecy – I own secrecy. Nuclear codes – I could blow up NATO in alphabetical order. In a world with locked rooms, the man with the key is king; and honey, you should see me in a crown.

name: SHERLOCK
line: You were advertising all the way through the trial. You were showing the world what you can do.

name: JIM
line: And you were helping. Big client list: rogue governments, intelligence communities ... terrorist cells. They all want me.

name: JIM
line: Suddenly, I’m Mr Sex.

name: SHERLOCK
line: If you could break any bank, what do you care about the highest bidder?

name: JIM
line: I don’t. I just like to watch them all competing. “Daddy loves me the best!” Aren’t ordinary people adorable? Well, you know: you’ve got John. I should get myself a live-in one.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Why are you doing all of this?

name: SHERLOCK
line: You don’t want money or power – not really.

name: SHERLOCK
line: What is it all for?

name: JIM
line: It’s gonna start very soon, Sherlock: the fall.

name: JIM
line: But don’t be scared. Falling’s just like flying, except there’s a more permanent destination.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Never liked riddles.

name: JIM
line: Learn to. Because I owe you a fall, Sherlock. I ... owe ... you.

name: The opening paragraph reads
line: “The Judge could only look on dumbfounded as the Jury found ‘Jimbo’ Moriarty ‘Not Guilty’. Gasps were heard around the courtroom as the Jury declared their verdict”. “The Guardian” declares “Shock verdict at trial” and the article begins, “In an unbelievable turn of events Moriarty walked free today after putting up no defence at all for what has been described as the Trial of the Century. Star witness Sherlock Holmes was not present for the verdict as in another twist to the case was thrown out of court by the Judge. Questions have been asked in Parliament and the Prime Minister was quoted as saying ‘This is a disgrace, a sign if ever we needed one that broken Britain is still broken...” [and yes, they do open the quote with single speech marks, then close it with double speech marks]. The “Daily Star” goes with “How was he ever acquitted” [but apparently can’t be bothered to put a question mark after it].

name: After a few seconds he is greeted with the onscreen message
John grimaces and a second later a new message appears
A moment later the message adds
JOHN
line: Er, excuse me. Um, I’m looking for Mycroft Holmes.

name: JOHN
line: Would you happen to know if he’s around at all?

name: JOHN
line: Can you not hear me?

name: JOHN
line: Yes, all right.

name: JOHN
line: Anyone?

name: JOHN
line: Anyone at all know where Mycroft Holmes is? I’ve been asked to meet him here.

name: JOHN
line: No takers? Right. (He raises his voice.) Am I invisible? Can you actually see me?

name: JOHN
line: Ah, thanks, gents.

name: JOHN
line: I’ve been asked to meet Mycroft Holm...

name: JOHN
line: What the ...? Hey!

name: Ariane transcripts
line: not only hopefully entertaining and useful but educational as well!]

name: MYCROFT
line: Tradition, John. Our traditions define us.

name: JOHN
line: So total silence is traditional, is it? You can’t even say, “Pass the sugar.”

name: MYCROFT
line: Three-quarters of the diplomatic service and half the government front bench all sharing one tea trolley. It’s for the best, believe me.

name: MYCROFT
line: They don’t want a repeat of 1972. But we can talk in here.

name: JOHN
line: You read this stuff?

name: MYCROFT
line: Caught my eye.

name: MYCROFT
line: Saturday: they’re doing a big exposé.

name: The headline reads
line: “SHERLOCK: THE SHOCKING TRUTH” with the strapline “Close Friend Richard Brook Tells All”. The article reveals that it is an Exclusive from Kitty Riley and the text reads: “Super-sleuth Sherlock Holmes has today been exposed as a fraud in a revelation that will shock his new found base of adoring fans. // Out-of-work actor Richard Brook revealed exclusively to THE SUN that he was hired by Holmes in an elaborate deception to fool the British public into believing Holmes had above-average ‘detective skills’. // Brook, who has known Holmes for decades and until recently considered him to be a close friend, said he was at first desperate for the money, but later found he had no” [at which point the text just stops].)

name: JOHN
line: I’d love to know where she got her information.

name: MYCROFT
line: Someone called Brook. Recognise the name?

name: JOHN
line: School friend, maybe?

name: MYCROFT
line: Of Sherlock’s? (He chuckles again.) But that’s not why I asked you here.

name: JOHN
line: Who’s that?

name: MYCROFT
line: Don’t know him?

name: JOHN
line: No.

name: MYCROFT
line: Never seen his face before?

name: MYCROFT
line: He’s taken a flat in Baker Street, two doors down from you.

name: JOHN
line: Hmm! I was thinking of doing a drinks thing for the neighbours.

name: MYCROFT
line: Not sure you’ll want to. (He nods towards the folder.) Sulejmani. Albanian hit squad. Expertly-trained killer living less than twenty feet from your front door.

name: JOHN
line: It’s a great location. Jubilee line’s handy.

name: MYCROFT
line: John ...

name: JOHN
line: What’s it got to do with me?

name: JOHN
line: Um, actually, I think I have seen her.

name: MYCROFT
line: Russian killer. She’s taken the flat opposite.

name: JOHN
line: I’m moving?!

name: MYCROFT
line: It’s not hard to guess the common denominator, is it?

name: JOHN
line: You think this is Moriarty?

name: MYCROFT
line: He promised Sherlock he’d come back.

name: JOHN
line: If this was Moriarty, we’d be dead already.

name: MYCROFT
line: If not Moriarty, then who?

name: JOHN
line: Why don’t you talk to Sherlock if you’re so concerned about him?

name: JOHN
line: Oh God, don’t tell me.

name: MYCROFT
line: Too much history between us, John. Old scores; resentments.

name: JOHN
line: Nicked all his Smurfs? Broke his Action Man?

name: MYCROFT
line: We both know what’s coming, John.

name: MYCROFT
line: Moriarty is obsessed. He’s sworn to destroy his only rival.

name: MYCROFT
line: If it’s not too much trouble.

name: MAN
line: ’Scuse, mate.

name: JOHN
line: Oh.

name: JOHN
line: Sherlock, something weird ...

name: JOHN
line: What’s going on?

name: SHERLOCK
line: Kidnapping.

name: LESTRADE
line: Rufus Bruhl, the ambassador to the U.S.

name: JOHN
line: He’s in Washington, isn’t he?

name: LESTRADE
line: Not him – his children, Max and Claudette, age seven and nine.

name: LESTRADE
line: They’re at St Aldate’s.

name: DONOVAN
line: Posh boarding place down in Surrey.

name: DONOVAN
line: The kids have vanished.

name: LESTRADE
line: The ambassador’s asked for you personally.

name: LESTRADE
line: Isn’t it great to be working with a celebrity(!)

name: SHERLOCK
line: Miss Mackenzie, you’re in charge of pupil welfare, yet you left this place wide open last night. (His voice rises angrily.) What are you: an idiot, a drunk or a criminal?

name: SHERLOCK
line: I do. I just wanted you to speak quickly.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Miss Mackenzie will need to breathe into a bag now.

name: JOHN
line: Six grand a term, you’d expect them to keep the kids safe for you. You said the other kids had all left on their holidays?

name: LESTRADE
line: They were the only two sleeping on this floor. Absolutely no sign of a break-in.

name: LESTRADE
line: The intruder must have been hidden inside some place.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Show me where the brother slept.

name: SHERLOCK
line: The boy sleeps there every night, gazing at the only light source outside in the corridor. He’d recognise every shape, every outline, the silhouette of everyone who came to the door.

name: LESTRADE
line: Okay, so ...

name: SHERLOCK
line: So someone approaches the door who he doesn’t recognise, an intruder. Maybe he can even see the outline of a weapon.

name: SHERLOCK
line: What would he do in the precious few seconds before they came into the room? How would he use them if not to cry out?

name: SHERLOCK
line: This little boy; this particular little boy ... (he looks at the bedside table and points towards it) ... who reads all of those spy books. What would he do?

name: JOHN
line: He’d leave a sign?

name: SHERLOCK
line: Linseed oil.

name: ANDERSON
line: Not much use. Doesn’t lead us to the kidnapper.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Brilliant, Anderson.

name: ANDERSON
line: Really?

name: SHERLOCK
line: Yes. Brilliant impression of an idiot.

name: SHERLOCK
line: The floor.

name: JOHN
line: He made a trail for us!

name: SHERLOCK
line: The boy was made to walk ahead of them.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Indicates anxiety; a gun held to his head.

name: SHERLOCK
line: The girl was pulled beside him, dragged sideways. He had his left arm cradled about her neck.

name: ANDERSON
line: That’s the end of it. We don’t know where they went from here.

name: ANDERSON
line: Tells us nothing after all.

name: SHERLOCK
line: You’re right, Anderson – nothing.

name: JOHN
line: Having fun?

name: SHERLOCK
line: Starting to.

name: JOHN
line: Maybe don’t do the smiling.

name: JOHN
line: Kidnapped children?

name: JOHN
line: But how did he get past the CCTV? If all the doors were locked ...

name: SHERLOCK
line: He walked in when they weren’t locked.

name: JOHN
line: But a stranger can’t just walk into a school like that.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Anyone can walk in anywhere if they pick the right moment. Yesterday – end of term, parents milling around, chauffeurs, staff. What’s one more stranger among that lot?

name: SHERLOCK
line: He was waiting for them. All he had to do was find a place to hide.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Molly!

name: MOLLY
line: Oh, hello. I’m just going out.

name: MOLLY
line: I’ve got a lunch date.

name: MOLLY
line: What?

name: JOHN
line: It’s Moriarty?

name: SHERLOCK
line: Course it’s Moriarty.

name: MOLLY
line: Er, Jim actually wasn’t even my boyfriend. We went out three times. I ended it.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Yes, and then he stole the Crown Jewels, broke into the Bank of England and organised a prison break at Pentonville. For the sake of law and order, I suggest you avoid all future attempts at a relationship, Molly.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Oil, John.

name: SHERLOCK
line: The oil in the kidnapper’s footprint – it’ll lead us to Moriarty.

name: SHERLOCK
line: All the chemical traces on his shoe have been preserved. The sole of the shoe is like a passport. If we’re lucky we can see everything that he’s been up to.

name: SHERLOCK
line: I need that analysis.

name: MOLLY
line: Alkaline.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Thank you, John.

name: MOLLY
line: Molly.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Yes.

name: Sherlock has found the first component in the mixture of items and makes a note of it
Dissolving another sample into a dish
And another sample dissolved and heated over a Bunsen burner
SHERLOCK
line: Glycerol molecule.

name: seeing it in his head as
SHERLOCK
line: What are you?

name: MOLLY
line: What did you mean, “I owe you”?

name: MOLLY
line: You said, “I owe you.” You were muttering it while you were working.

name: MOLLY
line: You’re a bit like my dad. He’s dead.

name: MOLLY
line: No, sorry.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Molly, please don’t feel the need to make conversation. It’s really not your area.

name: MOLLY
line: When he was ... dying, he was always cheerful; he was lovely – except when he thought no-one could see. I saw him once. He looked sad.

name: MOLLY
line: You look sad ... (she glances towards John) ... when you think he can’t see you.

name: MOLLY
line: Are you okay?

name: MOLLY
line: And don’t just say you are, because I know what that means, looking sad when you think no-one can see you.

name: SHERLOCK
line: But you can see me.

name: MOLLY
line: I don’t count.

name: MOLLY
line: What I’m trying to say is that, if there’s anything I can do, anything you need, anything at all, you can have me.

name: MOLLY
line: No, I just mean ... I mean if there’s anything you need ...

name: MOLLY
line: It’s fine.

name: SHERLOCK
line: What-what-what could I need from you?

name: MOLLY
line: I’m just gonna go and get some crisps. Do you want anything?

name: MOLLY
line: It’s okay, I know you don’t.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Well, actually, maybe I’ll ...

name: MOLLY
line: I know you don’t.

name: JOHN
line: Sherlock.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Hmm?

name: JOHN
line: This envelope that was in her trunk. There’s another one.

name: SHERLOCK
line: What?

name: JOHN
line: On our doorstep. Found it today.

name: JOHN
line: Yes, and look at that.

name: JOHN
line: Look at that. Exactly the same seal.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Breadcrumbs.

name: JOHN
line: Uh-huh. It was there when I got back.

name: SHERLOCK
line: A little trace of breadcrumbs; hardback copy of fairy tales.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Two children led into the forest by a wicked father follow a little trail of breadcrumbs.

name: JOHN
line: That’s “Hansel and Gretel.” What sort of kidnapper leaves clues?

name: SHERLOCK
line: The sort that likes to boast; the sort that thinks it’s all a game. He sat in our flat and he said these exact words to me ...

name: JIM
line: All fairytales need a good old-fashioned villain.

name: SHERLOCK
line: The fifth substance: it’s part of the tale.

name: SHERLOCK
line: The witch’s house.

name: JOHN
line: What?

name: SHERLOCK
line: The glycerol molecule.

name: The final element in the sample becomes clear to him
SHERLOCK
line: PGPR!

name: JOHN
line: What’s that?

name: LESTRADE
line: This fax arrived an hour ago.

name: There is a large handwritten note on the paper saying
LESTRADE
line: What have you got for us?

name: SHERLOCK
line: Need to find a place in the city where all five of these things intersect.

name: LESTRADE
line: Chalk, asphalt, brick dust, vegetation ... What the hell is this? Chocolate?

name: SHERLOCK
line: I think we’re looking for a disused sweet factory.

name: LESTRADE
line: We need to narrow that down. A sweet factory with asphalt?

name: SHERLOCK
line: No. No-no-no. Too general. Need something more specific. Chalk; chalky clay – that’s a far thinner band of geology.

name: LESTRADE
line: Brick dust?

name: SHERLOCK
line: Building site. Bricks from the 1950s.

name: SHERLOCK
line: I’ve got people out looking.

name: LESTRADE
line: So have I.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Homeless network – faster than the police. (He smiles snidely.) Far more relaxed about taking bribes.

name: SHERLOCK
line: John.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Rhododendron ponticum. It matches.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Addlestone.

name: LESTRADE
line: What?

name: SHERLOCK
line: There’s a mile of disused factories between the river and the park. It matches everything.

name: LESTRADE
line: Right, come on.

name: LESTRADE
line: Come on!

name: DONOVAN
line: You, look over there. Look everywhere. Okay, spread out, please. Spread out.

name: SHERLOCK
line: This was alight moments ago.

name: SHERLOCK
line: They’re still here.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Sweet wrappers. What’s he been feeding you?

name: SHERLOCK
line: Hansel and Gretel.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Mercury.

name: LESTRADE
line: What?

name: SHERLOCK
line: The papers: they’re painted with mercury.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Lethal. The more of the stuff they ate ...

name: JOHN
line: It was killing them.

name: SHERLOCK
line: But it’s not enough to kill them on its own. Taken in large enough quantities, eventually it would kill them.

name: SHERLOCK
line: He didn’t need to be there for the execution. Murder by remote control. He could be a thousand miles away.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Neat.

name: DONOVAN
line: I’ve got you. Don’t worry.

name: LESTRADE
line: Now, remember, she’s in shock and she’s just seven years old, so anything you can do to ...

name: SHERLOCK
line: ... not be myself.

name: LESTRADE
line: Yeah. Might be helpful.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Claudette, I ...

name: SHERLOCK
line: No-no, I know it’s been hard for you ...

name: SHERLOCK
line: Claudette, listen to me ...

name: LESTRADE
line: Out. Get out!

name: JOHN
line: Makes no sense.

name: LESTRADE
line: The kid’s traumatised. Something about Sherlock reminds her of the kidnapper.

name: JOHN
line: So what’s she said?

name: DONOVAN
line: Hasn’t uttered another syllable.

name: JOHN
line: And the boy?

name: LESTRADE
line: No, he’s unconscious; still in intensive care.

name: Sherlock stares at the enormous letters that have been painted
LESTRADE
line: Well, don’t let it get to you. I always feel like screaming when you walk into a room! In fact, so do most people.

name: LESTRADE
line: Come on.

name: DONOVAN
line: Brilliant work you did, finding those kids from just a footprint. It’s really amazing.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Thank you.

name: JOHN
line: Ah.

name: JOHN
line: You okay?

name: SHERLOCK
line: Thinking.

name: SHERLOCK
line: This is my cab. You get the next one.

name: JOHN
line: Why?

name: SHERLOCK
line: You might talk.

name: LESTRADE
line: What the hell is this? Chocolate?

name: SHERLOCK
line: I think we’re looking for a disused sweet factory.

name: LESTRADE
line: Get out!

name: LESTRADE
line: Problem?

name: VOICEOVER
line: This is a stunning evening wear set from us here at London Taxi Shopping.

name: VOICEOVER
line: As you can see, the set comprises of a beautiful ...

name: JIM
line: Hullo. Are you ready for the story? This is the story of Sir Boast-a-lot.

name: DONOVAN
line: The footprint. It’s all he has. A footprint.

name: LESTRADE
line: Yeah, well, you know what he’s like – CSI Baker Street.

name: DONOVAN
line: Well, our boys couldn’t have done it.

name: LESTRADE
line: Well, that’s why we need him. He’s better.

name: DONOVAN
line: That’s one explanation.

name: LESTRADE
line: And what’s the other?

name: JIM
line: Sir Boast-a-lot was the bravest and cleverest knight at the Round Table, but soon the other knights began to grow tired of his stories about how brave he was and how many dragons he’d slain ...

name: JIM
line: And soon they began to wonder ...

name: JIM
line: ... ‘Are Sir Boast-a-lot’s stories even true?’

name: JIM
line: Oh, no.

name: DONOVAN
line: And then the girl screams her head off when she sees him – a man she has never seen before ... unless she had seen him before.

name: LESTRADE
line: Wh-what’s your point?

name: DONOVAN
line: You know what my point is. You just don’t wanna think about it.

name: LESTRADE
line: You’re not seriously suggesting he’s involved, are you?

name: ANDERSON
line: I think we have to entertain the possibility.

name: JIM
line: That wasn’t the final problem.

name: JIM
line: The End.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Stop the cab! Stop the cab!

name: SHERLOCK
line: What was that?

name: SHERLOCK
line: What was that?

name: JIM
line: No charge.

name: MAN
line: Look out!

name: JOHN
line: Sherlock!

name: JOHN
line: That ... it’s him. It’s him. Sulejmani or something. Mycroft showed me his file. He’s a big Albanian gangster lives two doors down from us.

name: SHERLOCK
line: He died because I shook his hand.

name: JOHN
line: What d’you mean?

name: SHERLOCK
line: He saved my life but he couldn’t touch me. Why?

name: SHERLOCK
line: Four assassins living right on our doorstep. They didn’t come here to kill me; they have to keep me alive.

name: SHERLOCK
line: I’ve got something that all of them want, but if one of them approaches me ...

name: JOHN
line: ... the others kill them before they can get it.

name: SHERLOCK
line: All of the attention is focussed on me. There’s a surveillance web closing in on us right now.

name: JOHN
line: So what have you got that’s so important?

name: SHERLOCK
line: We need to ask about the dusting.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Precise details: in the last week, what’s been cleaned?

name: MRS HUDSON
line: Well, Tuesday I did your lino ...

name: SHERLOCK
line: No, in here, this room. This is where we’ll find it – any break in the dust line. You can put back anything but dust.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Dust is eloquent.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Cameras. We’re being watched.

name: MRS HUDSON
line: What? Cameras? (She cringes.) Here? I’m in my nightie!

name: LESTRADE
line: What?

name: LESTRADE
line: But you haven’t heard the question!

name: SHERLOCK
line: You want to take me to the station. Just saving you the trouble of asking.

name: LESTRADE
line: Sherlock ...

name: LESTRADE
line: Yeah.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Who was it? Donovan? I bet it was Donovan. Am I somehow responsible for the kidnapping? Ah, Moriarty is smart. He planted that doubt in her head; that little nagging sensation. You’re going to have to be strong to resist. You can’t kill an idea, can you? Not once it’s made a home ... (he reaches forward and briefly places his index fingertip on Greg’s forehead between his eyes) ... there.

name: LESTRADE
line: Will you come?

name: s game
line: first the scream, then a photograph of me being taken in for questioning. He wants to destroy me inch by inch.

name: SHERLOCK
line: It is a game, Lestrade, and not one I’m willing to play.

name: Memo to Benedict Cumberbatch
line: could you please not go into full cello-jaguar voice when I’m typing late at night and wearing headphones cranked up loud? It’s not good for my underwear. Kthxbai.]

name: SHERLOCK
line: They’ll be deciding.

name: JOHN
line: Deciding?

name: SHERLOCK
line: Whether to come back with a warrant and arrest me.

name: JOHN
line: You think?

name: SHERLOCK
line: Standard procedure.

name: JOHN
line: Should have gone with him. People’ll think ...

name: SHERLOCK
line: I don’t care what people think.

name: JOHN
line: You’d care if they thought you were stupid, or wrong.

name: SHERLOCK
line: No, that would just make them stupid or wrong.

name: JOHN
line: Sherlock, I don’t want the world believing you’re ...

name: SHERLOCK
line: That I am what?

name: JOHN
line: A fraud.

name: SHERLOCK
line: You’re worried they’re right.

name: JOHN
line: What?

name: SHERLOCK
line: You’re worried they’re right about me.

name: JOHN
line: No.

name: SHERLOCK
line: That’s why you’re so upset. You can’t even entertain the possibility that they might be right. You’re afraid that you’ve been taken in as well.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Moriarty is playing with your mind too. (Furious, he slams his hand onto the table.) Can’t you see what’s going on?

name: JOHN
line: No, I know you’re for real.

name: SHERLOCK
line: A hundred percent?

name: CHIEF SUPERINTENDANT
line: Sherlock Holmes?

name: LESTRADE
line: Yes, sir.

name: CHIEF SUPERINTENDANT
line: That bloke that’s been in the press.

name: LESTRADE
line: Mmm-hmm.

name: CHIEF SUPERINTENDANT
line: I thought he was some sort of private eye.

name: LESTRADE
line: He is.

name: CHIEF SUPERINTENDANT
line: We’ve been consulting with him – that’s what you’re ... you’re telling me?

name: CHIEF SUPERINTENDANT
line: Not used him on any proper cases, though, have we?

name: LESTRADE
line: Well, one or two.

name: CHIEF SUPERINTENDANT
line: What?

name: LESTRADE
line: Look, I’m not the only senior officer who did this. Gregson ...

name: LESTRADE
line: With all due respect, sir ...

name: LESTRADE
line: Are you proud of yourselves?

name: ANDERSON
line: Well, what if it’s not just this case? What if he’s done this to us every single time?

name: JOHN
line: So, still got some friends on the Force. It’s Lestrade. Says they’re all coming over here right now, queuing up to slap on the handcuffs: every single officer you ever made feel like a tit, which is a lot of people.

name: MRS HUDSON
line: Oh, sorry, am I interrupting?

name: MRS HUDSON
line: Some chap delivered a parcel. I forgot. Marked ‘Perishable’ – I had to sign for it.

name: MRS HUDSON
line: Funny name. German, like the fairytales.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Burnt to a crisp.

name: VOICE
line: Police!

name: MRS HUDSON
line: I’ll go.

name: LESTRADE
line: Sherlock Holmes, I’m arresting you on suspicion of abduction and kidnapping.

name: JOHN
line: He’s not resisting.

name: SHERLOCK
line: It’s all right, John.

name: JOHN
line: He’s not resisting. No, it’s not all right. This is ridiculous.

name: JOHN
line: You done?

name: JOHN
line: Mmm-hmm?

name: DONOVAN
line: First time we met.

name: JOHN
line: Don’t bother.

name: DONOVAN
line: “Solving crimes won’t be enough. One day he’ll cross the line.” Now, ask yourself: what sort of man would kidnap those kids just so he can impress us all by finding them?

name: CHIEF SUPERINTENDANT
line: Donovan.

name: DONOVAN
line: Sir.

name: CHIEF SUPERINTENDANT
line: Got our man?

name: DONOVAN
line: Er, yes, sir.

name: CHIEF SUPERINTENDANT
line: Looked a bit of a weirdo, if you ask me.

name: CHIEF SUPERINTENDANT
line: Often are, these vigilante types.

name: CHIEF SUPERINTENDANT
line: What are you looking at?

name: POLICE OFFICER
line: Are you all right, sir?

name: SHERLOCK
line: Joining me?

name: JOHN
line: Yeah. Apparently it’s against the law to chin the Chief Superintendant.

name: JOHN
line: Huh. No-one to bail us.

name: SHERLOCK
line: I was thinking more about our imminent and daring escape.

name: RADIO DISPATCHER
line: All units to two-seven.

name: JOHN
line: What?

name: RADIO DISPATCHER
line: All units to two ...

name: SHERLOCK
line: Ladies and gentlemen, will you all please get on your knees?

name: SHERLOCK
line: NOW would be good!

name: LESTRADE
line: Do as he says!

name: JOHN
line: So what now?

name: SHERLOCK
line: Doing what Moriarty wants – I’m becoming a fugitive. Run.

name: CHIEF SUPERINTENDANT
line: Get after him, Lestrade!

name: SHERLOCK
line: Take my hand.

name: JOHN
line: The gun!

name: SHERLOCK
line: Leave it!

name: JOHN
line: Sherlock, wait!

name: SHERLOCK
line: Go to your right.

name: JOHN
line: Huh?

name: SHERLOCK
line: Go to your right.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Everybody wants to believe it – that’s what makes it so clever. (He looks at John.) A lie that’s preferable to the truth. (Looking away again, his voice becomes bitter.) All my brilliant deductions were just a sham. No-one feels inadequate – Sherlock Holmes is just an ordinary man.

name: JOHN
line: What about Mycroft? He could help us.

name: SHERLOCK
line: A big family reconciliation? Now’s not really the moment.

name: JOHN
line: Sher... Sherlock.

name: JOHN
line: We’re being followed. I knew we couldn’t outrun the police.

name: SHERLOCK
line: That’s not the police. It’s one of my new neighbours from Baker Street. Let’s see if he can give us some answers.

name: JOHN
line: Where are we going?

name: SHERLOCK
line: We’re going to jump in front of that bus.

name: JOHN
line: What?!

name: SHERLOCK
line: Tell me what you want from me.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Tell me.

name: ASSASSIN
line: He left it at your flat.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Who?

name: ASSASSIN
line: Moriarty.

name: SHERLOCK
line: What?

name: ASSASSIN
line: The computer keycode.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Of course. He’s selling it – the programme he used to break into the Tower. He planted it when he came around.

name: SHERLOCK
line: It’s a game-changer. It’s a key – it can break into any system and it’s sitting in our flat right now. That’s why he left that message telling everyone where to come. “Get Sherlock.” We need to get back into the flat and search.

name: JOHN
line: CID’ll be camped out. Why plant it on you?

name: SHERLOCK
line: It’s another subtle way of smearing my name. Now I’m best pals with all those criminals.

name: JOHN
line: Yeah, well, have you seen this?

name: JOHN
line: A kiss and tell. Some bloke called Rich Brook.

name: JOHN
line: Who is he?

name: SHERLOCK
line: Too late to go on the record?

name: SHERLOCK
line: The scoop that everybody wanted and you got it. Bravo(!)

name: KITTY
line: I gave you your opportunity. I wanted to be on your side, remember? You turned me down, so ...

name: SHERLOCK
line: And then, behold, someone turns up and spills all the beans. How utterly convenient. Who is Brook?

name: SHERLOCK
line: Oh, come on, Kitty. No-one trusts the voice at the end of a telephone.

name: SHERLOCK
line: There are all those furtive little meetings in cafés; those sessions in the hotel room where he gabbled into your dictaphone. How do you know that you can trust him? A man turns up with the Holy Grail in his pockets. (Sternly) What were his credentials?

name: JIM
line: Darling, they didn’t have any ground coffee so I just got normal ...

name: KITTY
line: You are safe, Richard. I’m a witness. He wouldn’t harm you in front of witnesses.

name: KITTY
line: Of course he’s Richard Brook. There is no Moriarty. There never has been.

name: JOHN
line: What are you talking about?

name: KITTY
line: Look him up. Rich Brook – an actor Sherlock Holmes hired to be Moriarty.

name: JIM
line: Doctor Watson, I know you’re a good man.

name: JIM
line: Don’t ... don’t h... Don’t hurt me.

name: JOHN
line: No, you are Moriarty! (He turns his head briefly and yells at Kitty.) He’s Moriarty! (He turns back to Jim.) We’ve met, remember? You were gonna blow me up!

name: JIM
line: I’m sorry. I’m sorry. (He gestures towards Sherlock.) He paid me. I needed the work. I’m an actor. I was out of work. I’m sorry, okay?

name: JOHN
line: Sherlock, you’d better ... explain ... because I am not getting this.

name: KITTY
line: Oh I’ll ... I’ll be doing the explaining – in print. (She hands John a folder.) It’s all here – conclusive proof.

name: KITTY
line: Mmm-hmm. Invented all the crimes, actually – and to cap it all, you made up a master villain.

name: JOHN
line: Oh, don’t be ridiculous!

name: KITTY
line: Ask him. He’s right here! Just ask him. Tell him, Richard.

name: KITTY
line: Yes ... (she points at Sherlock) ... and you paid him; paid him to take the rap. Promised you’d rig the jury.

name: KITTY
line: Not exactly a West End role, but I’ll bet the money was good.

name: KITTY
line: But not so good he didn’t want to sell his story.

name: JIM
line: I am sorry. I am. I am sorry.

name: The big conclusion of it all
line: Moriarty’s an actor?!

name: JIM
line: He knows I am. I have proof. I have proof. Show him, Kitty! Show him something!

name: JOHN
line: Yeah, show me something.

name: JIM
line: I’m ... I’m The Storyteller. It’s on DVD.

name: JIM
line: Just tell him. It’s all coming out now. It’s all over. (His voice becomes more frantic.) Just tell them. Just tell them. Tell him!

name: JIM
line: It’s all over now ... NO!

name: JIM
line: Don’t you touch me! Don’t you lay a finger on me!

name: JIM
line: Don’t hurt me!

name: JOHN
line: Don’t let him get away!

name: KITTY
line: Leave him alone!

name: SHERLOCK
line: No, no, no. He’ll have back-up.

name: KITTY
line: D’you know what, Sherlock Holmes? I look at you now and I can read you.

name: KITTY
line: And you ... repel ... me.

name: JOHN
line: Can he do that? Completely change his identity; make you the criminal?

name: SHERLOCK
line: He’s got my whole life story. That’s what you do when you sell a big lie; you wrap it up in the truth to make it more palatable.

name: JOHN
line: Your word against his.

name: SHERLOCK
line: He’s been sowing doubt into people’s minds for the last twenty-four hours. There’s only one thing he needs to do to complete his game, and that’s to ...

name: JOHN
line: Sherlock?

name: SHERLOCK
line: Something I need to do.

name: JOHN
line: What? Can I help?

name: SHERLOCK
line: No – on my own.

name: SHERLOCK
line: You’re wrong, you know.

name: SHERLOCK
line: You do count. You’ve always counted and I’ve always trusted you.

name: SHERLOCK
line: But you were right. I’m not okay.

name: MOLLY
line: Tell me what’s wrong.

name: MOLLY
line: What do you need?

name: MOLLY
line: What do you need?

name: SHERLOCK
line: You.

name: JOHN
line: She has really done her homework, Miss Riley – things that only someone close to Sherlock could know.

name: JOHN
line: Have you seen your brother’s address book lately? Two names: yours and mine, and Moriarty didn’t get this stuff from me.

name: MYCROFT
line: John ...

name: JOHN
line: So how does it work, then, your relationship? D’you go out for a coffee now and then, eh, you and Jim?

name: JOHN
line: Your own brother, and you blabbed about his entire life to this maniac.

name: MYCROFT
line: I never inten... I never dreamt ...

name: t it
line: “Watch his back, ’cause I’ve made a mistake.”

name: JOHN
line: How did you meet him?

name: MYCROFT
line: People like him: we know about them; we watch them. But James Moriarty ... the most dangerous criminal mind the world has ever seen, and in his pocket the ultimate weapon: a keycode. A few lines of computer code that could unlock any door.

name: JOHN
line: And you abducted him to try and find the keycode?

name: MYCROFT
line: Interrogated him for weeks.

name: JOHN
line: And?

name: MYCROFT
line: He wouldn’t play along.

name: MYCROFT
line: He just sat there, staring into the darkness.

name: MYCROFT
line: The only thing that made him open up ...

name: MYCROFT
line: I could get him to talk ...

name: MYCROFT
line: ... just a little, but ...

name: JOHN
line: ... in return you had to offer him Sherlock’s life story. So one big lie – Sherlock’s a fraud – but people will swallow it because the rest of it’s true.

name: JOHN
line: Moriarty wanted Sherlock destroyed, right? And you have given him the perfect ammunition.

name: MYCROFT
line: John ...

name: MYCROFT
line: Tell him, would you?

name: JOHN
line: Got your message.

name: SHERLOCK
line: The computer code is key to this. If we find it, we can use it – beat Moriarty at his own game.

name: JOHN
line: What d’you mean, “use it”?

name: SHERLOCK
line: He used it to create a false identity, so we can use it to break into the records and destroy Richard Brook.

name: JOHN
line: And bring back Jim Moriarty again.

name: JOHN
line: Uh-huh.

name: JOHN
line: What did he touch?

name: SHERLOCK
line: An apple. Nothing else.

name: JOHN
line: Did he write anything down?

name: SHERLOCK
line: No.

name: takes his phone out of his pocket and begins to type a text message
JOHN
line: Yeah, speaking.

name: JOHN
line: What happened? Is she okay? (He listens.) Oh my God. Right, yes, I’m coming.

name: SHERLOCK
line: What is it?

name: JOHN
line: Paramedics. Mrs Hudson – she’s been shot.

name: SHERLOCK
line: What? How?

name: JOHN
line: Busy?

name: SHERLOCK
line: Thinking. I need to think.

name: JOHN
line: You need to ...? Doesn’t she mean anything to you? You once half killed a man because he laid a finger on her.

name: JOHN
line: You machine.

name: JOHN
line: Sod this. Sod this. (He heads towards the door.) You stay here if you want, on your own.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Alone is what I have. Alone protects me.

name: He reaches into his pocket and looks at the message
JIM
line: Ah. Here we are at last – you and me, Sherlock, and our problem – the final problem.

name: JIM
line: Stayin’ alive! It’s so boring, isn’t it?

name: JIM
line: It’s just ... (he holds his hand out flat with the palm down and skims it slowly through the air level to the roof) ... staying.

name: JIM
line: All my life I’ve been searching for distractions. You were the best distraction and now I don’t even have you. Because I’ve beaten you.

name: JIM
line: And you know what? In the end it was easy.

name: JIM
line: Ah well.

name: JIM
line: Did you almost start to wonder if I was real? Did I nearly get you?

name: SHERLOCK
line: Richard Brook.

name: JIM
line: Nobody seems to get the joke, but you do.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Of course.

name: JIM
line: Attaboy.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Rich Brook in German is Reichen Bach – the case that made my name.

name: JIM
line: Good. You got that too.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Beats like digits.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Every beat is a one; every rest is a zero. Binary code. That’s why all those assassins tried to save my life. It was hidden on me; hidden inside my head – a few simple lines of computer code that can break into any system.

name: JIM
line: I told all my clients: last one to Sherlock is a sissy.

name: JIM
line: No, no, no, no, no, this is too easy.

name: JIM
line: This is too easy.

name: JIM
line: There is no key, DOOFUS!

name: JIM
line: Those digits are meaningless. They’re utterly meaningless.

name: JIM
line: You don’t really think a couple of lines of computer code are gonna crash the world around our ears? I’m disappointed.

name: JIM
line: I’m disappointed in you, ordinary Sherlock.

name: SHERLOCK
line: But the rhythm ...

name: JIM
line: “Partita number one.” Thank you, Johann Sebastian Bach.

name: SHERLOCK
line: But then how did ...

name: JIM
line: Daylight robbery. All it takes is some willing participants.

name: He lifts his own phone to see the message
line: “it’s showtime !” then types on his keyboard and the alarms begin to sound as the security screens go blank. He gets up from the desk and hurries off, presumably to close the security door that will shut Jim into the Crown Jewels display room.)

name: JIM
line: I knew you’d fall for it. That’s your weakness – you always want everything to be clever. Now, shall we finish the game? One final act. Glad you chose a tall building – nice way to do it.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Do it? Do – do what?

name: SHERLOCK
line: Yes, of course. My suicide.

name: JIM
line: “Genius detective proved to be a fraud.” I read it in the paper, so it must be true. I love newspapers. Fairytales.

name: JIM
line: And pretty Grimm ones too.

name: MRS HUDSON
line: Oh, God, John! You made me jump!

name: MRS HUDSON
line: Is everything okay now with the police? Has, um, Sherlock sorted it all out?

name: JOHN
line: Taxi!

name: JOHN
line: Taxi!

name: JOHN
line: No, no, no, no, police! ... Sort of.

name: SHERLOCK
line: I can still prove that you created an entirely false identity.

name: JIM
line: Go on. For me.

name: JIM
line: Pleeeeeease?

name: SHERLOCK
line: You’re insane.

name: JIM
line: You’re just getting that now?

name: JIM
line: Okay, let me give you a little extra incentive.

name: JIM
line: Your friends will die if you don’t.

name: SHERLOCK
line: John.

name: JIM
line: Not just John. (In a whisper) Everyone.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Mrs Hudson.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Lestrade.

name: JIM
line: Three bullets; three gunmen; three victims. There’s no stopping them now.

name: JIM
line: Unless my people see you jump.

name: JIM
line: You can have me arrested; you can torture me; you can do anything you like with me; but nothing’s gonna prevent them from pulling the trigger. Your only three friends in the world will die ... unless ...

name: SHERLOCK
line: ... unless I kill myself – complete your story.

name: JIM
line: You’ve gotta admit that’s sexier.

name: JIM
line: Oh, you’ve got an audience now. Off you pop.

name: JIM
line: Go on.

name: JIM
line: I told you how this ends.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Would you give me ... one moment, please; one moment of privacy?

name: SHERLOCK
line: Please?

name: JIM
line: Of course.

name: JIM
line: What?

name: SHERLOCK
line: “You’re not going to do it.” So the killers can be called off, then – there’s a recall code or a word or a number.

name: SHERLOCK
line: I don’t have to die ... (his voice becomes sing-song) ... if I’ve got you.

name: JIM
line: Oh! (He laughs in relieved delight.) You think you can make me stop the order? You think you can make me do that?

name: JIM
line: Sherlock, your big brother and all the King’s horses couldn’t make me do a thing I didn’t want to.

name: JIM
line: Naah. You talk big. Naah. You’re ordinary. You’re ordinary – you’re on the side of the angels.

name: JIM
line: No, you’re not.

name: JIM
line: You’re me! Thank you!

name: JIM
line: Sherlock Holmes.

name: JIM
line: As long as I’m alive, you can save your friends; you’ve got a way out.

name: JIM
line: Well, good luck with that.

name: JOHN
line: Hello?

name: SHERLOCK
line: John.

name: JOHN
line: Hey, Sherlock, you okay?

name: SHERLOCK
line: Turn around and walk back the way you came now.

name: JOHN
line: No, I’m coming in.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Stop there.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Okay, look up. I’m on the rooftop.

name: JOHN
line: Oh God.

name: SHERLOCK
line: I ... I ... I can’t come down, so we’ll ... we’ll just have to do it like this.

name: SHERLOCK
line: An apology. It’s all true.

name: JOHN
line: Wh-what?

name: SHERLOCK
line: Everything they said about me. I invented Moriarty.

name: JOHN
line: Why are you saying this?

name: SHERLOCK
line: I’m a fake.

name: JOHN
line: Sherlock ...

name: JOHN
line: Okay, shut up, Sherlock, shut up. The first time we met ... the first time we met, you knew all about my sister, right?

name: SHERLOCK
line: Nobody could be that clever.

name: JOHN
line: You could.

name: SHERLOCK
line: I researched you. Before we met I discovered everything that I could to impress you. (He sniffs quietly.) It’s a trick. Just a magic trick.

name: JOHN
line: No. All right, stop it now.

name: JOHN
line: All right.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Keep your eyes fixed on me. (His voice becomes frantic.) Please, will you do this for me?

name: JOHN
line: Do what?

name: SHERLOCK
line: This phone call – it’s, er ... it’s my note. It’s what people do, don’t they – leave a note?

name: JOHN
line: Leave a note when?

name: SHERLOCK
line: Goodbye, John.

name: JOHN
line: No. SHERLOCK!

name: JOHN
line: Sher...

name: JOHN
line: I’m a doctor, let me come through. Let me come through, please.

name: JOHN
line: No, he’s my friend. He’s my friend. Please.

name: JOHN
line: Nggh, Jesus, no.

name: JOHN
line: God, no.

name: ELLA
line: There’s stuff that you wanted to say ...

name: ELLA
line: ... but didn’t say it.

name: ELLA
line: Say it now.

name: MRS HUDSON
line: There’s all the stuff, all the science equipment. I left it all in boxes. I don’t know what needs doing. I thought I’d take it to a school.

name: MRS HUDSON
line: Would you ...?

name: JOHN
line: I can’t go back to the flat again – not at the moment.

name: JOHN
line: I’m angry.

name: MRS HUDSON
line: It’s okay, John. There’s nothing unusual in that. That’s the way he made everyone feel.

name: MRS HUDSON
line: All the marks on my table; and the noise – firing guns at half past one in the morning!

name: JOHN
line: Yeah.

name: MRS HUDSON
line: Bloody specimens in my fridge. Imagine – keeping bodies where there’s food!

name: JOHN
line: Yes.

name: MRS HUDSON
line: And the fighting! Drove me up the wall with all his carryings-on!

name: JOHN
line: Yeah, listen: I-I’m not actually that angry, okay?

name: MRS HUDSON
line: Okay.

name: MRS HUDSON
line: I’ll leave you alone to, erm ... (her voice breaks again) ... you know.

name: but let me tell you this
line: you were the best man, and the most human ... human being that I’ve ever known and no-one will ever convince me that you told me a lie, and so ... There.

name: JOHN
line: I was so alone, and I owe you so much.

name: JOHN
line: Okay.

name: JOHN
line: No, please, there’s just one more thing, mate, one more thing: one more miracle, Sherlock, for me. Don’t ... be ... (his voice breaks and fills with tears) ... dead. Would you do ...? Just for me, just stop it. (He gestures down at the grave.) Stop this.

name: WOMAN
line: You bastard!

name: LESTRADE
line: A breakaway sect of Buddhist warrior monks infiltrated by a blonde drug smuggler?! That never really happened!

name: ANDERSON
line: A-A blonde drug smuggler who was exposed by an abbot with unusual powers of observation and deduction!

name: LESTRADE
line: A blonde woman hiding amongst bald monks? That wouldn’t exactly take Sherlock Holmes!

name: ANDERSON
line: Well, perhaps it did.

name: LESTRADE
line: He’s dead.

name: LESTRADE
line: I’m sorry. I wish he wasn’t, but he really is dead and gone.

name: ANDERSON
line: Well, how d’you explain this?

name: ANDERSON
line: Sighting number two: Incident at New Delhi.

name: LESTRADE
line: You haven’t been titling these?

name: INSPECTOR PRAKESH
line: After that it was simply a matter of tracking down the killer, which I did by working out the depth to which the chocolate Flake had sunk into the victim’s ice-cream cone. (He chuckles contentedly as the photographers and reporters crowd closer to the table.)  Shortly afterwards he leaves the room while the photographers continue trying to get one last picture. Closing the door behind him, he turns and looks at someone waiting a little way down the corridor. PRAKESH: My friend! (He looks over his shoulder as if to make sure that nobody is looking through the round glass window in the door, then turns back to the person in front of him.) PRAKESH: Will you not take any of the credit? This was all down to you. (We see who he’s looking at. A very familiar shape with curly hair and wearing a greatcoat is standing facing him. His face is obscured in shadow.)  THE PRESENT. PUB. LESTRADE: Clever man, Inspector Prakesh. ANDERSON: Oh, for ...! What police inspector could have made that deduction? LESTRADE: Oh, thank you(!) ANDERSON: You remember how Sherlock never took the credit when he solved all of your cases? LESTRADE (indignantly): He didn’t solve all of my cases! ANDERSON (gazing thoughtfully into the distance): He’s out there. He’s hiding. But he can’t stop himself from getting involved. (He chuckles.) ANDERSON: It’s so obviously him, if you know how to spot the signs! LESTRADE: The Klein Brothers, the Tower House thing, the Kensington Ripper – I solved all those myself! ANDERSON: Well, you got Tower House wrong. LESTRADE: No I didn’t! ANDERSON: Yep, you did. (He folds the map to another location.) ANDERSON: Okay, sighting number three ... (he taps Hamburg on the map) ... the Mysterious Juror. (Greg literally head-desks, leaning forward and thumping his forehead down onto the table.)  FLASHBACK. HAMBURG. In a jury room, the male foreman rubs his head tiredly before addressing the rest of the jury in German. FOREMAN: Nun, wie wir alle wissen, wurde diese Jury unter höchst ungewöhnlichen Umständen zusammengerufen. Aber ich muss Sie jetzt auf ein Urteil drängen. Ist Herr Trephoff schuldig oder nicht schuldig am Mord seiner Frau?  [Translation as subtitled: As we all know this jury was convened under highly unusual circumstances, but now I must press you for a judgment. Is Herr Trepoff guilty or not guilty of the murder of his wife?] (One by one, the jurors answer in German.) FEMALE JUROR 1: Nicht schuldig. [Not guilty.] (At the end of the table, the fingers of a male juror wearing a shirt and dark coat drum impatiently on the table.) FEMALE JUROR 2: Nicht schuldig. MALE JUROR 1: Nicht schuldig. (The juror’s fingers continue to drum ...) MALE JUROR 2: Nicht schuldig. (... and drum ...) FEMALE JUROR 3: Nicht schuldig. MALE JUROR 3: Nicht schuldig. MALE JUROR 4: Nicht schuldig. (... and drum ...) FEMALE JUROR 4: Nicht schuldig. MALE JUROR 5: Nicht schuldig. FEMALE JUROR 5: Nicht schuldig. (... and drum ... and then stop above the table. The foreman sighs wearily and looks at the last juror.) FOREMAN (in an exasperated voice): Nun? [Well?] (We see part of the juror from behind. He has dark curly hair and is wearing a dark greatcoat with the collar popped.)  Some time later, a man walks across a concourse towards to a display of newspapers. The “CAM Global News” front page headline reads “Trepoff ‘Guilty’ Sensation!” while a German newspaper beside it reads “TREPOFF SCHULDIG!” [Trepoff guilty!]   THE PRESENT. PUB. ANDERSON: It had to be him! There’s no-one else it can be! Do you not see? LESTRADE: I see that you lost a good job fantasising about a dead man coming back to life, and I know why you want that to happen. (He grimaces.) But it’s never gonna. (Anderson shakes his head.) LESTRADE: Okay ... (he finishes his pint) ... I’m gonna go and see an old friend. (He picks up his coat and looks across to Anderson.) LESTRADE: You take care, okay? (He stands and picks up a white box from a nearby stool, then looks down at his former colleague sympathetically.) LESTRADE: I’ll put a word in – see if they won’t review your case. ANDERSON: Just look at the map, though. (An imaginary dotted line works its way from New Delhi to Hamburg and then on to Amsterdam, and then Brussels.) ANDERSON: He’s getting closer. (He looks up at Greg.) ANDERSON: It’s like he’s coming back. (Greg looks thoughtful for a minute, then nods politely to Anderson and leaves the pub.)  JOHN WATSON’S HOME. John walks across the living room of his flat or house and puts the white box down on top of a filing cabinet. He turns and smiles at Greg. JOHN: It’s good to see you, Greg. LESTRADE: And you. (They shake hands.) JOHN: Have a seat. LESTRADE (sitting down in an armchair): So, how’ve you been? JOHN (sitting down on the sofa): Er, yeah, good. Yeah. Much better. (Greg nods. John points towards the box.) JOHN: Er, so what’s in the, er ...? LESTRADE: Oh, that, yeah. That’s, er, that’s some stuff from my office – some stuff of Sherlock’s, actually. I probably should have thrown it out, but I didn’t know if ... (He looks awkwardly at John.) JOHN: No, fine, yeah. (He smiles at Greg, who stands up and walks over to the box, smiling.) LESTRADE: Yeah, there’s-there’s-there’s something here. Um, wasn’t sure whether I should have kept it in. (He takes off the lid. Inside the box are a pink iPhone – perhaps the pink phone – together with a box of nicotine patches, a small sheet of paper with some writing on it, a toy train engine, a yellow mask of a face and a DVD in a case. He takes out the DVD.) LESTRADE: You remember the video message he made for your birthday? (John nods.) LESTRADE: Oh, I had to practically threaten him. (John smiles a little.) LESTRADE: This is the uncut version. It’s quite funny. (Smiling, he hands the DVD to John.) JOHN: Oh, right. (He takes it and looks at it.) LESTRADE: Maybe I shouldn’t have brought it. JOHN: Don’t worry. It’s okay. Probably won’t even watch it. (They smile awkwardly at each other, then John looks down at the DVD again.)  LATER. Greg has gone. John is sitting in the armchair pouring himself a glass of whisky. Screwing the lid back onto the bottle, he stands up and puts it into a nearby cupboard, then sits down again, picks up the glass and takes a drink. Gazing at the DVD on the table in front of him for a while, he eventually picks it up, looks thoughtfully across to the TV, then gets up and walks across the room to put the disc into the player. It loads and he walks back to get his glass. On the TV screen is the very familiar sight of the sofa in 221B Baker Street, with the smiley face sprayed on the wall behind it. John sits down on the sofa opposite the TV and takes another drink. SHERLOCK’s VOICE: Was that supposed to happen – the light going down? Yeah, okay. (On the TV screen, Sherlock paces across the living room in front of the sofa.) SHERLOCK: Oh, er, mmm. So, what do I, what do I, what d’you want me to do at the end? (He stops and looks at Greg who is presumably behind the camera.) SHERLOCK: Shall I, um ...? Smile and wink. I do that sometimes. I’ve no idea why. People seem to like it – humanises me. (He turns away.) LESTRADE: Fine. Whatever. SHERLOCK (turning back around): Why am I doing this, again? LESTRADE: You’re gonna miss the dinner. SHERLOCK: Of course I’m gonna miss dinner. There’ll be people. (He starts to turn away, then turns back.) SHERLOCK: How can John be having a birthday dinner? All his friends hate him. (John smiles very briefly.) SHERLOCK: You only have to look at their faces. I wrote an essay on suppressed hatred in close proximity based entirely on his friends. (John smiles again. Sherlock looks away thoughtfully.) SHERLOCK: On reflection, it probably wasn’t a very good choice of gift. (He pulls himself together and looks into the camera for a moment before looking past it to Greg.) SHERLOCK: What was my excuse again? LESTRADE: You said you had a thing. SHERLOCK: Ah, right, yes! That’s right. A thing. LESTRADE: You might wanna elaborate. SHERLOCK: No, no, no. Only lies have detail. (John closes his eyes and shakes his head minutely. Sherlock stares intensely into the camera for a couple of seconds.) SHERLOCK: Right, I just ... I need a moment to, um, figure out what I’m going to do. (He walks offscreen towards the window. John looks down at his glass.) JOHN: I can tell you what you can do. You can stop being dead. (He drinks.) SHERLOCK: Okay. (He was momentarily back in front of the camera and looking straight into it while he said that. John looks at the screen, startled, but Sherlock has already walked away again.) SHERLOCK: Okay, I’m ready now. (He sits down in his armchair, settles into it, then looks into the camera.) SHERLOCK: Hallo, John. (He smiles.) I’m sorry I’m not there at the moment. I’m very busy. However, many happy returns. (John looks at the screen, his face hard to read.) SHERLOCK: Oh, and don’t worry. I’m going to be with you again very soon. (John’s doorbell rings. He looks round, then sits forward, putting his glass on the table and pressing the Pause button on the remote control. The picture freezes on Sherlock looking intensely into the camera. John stands up and walks out of the room.)  ANDERSON: He’s coming back. (In the pub, he looks up and smiles to himself, then laughs quietly and looks down at the map, chuckling with delight.)  Greg is walking along a road, intermittently looking down at his phone, but then stops and stares at a man with a white beard standing nearby. The man is reading a copy of the Daily Express and the back page of the newspaper is facing towards Greg. It shows three footballers in the middle of a match, and the headline reads, “THE GAME IS BACK ON!” Greg stares at the headline for a few seconds, then smiles cynically and walks into a nearby shop.  Back in John’s living room, the Pause button shifts to Play on its own. Sherlock smiles widely into the camera and winks.

name: SHERLOCK
line: It’s a trick. Just a magic trick.

name: JOHN
line: No. All right, stop it now.

name: SHERLOCK
line: No, stay exactly where you are.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Don’t move.

name: JOHN
line: All right.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Keep your eyes fixed on me. Please, will you do this for me?

name: JOHN
line: Do what?

name: SHERLOCK
line: This phone call – it’s ... it’s my note.

name: SHERLOCK
line: It’s what people do, don’t they? Leave a note?

name: JOHN
line: Leave a note when?

name: SHERLOCK
line: Goodbye, John.

name: JOHN
line: No. Don’t.

name: DERREN
line: John.

name: DERREN
line: John. Look at me. Look at me.

name: DERREN
line: And sleep!

name: DERREN
line: Right the way down, right the way deep, right the way sound asleep. That’s right. That’s good – keeping my voice just there in the centre of your head and floating all the way around you.

name: DERREN
line: And you will awaken in three, two, one ...

name: DERREN
line: ... zero.

name: ANDERSON
line: No-no-no-no! It’s obvious! That’s how he did it! It’s obvious!

name: LESTRADE
line: Derren Brown?! Let it go. Sherlock’s dead.

name: ANDERSON
line: Is he?

name: LESTRADE
line: There was a body. It was him. It was definitely him. Molly Hooper laid him out.

name: ANDERSON
line: No, she’s lying. It was Jim Moriarty’s body with a mask on!

name: LESTRADE
line: A mask?!

name: LESTRADE
line: A bungee rope, a mask, Derren Brown. Two years, and the theories keep getting more stupid. How many more’ve you got for me today?

name: ANDERSON
line: Well, you know the paving slabs in that whole area – even the exact ones that he landed on – you know they were all ...

name: LESTRADE
line: You did this, and it killed him, and he’s staying dead. Do you honestly believe that if you have enough stupid theories, it’s gonna change what really happened?

name: ANDERSON
line: I believe in Sherlock Holmes.

name: LESTRADE
line: Yeah, well that won’t bring him back.

name: LESTRADE
line: Well then. (He raises his cup.) Absent friends. Sherlock.

name: LESTRADE
line: And may God rest his soul.

name: MYCROFT
line: Now listen to me. There’s an underground terrorist network active in London and a massive attack is imminent. Sorry, but the holiday is over, brother dear.

name: MYCROFT
line: Back to Baker Street, Sherlock Holmes.

name: BOY
line: Penny for the guy?

name: BOY
line: Oi, mate! Penny for the guy?

name: SECOND BOY
line: Penny for the guy, mate?

name: FIRST BOY
line: Penny for the guy?

name: JOHN
line: That was the most ridiculous thing I’ve ever done.

name: SHERLOCK
line: And you invaded Afghanistan!

name: MYCROFT
line: You have been busy, haven’t you?

name: MYCROFT
line: Quite the busy little bee. (He chuckles.)

name: SHERLOCK
line: Moriarty’s network – took me two years to dismantle it.

name: MYCROFT
line: And you’re confident you have?

name: SHERLOCK
line: The Serbian side was the last piece of the puzzle.

name: MYCROFT
line: Yes. You got yourself in deep there ... (he checks his report) ... with Baron Maupertuis. Quite a scheme.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Colossal.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Hmm.

name: MYCROFT
line: A small ‘thank you’ wouldn’t go amiss.

name: SHERLOCK
line: What for?

name: MYCROFT
line: For wading in.

name: MYCROFT
line: In case you’d forgotten, fieldwork is not my natural milieu.

name: SHERLOCK
line: “Wading in”? You sat there and watched me being beaten to a pulp.

name: SHERLOCK
line: No – I got me out. Why didn’t you intervene sooner?

name: MYCROFT
line: Well, I couldn’t risk giving myself away, could I? It would have ruined everything.

name: MYCROFT
line: Nonsense.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Definitely enjoying it.

name: Listen
line: do you have any idea what it was like, Sherlock, going ‘under cover,’ smuggling my way into their ranks like that? (He grimaces.) The noise; the people.

name: SHERLOCK
line: I didn’t know you spoke Serbian.

name: MYCROFT
line: I didn’t, but the language has a Slavic root, frequent Turkish and German loan words. (He shrugs.) Took me a couple of hours.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Hmm – you’re slipping.

name: MRS HUDSON
line: Oh no – you don’t take it, do you?

name: JOHN
line: No.

name: MRS HUDSON
line: You forget a little thing like that.

name: JOHN
line: Yes.

name: JOHN
line: Uh-huh.

name: MRS HUDSON
line: Not sure about that.

name: MRS HUDSON
line: Ages you.

name: JOHN
line: Just trying it out.

name: MRS HUDSON
line: Well, it ages you.

name: JOHN
line: Look ...

name: MRS HUDSON
line: I’m not your mother. I’ve no right to expect it ...

name: JOHN
line: No ...

name: MRS HUDSON
line: ... but just one phone call, John.

name: MRS HUDSON
line: Just one phone call would have done.

name: JOHN
line: I know.

name: MRS HUDSON
line: After all we went through.

name: JOHN
line: I just let it slide, Mrs Hudson. I let it all slide. And it just got harder and harder to pick up the phone somehow.

name: JOHN
line: D’you know what I mean?

name: MYCROFT
line: I need you to give this matter your full attention, Sherlock. Is that quite clear?

name: SHERLOCK
line: What do you think of this shirt?

name: SHERLOCK
line: I will find your underground terror cell, Mycroft.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Just put me back in London. I need to get to know the place again, breathe it in – feel every quiver of its beating heart.

name: ANTHEA
line: One of our men died getting this information. All the chatter, all the traffic, concurs there’s going to be a terror strike on London – a big one.

name: MYCROFT
line: John?

name: SHERLOCK
line: Mmm. Have you seen him?

name: MYCROFT
line: Oh, yes – we meet up every Friday for fish and chips(!)

name: MYCROFT
line: I’ve kept a weather eye on him, of course.

name: MYCROFT
line: You haven’t been in touch at all, to prepare him?

name: SHERLOCK
line: Well, we’ll have to get rid of that.

name: MYCROFT
line: “We”?

name: SHERLOCK
line: He looks ancient. I can’t be seen to be wandering around with an old man.

name: MRS HUDSON
line: I couldn’t face letting it out.

name: MRS HUDSON
line: He never liked me dusting.

name: MRS HUDSON
line: So, why now? What changed your mind?

name: JOHN
line: Well, I’ve got some news.

name: MRS HUDSON
line: Oh, God. Is it serious?

name: JOHN
line: What? No – no, I’m not ill. I’ve, er, well, I’m ... moving on.

name: JOHN
line: Nope. Er, no – I’ve, er ... I’ve met someone.

name: MRS HUDSON
line: Oh, lovely!

name: JOHN
line: Well, yes.

name: MRS HUDSON
line: What’s his name?

name: MRS HUDSON
line: A woman?!

name: JOHN
line: Yes, of course it’s a woman.

name: MRS HUDSON
line: You really have moved on, haven’t you?

name: JOHN
line: Mrs Hudson! How many times ...? Sherlock was not my boyfriend.

name: Listen to me
line: I am not gay!

name: SHERLOCK
line: Hmm. I’ll pop into Baker Street. Who knows – jump out of a cake.

name: MYCROFT
line: Why would he be? It’s been two years. He’s got on with his life.

name: SHERLOCK
line: What life? I’ve been away.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Where’s he going to be tonight?

name: MYCROFT
line: How would I know?

name: SHERLOCK
line: You always know.

name: MYCROFT
line: He has a dinner reservation in the Marylebone Road. Nice little spot. They have a few bottles of the 2000 Saint-Emilion ... though I prefer the 2001.

name: SHERLOCK
line: I think maybe I’ll just drop by.

name: MYCROFT
line: You know, it is just possible that you won’t be welcome.

name: SHERLOCK
line: No it isn’t. Now, where is it?

name: MYCROFT
line: Where’s what?

name: SHERLOCK
line: You know what.

name: ANTHEA
line: Welcome back, Mr Holmes.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Your wife just texted you. Possibly her contractions have started.

name: WAITRESS
line: ’Scuse me, sir.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Sorry! I’m so, so sorry!

name: SHERLOCK
line: Please, let me just go to the kitchen and, er, dry that off for you.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Finished with that, sir? Allow me to take it for you.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Madam, can I suggest you look at this menu? It’s, er, completely identical.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Can I ’elp you with anything, sir?

name: JOHN
line: Er, it’s not really my area. What do you suggest?

name: JOHN
line: Mm-hm.

name: JOHN
