line: Great. I’ll have that one, please.

name: JOHN
line: Well, er, surprise me.

name: MARY
line: Sorry that took so long.

name: MARY
line: You okay?

name: JOHN
line: Yeah, yeah. Me? Fine. I am fine.

name: MARY
line: Now then, what did you want to ask me?

name: JOHN
line: More wine?

name: MARY
line: No, I’m good with water, thanks.

name: JOHN
line: Right. (He briefly looks away.)

name: MARY
line: So ...

name: JOHN
line: Er, so ... Mary. Listen, erm ... I know it hasn’t been long ... I mean, I know we haven’t known each other for a long time ...

name: JOHN
line: Yes, I will. As you know, these last couple of years haven’t been easy for me; and meeting you ...

name: JOHN
line: Yeah, meeting you has been the best thing that could have possibly happened.

name: MARY
line: I agree.

name: JOHN
line: What?

name: MARY
line: Sorry.

name: JOHN
line: Well, no. That’s, um ...

name: JOHN
line: So ... if you’ll have me, Mary, could you see your way, um ...

name: JOHN
line: ... if you could see your way to ...

name: JOHN
line: No, look, seriously ... (he finally lifts his gaze to meet the waiter’s eyes) ... could you just ...

name: SHERLOCK
line: ... Not Dead.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Bit mean, springing it on you like that, I know. Could have given you a heart attack, probably still will. But in my defence, it was very funny.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Okay, it’s not a great defence.

name: MARY
line: Oh no! You’re ...

name: SHERLOCK
line: Not quite.

name: MARY
line: You died. You jumped off a roof.

name: SHERLOCK
line: No.

name: SHERLOCK
line: No. I’m quite sure. I checked. Excuse me.

name: MARY
line: Oh my God, oh my God. Do you have any idea what you’ve done to him?

name: MARY
line: All right, just ... John? Just keep ...

name: JOHN
line: I thought ...

name: JOHN
line: I thought ... you were dead. (His face begins to fill with anger again.) Hmm?

name: JOHN
line: Now, you let me grieve, hmm? How could you do that?

name: SHERLOCK
line: ... um, one question. Just let me ask one question. Um ...

name: SHERLOCK
line: I calculated that there were thirteen possibilities once I’d invited Moriarty onto the roof.

name: SHERLOCK
line: What?

name: SHERLOCK
line: Oh. ‘Why’ as in ...

name: SHERLOCK
line: I see. Yes. ‘Why?’ That’s a little more difficult to explain.

name: JOHN
line: Oh, so it’s your brother’s plan?

name: MARY
line: Sorry.

name: JOHN
line: But he was the only one? The only one who knew?

name: SHERLOCK
line: Couple of others.

name: SHERLOCK
line: It was a very elaborate plan – it had to be. The next of the thirteen possibilities ...

name: JOHN
line: Who else knew?

name: JOHN
line: Who?

name: SHERLOCK
line: Molly.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Molly Hooper – and some of my homeless network, and that’s all.

name: JOHN
line: Okay. (He sits up a little and glances round at Mary, who gives him a sympathetic smile. He turns to Sherlock again.) Okay. So just your brother, and Molly Hooper, and a hundred tramps.

name: SHERLOCK
line: No! Twenty-five at most.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Seriously, it’s not a joke? (He gestures to his own top lip.) You’re-you’re really keeping this?

name: JOHN
line: Yeah.

name: SHERLOCK
line: You’re sure?

name: JOHN
line: Mary likes it.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Mmmmmm, no she doesn’t.

name: JOHN
line: She does.

name: SHERLOCK
line: She doesn’t.

name: JOHN
line: Oh! (He tries to cover his moustache with his hand.) Brilliant.

name: MARY
line: I’m sorry. Oh, I’m sorry – I didn’t know how to tell you.

name: JOHN
line: No, no, this is charming(!)

name: JOHN
line: I’ve really missed this(!)

name: JOHN
line: One Word, Sherlock. That is all I would have needed. One word to let me know that you were alive.

name: SHERLOCK
line: ... I worried that, you know, you might say something indiscreet.

name: JOHN
line: What?

name: SHERLOCK
line: Well, you know, let the cat out of the bag.

name: MARY
line: Oh, God!

name: SHERLOCK
line: Over-reacting.

name: MARY
line: John!

name: SHERLOCK
line: Shh!

name: JOHN
line: ... and you waltz in ’ere large as bloody life ...

name: SHERLOCK
line: Shh!

name: SHERLOCK
line: London is in danger, John. There’s an imminent terrorist attack and I need your help.

name: JOHN
line: My help?

name: SHERLOCK
line: You have missed this. Admit it. The thrill of the chase, the blood pumping through your veins, just the two of us against the rest of the world ...

name: SHERLOCK
line: I don’t understand.

name: SHERLOCK
line: I said I’m sorry. Isn’t that what you’re supposed to do?

name: MARY
line: Gosh. You don’t know anything about human nature, do you?

name: SHERLOCK
line: Mmm, nature? No. Human? ... No.

name: MARY
line: I’ll talk him round.

name: SHERLOCK
line: You will?

name: JOHN
line: Mary.

name: JOHN
line: Can you believe his nerve?

name: MARY
line: I like him.

name: JOHN
line: What?

name: LESTRADE
line: Ooh, you bastard!

name: LESTRADE
line: Greg!

name: SHERLOCK
line: Greg.

name: RADIO
line: ... with an anti-terrorism bill this important, the government feels duty-bound to push through the legislation with all due expe...

name: SHERLOCK
line: Don’t move. Keep your eyes fixed on me.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Please, will you do this for me? Please.

name: JOHN
line: Do what?

name: SHERLOCK
line: This phone call – it’s my note. That’s what people do, don’t they? Leave a note.

name: JOHN
line: Sherlock!

name: JIM
line: Oh-ho!

name: LAURA
line: I don’t see why not. It’s just as plausible as some of your theories.

name: ANDERSON
line: Look, if you’re not going to take it seriously, Laura, you can ... (He makes a ‘get out’ gesture.)

name: ANDERSON
line: I founded ‘The Empty Hearse’ so like-minded people could meet, discuss theories ...

name: ANDERSON
line: Sherlock’s still out there.

name: ANDERSON
line: I’m convinced of it.

name: LAURA
line: Oh my God.

name: LAURA
line: Oh. My. God!

name: MARY
line: “I couldn’t help thinking what an amazing criminal he’d make if he turned his talents against the law.”

name: JOHN
line: Don’t read that.

name: JOHN
line: Come on – that’s ...

name: MARY
line: ... ancient history, yes, I know. But it’s not, though, is it, because he’s ...

name: JOHN
line: Having a wash.

name: JOHN
line: Well, you hate it.

name: MARY
line: Sherlock hates it.

name: JOHN
line: Apparently everyone hates it.

name: MARY
line: Are you gonna see him again?

name: JOHN
line: No – I’m going to work.

name: MARY
line: Oh. And after work, are you gonna see him again?

name: MARY
line: Cor, I dunno – six months of bristly kisses for me, and then His Nibs turns up ...

name: MARY
line: Oh! You should put that on a T-shirt!

name: JOHN
line: Shut up.

name: JOHN
line: Or I’ll marry you.

name: MYCROFT
line: All very interesting, Sherlock, but the terror alert has been raised to Critical.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Boring. Your move.

name: MYCROFT
line: We have solid information. An attack is coming.

name: SHERLOCK
line: “Solid information.” A secret terrorist organisation’s planning an attack – that’s what secret terrorist organisations do, isn’t it? It’s their version of golf.

name: MYCROFT
line: An agent gave his life to tell us that.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Oh, well, perhaps he shouldn’t have done. He was obviously just trying to show off.

name: MYCROFT
line: None of these markers of yours is behaving in any way suspiciously? (He glances down again and we hear him makes a move.) Your move.

name: SHERLOCK
line: No, Mycroft, but you have to trust me. I’ll find the answer. It’ll be in an odd phrase in an online blog, or an unexpected trip to the countryside, or a misplaced Lonely Hearts ad.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Your move.

name: MYCROFT
line: I’ve given the Prime Minister my personal assurance you’re on the case.

name: SHERLOCK
line: I am on the case. We’re both on the case. Look at us right now.

name: MYCROFT
line: Oh, bugger!

name: SHERLOCK
line: Oopsie!

name: MYCROFT
line: Don’t be smart.

name: SHERLOCK
line: That takes me back. (In a little boy’s voice) “Don’t be smart, Sherlock. I’m the smart one.”

name: SHERLOCK
line: I used to think I was an idiot.

name: MYCROFT
line: Both of us thought you were an idiot, Sherlock. We had nothing else to go on ’til we met other children.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Oh, yes. That was a mistake.

name: MYCROFT
line: Ghastly. What were they thinking of?

name: SHERLOCK
line: Probably something about trying to make friends.

name: MYCROFT
line: Oh yes. Friends. Of course, you go in for that sort of thing now.

name: MYCROFT
line: If you seem slow to me, Sherlock, can you imagine what real people are like? I’m living in a world of goldfish.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Yes, but I’ve been away for two years.

name: MYCROFT
line: So?

name: SHERLOCK
line: Rest assured, Mycroft – whatever this underground network of yours is up to, the secret will reside in something seemingly insignificant or bizarre.

name: MYCROFT
line: Speaking of which ...

name: MRS HUDSON
line: Oh, isn’t it wonderful, Mr Holmes?

name: MYCROFT
line: I can barely contain myself(!)

name: SHERLOCK
line: Oh, he really can, you know.

name: MRS HUDSON
line: He’s secretly pleased to see you underneath all that ... (she pulls a sour face).

name: MYCROFT
line: Sorry – which of us?

name: MRS HUDSON
line: Both of you.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Let’s play something different.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Well, London’s terror alert has been raised to Critical. (He flails his legs over the table in front of him and stands up.) I’m just passing the time. Let’s do deductions.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Client left this while I was out. What d’you reckon?

name: SHERLOCK
line: Oh, go on. It’s been an age.

name: MYCROFT
line: I always win.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Which is why you can’t resist.

name: MYCROFT
line: Damn.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Isolated, too, don’t you think?

name: MYCROFT
line: Why would he be isolated?

name: SHERLOCK
line: “He”?

name: MYCROFT
line: Obviously.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Why? Size of the hat?

name: MYCROFT
line: Don’t be silly. Some women have large heads too.

name: MYCROFT
line: No – he’s recently had his hair cut. You can see the little hairs adhering to the perspiration stains on the inside.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Some women have short hair, too.

name: MYCROFT
line: Balance of probability.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Not that you’ve ever spoken to a woman with short hair – or, you know, a woman.

name: MYCROFT
line: Stains show he’s out of condition, and he’s sentimental because the hat has been repaired three, four ...

name: SHERLOCK
line: Five times. (He throws the hat back to his brother.) Very neatly. (Quick fire) The cost of the repairs exceeds the cost of the hat, so he's mawkishly attached to it, but it’s more than that. One, perhaps two, patches would indicate sentimentality, but five? Five’s excessive behaviour. Obsessive compulsive.

name: MYCROFT
line: Hardly. Your client left it behind. What sort of an obsessive compulsive would do that?

name: MYCROFT
line: The earlier patches are extensively sun-bleached, so he’s worn it abroad – in Peru.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Peru?

name: MYCROFT
line: This is a chullo – the classic headgear of the Andes. It’s made of alpaca.

name: MYCROFT
line: No?

name: SHERLOCK
line: Icelandic sheep wool. Similar, but very distinctive if you know what you’re looking for. I’ve written a blog on the varying tensile strengths of different natural fibres.

name: SHERLOCK
line: You said he was anxious.

name: MYCROFT
line: The bobble on the left side has been badly chewed, which shows he’s a man of a nervous disposition but ...

name: MYCROFT
line: Precisely.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Brief sniff of the offending bobble tells us everything we need to know about the state of his breath.

name: MYCROFT
line: Elementary.

name: SHERLOCK
line: But you’ve missed his isolation.

name: MYCROFT
line: I don’t see it.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Plain as day.

name: MYCROFT
line: Where?

name: SHERLOCK
line: There for all to see.

name: MYCROFT
line: Tell me.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Plain as the nose on your ...

name: MYCROFT
line: Tell me.

name: MYCROFT
line: Not at all. Maybe he just doesn’t mind being different. He doesn’t necessarily have to be isolated.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Exactly.

name: MYCROFT
line: I’m sorry?

name: SHERLOCK
line: Why would anyone mind?

name: MYCROFT
line: ... I’m not lonely, Sherlock.

name: SHERLOCK
line: How would you know?

name: MYCROFT
line: Yes. Back to work if you don’t mind. Good morning.

name: MARY
line: Mr Summerson.

name: JOHN
line: Right.

name: MARY
line: Undescended testicle.

name: JOHN
line: ... Right.

name: MRS HUDSON
line: Sherlock.

name: MRS HUDSON
line: Talk to John.

name: SHERLOCK
line: I tried talking to him. He made his position quite clear.

name: JOHN
line: Just relax, Mr Summerson.

name: MRS HUDSON
line: What did he say?

name: JOHN
line: Cough.

name: MRS HUDSON
line: Ooh dear!

name: JOHN
line: Hi.

name: JOHN
line: Right.

name: MOLLY
line: You wanted to see me?

name: SHERLOCK
line: Molly?

name: MOLLY
line: Yes?

name: SHERLOCK
line: Would you ...

name: SHERLOCK
line: Would you like to ...

name: MOLLY
line: ... have dinner?

name: JOHN
line: Absolutely nothing to be ashamed of, Mrs Reeves. It’s very common ... (he turns and hands the prescription to her) ... but I’m recommending a course of ...

name: SHERLOCK
line: ... monkey glands.

name: SHERLOCK
line: But enough about Professor Presbury. Tell us more about your case, Mr Harcourt.

name: MOLLY
line: Are you sure about this?

name: SHERLOCK
line: Absolutely.

name: MOLLY
line: Should I be making notes?

name: SHERLOCK
line: If it makes you feel better.

name: MOLLY
line: It’s just that that’s what John says he does, so if I’m being John ...

name: MR HARCOURT
line: Well, absolutely no one should have been able to empty that bank account other than myself and Helen.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Why didn’t you assume it was your wife?

name: MR HARCOURT
line: Because I’ve always had total faith in her.

name: SHERLOCK
line: No – it’s because you emptied it. (He points at the three areas on the man at which he had just looked and speaks rapidly.) Weight loss, hair dye, Botox; affair. (Whipping out a business card, he holds it out to Mrs Harcourt.) Lawyer. Next!

name: MARY
line: This is Mr Blake. (Whispering) Piles.

name: JOHN
line: Mr Blake, hi.

name: SHERLOCK
line: And your pen pal’s emails just stopped, did they?

name: SHERLOCK
line: Stepfather posing as online boyfriend.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Breaks it off, breaks her heart. She swears off relationships, stays at home – he still has her wage coming in.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Mr Windibank, you have been a complete and utter ...

name: JOHN
line: ... piss pot.

name: JOHN
line: It’s nothing to worry about. Just a small infection by the sound of it. Er, Doctor Verner is your usual GP, yes?

name: MR SZIKORA
line: Yeah, yeah, yeah, yeah.

name: MR SZIKORA
line: He looked after me, man and boy.

name: MR SZIKORA
line: I run a little shop, just on the corner of Church Street.

name: JOHN
line: Oh, right.

name: MR SZIKORA
line: “Tree Worshippers.” Oh, that’s a corker. It’s very saucy.

name: MR SZIKORA
line: “British Birds.” Same sort of thing.

name: JOHN
line: I’m fine, thanks.

name: JOHN
line: Jesus. Sherlock ...

name: MR SZIKORA
line: Huh?

name: JOHN
line: ... what do you want?

name: MR SZIKORA
line: Huh?

name: JOHN
line: Have you come to torment me?

name: MR SZIKORA
line: What are you talking about?

name: MR SZIKORA
line: Are you crazy?!

name: JOHN
line: It’s not as good as your French. Not as good as your French. It’s not even a good disguise, Sherlock!

name: JOHN
line: Where’d you get it from? A bloody joke ... sh-shop ...?

name: JOHN
line: Oh my God.

name: JOHN
line: I am so sorry. Oh my God.

name: JOHN
line: Please for... (He looks across to Mary, speaking a little plaintively.) It’s fine.

name: LESTRADE
line: This one’s got us all baffled.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Mmm. I don’t doubt it.

name: MOLLY
line: What is it?

name: MOLLY
line: You’re on to something, aren’t you?

name: SHERLOCK
line: Mm, maybe.

name: MOLLY
line: What?

name: SHERLOCK
line: Hmm? Nothing.

name: JOHN
line: Mmm.

name: MARY
line: You sure?

name: JOHN
line: I’m sure.

name: MARY
line: Okay. I’m late for Cath. I’ll see you later.

name: JOHN
line: ’Bye.

name: MARY
line: ’Bye.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Just giving it a go.

name: LESTRADE
line: Right. So, John?

name: SHERLOCK
line: Not really in the picture any more.

name: MOLLY
line: Trains?

name: SHERLOCK
line: Trains.

name: MOLLY
line: Male, forty to fifty.

name: MOLLY
line: Ooh, sorry, did you want to be ...?

name: SHERLOCK
line: Er, no, please. Be my guest.

name: MOLLY

name: SHERLOCK
line: Welcome to my world.

name: SHERLOCK
line: I won’t insult your intelligence by explaining it to you.

name: SHERLOCK
line: The-the-the corpse is-is six months old; it’s dressed in a shoddy Victorian outfit from a museum. It’s been displayed on a dummy for many years in a case facing south-east judging from the fading of the fabric. It was sold off in a fire-damage sale ... (he gets out his phone and shows the screen to Greg) ... a week ago.

name: LESTRADE
line: So the whole thing was a fake.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Yes.

name: LESTRADE
line: Looked so promising.

name: MOLLY
line: Why would someone go to all that trouble?

name: HOWARD
line: Oh. Thanks for hanging on to it.

name: SHERLOCK
line: No problem.

name: SHERLOCK
line: So, what’s this all about, Mr Shilcott?

name: HOWARD
line: My girlfriend’s a big fan of yours.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Sorry. Do go on.

name: HOWARD
line: I like trains.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Yyyes.

name: HOWARD
line: I work on the Tube, on the District Line, and part of my job is to wipe the security footage after it’s been cleared.

name: HOWARD
line: I was just whizzing through and, er, I found something a bit bizarre.

name: HOWARD
line: Now, this was a week ago. The last train on the Friday night, Westminster station, and this man gets into the last car.

name: MOLLY
line: “Car”?

name: HOWARD
line: They’re cars, not carriages. It’s a legacy of the early American involvement in the Tube system.

name: SHERLOCK
line: He said he liked trains.

name: MOLLY
line: Hmm!

name: HOWARD
line: And the next stop ... (he shows the appropriate footage) ... St James’s Park station ... and ...

name: HOWARD
line: I thought you’d like it.

name: HOWARD
line: He gets into the last car at Westminster, the only passenger ...

name: HOWARD
line: ... and the car is empty at St James’s Park station. Explain that, Mr Holmes.

name: MOLLY
line: Couldn’t he have just jumped off?

name: HOWARD
line: There’s a safety mechanism that prevents the doors from opening in transit. But there’s something else. The driver of that train hasn’t been to work since. According to his flatmate, he’s on holiday. Came into some money.

name: SHERLOCK
line: So if the driver of the train was in on it, then the passenger did get off.

name: HOWARD
line: There’s nowhere he could go. It’s a straight run on the District Line between the two stations. There’s no side tunnels, no maintenance tunnels – nothing on any map. Nothing. The train never stops, and the man vanishes. Good, innit?!

name: SHERLOCK
line: I know that face.

name: MOLLY
line: Right.

name: MOLLY
line: What?

name: SHERLOCK
line: I know a fantastic fish shop just off the Marylebone Road. The owner always gives me extra portions.

name: SHERLOCK
line: No – I helped him put up some shelves.

name: MOLLY
line: Sherlock?

name: SHERLOCK
line: Hmm?

name: MOLLY
line: What was today about?

name: SHERLOCK
line: Saying thank you.

name: MOLLY
line: For what?

name: SHERLOCK
line: Everything you did for me.

name: MOLLY
line: It’s okay. It was my pleasure.

name: SHERLOCK
line: No, I mean it.

name: MOLLY
line: I don’t mean ‘pleasure.’ I mean, I didn’t mind. I wanted to.

name: SHERLOCK
line: But you can’t do this again, can you?

name: MOLLY
line: I had a lovely day. I’d love to – I just ... um ... (She looks down.)

name: MOLLY
line: He’s not from work.

name: MOLLY
line: We met through friends, the old-fashioned way. He’s nice. We ... he’s got a dog ... we-we go to the pub on weekends and he ... I’ve met his mum and dad and his friends and all his family. I’ve no idea why I’m telling you this.

name: SHERLOCK
line: I hope you’ll be very happy, Molly Hooper. You deserve it. After all, not all the men you fall for can turn out to be sociopaths(!)

name: MOLLY

name: SHERLOCK
line: No.

name: SHERLOCK

name: SHERLOCK
line: Why would an agent give his life to tell us something incredibly insignificant? That’s what’s strange.

name: SHERLOCK
line: According to Mycroft. There’s an underground network planning an attack on London – that’s all we know.

name: SHERLOCK
line: My markers: agents, low-lifes, people who might find themselves arrested or their diplomatic immunity suddenly rescinded. If one of them starts acting suspiciously, we know something’s up. Five of them are behaving perfectly normally, but the sixth ...

name: SHERLOCK
line: Lord Moran, peer of the realm, Minister for Overseas Development. Pillar of the establishment.

name: JOHN

name: SHERLOCK
line: He’s been working for North Korea since 1996.

name: JOHN

name: SHERLOCK

name: SHERLOCK
line: Not according to the maps.

name: JOHN

name: SHERLOCK
line: There’s something – something, something I’m missing, something staring me in the face.

name: SHERLOCK

name: JOHN
line: Al-Qaeda; the IRA have been getting restless again – maybe they’re gonna make an appearance ...

name: JOHN
line: What?

name: JOHN

name: SHERLOCK
line: Mycroft’s intelligence – it’s not nebulous at all. It’s specific – incredibly specific.

name: SHERLOCK

name: JOHN

name: SHERLOCK
line: Sometimes a deception is so audacious, so outrageous that you can’t see it even when it’s staring you in the face.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Look – seven carriages leave Westminster ... (the footage switches to show the next station) ... but only six carriages arrive at St James’s Park.

name: JOHN
line: But that’s ... I ... it’s-it’s impossible.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Moran didn’t disappear – the entire Tube compartment did. The driver must have diverted the train and then detached the last carriage.

name: JOHN
line: Detached it where?! You said there was nothing between those stations.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Not on the maps, but once you eliminate all the other factors, the only thing remaining must be the truth. (He points at the screen.) That carriage vanished, so it must be somewhere.

name: JOHN
line: But why, though? Why detach it in the first place?

name: JOHN
line: Hmm? November the ... My God.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Lord Moran – he’s a peer of the realm. Normally he’d sit in the House. Tonight there’s an all-night sitting to vote on the new anti-terrorism Bill.

name: SHERLOCK
line: But he won’t be there. Not tonight. (He turns to look down at John.) Not the fifth of November.

name: JOHN

name: SHERLOCK

line: You assumed she reacted like that because I was her kidnapper. But I deduced Moriarty must have found someone who looked very like me to plant suspicion, and that that man – whoever he was – had to be got out of the way as soon as his usefulness ended. name: s note
line: some of the newspaper articles name Greg as ‘DCI Lestrade’ but in the end credits of the programme he is named as ‘DI Lestrade.’ I am far more inclined to believe the end credits.]

name: DONOVAN
line: Okay: ten men on the roof; all exits covered; the bank’s closed, so there are no hostages to worry about ...

name: LESTRADE
line: Sorry, no, go on, go on.

name: DONOVAN
line: Um, we’ve got the tunnel entrance covered; and Davies, Willard and Christie are heading up our Response on Mafeking Road.

name: LESTRADE
line: Sorry, I’d better get this.

name: LESTRADE
line: I-I, I have to go.

name: LESTRADE
line: You make the arrest.

name: DONOVAN
line: No way!

name: LESTRADE
line: Sorry. You’ll be fine. I’m-I’m-I’m cool with this.

name: DONOVAN
line: Jones’ll get all the credit if you leave now! You know he will!

name: LESTRADE
line: Yeah, but d... It doesn’t matter. I have to go.

name: SHERLOCK
line: This is hard.

name: LESTRADE
line: What?

name: SHERLOCK
line: Really hard. Hardest thing I’ve ever had to do.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Have you any funny stories about John?

name: LESTRADE
line: What?!

name: SHERLOCK
line: I need anecdotes.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Didn’t go to any trouble, did you?

name: SHERLOCK
line: Shut up, Mrs Hudson.

name: MRS HUDSON
line: I haven’t said a word.

name: MRS HUDSON
line: I thought it was you playing.

name: SHERLOCK
line: I am composing.

name: SHERLOCK
line: I was road-testing.

name: MRS HUDSON
line: You what?

name: MRS HUDSON
line: I’m bringing you your morning tea. (She pours some milk into the teacup.) You’re not usually awake.

name: SHERLOCK
line: I don’t know. I just thought it sort of happened.

name: MRS HUDSON
line: Your mother has a lot to answer for.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Mm, I know. I have a list. Mycroft has a file.

name: MRS HUDSON
line: The wedding! John and Mary getting married!

name: SHERLOCK
line: Two people who currently live together are about to attend church, have a party, go on a short holiday and then carry on living together. What’s big about that?

name: MRS HUDSON
line: It changes people, marriage.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Mmm, no it doesn’t.

name: MRS HUDSON
line: Well, you wouldn’t understand ’cause you always live alone.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Your husband was executed for double murder. You’re hardly an advert for companionship. (He drinks.)

name: MRS HUDSON
line: Marriage changes you as a person, in ways that you can’t imagine.

name: SHERLOCK
line: As does lethal injection. (He smiles pointedly at her.)

name: MRS HUDSON
line: My best friend, Margaret – she was my chief bridesmaid.

name: MRS HUDSON
line: We were going to be best friends forever, we always said that; but I hardly saw her after that.

name: MRS HUDSON
line: I’ve run out.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Have the shops?

name: MRS HUDSON
line: She cried the whole day, saying, “Ooh, it’s the end of an era.”

name: MRS HUDSON
line: She was probably right, really.

name: MRS HUDSON
line: I remember she left early. I mean, who leaves a wedding early? (She shakes her head.) So sad.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Mmm. Anyway, you’ve got things to do.

name: MRS HUDSON
line: No, not really. I’ve got plenty of time to ...

name: SHERLOCK
line: You can if you like. She understands very little.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Into battle.

name: PHOTOGRAPHER
line: Congratulations! Okay, hold it there – I wanna get this shot of the newlyweds.

name: PHOTOGRAPHER
line: Er, just the bride and groom, please.

name: JOHN
line: Sherlock?

name: SHERLOCK
line: Oh, sorry.

name: PHOTOGRAPHER
line: Okay – three, two, one, cheese!

name: JANINE
line: The famous Mr Holmes! I’m very pleased to meet you. But no sex, okay?

name: SHERLOCK
line: Is it?

name: SHERLOCK
line: If that’s the sort of thing you’re looking for ... (he jerks his head towards one of the wedding guests) ... the man over there in blue is your best bet. Recently divorced doctor with a ginger cat ... (there’s a close-up of a ginger cat hair stuck on the man’s suit, and the sound of a miaow) ... a barn conversion ... (close-up of sawdust on the man’s footwear) ... and a history of erectile dysfunction.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Reviewing that information, possibly not your best bet.

name: JANINE
line: Yeah, maybe not.

name: JANINE
line: Mr Holmes ... (she takes his arm) ... you’re going to be incredibly useful.

name: MARY
line: How are you?

name: MAN
line: You look beautiful, Mary.

name: MARY
line: Thank you!

name: MAN
line: Congratulations.

name: MARY
line: David!

name: DAVID
line: Mary. Congratulations. You look, um, very nice.

name: DAVID
line: John, congratulations. You’re a lucky man.

name: JOHN
line: Thank you.

name: MARY
line: Um, er, David, this is Sherlock.

name: DAVID
line: Um, yeah. We’ve, um, we’ve met.

name: DAVID
line: So, what exactly are my duties as an usher?

name: SHERLOCK
line: Let’s talk about Mary, first.

name: DAVID
line: Sorry, what?

name: SHERLOCK
line: Oh, I think you know what. You went out with her for two years.

name: DAVID
line: A-ages ago. We’re j... we’re just good friends now.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Is that a fact?

name: SHERLOCK
line: Whenever she tweets, you respond within five minutes regardless of time or current location, suggesting you have her on text alert. In all your Facebook photographs of the happy couple, Mary takes centre frame whereas John is always partly or entirely excluded.

name: SHERLOCK
line: You volunteered to be a shoulder to cry on on no less than three separate occasions. Do you have anything to say in your defence?

name: SHERLOCK
line: I have your contact details. I will be monitoring.

name: SHERLOCK
line: High-functioning sociopath ... with your number.

name: MARY
line: Hello!

name: MARY
line: Pleased to see you.

name: WOMAN
line: Congratulations.

name: JOHN
line: Thanks for coming, thank you.

name: MARY
line: Hello, Archie!

name: SHERLOCK
line: Mm, yes, um, well done in the service, Archie.

name: MUM
line: He’s really come out of his shell. I don’t know how you did it.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Um ...

name: SHERLOCK
line: Basically it’s a cute smile to the bride’s side, cute smile to the groom’s side and then the rings.

name: SHERLOCK
line: And you have to wear the outfit.

name: SHERLOCK
line: You really do have to wear the outfit.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Grown-ups like that sort of thing.

name: SHERLOCK
line: ... I don’t know. I’ll ask one.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Yep. (He pops the ‘p’ loudly.)

name: ARCHIE
line: Have you solved any murders?

name: SHERLOCK
line: Sure. Loads.

name: ARCHIE
line: Can I see?

name: ARCHIE
line: What’s all the stuff in his eye?

name: SHERLOCK
line: Maggots.

name: ARCHIE
line: Cool!

name: MUM
line: He said you had some pictures for him, as a treat.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Er, yes ... (he pats Archie’s head) ... if he’s good.

name: MUM
line: Hmm? (She looks down at Archie as they go inside.) What did you say?

name: PHOTOGRAPHER
line: Nice.

name: JOHN
line: Oh, d’you want ...?

name: MARY
line: Had to lose so much weight to get into this dress.

name: JANINE
line: He’s nice.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Traces of two leading brands of deodorant, both advertised for their strength, suggestive of a chronic body odour problem manifesting under stress.

name: JANINE
line: Okay, done there. What about his friend?

name: SHERLOCK
line: Long-term relationship, compulsive cheat.

name: JANINE
line: Seriously?

name: SHERLOCK
line: Waterproof cover on his smartphone. (Close-up of the phone in the man’s jacket pocket.) Yet his complexion doesn’t indicate outdoor work. (Close-up of the man’s face.) Suggests he’s in the habit of taking his phone into the shower with him, which means he often receives texts and emails he’d rather went unseen.

name: SHERLOCK
line: D’you like solving crimes?

name: JANINE
line: Do you have a vacancy?

name: MARY
line: So, Harry?

name: JOHN
line: Er, no. No show.

name: MARY
line: Darling, I’m so sorry.

name: JOHN
line: It was a bit of a punt asking her, I suppose. Still, free bar – wouldn’t have been a good mix.

name: JOHN
line: Oh, God, wow!

name: MARY
line: Oh, G... Is that ...?

name: JOHN
line: He came!

name: SHERLOCK
line: So that’s him. Major Sholto.

name: MARY
line: Uh-huh.

name: SHERLOCK
line: If they’re such good friends, why does he barely even mention him?

name: MARY
line: He mentions him all the time to me. He never shuts up about him.

name: SHERLOCK
line: About him?

name: MARY
line: Mm-hmm.

name: MARY
line: Urgh. I chose this wine. It’s bloody awful.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Yes, but it’s definitely him that he talks about?

name: MARY
line: Mm-hmm.

name: JOHN
line: I’m very, very glad to see you, sir. I know you don’t really do this sort of thing.

name: SHOLTO
line: Well, I do for old friends, Watson ... John. It’s good to see you.

name: JOHN
line: You too.

name: SHOLTO
line: Civilian life suiting you, then?

name: JOHN
line: Er, er, yes, well ... (he gestures towards Mary) ... I think so, sir.

name: SHOLTO
line: No more need for the trick cyclist?

name: JOHN
line: No, I-I go now and then. Sort of a top-up.

name: JOHN
line: Therapy can be very helpful.

name: JOHN
line: Where are you living these days?

name: SHOLTO
line: Oh, way out in the middle of nowhere. You wouldn’t know it.

name: SHERLOCK
line: I’ve never even heard him say his name.

name: MARY
line: Well, he’s almost a recluse – you know, since ...

name: SHERLOCK
line: Yes.

name: MARY
line: I didn’t think he’d show up at all. John says he’s the most unsociable man he’s ever met.

name: SHERLOCK
line: He is? He’s the most unsociable?

name: MARY
line: Mm.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Ah, that’s why he’s bouncing round him like a puppy.

name: MARY
line: Oh, Sherlock! Neither of us were the first, you know.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Stop smiling.

name: MYCROFT
line: Filing.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Either I’ve caught you in a compromising position or you’ve been working out again. I favour the latter.

name: MYCROFT
line: What do you want?

name: SHERLOCK
line: I need your answer, Mycroft, as a matter of urgency.

name: MYCROFT
line: “Answer”?

name: SHERLOCK
line: Even at the eleventh hour it’s not too late, you know.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Cars can be ordered, private jets commandeered.

name: MYCROFT
line: Today. It’s today, isn’t it? No, Sherlock, I will not be coming to the “night do,” as you so poetically put it.

name: MYCROFT
line: ... delighted not to have me hanging around.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Oh, I don’t know. There should always be a spectre at the feast.

name: SHERLOCK
line: What do you mean?

name: MYCROFT
line: Just like old times.

name: SHERLOCK
line: No, I don’t understand.

name: MYCROFT
line: Well, it’s the end of an era, isn’t it? John and Mary – domestic bliss.

name: SHERLOCK
line: No, no, no – I prefer to think of it as the beginning of a new chapter.

name: SHERLOCK
line: What?

name: MYCROFT
line: Nothing!

name: SHERLOCK
line: I know that silence. What?

name: MYCROFT
line: Well, I’d better let you get back to it. You have a big speech, or something, don’t you?

name: MYCROFT
line: Cake, karaoke ... mingling.

name: MYCROFT
line: This is what people do, Sherlock – they get married. I warned you: don’t get involved.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Involved? I’m not involved.

name: SHERLOCK
line: John asked me to be his best man. How could I say no?

name: SHERLOCK
line: I’m not involved!

name: SHERLOCK
line: I will.

name: MYCROFT
line: Oh, by the way, Sherlock – do you remember Redbeard?

name: SHERLOCK
line: I’m not a child any more, Mycroft.

name: MYCROFT
line: No, of course you’re not. Enjoy not getting involved, Sherlock.

name: MASTER OF CEREMONIES
line: Pray silence for the best man.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Ladies and gentlemen, family and friends ... and ... erm ... others.

name: SHERLOCK
line: A-a-also ...

name: MOLLY
line: Greg.

name: LESTRADE
line: Molly.

name: LESTRADE
line: Is that a brain?!

name: MOLLY
line: What if John asks Sherlock to be his best man?

name: LESTRADE
line: Well, he will, won’t he? He’s bound to.

name: MOLLY
line: Exactly.

name: LESTRADE
line: So?

name: MOLLY
line: So he’ll have to make a speech in front of people.

name: MOLLY
line: There’ll be actual people there, actually listening.

name: MOLLY
line: Helen Louise probably wondered the same.

name: LESTRADE
line: Helen Louise?

name: MRS HUDSON
line: Oh, hallo, dear.

name: MRS HUDSON
line: What, the speech, dear? No, it’ll be fine.

name: MOLLY
line: It-it’s not just the speech, though, is it?

name: JOHN
line: Mrs Hudson?

name: MRS HUDSON
line: Oh, hello, darling! (She continues to giggle.)

name: JOHN
line: You all right?

name: JOHN
line: I was – I was coming to see Sherlock, and I thought you were ...

name: JOHN
line: ... possibly dying. (He grins at the sight of her mirth.)

name: MRS HUDSON
line: Oh, sorry!

name: JOHN
line: What’s wrong?

name: MRS HUDSON
line: The-the telegrams!

name: SHERLOCK
line: Right, um ...

name: SHERLOCK
line: First things first. Telegrams.

name: JOHN
line: Ah, Mike.

name: MARY
line: Ahh!

name: JOHN
line: Yeah?

name: SHERLOCK
line: “... Oodles of love and heaps of good wishes from CAM.”

name: SHERLOCK
line: “Wish your family could have seen this.”

name: JOHN
line: Hey. Hmm?

name: SHERLOCK
line: When John first broached the subject of being best man, I was confused.

name: JOHN
line: Sherlock?

name: JOHN
line: Er, it was Mrs Hudson laughing.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Sounded like she was torturing an owl.

name: JOHN
line: Yeah. Well, it was laughter.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Could have been both.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Just occupying myself. (He lifts his head and looks dramatically towards the ceiling.) Sometimes, it’s so-o-o hard not smoking.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Oh.

name: JOHN
line: Mm-hmm. Mind if I interrupt?

name: SHERLOCK
line: Tea?

name: JOHN
line: Er ...

name: SHERLOCK
line: The best man?

name: JOHN
line: What do you think?

name: JOHN
line: Sorry, what?

name: SHERLOCK
line: Oh, right.

name: JOHN
line: Maybe not a garrotter.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Gavin?

name: JOHN
line: Who?

name: SHERLOCK
line: Gavin Lestrade? He’s a man, and good at it.

name: JOHN
line: It’s Greg. And he’s not my best friend.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Oh, Mike Stamford, I see. Well, he’s nice, um, though I’m not sure how well he’d cope with all ...

name: JOHN
line: Look, Sherlock, this is the biggest and most important day of my life.

name: JOHN
line: No, it is! It is, and I want to be up there with the two people that I love and care about most in the world.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Yes.

name: JOHN
line: So, Mary Morstan ...

name: SHERLOCK
line: Yes.

name: JOHN
line: ... you.

name: SHERLOCK
line: I confess at first I didn’t realise he was asking me. When finally I understood, I expressed to him that I was both flattered and ... surprised.

name: SHERLOCK
line: I explained to him that I’d never expected this request and I was a little daunted in the face of it.

name: JOHN
line: Sherlock.

name: SHERLOCK
line: I nonetheless promised that I would do my very best to accomplish a task which was – for me – as demanding and difficult as any I had ever contemplated. Additionally, I thanked him for the trust he’d placed in me ...

name: SHERLOCK
line: ... and indicated that I was, in some ways, very close to being ... moved by it.

name: JOHN
line: That’s getting a bit scary now.

name: SHERLOCK
line: It later transpired that I had said none of this out loud.

name: SHERLOCK
line: So, in fact ...

name: SHERLOCK
line: You-you mean ...

name: JOHN
line: Yes.

name: SHERLOCK
line: I’m your ...

name: SHERLOCK
line: ... best ...

name: JOHN
line: ... man.

name: JOHN
line: Yeah, ’course you are. ’Course you’re my best friend.

name: JOHN
line: Well, how was that?

name: SHERLOCK
line: Surprisingly okay.

name: JOHN
line: So you’ll have to make a speech, of course.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Done that. ... Done that ... Done that bit ... Done that bit ... Done that bit ... Hmm ...

name: SHERLOCK
line: I’m afraid, John, I can’t congratulate you.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Today we honour the death-watch beetle that is the doom of our society and, in time – one feels certain – our entire species.

name: SHERLOCK
line: But anyway ... (he looks down at his cards) ... let’s talk about John.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Indeed, any reputation I have for mental acuity and sharpness comes, in truth, from the extraordinary contrast John so selflessly provides.

name: SHERLOCK
line: It is a fact, I believe, that brides tend to favour exceptionally plain bridesmaids for their big day. There is a certain analogy there, I feel.

name: SHERLOCK
line: ... or it would be if God were not a ludicrous fantasy designed to provide a career opportunity for the family idiot.

name: SHERLOCK
line: The point I’m trying to make is that I am the most unpleasant, rude, ignorant and all-round obnoxious arsehole that anyone could possibly have the misfortune to meet.

name: SHERLOCK
line: I am dismissive of the virtuous ...

name: SHERLOCK
line: ... unaware of the beautiful ...

name: SHERLOCK
line: ... and uncomprehending in the face of the happy. So if I didn’t understand I was being asked to be best man, it is because I never expected to be anybody’s best friend.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Certainly not the best friend of the bravest and kindest and wisest human being I have ever had the good fortune of knowing.

name: SHERLOCK
line: John, I am a ridiculous man ...

name: SHERLOCK
line: ... redeemed only by the warmth and constancy of your friendship. But, as I’m apparently your best friend, I cannot congratulate you on your choice of companion.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Actually, now I can.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Mary, when I say you deserve this man, it is the highest compliment of which I am capable. John, you have endured war, and injury, and tragic loss ... (he leans closer to John) ... so sorry again about that last one ... (he straightens up again) ... so know this: today you sit between the woman you have made your wife and the man you have saved – in short, the two people who love you most in all this world. And I know I speak for Mary as well when I say we will never let you down, and we have a lifetime ahead to prove that.

name: JOHN
line: If I try and hug him, stop me.

name: MARY
line: Certainly not.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Ah, yes. Now on to some funny stories about John ...

name: SHERLOCK
line: Did I do it wrong?

name: SHERLOCK
line: I haven’t finished yet.

name: JOHN
line: Yeah, I know, I know.

name: JOHN
line: Can you – can you wait ’til I sit down?

name: SHERLOCK
line: So, on to some funny stories about John.

name: SHERLOCK
line: If you could all just cheer up a bit, that would ...

name: SHERLOCK
line: ... be better. On we go. So, for funny stories ... (he reaches into his pocket and takes out his phone) ... one has to look no further than John’s blog.

name: JOHN
line: Here we go.

name: SHERLOCK
line: The record of our time together. Of course, he does tend to romanticise things a bit, but then, you know ... (he looks down at John and Mary and half-winks at them) ... he’s a romantic. We’ve tackled some strange cases: the Hollow Client ...

name: SHERLOCK
line: ... the Poison Giant ...

name: SHERLOCK
line: We’ve had some frustrating cases ...

name: JOHN
line: What is that?

name: SHERLOCK
line: A French decathlete found completely out of his mind, surrounded by one thousand, eight hundred and twelve matchboxes – all empty except this one.

name: JOHN
line: And what’s in that one?

name: JOHN
line: She’s going to ring the doorbell.

name: JOHN
line: Oh, no. She’s changed her mind.

name: JOHN
line: No, she’s gonna do it ... No, she’s leaving. She’s leaving. ... Oh, she’s coming back.

name: SHERLOCK
line: She’s a client. She’s boring. I’ve seen those symptoms before.

name: JOHN
line: Hmm?

name: SHERLOCK
line: Oscillation on the pavement always means there’s a love affair.

name: SHERLOCK
line: ... and of course I have to mention the elephant in the room.

name: SHERLOCK
line: But we want something ... very particular for this special day, don’t we?

name: SHERLOCK
line: The Bloody Guardsman.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Need to work on your half of the church, Mary. Looking a bit thin.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Schedule the organ music to begin at precisely 11.48.

name: MARY
line: But the rehearsal’s not for another two weeks. Just calm down.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Calm? I am calm. I’m extremely calm.

name: MARY
line: Let’s get back to the reception, come on.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Second class post, cheap card ... (he sniffs it and grimaces) ... bought at a petrol station. Look at the stamp: three attempts at licking. She’s obviously unconsciously retaining saliva.

name: MARY
line: Ah. (Over her shoulder to John) Let’s stick her by the bogs.

name: s note
line: ‘bogs’ is a slang word for ‘toilets.’]

name: SHERLOCK
line: Oh yes.

name: MARY
line: Who else hates me?

name: MARY
line: Oh great – thanks(!)

name: SHERLOCK
line: Done.

name: MARY
line: Table five.

line: Oh, John’s old commanding officer. I don’t think he’s coming.

line: He’ll be there.

name: MARY
line: Well, he needs to RSVP, then.

name: MARY
line: Mmm ...

name: SHERLOCK
line: Swan, or Sydney Opera House?

name: MARY
line: Where’d you learn to do that?!

name: MARY
line: Fibbing, Sherlock.

name: SHERLOCK
line: I once broke an alibi by demonstrating the exact severity of ...

name: MARY
line: I’m not John. I can tell when you’re fibbing.

name: MARY
line: Opera House, please.

name: MARY
line: Ooh, hang on. I’m buzzing.

name: MARY
line: Hello?

name: MARY
line: Oh, hi, Beth!

name: JOHN
line: He knows we don’t have a friend called Beth. He’s gonna figure out that it’s code.

name: MARY
line: He’s YouTube-ing serviettes.

name: JOHN
line: He’s thorough.

name: MARY
line: He’s terrified.

name: JOHN
line: ’Course he’s not.

name: MARY
line: Right, you know when you’re scared of something, you start wishing it sooner just to get it all going? That’s what he’s doing.

name: JOHN
line: Why would he be scared that we’re getting married? It’s not gonna change anything – we’ll still do stuff.

name: MARY
line: Well, you need to prove it to him. I told you to find him a new case.

name: JOHN
line: I’m trying.

name: MARY
line: You need to run him, okay? Show him it’s still the good old days.

name: SHERLOCK
line: That just sort of ... happened.

name: JOHN
line: Sherlock, um ...

name: JOHN
line: ... mate ...

name: JOHN
line: I-I’ve ...

name: JOHN
line: I’ve smelled eighteen different perfumes; I’ve sampled ... (he stops to think) ... nine different slices of cake which all tasted identical; I like the bridesmaids in purple ...

name: SHERLOCK
line: Lilac.

name: JOHN
line: ... lilac. Um, there are no more decisions left to make. I don’t even understand the decisions that we have made. I’m faking opinions and it’s exhausting, so please, before she comes back ...

name: JOHN
line: ... pick something.

name: JOHN
line: Anything. Pick one.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Pick what?

name: JOHN
line: A case. Your Inbox is bursting. Just ... get me out of here.

name: JOHN
line: Please, Sherlock, for me.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Oh.

line: my knowledge of military terminology is extremely limited. I have googled the heck out of certain terms in the hope of getting them right but am not confident that I am using the correct words all the time. I’m happy to take corrections from people with expertise.

name: SHERLOCK
line: ... tie.

name: JOHN
line: My coat in there?

name: MARY
line: Yes!

name: MARY
line: I know.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Mm.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Coming.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Taxi!

name: PARADE SERGEANT
line: Company, halt! ... Right turn!

name: JOHN
line: We’re here to see Private Stephen Bainbridge.

name: DUTY SERGEANT
line: He’s on duty right now, sir ... (he hands the wallet back) ... but I’ll certainly let him know when he’s free.

name: SHERLOCK
line: And when will that be?

name: DUTY SERGEANT
line: Another hour.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Do you think they give them classes?

name: JOHN
line: Classes?

name: SHERLOCK
line: How to resist the temptation to scratch their behinds?

name: JOHN
line: Afferent neurons in the peripheral nervous system.

name: JOHN
line: Bum itch.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Oh!

name: SHERLOCK
line: So why don’t you see him any more?

name: JOHN
line: Who?

name: SHERLOCK
line: Your previous commander, Sholto.

name: JOHN
line: “Previous commander.”

name: JOHN
line: “Previous” suggests that I currently have a commander.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Which you don’t.

name: JOHN
line: Which I don’t.

name: JOHN
line: Not to everyone. He led a team of crows into battle.

name: SHERLOCK
line: “Crows”?

name: JOHN
line: New recruits. It’s standard procedure; break the new boys in – but it went wrong. They all died; he was the only survivor. The press and the families gave him hell. He gets more death threats than you.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Oh, I wouldn’t count on that.

name: JOHN
line: Why have you suddenly taken an interest in another human being?

name: SHERLOCK
line: I’m ... chatting.

name: JOHN
line: Changing the subject completely ... (he pulls in a breath through his nose, then looks at Sherlock again) ... you know it won’t alter anything, right, me and Mary, getting married? We’ll still be doing all this.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Oh, good.

name: JOHN
line: If you were worrying.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Wasn’t worried.

name: JOHN
line: See, the thing about Mary – she has completely turned my life around; changed everything. But, for the record, over the last few years there are two people who have done that ... and the other one is ...

name: JOHN
line: ... a complete dickhead.

name: REED
line: Can I ask what this is in connection with?

name: JOHN
line: Private Bainbridge contacted us about a personal matter, sir.

name: REED
line: Nothing’s personal when it concerns my troops. What do you really want?

name: JOHN
line: I’m here on a legitimate enquiry.

name: REED
line: Press? Digging for some bloody Royal story or something?

name: REED
line: Retired. You could be a used car salesman now, for all I know.

name: DUTY SERGEANT
line: Bainbridge! Gentleman here to see you!

name: DUTY SERGEANT
line: Bainbridge!

name: REED
line: I know you, don’t I?

name: JOHN
line: Hmm?

name: REED
line: I’ve seen you in the papers.

name: REED
line: Hang around with that detective – the one with the silly hat. What the hell does Bainbridge want with a detective?

name: JOHN
line: I’m afraid I’m not at liberty to say.

name: REED
line: You’re not at liberty to say?! He’s a soldier in my regiment – I’ll be damned if he’s going to get up to cloak and dagger nonsense like this.

name: DUTY SERGEANT
line: Sir ...

name: DUTY SERGEANT
line: Sir.

name: REED
line: What’s going on?

name: DUTY SERGEANT
line: It’s Bainbridge, sir. He’s dead.

name: REED
line: My God!

name: JOHN
line: Ah, no, let me take a look, sir. I’m a doctor.

name: REED
line: What? Sergeant, arrest this man.

name: JOHN
line: What? No-no! I’m a – I’m a doctor.

name: REED
line: Oh, you’re a doctor now, too. Sergeant ...

name: JOHN
line: Let me examine him, please!

name: SERGEANT
line: Sir, caught this one snooping around.

name: REED
line: Is that what this was all about? Distracting me so that this man could get in here and kill Bainbridge?

name: JOHN
line: Don’t be ...

name: REED
line: What?

name: SHERLOCK
line: Where’s the weapon? Go on, search me. (He holds his arms wide.) No weapon.

name: JOHN
line: Bainbridge was on parade. He came off duty five minutes ago. When’s this supposed to have happened?

name: SHERLOCK
line: No.

name: REED
line: No?!

name: SHERLOCK
line: He’s soaking wet and there’s still shampoo in his hair. He got into the shower and then someone stabbed him.

name: DUTY SERGEANT
line: The cubicle was locked from the inside, sir. I had to break it open.

name: REED
line: You must have climbed over the top.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Well then I’d be soaking wet too, wouldn’t I?

name: DUTY SERGEANT
line: Suicide?

name: SHERLOCK
line: No. The weapon again – no knife.

name: JOHN
line: Hmm. There is a wound to the abdomen – incredibly fine.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Man stabbed to death. No murder weapon. Door locked from the inside. Only one way in or out of here.

name: JOHN
line: Sherlock.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Mmm?

name: JOHN
line: He’s still breathing.

name: DUTY SERGEANT
line: Oh my God.

name: JOHN
line: Give me your scarf.

name: SHERLOCK
line: What?

name: JOHN
line: Quickly, now.

name: JOHN
line: Call an ambulance.

name: SERGEANT
line: What?

name: JOHN
line: Nurse, press here – hard.

name: JOHN
line: Yeah, I’m making do. Keep pressure on that wound.

name: JOHN
line: Stephen. Stephen, stay with me.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Private Bainbridge had just come off guard duty. He’d stood there for hours, plenty of people watching, nothing apparently wrong. He came off duty and within minutes was nearly dead from a wound in his stomach, but there was no weapon. Where did it go? Ladies and gentlemen, I invite you to consider this: a murderer who can walk through walls, a weapon that can vanish – but in all of this there is only one element which can be said to be truly remarkable. Would anyone like to make a guess?

name: SHERLOCK
line: Come on, come on, there is actually an element of Q and A to all of this.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Scotland Yard.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Have you got a theory?

name: SHERLOCK
line: Yeah, you. You’re a detective – broadly speaking. Got a theory?

name: LESTRADE
line: Er, um, if the, uh, if the, if-if-if, if the blade was, er, propelled through the, um ... (he stops to think for a moment) ... grating in the air vent ... maybe a-a ballista or a – or a – or a catapult. Erm, somebody tiny could-could crawl in there. (He sucks in a breath.) So, yeah, we’re loo... we’re looking for a-a-a-a dwarf.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Brilliant.

name: LESTRADE
line: Really?

name: SHERLOCK
line: Next!

name: SHERLOCK
line: Hello? Who was that?

name: SHERLOCK
line: Tom.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Got a theory?

name: SHERLOCK
line: There are mysteries worth solving and stories worth telling.

name: SHERLOCK
line: The best and bravest man I know – and on top of that he actually knows how to do stuff.

name: SHERLOCK
line: ... except wedding planning and serviettes – he’s rubbish at those.

name: JOHN
line: True!

name: SHERLOCK
line: The case itself remains the most ingenious and brilliantly-planned murder – or attempted murder – I’ve ever had the pleasure to encounter; the most perfect locked-room mystery of which I am aware. However, I’m not just here to praise John – I’m also here to embarrass him, so let’s move on to some ...

name: SHERLOCK
line: How was what done?

name: LESTRADE
line: The stabbing.

name: SHERLOCK
line: I’m afraid I don’t know. I didn’t solve that one. That’s ... (he pauses) ... It can happen sometimes. It’s very ... very disappointing.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Embarrassment leads me on to the stag night. Of course there’s hours of material here, but I’ve cut it down to the really good bits.

name: MOLLY
line: Murder scenes?

name: MOLLY
line: Locations of ... murders?

name: SHERLOCK
line: Mmmm, pub crawl – themed.

name: MOLLY
line: Yeah, but why-why can’t you just do Underground stations?

name: SHERLOCK
line: Don’t want to get ill. That would ruin it – spoil the mood.

name: MOLLY
line: You’re a graduate chemist. Can’t you just work it out?

name: SHERLOCK
line: I lack the practical experience.

name: MOLLY
line: Meaning you think I like a drink.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Occasionally.

name: MOLLY
line: That I’m a drunk.

name: SHERLOCK
line: You look ... well.

name: SHERLOCK
line: How’s ...

name: SHERLOCK
line: ... Tom?

name: MOLLY
line: Not a sociopath.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Still? Good.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Okay.

name: SHERLOCK
line: I want you to calculate John’s ideal intake, and mine, to remain in the sweet spot the whole evening.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Light-headed, good ...

name: MOLLY
line: Urinating in wardrobes, bad.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Hmm.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Two, er ... beers, please.

name: BARMAN
line: Pints?

name: SHERLOCK
line: Four hundred and forty-three point seven millilitres.

name: JOHN
line: Ah...

name: SHERLOCK
line: You’ll thank me.

name: JOHN
line: Cheers.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Cheers.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Over there.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Toilets. Any second now, you’re going to ...

name: SHERLOCK
line: Mmm, on schedule.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Nothing – go!

name: SHERLOCK
line: How long?

name: JOHN
line: Sorry?

name: SHERLOCK
line: Your visit.

name: SHERLOCK
line: If you could estimate approximate volume discharged ...

name: JOHN
line: Stop talking now.

name: JOHN
line: Ooh, er ...

name: JOHN
line: Quick, one more. He mustn’t see.

name: JOHN
line: Ta.

name: JOHN
line: There you go.

name: JOHN
line: Cheers.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Thank you.

name: SHERLOCK
line: I know ash!

name: SHERLOCK
line: Don’t – Tell – Me – I – Don’t!

name: JOHN
line: All right, enough! That’s ...

name: JOHN
line: Stand up straight.

name: JOHN
line: Yeah.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Do you have an international reputation?

name: JOHN
line: No, I don’t have an international reputation.

name: SHERLOCK
line: No.

name: SHERLOCK
line: And I can’t even remember what for.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Sss... Crime ... something or other.

name: MRS HUDSON
line: Ooh! What are you doing back? I thought you were going to be out late.

name: MRS HUDSON
line: You’ve only been out two hours.

name: JOHN
line: Am I a vegetable?

name: SHERLOCK
line: You, or the thing?

name: JOHN
line: Funny!

name: JOHN
line: Come on.

name: JOHN
line: It’s your go.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Errr ... am I human?

name: JOHN
line: Sometimes.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Can’t have ‘sometimes.’ Has to be, um ...

name: JOHN
line: Yes, you’re human. (He puts down his glass and slumps back in his seat.)

name: SHERLOCK
line: And am I a man?

name: JOHN
line: Yep.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Tall?

name: JOHN
line: Not as tall as people think.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Hmm. Nice?

name: JOHN
line: Ish.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Clever?

name: JOHN
line: I’d say so.

name: SHERLOCK
line: You would?

name: SHERLOCK
line: Mmm, am I important?

name: JOHN
line: To s-some people.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Do “people” ... (he makes vague air-quotes around the word) ... like me?

name: SHERLOCK
line: Okay.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Am I the current King of England?

name: JOHN
line: Are you ...? (He cackles with laughter.) You know we don’t have a king?

name: SHERLOCK
line: Don’t we?

name: JOHN
line: No. (He chuckles again briefly.)

name: JOHN
line: I don’t mind.

name: JOHN
line: Am I a woman?

name: JOHN
line: What?

name: SHERLOCK
line: Yes.

name: JOHN
line: Am I ... pretty? (He points up to his Rizla.) This.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Err ... Er, beauty is a construct based entirely on childhood impressions, influences and role models.

name: JOHN
line: Yeah, but am I a pretty lady?

name: SHERLOCK
line: I don’t know who you are. I don’t know who you’re supposed to be.

name: JOHN
line: You picked the name!

name: SHERLOCK
line: I’m-I’m nice-ish ...

name: SHERLOCK
line: ... clever, important to some people, but I tend to rub them up the wrong way.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Got it.

name: JOHN
line: Go on, then.

name: SHERLOCK
line: I’m you, aren’t I?

name: MRS HUDSON
line: Ooh-ooh!

name: MRS HUDSON
line: Client!

name: JOHN
line: Hallo.

name: TESSA
line: Which one of you is Sherlock Holmes?

name: TESSA
line: ... and ... he seemed ... nice, you know?

name: TESSA
line: We seemed to automatically connect. We had one night – dinner, such interesting conversation. It was ... lovely.

name: TESSA
line: To be honest, I’d love to have gone further ...

name: TESSA
line: ... but I thought, ‘No, this is special. Let’s take it slowly ...

name: TESSA
line: ... exchange numbers.’

name: TESSA
line: He said he’d get in touch and then ...

name: TESSA
line: Maybe he wasn’t quite as keen as I was ...

name: TESSA
line: ... but I – I just thought ... (she becomes tearful) ... at least he’d call to say that we were finished.

name: TESSA
line: No trace of him. Mr Holmes ...

name: TESSA
line: Mr Holmes?

name: SHERLOCK
line: Fascinating!

name: SHERLOCK
line: John – John! Wake up!

name: TESSA
line: I checked with the landlord, and the man who lived there died. Heart attack. And there we are, having dinner one week on.

name: TESSA
line: And I found this thing online, sort of chatroom thing ...

name: TESSA
line: ... for girls who think they’re dating men from the spirit world.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Don’t worry. I’ll find him in ten minutes.

name: SHERLOCK
line: What’s your dog’s name?

name: SHERLOCK
line: John! Wake up!

name: SHERLOCK
line: We’re meant to ... (he clicks his fingers) ... The game’s ... (he waves a hand vaguely) ... something.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Yeah, that, that!

name: JOHN
line: Ohhh, it’s nice!

name: JOHN
line: Nice place.

name: TESSA
line: See anything?

name: SHERLOCK
line: Hmm?

name: TESSA
line: Any clues, Mr Holmes?

name: SHERLOCK
line: Oh, errrrrr ...

name: SHERLOCK
line: Mm-hmm?

name: TESSA
line: What?

name: JOHN
line: He’s ... hmm? He’s clueing for looks.

name: TESSA
line: Mr Holmes?

name: LANDLORD
line: I’m calling the police.

name: TESSA
line: Oh, no ...

name: TESSA
line: This is a famous detective. It’s Sherlock Holmes and his partner, John Hamish Watson.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Yeah, that.

name: JOHN
line: Greg. Is that Greg?

name: LESTRADE
line: Get up. I’m gonna put you two in a taxi. Managed to square things with the desk sergeant.

name: LESTRADE
line: What a couple of lightweights! You couldn’t even make it to closing time!

name: LESTRADE
line: Come on.

name: JOHN
line: Well, thanks for a ... you know ...

name: JOHN
line: ... an evening.

name: SHERLOCK
line: It was awful.

name: JOHN
line: Yeah.

name: JOHN
line: I was gonna pretend, but it was, truly.

name: JOHN
line: What?

name: SHERLOCK
line: Dated a ghost. The most interesting case for months. What a wasted opportunity.

name: JOHN
line: ... Okay.

name: MRS HUDSON
line: How are you feeling?

name: JOHN
line: Mmm. (He drinks again.)

name: MRS HUDSON
line: It’s just like old times, having you back here.

name: MRS HUDSON
line: Thought I’d make your favourite, one last time.

name: JOHN
line: Mm. Don’t sound so ... final about it. I will be visiting, you know.

name: MRS HUDSON
line: Ooh, I’ve heard that one before!

name: MRS HUDSON
line: Well, marriage changes everything, John.

name: JOHN
line: Does it?

name: MRS HUDSON
line: Yeah.

name: MRS HUDSON
line: You might not think it, but it does.

name: MRS HUDSON
line: It’s a different phase in your life.

name: MRS HUDSON
line: You meet new people ’cause you’re a couple ...

name: JOHN
line: Mmm.

name: MRS HUDSON
line: ... and then you just ... let your old friends slip away.

name: JOHN
line: It won’t be like that.

name: MRS HUDSON
line: Well, if you’ve found the right one – the person that you click with – it’s the best thing in the world.

name: JOHN
line: Well, I have. I know I have.

name: MRS HUDSON
line: Oh, I’m sure. She’s lovely!

name: JOHN
line: Yeah. I think so. What about you?

name: MRS HUDSON
line: Me?

name: JOHN
line: Did you think you’d found the right one when you married Mr Hudson?

name: JOHN
line: Right.

name: MRS HUDSON
line: And then we moved to Florida. We had a fantastic time, but of course I didn’t know what he was up to. (Whispering) The drugs.

name: MRS HUDSON
line: He was running ... um, oh God, what d’you call it? Um, a ... cartel.

name: MRS HUDSON
line: Got in with a really bad crowd.

name: JOHN
line: Right.

name: MRS HUDSON
line: And then I found out about all the other women. I didn’t have a clue! So, when he was actually arrested for blowing someone’s head off ...

name: MRS HUDSON
line: ... it was quite a relief, to be honest.

name: JOHN
line: ... Right.

name: MRS HUDSON
line: It was purely physical between me and Frank. We couldn’t keep our hands off each other.

name: MRS HUDSON
line: I know: there was one night ...

name: JOHN
line: Hang on – was that ... Sherlock?

name: MRS HUDSON
line: Is it?

name: JOHN
line: That’s Sherlock.

name: SHERLOCK

name: SHERLOCK
line: Victims, women. Most ghosts tend to haunt a single house – this ghost, however, is willing to commute, look.

name: s note
line: Your humble transcriber is so anally obsessed with the accuracy of her transcripts that normally she would type every single instance of what follows, carefully counting every “Not you” and the location of the woman to whom Sherlock says it. However, it would probably make for very boring reading and so for speed, convenience and the nurturing of very sore typing fingers, suffice it to say that this scene continues for a long time, with Sherlock dismissing woman after woman, each of whom sits down.]

line: Why? Why would he date all of those women and not return their calls?

name: SHERLOCK
line: Married. Obvious, really. Our Mayfly Man was trying to escape the suffocating chains of domesticity ...

name: SHERLOCK

name: SHERLOCK
line: On second thoughts I probably should have told you about the Elephant in the Room. However, it does help to further illustrate how invaluable John is to me. I can read a crime scene the way he can understand a human being. I used to think that’s what made me special – quite frankly, I still do. But a word to the wise: should any of you require the services of either of us, I will solve your murder, but it takes John Watson to save your life. Trust me on that – I should know. He’s saved mine so many times, and in so many ways.

line: Why?
