line: Anyone else? I mean, we’re taking everybody home, are we?

name: BILL
line: All right, Shezza?

name: MARY
line: Seriously – “Shezza,” though?!

name: JOHN
line: We’re not going home. We’re going to Bart’s. I’m calling Molly.

name: MARY
line: Why?

name: JOHN
line: Well? Is he clean?

name: MOLLY
line: Clean?

name: MOLLY
line: How dare you throw away the beautiful gifts you were born with?

name: MOLLY
line: And how dare you betray the love of your friends? Say you’re sorry.

name: MOLLY
line: Stop it. (Angrily) Just stop it.

name: JOHN
line: If you were anywhere near this kind of thing again, you could have called, you could have talked to me.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Please do relax. This is all for a case.

name: JOHN
line: A ca... What kind of case would need you doing this?

name: SHERLOCK
line: I might as well ask you why you’ve started cycling to work.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Quite recently, I’d say. You’re very determined about it.

name: JOHN
line: Not interested.

name: BILL
line: I am.

name: BILL
line: Ow.

name: MARY
line: Oh, sorry. You moved. But it is just a sprain.

name: BILL
line: Yeah. Somebody ’it me.

name: MARY
line: Huh?

name: BILL
line: Eh, just some guy.

name: JOHN
line: Yeah, probably just an addict in need of a fix.

name: BILL
line: Is it his shirt?

name: BILL
line: Well, it’s the creases, innit?

name: BILL
line: The two creases down the front. It’s been recently folded but it’s not new.

name: BILL
line: Must have dressed in a hurry this morning ...

name: BILL
line: ... so all your shirts must be kept like that.

name: BILL
line: But why? Maybe ’cause you cycle to work every morning, shower when you get there an’ then dress in the clothes you brought with you.

name: BILL
line: ... ready to pack.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Not bad.

name: BILL
line: ... you’ve only started recently, because you’ve got a bit of chafing.

name: SHERLOCK
line: No – he’s always walked like that. Remind me – what’s your name again?

name: BILL
line: They call me The Wig.

name: SHERLOCK
line: No they don’t.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Nope.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Nice observational skills, Billy.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Ah! Finally.

name: MOLLY
line: “Finally” what?

name: BILL
line: Good news?

name: SHERLOCK
line: Oh, excellent news – the best.

name: SHERLOCK
line: There’s every chance that my drug habit might hit the newspapers. The game is on.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Excuse me for a second.

name: SHERLOCK
line: You’ve heard of Charles Augustus Magnussen, of course.

name: JOHN
line: Yeah. Owns some newspapers – ones I don’t read.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Hang on – weren’t there other people?

name: JOHN
line: Mary’s taking the boys home; I’m taking you. We did discuss it.

name: SHERLOCK
line: People were talking, none of them me. I must have filtered.

name: JOHN
line: I noticed.

name: SHERLOCK
line: I have to filter out a lot of witless babble. I’ve got Mrs Hudson on semi-permanent mute.

name: SHERLOCK
line: What is my brother doing here?

name: SHERLOCK
line: He’s straightened the knocker.

name: SHERLOCK
line: He always corrects it. He’s OCD. Doesn’t even know he’s doing it.

name: JOHN
line: Why’d you do that?

name: SHERLOCK
line: Do what?

name: JOHN
line: Nothing.

name: MYCROFT
line: Well, then, Sherlock. Back on the sauce?

name: SHERLOCK
line: What are you doing here?

name: JOHN
line: I phoned him.

name: MYCROFT
line: The siren call of old habits. How very like Uncle Rudy – though, in many ways, cross-dressing would have been a wiser path for you.

name: JOHN
line: ’Course I bloody phoned him.

name: MYCROFT
line: ’Course he bloody did. Now, save me a little time. Where should we be looking?

name: SHERLOCK
line: “We”?

name: BENJI
line: Oh, that’s him, isn’t it?

name: BENJI
line: You said he’d be taller.

name: MYCROFT
line: You’re a celebrity these days, Sherlock. You can’t afford a drug habit.

name: JOHN
line: Hey, what happened to my chair?

name: SHERLOCK
line: It was blocking my view to the kitchen.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Well, you were gone. I saw an opportunity.

name: JOHN
line: No, you saw the kitchen.

name: MYCROFT
line: What have you found so far? Clearly nothing.

name: SHERLOCK
line: There’s nothing to find.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Okay, stop! Just stop.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Point made.

name: JOHN
line: Jesus, Sherlock.

name: MYCROFT
line: Have to phone our parents, of course, in Oklahoma.

name: MYCROFT
line: Won’t be the first time that your substance abuse has wreaked havoc with their line-dancing.

name: SHERLOCK
line: This is not what you think. This is for a case.

name: MYCROFT
line: What case could possibly justify this?

name: SHERLOCK
line: Magnussen.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Charles Augustus Magnussen.

name: MYCROFT
line: That name you think you may have just heard – you were mistaken. If you ever mention hearing that name in this room, in this context, I guarantee you – on behalf of the British security services – that materials will be found on your computer hard drives resulting in your immediate incarceration. Don’t reply – just look frightened and scuttle.

name: MYCROFT
line: I hope I won’t have to threaten you as well.

name: JOHN
line: Well, I think we’d both find that embarrassing.

name: MYCROFT
line: You may consider him under my protection.

name: SHERLOCK
line: I consider you under his thumb.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Er, what was I going to say? Oh, yeah.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Bye-bye.

name: MYCROFT
line: Unwise, brother mine.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Brother mine, don’t appal me when I’m high.

name: JOHN
line: Oh.

name: JOHN
line: Er, Magnussen?

name: SHERLOCK
line: What time is it?

name: JOHN
line: About eight.

name: SHERLOCK
line: I’m meeting him in three hours. I need a bath.

name: JOHN
line: It’s for a case, you said?

name: SHERLOCK
line: Yep.

name: JOHN
line: What sort of case?

name: SHERLOCK
line: Too big and dangerous for any sane individual to get involved in.

name: JOHN
line: You trying to put me off?

name: SHERLOCK
line: God, no.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Trying to recruit you.

name: JANINE
line: Oh, John, hi.

name: JANINE
line: How are you?

name: JANINE
line: Sorry. Not dressed.

name: JANINE
line: Has everybody gone? I heard shouting.

name: JOHN
line: Yes, they’re gone.

name: JANINE
line: Sounded like an argument. (She turns to John.) Was it Mike?

name: JOHN
line: Mike?

name: JANINE
line: Mike, yeah. His brother, Mike. They’re always fighting.

name: JOHN
line: Mycroft.

name: JANINE
line: Do people actually call him that?!

name: JOHN
line: Yeah.

name: JANINE
line: Huh! Oh, could you be a love and put some coffee on?

name: JOHN
line: ... Sure, right, yeah.

name: JANINE
line: Ooh, how’s Mary? How’s married life?

name: JOHN
line: She’s fine. We’re both fine, yeah.

name: JANINE
line: Oh, it’s over there now.

name: JANINE
line: Where’s Sherl?

name: JOHN
line: He’s just having a bath. I’m sure he’ll be out in a minute.

name: JANINE
line: Oh, like he ever is!

name: JOHN
line: Yeah(!)

name: JANINE
line: Morning! Room for a little one?!

name: SHERLOCK
line: So – it’s just a guess but you’ve probably got some questions.

name: JOHN
line: Yyyyeah, one or two, pretty much.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Naturally.

name: JOHN
line: You have a girlfriend?

name: SHERLOCK
line: Now, Magnussen. Magnussen is like a shark – it’s the only way I can describe him. Have you ever been to the shark tank at the London Aquarium, John – stood up close to the glass? Those floating flat faces, those dead eyes ... That’s what he is. I’ve dealt with murderers, psychopaths, terrorists, serial killers. None of them can turn my stomach like Charles Augustus Magnussen.

name: JOHN
line: Yes, you have.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Sorry, what?

name: JOHN
line: You have a girlfriend.

name: SHERLOCK
line: What? Yes! Yes, I’m going out with Janine. I thought that was fairly obvious.

name: JOHN
line: Yes. Well ... yes. (He clears his throat loudly.) But I mean you, you, you ... are in a relationship?

name: SHERLOCK
line: Yes, I am.

name: JOHN
line: You and Janine?

name: SHERLOCK
line: Mmm, yes. Me and Janine.

name: JOHN
line: Care to elaborate?

name: SHERLOCK
line: Well, we’re in a good place. It’s, um ... (he looks down thoughtfully, then turns to John) ... very affirming.

name: JOHN
line: You got that from a book.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Everyone got that from a book.

name: JANINE
line: Okay, you two bad boys, behave yourselves.

name: JANINE
line: And you, Sherl, you’re gonna have to tell me where you were last night.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Working.

name: JANINE
line: “Working.” Of course. I’m the only one who really knows what you’re like, remember?

name: JANINE
line: I haven’t told Mary about this. I kind of wanted to surprise her.

name: JOHN
line: Yeah, you probably will.

name: JANINE
line: But we should have you two over for dinner really soon!

name: SHERLOCK
line: Yeah!

name: JANINE
line: My place, though – not the scuzz-dump!

name: JOHN
line: Great, yeah! Dinner! Yeah.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Have a lovely day. Call me later.

name: JANINE
line: Solve me a crime, Sherlock Holmes.

name: SHERLOCK
line: You know Magnussen as a newspaper owner, but he’s so much more than that.

name: SHERLOCK
line: He uses his power and wealth to gain information. The more he acquires, the greater his wealth and power.

name: SHERLOCK
line: I’m not exaggerating when I say that he knows the critical pressure point on every person of note or influence in the whole of the Western world and probably beyond. He is the Napoleon of blackmail ...

name: SHERLOCK
line: ... and he has created an unassailable architecture of forbidden knowledge. Its name ...

name: SHERLOCK
line: ... is Appledore.

name: JOHN
line: Dinner.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Sorry, what, dinner?

name: JOHN
line: Me and Mary, coming for dinner ... with ... wine and ... sitting.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Seriously? I’ve just told you that the Western world is run from this house ... (he points at the screen) ... and you want to talk about dinner?

name: JOHN
line: Fine, talk about the house.

name: SHERLOCK
line: It is the greatest repository of sensitive and dangerous information anywhere in the world ... (he looks over his shoulder at John) ... the Alexandrian Library of secrets and scandals – and none of it is on a computer. He’s smart – computers can be hacked. It’s all on hard copy in vaults ... (he points at the rotating blueprint on the screen) ... underneath that house; and as long as it is, the personal freedom of anyone you’ve ever met is a fantasy.

name: SHERLOCK
line: It’s in the fridge. It kept ringing.

name: MRS HUDSON
line: Oh, that’s not a fault, Sherlock!

name: JOHN
line: Who is it?

name: MRS HUDSON
line: Mr Holmes said you can go right up.

name: FINANCES
line: 21% DEBT

name: STATUS
line: UNIMPORTANT

name: JOHN
line: Can I have a moment?

name: SHERLOCK
line: Oh, he’s fine.

name: JOHN
line: Er, I ... right. I should probably tell you ...

name: JOHN
line: Okay, I ... (he points to the knife) ... That.

name: JOHN
line: And ...

name: JOHN
line: Doesn’t mean I’m not pleased to see you.

name: SHERLOCK
line: I can vouch for this man. He’s a doctor. If you know who I am, then you know who he is ...

name: SHERLOCK
line: ... don’t you, Mr Magnussen?

name: MAGNUSSEN
line: This is my office.

name: PORN PREFERENCE
line: NORMAL

name: FINANCES
line: 10% DEBT (SEE FILE)

name: PRESSURE POINT
line: > HARRY WATSON (SISTER) ALCOHOLIC

name: MAGNUSSEN
line: Well, it is now.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Mr Magnussen, I have been asked to intercede with you by Lady Elizabeth Smallwood on the matter of her husband’s letters.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Some time ago you ... put pressure on her concerning those letters.

name: SHERLOCK
line: She would like those letters back.

name: PORN PREFERENCE
line: NORMAL

name: FINANCES
line: UNKNOWN

name: BROTHER
line: MYCROFT HOLMES

name: SHERLOCK
line: Obviously the letters no longer have any practical use to you, so with that in mind ...

name: MAGNUSSEN
line: No, no. I-I was reading.

name: MAGNUSSEN
line: There’s rather a lot.

name: MAGNUSSEN
line: “Redbeard.”

name: MAGNUSSEN
line: Sorry. (He shakes his head.) S-sorry. You were probably talking?

name: SHERLOCK
line: I was trying to explain that I’ve been asked to act on behalf of ...

name: MAGNUSSEN
line: Bathroom?

name: MAGNUSSEN
line: Okay.

name: SHERLOCK
line: I’m aware you do not make copies of sensitive documents ...

name: SECURITY MAN
line: Sir?

name: MAGNUSSEN
line: The bathroom?

name: SECURITY MAN
line: Er, yes, sir.

name: MAGNUSSEN
line: Maybe not, then.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Am I acceptable to you as an intermediary?

name: MAGNUSSEN
line: Lady Elizabeth Smallwood. I like her.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Mr Magnussen, am I acceptable to you as an intermediary?

name: MAGNUSSEN
line: She’s English, with a spine.

name: MAGNUSSEN
line: Best thing about the English ...

name: MAGNUSSEN
line: ... you’re so domesticated. All standing around, apologising ...

name: MAGNUSSEN
line: ... keeping your little heads down.

name: MAGNUSSEN
line: You can do what you like here. No-one’s ever going to stop you.

name: MAGNUSSEN
line: I’ve interests all over the world but, er, everything starts in England.

name: MAGNUSSEN
line: If it works here ...

name: MAGNUSSEN
line: ... I’ll try it in a real country.

name: MAGNUSSEN
line: The United Kingdom, huh? (He starts to wipe his fingers.) Petri dish to the Western world.

name: MAGNUSSEN
line: Tell Lady Elizabeth I might need those letters, so I’m keeping them.

name: MAGNUSSEN
line: Goodbye.

name: MAGNUSSEN
line: Anyway ...

name: MAGNUSSEN
line: ... they’re funny.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Did you notice the one extraordinary thing he did?

name: JOHN
line: Wh... There was a moment that kind of stuck in the mind, yeah.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Exactly – when he showed us the letters.

name: JOHN
line: ... Okay.

name: SHERLOCK
line: So he’s brought the letters to London – so no matter what he says, he’s ready to make a deal. Now, Magnussen only makes a deal once he’s established a person’s weaknesses – the ‘pressure point,’ he calls it.

name: SHERLOCK
line: So, clearly he believes I’m a drug addict and no serious threat.

name: JOHN
line: How-how do you know his schedule?

name: SHERLOCK
line: Because I do. Right – I’ll see you tonight. I’ve got some shopping to do.

name: SHERLOCK
line: You are! I checked!

name: SHERLOCK
line: Don’t bring a gun.

name: JOHN
line: Why would I bring a gun?

name: SHERLOCK
line: Or a knife, or a tyre lever. Probably best not to do any arm-spraining, but we’ll see how the night goes.

name: JOHN
line: You’re just assuming I’m coming along?

name: SHERLOCK
line: Time you got out of the house, John. (He runs his eyes over him as the taxi pulls up.) You’ve put on seven pounds since you got married, and the cycling isn’t doing it.

name: JOHN
line: It’s actually four pounds.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Hatton Garden.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Magnussen’s office is on the top floor, just below his private flat ... (he looks towards lift doors on the next level up) ... but there are fourteen levels of security between us and him ...

name: SHERLOCK
line: ... two of which aren’t even legal in this country. Want to know how we’re going to break in?

name: JOHN
line: Is that what we’re doing?

name: SHERLOCK
line: Of course it’s what we’re doing.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Magnussen’s private lift. It goes straight to his penthouse and office. Only he uses it ... (they get onto the escalator) ... and only his key card calls the lift. Anyone else even tries, security is automatically informed.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Here we go, then.

name: SHERLOCK
line: If I was to use this card on that lift now, what happens?

name: SHERLOCK
line: Exactly.

name: JOHN
line: Get taken to a small room somewhere and your head kicked in.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Do we really need so much colour?

name: JOHN
line: It passes the time.

name: SHERLOCK
line: But if I do this ...

name: SHERLOCK
line: If you press a key card against your mobile phone for long enough, it corrupts the magnetic strip. The card stops working. It’s a common problem – never put your key card with your phone.

name: SHERLOCK
line: What happens if I use the card now?

name: JOHN
line: It still doesn’t work.

name: SHERLOCK
line: But it doesn’t read as the wrong card now.

name: SHERLOCK
line: It registers as corrupted. But if it’s corrupted, how do they know it’s not Magnussen?

name: SHERLOCK
line: Would they risk dragging him off?

name: JOHN
line: Probably not.

name: SHERLOCK
line: So what do they do? What do they have to do?

name: JOHN
line: Check if it’s him or not.

name: SHERLOCK
line: There’s a camera at eye height to the right of the door.

name: SHERLOCK
line: A live picture of the card user is relayed directly to Magnussen’s personal staff in his office – the only people trusted to make a positive ID.

name: SHERLOCK
line: ... at this hour, almost certainly his PA.

name: JOHN
line: S-so how’s that help us?

name: SHERLOCK
line: Human error. (He raises his hand to the breast pocket of his coat and pats it.) I’ve been shopping.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Here we go, then.

name: JOHN
line: Hang on – was that ...? That ...!

name: SHERLOCK
line: Hi, Janine. (Secretively, glancing around) Go on, let me in.

name: JANINE
line: I can’t! You know I can’t. Don’t be silly.

name: JANINE
line: Do what in front of everyone?

name: SHERLOCK
line: You see? As long as there’s people, there’s always a weak spot.

name: JOHN
line: That was Janine.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Yes, of course it was Janine. She’s Magnussen’s PA. That’s the whole point.

name: JOHN
line: Did you just get engaged to break into an office?

name: SHERLOCK
line: Yeah. (He steps into the lift.) Stroke of luck, meeting her at your wedding. You can take some of the credit.

name: JOHN
line: Je-Jesus!

name: s note
line: thanks to ‘Hobbitfoot’ on fanfiction.net who pointed out that in one of the earlier long shots while John and Sherlock are still some distance away from the lift, there’s a bin beside the lift. The bin disappears in the shots where they’re close to the lift but it does make more sense than John simply dropping the cups onto the floor.]

name: JOHN
line: What are you gonna do?

name: SHERLOCK
line: Well, not actually marry her, obviously. (He looks round to him.) There’s only so far you can go.

name: JOHN
line: So what will you tell her?

name: SHERLOCK
line: Well, I’ll tell her that our entire relationship was a ruse to break into her boss’ office. I imagine she’ll want to stop seeing me at that point ... (he looks at John again) ... but you’re the expert on women.

name: JOHN
line: So where did she go?

name: SHERLOCK
line: It’s a bit rude. I just proposed to her.

name: JOHN
line: Sherlock ...

name: SHERLOCK
line: Did she faint? Do they really do that?

name: JOHN
line: It’s a blow to the head. (He bends lower to her.) She’s breathing. Janine?

name: SHERLOCK
line: Security.

name: JOHN
line: Does he need help?

name: SHERLOCK
line: Ex-con.

name: SHERLOCK
line: White supremacist, by the tattoo, so who cares? (He points back towards John.) Stick with Janine.

name: JOHN
line: Janine, focus on my voice now. Can you hear me?

name: SHERLOCK
line: Perfume – not Janine’s.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Why do I know it?

name: JOHN
line: Mary wears it.

name: JOHN
line: Sherlock!

name: MAGNUSSEN
line: ... so English. What-what would he say to you now?

name: MAGNUSSEN
line: Nej, nej! [No, no!]

name: SHERLOCK
line: ... Lady Smallwood.

name: MAGNUSSEN
line: That’s ... not ... Lady Smallwood, Mr Holmes.

name: SHERLOCK
line: He-he’s downstairs.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Mary, whatever he’s got on you, let me help.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Mary?

name: MOLLY
line: It’s tightly focussed, so there’s little or no energy transfer.

name: MOLLY
line: You stay still ...

name: MOLLY
line: ... and the bullet pushes through.

name: MOLLY
line: You’re almost certainly going to die, so we need to focus.

name: MOLLY
line: ... focus.

name: MOLLY
line: It’s all well and clever having a Mind Palace, but you’ve only three seconds of consciousness left to use it. So, come on – what’s going to kill you?

name: SHERLOCK
line: Blood loss.

name: MOLLY
line: So, it’s all about one thing now.

name: MOLLY
line: Forwards, or backwards?

name: ANDERSON
line: One hole, or two?

name: MOLLY
line: Is the bullet still inside you ...

name: MOLLY
line: ... or is there an exit wound?

name: SHERLOCK
line: That one, I think.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Or that one.

name: MYCROFT
line: It doesn’t matter about the gun. Don’t be stupid.

name: MYCROFT
line: You always were so stupid.

name: MYCROFT
line: Such a disappointment.

name: MYCROFT
line: Mummy and Daddy are very cross ...

name: MYCROFT
line: ... because it doesn’t matter about the gun.

name: MYCROFT
line: You saw the whole room when you entered it. What was directly behind you when you were murdered?

name: SHERLOCK
line: The mirror shattering.

name: MYCROFT
line: You didn’t. Therefore ...?

name: SHERLOCK
line: The bullet’s still inside me.

name: MOLLY
line: ... you need to fall on your back.

name: SHERLOCK
line: What the hell is that? What’s happening?

name: MOLLY
line: It’s the next thing that’s going to kill you.

name: SHERLOCK
line: What do I do?

name: MYCROFT
line: Don’t go into shock, obviously.

name: MYCROFT
line: Must be something in this ridiculous memory palace of yours that can calm you down.

name: MYCROFT
line: Find it.

name: s VOICE
line: Find it.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Hello, Redbeard. Here, boy. Come on!

name: SHERLOCK
line: Come to me. It’s okay. It’s all right.

name: YOUNG SHERLOCK
line: Come on! It’s me! It’s me, come on!

name: SHERLOCK
line: Come on!

name: YOUNG SHERLOCK
line: Good boy! Clever boy!

name: SHERLOCK
line: Hello, Redbeard. They’re putting me down too, now. It’s no fun, is it?

name: MOLLY
line: There’s a hole ripped through you. Massive internal bleeding.

name: MOLLY
line: You have to control the pain.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Control! Control! Control.

name: SHERLOCK
line: You never felt pain, did you? Why did you never feel pain?

name: JIM
line: But you don’t have to fear it!

name: JIM
line: Pain. Heartbreak. Loss.

name: s VOICE
line: Sherlock?

name: JOHN
line: Sherlock?

name: JOHN
line: Can you hear me?

name: JOHN
line: What happened?

name: JOHN
line: Sherlock! Oh, my ...

name: JOHN
line: Who shot him?

name: JIM
line: ♪ It’s raining, it’s pouring. Sherlock is boring ... ♪

name: JOHN
line: Sherlock.

name: JOHN
line: We’re losing you. Sherlock?

name: JIM
line: One little push, and off you pop.

name: JIM
line: You’re gonna love being dead, Sherlock.

name: JIM
line: No-one ever bothers you.

name: JIM
line: ... and The Woman will cry; and John will cry buckets and buckets. It’s him that I worry about the most. That wife!

name: JIM
line: You’re letting him down, Sherlock. John Watson is definitely in danger.

name: JIM
line: Was it something I said, huh?

name: JIM
line: SHERLOCK!

name: Sherlock sees a rapid montage of images
line: several moments from when Magnussen showed him the edge of the papers in his jacket pocket in 221B’s living room; then Mary aiming her gun down at Magnussen in his flat before Sherlock knew who the potential killer was; then the front door to 221B. His inner vision closes in on the door and settles on it. In the operating room, his eyelids begin to lift as the heart monitor’s blips become more regular. The surgeon looks down at him ... ... and Sherlock Holmes opens his eyes. His gaze becomes more focussed, and his mouth begins to close around the tube in his mouth in an attempt to form a word. As the scene switches to the next one, a soft whisper can be heard. SHERLOCK’s VOICE (offscreen, in a whisper): Mary.  [Your transcriber slumps sideways and falls off her chair, exhausted at having just typed the most intense and complicated seven minutes of footage that she has ever attempted. She lies on the floor giggling contentedly to herself for a few minutes, then wearily hauls herself back onto her chair and gets back to work.]

name: JOHN
line: Mary.

name: MARY
line: Hey.

name: JOHN
line: Oh, you, Mrs Watson ... (he points at her, trying to look stern) ... you’re in big trouble.

name: MARY

name: JOHN
line: His first word when he woke up?

name: JOHN
line: “Mary”!

name: MARY
line: Ahh!

name: MARY
line: You don’t tell John.

name: JANINE
line: I’m buying a cottage.

name: JANINE
line: I made a lot of money out of you, mister.

name: JANINE
line: Nothing hits the spot like revenge for profits.

name: JANINE
line: God, no – one of his rivals. He was spittin’!

name: SHERLOCK
line: And you – as it turns out – are a grasping, opportunistic, publicity-hungry tabloid whore.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Yeah, of course. (He smiles.) Where’s the cottage?

name: JANINE
line: Sussex Downs.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Hmm, nice.

name: JANINE
line: It’s gorgeous. There’s beehives, but I’m getting rid of those.

name: JANINE
line: Aw, hurts, does it? Probably wanna restart your morphine. I might have fiddled with the taps.

name: SHERLOCK
line: How much more revenge are you gonna need?

name: JANINE

name: JANINE
line: Dream come true for you, this place. They actually attach the drugs to you!

name: SHERLOCK
line: Not good for working.

name: JANINE
line: You won’t be working for a while, Sherl.

name: SHERLOCK
line: I exploited the fact of our connection.

name: JANINE
line: When?!

name: SHERLOCK
line: Hmm?

name: JANINE
line: Just once would have been nice.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Oh. (He looks a little shifty-eyed.) I was waiting until we got married.

name: JANINE
line: That was never gonna happen!

name: JANINE
line: Got to go.

name: JANINE
line: I’m not supposed to keep you talking.

name: JANINE
line: Just one thing.

name: JANINE
line: You shouldn’t have lied to me. I know what kind of man you are ... but we could have been friends.

name: JANINE
line: I’ll give your love to John and Mary.

name: MARY
line: You don’t tell John.

name: SHERLOCK
line: ... Mary Watson. Who are you?

name: JOHN
line: Dunno how much sense you’ll get out of him. He’s drugged up, so he’s pretty much babbling.

name: JOHN
line: Oh, they won’t let you use that in here, you know.

line: No, I’m not gonna use the phone. I just wanna take a video.

line: Oh, Jesus.

line: He’s got three known bolt holes ...

line: Parliament Hill, Camden Lock and Dagmar Court.

name: MYCROFT

name: MYCROFT
line: There’s the blind greenhouse in Kew Gardens and the leaning tomb in Hampstead Cemetery.

name: MOLLY
line: Just the spare bedroom. ... (Awkwardly) Well ... my bedroom. We agreed he needs the space.

line: Behind the clock face of Big Ben.

name: JOHN
line: I think he was probably joking.

name: MRS HUDSON
line: No! I don’t think so!

name: ANDERSON
line: Leinster Gardens. That’s his number one bolt hole. It’s top-top secret.

line: Followed!

line: Followed, yeah.

line: He knew who shot him.

name: JOHN
line: The bullet wound was here, so he was facing whoever it was.

name: LESTRADE
line: Call me if you hear anything. Don’t hold out on me, John.

line: Call me, okay?

line: Oh ...

line: Mrs Hudson ... (he clears his throat) ... wh-why does Sherlock think that I’ll be moving back in here?

line: Huh. (He sits back in the chair again, still looking at it thoughtfully.)

line: That’s nice!

name: MRS HUDSON

line: John, what’s wrong? Tell me.

name: MRS HUDSON
line: John?

name: MRS HUDSON
line: That’s your phone, isn’t it?

name: MRS HUDSON
line: It’s Sherlock, John. It’s Sherlock.

name: MRS HUDSON
line: John! You have to answer it!

name: BILL
line: ... ’e finds you.

name: MARY
line: You’re working for Sherlock now.

name: BILL
line: Keeps me off the streets, dunnit?

name: MARY

name: MARY
line: Well, what am I looking for?

name: MARY
line: How did you know I’d come here?

name: MARY
line: What am I looking at?

name: MARY
line: What do you want, Sherlock?

name: MARY
line: At first I thought it was just a Bible thing, you know, spam, but it’s not. It’s a skip-code.

name: JOHN
line: How can you not remember which room? You remember everything.

name: MARY
line: Two oh seven.

name: MARY
line: You were very slow.

name: MARY
line: How badly do you want to find out?

name: SHERLOCK
line: May I see?

name: MARY
line: It’s a dummy.

name: MARY
line: I suppose it was a fairly obvious trick.

name: SHERLOCK
line: And yet, over a distance of six feet, you failed to make a kill shot.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Enough to hospitalise me; not enough to kill me. That wasn’t a miss.

name: SHERLOCK
line: That was surgery.

name: SHERLOCK
line: I’ll take the case.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Yours. (A little angrily) Why didn’t you come to me in the first place?

name: MARY
line: Because John can’t ever know that I lied to him. It would break him and I would lose him forever – and, Sherlock, I will never let that happen.

name: MARY
line: Please ...

name: MARY
line: ... understand. There is nothing in this world that I would not do to stop that happening.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Not that obvious a trick.

name: MRS HOLMES
line: Mikey, is this your laptop?

name: MYCROFT
line: On which depends the security of the free world, yes ... (he smiles rather sarcastically up at her) ... and you’ve got potatoes on it.

name: MYCROFT
line: Why are we doing this? We never do this.

name: MRS HOLMES
line: We are here because Sherlock is home from hospital and we are all very happy.

name: MYCROFT
line: Am I happy too? I haven’t checked.

name: MYCROFT
line: ‘Mycroft’ is the name you gave me, if you could possibly struggle all the way to the end.

name: BILL
line: Mrs Holmes?

name: MRS HOLMES
line: Oh! Thank you, dear.

name: MRS HOLMES
line: Not absolutely sure why you’re here.

name: SHERLOCK
line: I invited him.

name: BILL
line: I’m his protégé, Mrs ’olmes. When ’e dies, I get all his stuff, an’ ’is job.

name: BILL
line: Oh. Well, I help out a bit.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Closer.

name: BILL
line: If ’e does get murdered or something ...

name: BILL
line: Okay.

name: MRS HOLMES
line: Ah. This was for Mary. (She walks away with whatever it is.) I’ll be back in a minute.

name: MRS HOLMES
line: Ah, Mary.

name: MRS HOLMES
line: There you are.

name: MRS HOLMES
line: Cup of tea. Now, if Father starts making little humming noises, just give him a little poke. That usually does it.

name: MRS HOLMES
line: Oh, that silly old thing. You mustn’t read that. Mathematics must seem terribly fatuous now!

name: MR HOLMES
line: Complete flake, my wife, but happens to be a genius.

name: MARY
line: She was a mathematician?

name: MR HOLMES
line: Gave it all up for children.

name: MR HOLMES
line: I could never bear to argue with her. I’m something of a moron myself. But she’s ... (he glances away briefly, then looks back to Mary and leans closer to her, smiling) ... unbelievably hot!

name: JOHN
line: Oh.

name: JOHN
line: Sorry. I-I just, er ...

name: MR HOLMES
line: Oh. Er-er, do you two need a moment?

name: JOHN
line: If you don’t mind.

name: MR HOLMES
line: Those two. They all right?

name: MRS HUDSON
line: John.

name: MRS HUDSON
line: Mary!

name: SHERLOCK
line: Get me some morphine from your kitchen. I’ve run out.

name: MRS HUDSON
line: I don’t have any morphine!

name: MRS HUDSON
line: What is going on?

name: JOHN
line: Bloody good question.

name: JOHN
line: Oh, I have a better question.

name: JOHN
line: Is everyone I’ve ever met a psychopath?

name: SHERLOCK
line: Good that we’ve settled that. Anyway, we ...

name: MRS HUDSON
line: Oh!

name: SHERLOCK
line: I didn’t say it was funny.

name: JOHN
line: You.

name: JOHN
line: What have I ever done ... hmm? ... my whole life ... to deserve you?

name: SHERLOCK
line: That’s me, by the way. (He raises his left hand and waves at him.) Hello.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Even the landlady used to run a drug cartel.

name: MRS HUDSON
line: It was my husband’s cartel. I was just typing.

name: MRS HUDSON
line: Sherlock Holmes, if you’ve been YouTube-ing ...

name: SHERLOCK
line: Because you chose her.

name: JOHN
line: Why is everything ... (he walks towards the dining table, holding up a questioning hand and shrugging) ... always ... (his voice raises to a loud shout) ... MY FAULT?!

name: MRS HUDSON
line: Oh, the neighbours!

name: SHERLOCK
line: No. What is she?

name: SHERLOCK
line: No. Not in this flat; not in this room. Right here, right now, what is she?

name: JOHN
line: Okay.

name: JOHN
line: Always your way.

name: JOHN
line: Sit.

name: MARY
line: Why?

name: JOHN
line: ... the people who come in here with their stories. Th-the clients – that’s all you are now, Mary. You’re a client. This is where you sit and talk ... (he gestures towards the armchairs) ... and this is where we sit and listen, then we decide if we want you or not.

name: JOHN
line: So, are you okay?

name: MARY
line: Now?

name: MARY
line: Seriously? Months of silence and we’re gonna do this ... (she nods towards the drive) ... now?

name: SHERLOCK
line: ‘A.G.R.A.’ What’s that?

name: MARY
line: Er ... my initials.

name: MARY
line: Everything about who I was is on there. (Directly to John) If you love me, don’t read it in front of me.

name: MARY
line: ... and I don’t want to see that happen.

name: MARY
line: How much d’you know already?

name: SHERLOCK
line: ... Magnussen knows your secret, which is why you were going to kill him; and I assume you befriended Janine ... (he grimaces, shifting uncomfortably on his chair) ... in order to get close to him.

name: MARY
line: Oh – you can talk!

name: JOHN
line: Ohhh. Look at you two.

name: JOHN
line: You should have got married.

name: MARY
line: The stuff Magnussen has on me, I would go to prison for the rest of my life.

name: JOHN
line: So you were just gonna kill him.

name: MARY
line: People like Magnussen should be killed. That’s why there are people like me.

name: JOHN
line: How could I not see that?

name: MARY
line: You did see that.

name: MARY
line: Because he’s right.

name: SHERLOCK
line: So ... Mary ...

name: SHERLOCK
line: ... any documents that Magnussen has concerning yourself, you want ... (he grimaces yet again, his voice tight as if with physical pain) ... extracted and returned.

name: MARY
line: Why would you help me?

name: SHERLOCK
line: Because ... you saved my life.

name: JOHN
line: Sor-sorry, what?

name: SHERLOCK
line: ... you had a problem.

name: s note
line: In the original version of this scene, Magnussen said, “Kill us both?”]

name: s note
line: Sherlock does say ‘bide,’ though I suspect that Benedict ought to have said ‘buy.’ However, note an alternative theory here]

name: JOHN
line: How did she save your life?

name: PARAMEDIC
line: Did somebody call an ambulance?

name: SHERLOCK
line: ... eight minutes.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Did you bring any morphine? I asked on the phone.

name: SHERLOCK
line: There was, last week ...

name: SHERLOCK
line: ... but I believe I’m bleeding internally and my pulse is very erratic.

name: SHERLOCK
line: You may need to re-start my heart on the way.

name: JOHN
line: Come on, Sherlock. Come on, Sherlock.

name: SHERLOCK
line: John?

name: SHERLOCK
line: John – Magnussen is all that matters now. You can trust Mary. She saved my life.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Er, mixed messages, I grant you.

name: JOHN
line: Sherlock? Sherlock. (To the paramedics) All right, take him.

name: JOHN
line: Got him?

name: MARY
line: So, have you read it?

name: JOHN

name: MARY
line: No, I’m fine.

name: JOHN
line: I’ve thought long and hard about what I want to say to you.

name: JOHN
line: These are prepared words, Mary.

name: JOHN
line: I’ve chosen these words with care.

name: JOHN
line: It’s all I have to say. It’s all I need to know.

name: JOHN
line: Is ‘Mary Watson’ good enough for you?

name: JOHN
line: Then it’s good enough for me, too.

name: MARY
line: Oh!

name: JOHN
line: All this does not mean that I’m not still basically pissed off with you.

name: JOHN
line: I am very pissed off, and it will come out now and then.

name: MARY
line: I know, I know, I know.

name: MARY
line: I do mow the lawn.

name: JOHN
line: No, I do it loads.

name: MARY
line: You really don’t.

name: JOHN
line: I choose the baby’s name.

name: MARY
line: Not a chance.

name: JOHN
line: Okay.

name: MYCROFT
line: I’m glad you’ve given up on the Magnussen business.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Are you?

name: MYCROFT
line: He never causes too much damage to anyone important. He’s far too intelligent for that. He’s a business-man, that’s all, and occasionally useful to us. A necessary evil – not a dragon for you to slay.

name: SHERLOCK
line: A dragon slayer. Is that what you think of me?

name: MYCROFT
line: No!

name: MYCROFT
line: I have, by the way, a job offer I should like you to decline.

name: SHERLOCK
line: I decline your kind offer.

name: MYCROFT
line: I shall pass on your regrets.

name: SHERLOCK
line: What was it?

name: MYCROFT
line: MI6 – they want to place you back into Eastern Europe. An undercover assignment that would prove fatal to you in, I think, about six months.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Then why don’t you want me to take it?

name: SHERLOCK
line: Utility(!) How do I have utility?

name: MYCROFT
line: “Here be dragons.”

name: MYCROFT
line: This isn’t agreeing with me. I’m going in.

name: SHERLOCK
line: You need low tar. You still smoke like a beginner.

name: SHERLOCK
line: What the hell am I supposed to say to that?!

name: SHERLOCK
line: You hate Christmas.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Clearly. Go and have some more.

name: MARY
line: So you realise that, er, Sherlock got us out here to see his mum and dad for a reason?

name: JOHN
line: Oi. (He frowns round to the side of her head.) Oi.

name: JOHN
line: Mary? Jesus Christ. Mary?

name: JOHN
line: Sit down.

name: JOHN
line: Mary, can you hear me?

name: SHERLOCK
line: Don’t drink Mary’s tea.

name: JOHN
line: Sherlock?

name: BILL
line: I calculated your wife’s dose meself. Won’t affect the little one. I’ll keep an eye on ’er.

name: SHERLOCK
line: ... A deal with the devil.

name: MAGNUSSEN
line: Shouldn’t you be in hospital?

name: MAGNUSSEN
line: Is it?

name: SHERLOCK
line: In my opinion, yes.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Have a seat.

name: MAGNUSSEN
line: Thank you.

name: SHERLOCK
line: I’ve been thinking about you.

name: MAGNUSSEN
line: I’ve been thinking about you.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Really?

name: MAGNUSSEN
line: What makes you think I’d be so careless?

name: SHERLOCK
line: It’s the dead-eye stare that gives it away.

name: SHERLOCK
line: You’re reading.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Portable Appledore. (He briefly snorts, then looks across to Magnussen.) How does it work?

name: SHERLOCK
line: Built-in flash drive? (He lifts the glasses towards his own face.) 4G wireless?

name: SHERLOCK
line: They’re just ordinary spectacles.

name: MAGNUSSEN
line: Yes – they are.

name: PRESSURE POINT
line: > MORPHINE (ADD TO FILE)

name: MAGNUSSEN
line: You underestimate me, Mr Holmes.

name: MAGNUSSEN
line: Are you making me an offer?

name: SHERLOCK
line: A Christmas present.

name: MAGNUSSEN
line: And what are you giving me for Christmas, Mr Holmes?

name: SHERLOCK
line: My brother.

name: JOHN
line: Sherlock ...

name: SHERLOCK
line: I’d rather keep you guessing.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Ah. (He smiles.) There’s our lift.

name: JOHN
line: Where?

name: SHERLOCK
line: D’you want your wife to be safe?

name: JOHN
line: Yeah, of course I do.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Good, because this is going to be incredibly dangerous. (Quick fire, speaking on one single breath for the next two sentences) One false move and we’ll have betrayed the security of the United Kingdom and be in prison for high treason. Magnussen is quite simply the most dangerous man we’ve ever encountered, and the odds are comprehensively stacked against us.

name: SHERLOCK
line: I feel the same.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Oh, you mean it’s actually Christmas. Did you bring your gun as I suggested?

name: JOHN
line: Why would I bring my gun to your parents’ house for Christmas dinner?!

name: SHERLOCK
line: Off we go, then.

name: JOHN
line: Where are we going?

name: SHERLOCK
line: Appledore.

name: MAGNUSSEN
line: Yes, of course.

name: MAGNUSSEN
line: Very hard to find a pressure point on you, Mr Holmes.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Mm.

name: MAGNUSSEN
line: The drugs thing I never believed for a moment.

name: MAGNUSSEN
line: Anyway, you wouldn’t care if it was exposed, would you?

name: MAGNUSSEN
line: Your damsel in distress.

name: JOHN
line: You ... (he walks closer to Magnussen, his voice tight and furious) ... put me in a fire ... for leverage?

name: MAGNUSSEN
line: Oh, I’d never let you burn, Doctor Watson. (He sits up and puts his glass onto the clear glass table in front of him, then looks up at John again.) I had people standing by.

name: MAGNUSSEN
line: I’m not a murderer ... unlike your wife.

name: MAGNUSSEN
line: Let me explain how leverage works, Doctor Watson.

name: MAGNUSSEN
line: Mycroft’s pressure point is his junkie detective brother, Sherlock.

name: MAGNUSSEN
line: And Sherlock’s pressure point is his best friend, John Watson. John Watson’s pressure point is his wife. I own John Watson’s wife ... (he looks round to Sherlock) ... I own Mycroft. (He sits down.) He’s what I’m getting for Christmas.

name: SHERLOCK
line: It’s an exchange, not a gift.

name: MAGNUSSEN
line: Forgive me, but ... (he holds the laptop to his chest and runs his fingers over the back) ... I already seem to have it.

name: SHERLOCK
line: It’s password protected.

name: SHERLOCK
line: In return for the password, you will give me any material in your possession pertaining to the woman I know as Mary Watson.

name: MAGNUSSEN
line: Oh, she’s bad, that one. So many dead people. You should see what I’ve seen.

name: JOHN
line: I don’t need to see it.

name: MAGNUSSEN
line: You might enjoy it, though.

name: MAGNUSSEN
line: I enjoy it.

name: MAGNUSSEN
line: Show you Appledore?

name: MAGNUSSEN
line: The secret vaults? Is that what you want?

name: MAGNUSSEN
line: You know, I honestly expected something good.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Oh, I think you’ll find the contents of that laptop ...

name: MAGNUSSEN
line: ... include a GPS locator. By now, your brother will have noticed the theft, and security services will be converging on this house. Having arrived ... (he looks down at the laptop) ... they’ll find top secret information in my hands ... (he reaches forward and picks up his glass from the table) ... and have every justification to search my vaults. They will discover further information of this kind and I’ll be imprisoned. You will be exonerated, and restored to your smelly little apartment to solve crimes with Mr and Mrs Psychopath.

name: SHERLOCK
line: The fact that you know it’s going to happen isn’t going to stop it.

name: MAGNUSSEN
line: Then why am I smiling?

name: MAGNUSSEN
line: Ask me.

name: MAGNUSSEN
line: ... and everything he holds dear.

name: MAGNUSSEN
line: Let me show you the Appledore vaults.

name: MAGNUSSEN
line: The entrance to my vaults. This is where I keep you all.

name: JOHN
line: Okay – so where are the vaults, then?

name: MAGNUSSEN
line: They’re all in here.

name: MAGNUSSEN
line: The Appledore vaults are my Mind Palace. You know about Mind Palaces, don’t you, Sherlock?

name: MAGNUSSEN
line: How to store information so you never forget it – by picturing it. I just sit here, I close my eyes ... (he does so, slowly lowering his head) ... and down I go to my vaults.

name: MAGNUSSEN
line: ... my memories.

name: MAGNUSSEN
line: I’ll look at the files on Mrs Watson.

name: MAGNUSSEN
line: Mmm, ah. (In the white room he lifts his right hand as if lifting a folder out of the drawer.) This is one of my favourites. (He sits back in the chair while, in his head, he looks at the file with a picture of Mary paper-clipped to the inside.) Oh, it’s so exciting.

name: MAGNUSSEN
line: All those wet jobs for the CIA. Ooh!

name: MAGNUSSEN
line: She’s gone a bit ... freelance now. Bad girl.

name: MAGNUSSEN
line: Ah, she is so wicked.

name: MAGNUSSEN
line: I can really see why you like her.

name: MAGNUSSEN
line: You see?

name: JOHN
line: So there are no documents. You don’t actually have anything here.

name: MAGNUSSEN
line: Oh, sometimes I send out for something ... (he lifts his left hand and looks down at his watch) ... if I really need it ...

name: MAGNUSSEN
line: ... but mostly I just remember it all.

name: MAGNUSSEN
line: You should have that on a T-shirt.

name: JOHN
line: You just remember it all?

name: JOHN
line: But if you just know it, then you don’t have proof.

name: MAGNUSSEN
line: Proof? What would I need proof for? I’m in news, you moron. I don’t have to prove it – I just have to print it.

name: MAGNUSSEN
line: Let’s go outside. They’ll be here shortly.

name: MAGNUSSEN
line: Can’t wait to see you arrested.

name: MAGNUSSEN
line: They’re taking their time, aren’t they?

name: JOHN
line: I still don’t understand.

name: MAGNUSSEN
line: Bring it over here a minute.

name: MAGNUSSEN
line: Come on.

name: MAGNUSSEN
line: Lean forward a bit and stick your face out.

name: MAGNUSSEN
line: Now, can I flick it?

name: MAGNUSSEN
line: Can I flick your face?

name: MAGNUSSEN
line: I just love doing this.

name: MAGNUSSEN
line: I could do it all day.

name: MAGNUSSEN
line: It works like this, John. I know who Mary hurt and killed.

name: MAGNUSSEN
line: I know where they live; I know their phone numbers.

name: MAGNUSSEN
line: All in my Mind Palace – all of it.

name: MAGNUSSEN
line: ... just because I know.

name: MAGNUSSEN
line: Can I do your eye now?

name: MAGNUSSEN
line: See if you can keep it open, hmm?

name: MAGNUSSEN
line: Come on. For Mary. Keep it open.

name: JOHN
line: Sherlock?

name: SHERLOCK
line: Just ... let him.

name: MAGNUSSEN
line: Here we go, Mr Holmes!

name: To clarify
line: Appledore’s vaults only exist in your mind, nowhere else, just there.

name: MAGNUSSEN
line: Sorry. No chance for you to be a hero this time, Mr Holmes.

name: SHERLOCK
line: I’m not a hero ...

name: SHERLOCK
line: ... I’m a high-functioning sociopath.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Merry Christmas!

name: JOHN
line: Oh, Christ, Sherlock.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Give my love to Mary.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Tell her she’s safe now.

name: MYCROFT
line: As my colleague is fond of remarking, this country sometimes needs a blunt instrument. Equally, it sometimes needs a dagger – a scalpel wielded with precision and without remorse.

name: MYCROFT
line: There will always come a time when we need Sherlock Holmes.

name: SIR EDWIN
line: If this is some expression of familial sentiment ...

name: MYCROFT
line: Don’t be absurd. I am not given to outbursts of brotherly compassion.

name: MYCROFT
line: You know what happened to the other one.

name: MYCROFT
line: In any event, there is no prison in which we could incarcerate Sherlock without causing a riot on a daily basis. The alternative, however ...

name: MYCROFT
line: ... would require your approval.

name: LADY SMALLWOOD
line: Hardly merciful, Mr Holmes.

name: MYCROFT
line: Regrettably, Lady Smallwood, my brother is a murderer.

name: MARY
line: Oh ... (she puts her hands on his shoulders and they kiss each other’s cheeks, then hug) ... don’t worry. I’ll keep him in trouble.

name: SHERLOCK
line: That’s my girl.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Since this is likely to be the last conversation I’ll have with John Watson ...

name: SHERLOCK
line: ... would you mind if we took a moment?

name: JOHN
line: So, here we are.

name: SHERLOCK
line: William Sherlock Scott Holmes.

name: JOHN
line: Sorry?

name: SHERLOCK
line: That’s the whole of it – if you’re looking for baby names.

name: JOHN
line: No, we’ve had a scan. We’re pretty sure it’s a girl.

name: JOHN
line: The game is over.

name: JOHN
line: What’s that?

name: SHERLOCK
line: It’s a story my brother told me when we were kids. The East Wind – this terrifying force that lays waste to all in its path.

name: SHERLOCK
line: It seeks out the unworthy ... (he meets John’s eyes) ... and plucks them from the Earth. That was generally me.

name: JOHN
line: Nice(!)

name: SHERLOCK
line: He was a rubbish big brother.

name: JOHN
line: So what about you, then? (He lifts his head.) Where are you actually going now?

name: JOHN
line: For how long?

name: JOHN
line: And then what?

name: SHERLOCK
line: Who knows?

name: SHERLOCK
line: John, there’s something ... I should say; I-I’ve meant to say always and then never have. Since it’s unlikely we’ll ever meet again, I might as well say it now.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Sherlock is actually a girl’s name.

name: JOHN
line: It’s not.

name: JOHN
line: We’re not naming our daughter after you.

name: SHERLOCK
line: I think it could work.

name: SHERLOCK
line: To the very best of times, John.

name: COMMENTATOR
line: Smith brings it inside. This looks good.

name: CUSTOMER
line: Oi! What’s up with the telly? There’s something wrong with the telly, mate!

name: ANOTHER CUSTOMER
line: Give it a whack, then!

name: CUSTOMER
line: Who’s that?

name: VOICE
line: Did you miss me?

name: LADY SMALLWOOD
line: How is this possible?

name: LADY SMALLWOOD
line: Has the Prime Minister been told? (She looks round and up to Sir Edwin.) And Mycroft?

name: MAN
line: It’s your brother.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Mycroft?

name: SHERLOCK
line: I’ve only been gone four minutes.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Oh, for God’s sake. Make up your mind. Who needs me this time?

name: MARY
line: But he’s dead. I mean, you told me he was dead, Moriarty.

name: JOHN
line: Absolutely. He blew his own brains out.

name: MARY
line: So how can he be back?

name: JOHN
line: There’s an East Wind coming.

name: JIM
line: Miss me?

name: SHERLOCK
line: Afternoon!

name: MOLLY
line: Bad day, was it?

name: MYCROFT
line: Since yesterday you’ve moved in with him ...

name: MYCROFT
line: ... and now you’re solving crimes together.

name: MRS HUDSON
line: Look at you, all happy. It’s not decent.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Who cares about decent? The game, Mrs Hudson, is on!

name: SHERLOCK
line: Don’t make people into heroes, John. Heroes don’t exist and if they did, I wouldn’t be one of them.

name: JOHN
line: Right, this should do it.

name: JOHN
line: Are you wearing any pants?

name: SHERLOCK
line: No.

name: JOHN
line: Okay.

name: IRENE
line: This is how I want you to remember me: the woman who beat you.

name: SHERLOCK
line: But there never was any monster.

name: JOHN
line: Sherlock?

name: JIM
line: Here we are at last.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Goodbye, John.

name: LESTRADE
line: Ooh, you bastard!

name: SHERLOCK
line: ... just the two of us against the rest of the world.

name: JOHN
line: Wait! We’re going to need to co-ordinate.

name: JOHN
line: I asked you for one more miracle. I asked you to stop being dead.

name: SHERLOCK
line: I heard you.

name: JOHN
line: Shut up. You are not a puzzle solver; you never have been. You’re a drama queen. Now there is a man in there about to die ...

name: MAGNUSSEN
line: No chance for you to be a hero this time, Mr Holmes.

name: SHERLOCK
line: I’m a high-functioning sociopath.

name: SHERLOCK
line: To the very best of times, John.

name: LADY SMALLWOOD
line: How is this possible?

name: SHERLOCK
line: I’ve only been gone four minutes.

name: MYCROFT
line: Well, I certainly hope you’ve learned your lesson.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Who needs me this time?

name: JIM
line: Miss me?

name: SOLDIER
line: You all right, Captain?

name: STAMFORD
line: Watson!

name: STAMFORD
line: Stamford. Remember?

name: STAMFORD
line: We were at Bart’s together.

name: WATSON
line: Yes, of course. (He shakes hands with the other man.) Stamford.

name: STAMFORD
line: Good Lord! Where have you been? You’re as thin as a rake!

name: WATSON
line: I made it home. Many weren’t so lucky.

name: STAMFORD
line: So what now?

name: WATSON
line: Hmm? I need a place to live. Somewhere decent, and an affordable price. It’s not easy.

name: STAMFORD
line: You know, you’re the second person to say that to me today.

name: WATSON
line: Hmm? Who was the first?

name: WATSON
line: Good Lord!

name: STAMFORD
line: It’s an experiment, apparently. Beating corpses to establish how long after death bruising is still possible.

name: WATSON
line: Is there a medical point to that?

name: WATSON
line: Neither am I. So, where’s this friend of yours, then?

name: HOLMES
line: You’ve been in Afghanistan, I perceive. (He turns away, reaching into his waistcoat for his pocket watch.)

name: STAMFORD
line: Doctor Watson, Mr Sherlock ...

name: WATSON
line: I’m sorry?

name: HOLMES
line: I have my eye on a suite of rooms near Regent’s Park. Between us we could afford them.

name: WATSON
line: Rooms? (He glances briefly at Stamford.) Who said anything about rooms?

name: HOLMES
line: Now if you’ll excuse me, I have a hanging in Wandsworth and I’d hate them to start without me.

name: WATSON
line: A hanging?

name: HOLMES
line: I take a professional interest. I also play the violin and smoke a pipe. I presume that’s not a problem?

name: WATSON
line: Er, no, well ...

name: HOLMES
line: Oh, and the name is Sherlock Holmes and the address is two hundred and twenty-one B Baker Street.

name: NEWS VENDOR
line: Papers! Papers!

name: NEWS VENDOR
line: Papers! Papers!

name: WATSON
line: Here.

name: WATSON
line: How’s ‘The Blue Carbuncle’ doing?

name: NEWS VENDOR
line: Very popular, Doctor Watson. Is there gonna be a proper murder next time?

name: WATSON
line: I’ll have a word with the criminal classes.

name: NEWS VENDOR
line: If you wouldn’t mind.

name: NEWS VENDOR
line: Is that ’im? Is ’e in there?

name: WATSON
line: No. No, no, not at all. (He tips a finger to his hat.) Ah, good day to you.

name: NEWS VENDOR
line: Merry Christmas, Mr Holmes!

name: MRS HUDSON
line: Mr Holmes, I do wish you’d let me know when you’re planning to come home.

name: HOLMES
line: I hardly knew myself, Mrs Hudson. That’s the trouble with dismembered country squires – they’re notoriously difficult to schedule.

name: WATSON
line: Never mind.

name: HOLMES
line: Caught the murderer; still looking for the legs. Think we’ll call it a draw.

name: MRS HUDSON
line: And I notice you’ve published another of your stories, Doctor Watson.

name: WATSON
line: Yes. Did you enjoy it?

name: WATSON
line: Oh?

name: MRS HUDSON
line: I never enjoy them.

name: MRS HUDSON
line: Well, I never say anything, do I? According to you, I just show people up the stairs and serve you breakfasts.

name: MRS HUDSON
line: My what?!

name: HOLMES
line: Don’t feel singled out, Mrs Hudson. I’m hardly in the dog one.

name: MRS HUDSON
line: I’m your landlady, not a plot device.

name: WATSON
line: Would you, er, care to sit down?

name: HOLMES
line: Well, why didn’t you ask her?

name: HOLMES
line: Oh, for God’s sake. (Quietly, to Watson) Give her some lines. She’s perfectly capable of starving us.

name: HOLMES
line: Good afternoon. I’m Sherlock Holmes. This is my friend and colleague, Doctor Watson. You may speak freely in front of him, as he rarely understands a word.

name: WATSON
line: Holmes.

name: HOLMES
line: You have an impish sense of humour which currently you’re deploying to ease a degree of personal anguish.

name: HOLMES
line: You have recently married a man of a seemingly kindly disposition who has now abandoned you for an unsavoury companion of dubious morals. You have come to this agency as a last resort in the hope that reconciliation may still be possible.

name: WATSON
line: Good Lord, Holmes!

name: HOLMES
line: All of this is, of course, perfectly evident from your perfume.

name: WATSON
line: Her perfume?

name: HOLMES
line: Yes, her perfume, which brings insight to me and disaster to you.

name: WATSON
line: How so?

name: WATSON
line: Mary!

name: WATSON
line: Why, in God’s name, are you pretending to be a client?

name: MRS WATSON
line: Because I could think of no other way to see my husband, Husband.

name: WATSON
line: It was an affair of international intrigue.

name: MRS WATSON
line: It was a murdered country squire.

name: WATSON
line: Nevertheless, matters were pressing.

name: MRS WATSON
line: I don’t mind you going, my darling. I mind you leaving me behind!

name: WATSON
line: But what could you do?!

name: MRS WATSON
line: Oh, what do you do except wander round, taking notes, looking surprised ...

name: HOLMES
line: Enough!

name: MRS WATSON
line: Begin what?

name: HOLMES
line: Sometimes, to solve a case, one must first solve another.

name: WATSON
line: Oh, you have a case, then, a new one?

name: WATSON
line: Deep? Into what?

name: HOLMES
line: Lestrade! Do stop loitering by the door and come in.

name: LESTRADE
line: How did you know it was me?

name: HOLMES
line: I fear she’s branched into literary criticism by means of satire. It is a distressing trend in the modern landlady. What brings you here in your off-duty hours?

name: LESTRADE
line: How’d you know I’m off-duty?

name: HOLMES
line: Well, since your arrival you’ve addressed over forty percent of your remarks to my decanter.

name: HOLMES
line: Watson, give the inspector what he so clearly wants.

name: WATSON
line: So, Lestrade, what can we do for you?

name: LESTRADE
line: Oh, I’m not here on business. I just thought I’d ... drop by.

name: WATSON
line: A social call? (He walks over and hands Lestrade the glass.)

name: LESTRADE
line: Yeah, of course, just to wish you the compliments of the season.

name: LESTRADE
line: Merry Christmas?

name: HOLMES
line: Merry Christmas.

name: WATSON
line: Merry Christmas.

name: MRS WATSON
line: Merry Christmas.

name: HOLMES
line: Thank God that’s over. Now, Inspector, what strange happening compels you to my door but embarrasses you to relate?

name: LESTRADE
line: Who said anything happened?

name: HOLMES
line: You did, by every means short of actual speech.

name: WATSON
line: He didn’t want a drink ... (he takes the glass from Lestrade and turns it upside down to show that it is empty) ... he needed one. He’s not embarrassed; he’s afraid.

name: HOLMES
line: My Boswell is learning. They do grow up so fast.

name: HOLMES
line: Watson, restore the courage of Scotland Yard.

name: HOLMES
line: Inspector, do sit down.

name: HOLMES
line: Fear is wisdom in the face of danger. It is nothing to be ashamed of.

name: LESTRADE
line: Thank you.

name: HOLMES
line: From the beginning, then.

name: BRIDE
line: You!

name: GILES
line: No! Please!

name: BRIDE
line: You?!

name: HOLMES
line: A moment.

name: HOLMES
line: When was this?

name: LESTRADE
line: Yesterday morning.

name: HOLMES
line: The bride’s face. How was it described?

name: LESTRADE
line: White as death ...

name: LESTRADE
line: ... mouth like a crimson wound.

name: HOLMES
line: Poetry or truth?

name: LESTRADE
line: Many would say they’re the same thing.

name: LESTRADE
line: I saw her face myself. Afterwards.

name: HOLMES
line: After what?

name: BRIDE
line: You! (She pauses for a moment.) Or me?

name: HOLMES
line: Really, Lestrade. (He walks back across the room to sit in his chair.) A woman blows her own brains out in public and you need help identifying the guilty party. I fear Scotland Yard has reached a new low.

name: LESTRADE
line: That’s not why I’m here.

name: HOLMES
line: I surmise.

name: LESTRADE
line: Emelia Ricoletti. Yesterday was her wedding anniversary. The police, of course, were called, and her body taken to the morgue. (He drinks from his glass.)

name: HOLMES
line: Standard procedure. Why are you telling us what may be presumed?

name: LESTRADE
line: Because of what happened next.

name: LESTRADE
line: Thomas Ricoletti, Emelia Ricoletti’s husband.

name: HOLMES
line: Presumably on his way to the morgue to identify her remains.

name: LESTRADE
line: As it turned out, he was saved the trip.

name: BRIDE
line: ♪ Remember the maid ...

name: RICOLETTI
line: Who are you?

name: BRIDE
line: ♪ The maid of the mill. ♪

name: BRIDE
line: You recognise our song, my dear? I sang it at our wedding.

name: RICOLETTI
line: Emelia?! (He stutters.) You’re dead. You can’t be here. You died.

name: BRIDE
line: What does it look like, my handsome friend?

name: BRIDE
line: It’s a shotgun wedding.

name: HOLMES
line: ’Til death us do part. Twice, in this case.

name: WATSON
line: Extraordinary.

name: MRS WATSON
line: Impossible!

name: HOLMES
line: ... which one can so rarely say of a morgue.

name: MRS WATSON
line: And am I just to sit here?

name: WATSON
line: Not at all, my dear. (He leans down and chucks her under the chin.) We’ll be hungry later!

name: WATSON
line: Holmes, just one thing? (He looks down at his own clothes.) Tweeds, in a morgue?

name: HOLMES
line: Needs must when the devil drives, Watson.

name: LESTRADE
line: Ma’am.

name: MRS WATSON
line: Votes for Women.

name: LESTRADE
line: And are you – are you for or against?

name: MRS HUDSON
line: Ooh-ooh!

name: MRS HUDSON
line: Oh. Have they gone off again, have they? I dunno – what a life those gentlemen lead.

name: MRS HUDSON
line: Oh, never you mind. Ooh, almost forgot.

name: MRS HUDSON
line: That came for you.

name: MRS WATSON
line: Oh!

name: MRS WATSON
line: Mrs Hudson, tell my husband I’ll be home late. I have some urgent business.

name: MRS HUDSON
line: Is everything all right?

name: MRS WATSON
line: Oh, you know, just a ... (she waves her hand vaguely and clears her throat) ... friend in need.

name: MRS HUDSON
line: Oh dear. What friend?

name: MRS WATSON
line: England.

name: MRS HUDSON
line: Well, that’s not very specific!

name: HOLMES
line: Who’s on mortuary duty?

name: LESTRADE
line: You know who.

name: HOLMES
line: Please tell me which idiot did this!

name: ANDERSON
line: It’s for everyone’s safety.

name: WATSON
line: This woman is dead. Half her head is missing! She’s not a threat to anyone!

name: ANDERSON
line: Tell that to her husband. (He points across the room.) He’s under a sheet over there.

name: HOLMES
line: Whatever happened in Limehouse last night, I think we can safely assume it wasn’t the work of a dead woman.

name: ANDERSON
line: Stranger things have happened.

name: HOLMES
line: Such as?

name: WATSON
line: You’re speaking like a child.

name: THE NEW ARRIVAL
line: Holmes.

name: HOLMES
line: Hooper.

name: HOOPER
line: You – back to work.

name: HOOPER
line: So, come to astonish us with your magic tricks, I suppose.

name: HOLMES
line: Is there anything to which you would like to draw my attention?

name: HOOPER
line: Nothing at all, Mr Holmes. You may leave any time you like.

name: LESTRADE
line: Doctor Hooper, I asked Mr Holmes to come here. Co-operate. That’s an order.

name: HOOPER
line: There are two ‘features of interest,’ as you are always saying in Doctor Watson’s stories.

name: HOLMES
line: I never say that.

name: WATSON
line: You do, actually, quite a lot.

name: HOOPER
line: First of all, this is definitely Emelia Ricoletti. She has been categorically identified. Beyond a doubt it is her.

name: WATSON
line: Then who was that in Limehouse last night?

name: HOOPER
line: That was also Emelia Ricoletti.

name: WATSON
line: It can’t have been. She was dead. She was here.

name: HOOPER
line: She was positively identified by her own husband seconds before he died. He had no reason to lie. He could hardly be mistaken.

name: LESTRADE
line: The cabbie knew her too. There’s no question it’s her.

name: WATSON
line: But she can’t have been in two places at the same time, can she?

name: WATSON
line: Holmes, could it have been twins?

name: HOLMES
line: No.

name: WATSON
line: Why not?

name: HOLMES
line: Because it’s never twins.

name: LESTRADE
line: Emelia was not a twin, nor did she have any sisters. She had one older brother who died four years ago.

name: WATSON
line: Maybe it was a secret twin.

name: HOLMES
line: A what?

name: WATSON
line: Hmm? You know? A twin that nobody knows about? This whole thing could have been planned.

name: HOLMES
line: Since the moment of conception? How breathtakingly prescient of her! It is never twins, Watson.

name: WATSON
line: Then what’s your theory?

name: LESTRADE
line: I-I don’t understand. What ...

name: HOLMES
line: Why were you so frightened? Nothing so far has justified your assault on my decanter, and why have you allowed a dead woman to be placed under arrest?

name: HOOPER
line: Ah. That would be the other feature of interest.

name: WATSON
line: Ah. A smear of blood on her finger. That could have happened any number of ways.

name: HOOPER
line: Indeed.

name: HOOPER
line: There’s one other thing. It wasn’t there earlier.

name: LESTRADE
line: And neither was that.

name: WATSON
line: Holmes!

name: WATSON
line: She, you mean.

name: WATSON
line: Not “he,” “she.”

name: WATSON
line: Er, the gunshot wound was obviously the cause of death, but there are clear indicators of consumption. Might be worth a post mortem. We need all the information we can get.

name: HOOPER
line: Oh, isn’t he observant now that Daddy’s gone?

name: ANDERSON
line: What’s he saying that for?

name: WATSON
line: Well, Holmes? Surely you must have some theory.

name: HOLMES
line: Not yet. These are deep waters, Watson. Deep waters. (He looks out of the window.) And I shall have to go deeper still.

name: LESTRADE
line: Five of them now, all the same, every one of ’em.

name: LESTRADE
line: What is?

name: HOLMES
line: The obliquity of the ecliptic. I have to understand it.

name: LESTRADE
line: What is it?

name: HOLMES
line: I don’t know. I’m still trying to understand it.

name: LESTRADE
line: I thought you understood everything.

name: HOLMES
line: Of course not. That would be an appalling waste of brain space. I specialise.

name: LESTRADE
line: Then what’s so important about this?

name: LESTRADE
line: They’re not boring! Five men dead! Murdered in their own homes; rice on the floor, like at a wedding; and the word “YOU” written in blood on the wall!

name: LESTRADE
line: Uh, it’s-it’s her! It’s-it’s the Bride. Somehow she’s risen again!

name: There you are
line: solved.

name: HOLMES
line: Pay Mrs Hudson a visit on your way out. She likes to feel involved.

name: LESTRADE
line: You sure?

name: HOLMES
line: Certainly. Go away. (He turns and calls into the sitting room.) Watson! I’m ready. Get your hat and boots. We have an important appointment.

name: LESTRADE
line: Didn’t Doctor Watson move out a few months ago?

name: HOLMES
line: He did, didn’t he? (He looks thoughtful.) Who have I been talking to all this time?

name: LESTRADE
line: Well, speaking on behalf of the impossibly imbecilic Scotland Yard, that chair is definitely empty.

name: HOLMES
line: It is, isn’t it? Works surprisingly well, though. I actually thought he was improving.

name: WATSON
line: Ah. Where have you been?

name: JANE
line: Sorry, sir. I’m rather behind my time this morning.

name: WATSON
line: Are you incapable of boiling an egg? (He sighs.) The fires are rarely lit; there is dust everywhere; and you almost destroyed my boots scraping the mud off them. If it wasn’t my wife’s business to deal with the staff, I would talk to you myself. Where is my wife?

name: JANE
line: Begging your pardon, sir, but the mistress has gone out.

name: WATSON
line: Out? At this hour of the morning?

name: JANE
line: Yes, sir. Did you not know that, sir?

name: WATSON
line: Where did she go? (He looks down at his newspaper.) She’s always out these days.

name: JANE
line: ... sir.

name: WATSON
line: I’m sorry?

name: JANE
line: Just observing, sir.

name: WATSON
line: Well, that’s quite enough. Nobody asked you to be observant.

name: JANE
line: Sorry, sir. I just meant you’re hardly ever home together any more, sir.

name: WATSON
line: You are dangerously close to impertinence. (He leans forward.) I shall have a word with my wife to have a word with you.

name: JANE
line: Very good, sir. And when will you be seeing her?

name: WATSON
line: Now listen ...

name: JANE
line: Ooh, I nearly forgot, sir.

name: JANE
line: Er, a telegram came for you.

name: WATSON
line: You forgot?!

name: JANE
line: No, I nearly forgot.

name: JANE
line: Reading your new one in The Strand, sir.

name: WATSON
line: Did you enjoy it?

name: JANE
line: Why do you never mention me, sir?

name: WATSON
line: Go away.

name: WATSON
line: The what of the what?

name: HOLMES
line: The obliquity of the ecliptic.

name: WATSON
line: “Come at once,” you said. I assumed it was important.

name: HOLMES
line: It is. It’s the inclination of the Earth’s equator to the path of the sun on the celestial plane.

name: WATSON
line: Have you been swotting up?

name: HOLMES
line: Why would I do that?

name: WATSON
line: To sound clever.

name: HOLMES
line: I am clever.

name: WATSON
line: Oh, I see.

name: HOLMES
line: You see what?

name: WATSON
line: I deduce we’re on our way to see someone cleverer than you.

name: Wilder looks at Watson and signs
who smiles ruefully at Watson and signs to him
WATSON
line: Oh.

name: MYCROFT HOLMES
line: To anyone who wishes to study mankind, this is the spot.

name: HOLMES
line: Handy, really, as your ever-expanding backside is permanently glued to it. Good morning, brother mine.

name: WATSON
line: You look ... well, sir.

name: MYCROFT HOLMES
line: Really? I rather thought I looked enormous.

name: WATSON
line: Well, now you mention it, this level of consumption is incredibly injurious to your health. Your heart ...

name: HOLMES
line: No need to worry on that score, Watson.

name: WATSON
line: No?

name: HOLMES
line: There’s only a large cavity where that organ should reside.

name: MYCROFT HOLMES
line: It’s a family trait.

name: HOLMES
line: Oh, I wasn’t being critical.

name: WATSON
line: If you continue like this, sir, I give you five years at the most.

name: MYCROFT HOLMES
line: Five? We thought three, did we not, Sherlock?

name: HOLMES
line: I’m still inclined to four.

name: MYCROFT HOLMES
line: As ever, you see but you do not observe. Note the discolouration in the whites of my eyes, the visible rings of fat around the corneas ...

name: HOLMES
line: Yes, you’re right. I’m changing my bet to three years, four months and eleven days.

name: WATSON
line: A bet?!

name: HOLMES
line: I understand your disapproval, Watson, but if he’s feeling competitive it is perfectly within his power to die early.

name: MYCROFT HOLMES
line: That’s a risk you’ll have to take.

name: WATSON
line: You’re gambling with your own life?

name: MYCROFT HOLMES
line: Why not? It’s so much more exciting than gambling with others’.

name: MYCROFT HOLMES
line: Done!

name: MYCROFT HOLMES
line: I expected to see you a few days ago about the Manor House case. I thought you might be a little out of your depth there.

name: MYCROFT HOLMES
line: It was Adams, of course.

name: HOLMES
line: Yes, it was Adams.

name: HOLMES
line: I know. I read it.

name: MYCROFT HOLMES
line: Did you understand it?

name: MYCROFT HOLMES
line: No – did you understand the murderous jealousy? It is no easy thing for a great mind to contemplate a still greater one.

name: HOLMES
line: Did you summon me here just to humiliate me?

name: MYCROFT HOLMES
line: Yes.

name: MYCROFT HOLMES
line: Of course not, but it is by far the greater pleasure.

name: HOLMES
line: Then would you mind explaining exactly why you did summon ...

name: WATSON
line: Socialists?

name: MYCROFT HOLMES
line: Not socialists, Doctor, no.

name: WATSON
line: Anarchists?

name: MYCROFT HOLMES
line: No.

name: WATSON
line: The French? The suffragists?

name: MYCROFT HOLMES
line: Is there any large body of people you’re not concerned about?

name: HOLMES
line: Doctor Watson is endlessly vigilant. (He looks at his brother.) Elaborate.

name: MYCROFT HOLMES
line: No. Investigate. This is a conjecture of mine and I need you to confirm it. I’m sending you a case.

name: WATSON
line: The Scots.

name: HOLMES
line: Scots?!

name: MYCROFT HOLMES
line: Are you aware of recent theories concerning what is known as ‘paranoia’?

name: WATSON
line: Ooh, sounds Serbian.

name: WATSON
line: But these enemies: how are we to defeat them if you won’t tell us about them?

name: MYCROFT HOLMES
line: We don’t defeat them. We must certainly lose to them.

name: WATSON
line: Why?

name: MYCROFT HOLMES
line: Because they are right, and we are wrong.

name: HOLMES
line: Lady Carmichael’s case – what is it?

name: MYCROFT HOLMES
line: Oh, rest assured, it has features of interest.

name: HOLMES
line: I never really say that.

name: WATSON
line: You really do.

name: MYCROFT HOLMES
line: Only in my head. I need you for the, er ... (he grimaces) ... legwork.

name: WATSON
line: Why not just tell us your solution?

name: MYCROFT HOLMES
line: Where would be the sport in that? Will you do it, Sherlock? I can promise you a superior distraction.

name: HOLMES
line: On one condition. Have another plum pudding.

name: MYCROFT HOLMES
line: There’s one on the way.

name: MYCROFT HOLMES
line: It’s getting exciting now!

name: MYCROFT HOLMES
line: Tick tock, tick tock, tick tock.

name: MYCROFT HOLMES
line: Thank you, Wilder.

name: WILDER
line: Also, Mr Melas to see you, Mr Holmes.

name: MYCROFT HOLMES
line: Ah. Give me five minutes. I have a wager to win.

name: MYCROFT HOLMES
line: Better make that fifteen.

name: MYCROFT HOLMES
line: Tick tock.

name: LADY CARMICHAEL
line: Mr Holmes, I have come here for advice.

name: HOLMES
line: That is easily got.

name: LADY CARMICHAEL
line: And help.

name: HOLMES
line: Not always so easy.

name: LADY CARMICHAEL
line: Something has happened, Mr Holmes – something ... unusual and ... terrifying.

name: HOLMES
line: Then you are in luck.

name: LADY CARMICHAEL
line: ‘Luck’?

name: HOLMES
line: This is really very promising.

name: WATSON
line: Holmes ...

name: HOLMES
line: Please do tell us what has so distressed you.

name: LADY CARMICHAEL
line: I – I thought long and hard as to what to do, but then, er, it occurred to me that my husband was an acquaintance of your brother and that, perhaps through him ...

name: LADY CARMICHAEL
line: The fact is, I’m not sure this comes within your purview, Mr Holmes.

name: HOLMES
line: No?

name: LADY CARMICHAEL
line: Lord help me, I think it may be a matter for a priest.

name: SIR EUSTACE
line: And what does your morning threaten, my dear? (He takes a drink from his teacup.) A vigorous round of embroidering? An exhausting appointment at the milliner’s?

name: LADY CARMICHAEL
line: I hope you are teasing, Eustace.

name: LADY CARMICHAEL
line: What is it?

name: LADY CARMICHAEL
line: Eustace?

name: LADY CARMICHAEL
line: Daniel, Sophie, go out and play.

name: SOPHIE
line: But Mama ...

name: LADY CARMICHAEL
line: Do as I tell you. Quickly, now.

name: LADY CARMICHAEL
line: Eustace! What does this mean?

name: LADY CARMICHAEL
line: What?

name: SIR EUSTACE
line: It means death.

name: SIR EUSTACE
line: Er, nothing. It’s, er, it’s nothing. I was mistaken.

name: LADY CARMICHAEL
line: My dear, you’ve gone quite pale.

name: SIR EUSTACE
line: It’s nothing.

name: LADY CARMICHAEL
line: Eustace ...

name: HOLMES
line: Did you keep the envelope?

name: LADY CARMICHAEL
line: My husband destroyed it ...

name: LADY CARMICHAEL
line: ... but it was blank. No name or address of any kind.

name: HOLMES
line: Tell me: has Sir Eustace spent time in America?

name: LADY CARMICHAEL
line: No.

name: HOLMES
line: Not even before your marriage?

name: LADY CARMICHAEL
line: Well, not to my knowledge.

name: HOLMES
line: Hmm. Pray continue with your fascinating narrative. (He steeples his hands in front of his mouth.)

name: LADY CARMICHAEL
line: Well, that incident took place last Monday morning. It was two days later, on the Wednesday, that my husband first saw her.

name: WATSON
line: Who?

name: LADY CARMICHAEL
line: Eustace?

name: SIR EUSTACE
line: She’s come for me, Louisa. Oh, God help me, my sins have found me out.

name: LADY CARMICHAEL
line: Who’s come for you?

name: LADY CARMICHAEL
line: Eustace, you’re frightening me.

name: SIR EUSTACE
line: Look! Look!

name: SIR EUSTACE
line: Don’t you see her?

name: LADY CARMICHAEL
line: No, no. I see no-one.

name: SIR EUSTACE
line: Gone.

name: LADY CARMICHAEL
line: You keep so many secrets from me. Is this another? Who have you seen?

name: SIR EUSTACE
line: It was her. It was the Bride.

name: HOLMES
line: And you saw nothing?

name: LADY CARMICHAEL
line: Nothing.

name: HOLMES
line: Did your husband describe ...

name: LADY CARMICHAEL
line: Nothing – until this morning.

name: LADY CARMICHAEL
line: Eustace?!

name: LADY CARMICHAEL
line: Eustace?

name: LADY CARMICHAEL
line: Eustace!

name: LADY CARMICHAEL
line: Ah!

name: LADY CARMICHAEL
line: Blast!

name: LADY CARMICHAEL
line: Eustace! Where are you? It’s me!

name: LADY CARMICHAEL
line: Who are you? I demand you speak! Who are you?

name: LADY CARMICHAEL
line: Eustace! Speak to me!

name: LADY CARMICHAEL
line: In the name of God!

name: SIR EUSTACE
line: She’s ... she’s Emelia Ricoletti.

name: BRIDE
line: This night, Eustace Carmichael, you ... will ... die.

name: HOLMES
line: Hush, Watson.

name: LADY CARMICHAEL
line: You know the name.

name: HOLMES
line: You must forgive Watson. He has an enthusiasm for stating the obvious which borders on mania.

name: May I ask
line: how is your husband this morning?

name: LADY CARMICHAEL
line: He refuses to speak about the matter. Obviously I have urged him to leave the house.

name: HOLMES
line: No, no! He must stay exactly where he is.

name: LADY CARMICHAEL
line: Well, you don’t think he’s in danger?

name: HOLMES
line: Oh no, somebody definitely wants to kill him, but that’s good for us. You can’t set a trap without bait.

name: LADY CARMICHAEL
line: My husband is not bait, Mr Holmes.

name: HOLMES
line: No. But he could be if we play our cards right.

name: HOLMES
line: Now, listen: you must go home immediately. Doctor Watson and I will follow on the next train. There’s not a moment to lose. Sir Eustace is to die tonight.

name: WATSON
line: Holmes!

name: HOLMES
line: ... and we should ... probably avoid that.

name: WATSON
line: Definitely.

name: HOLMES
line: Definitely avoid that.

name: MYCROFT HOLMES
line: Little brother has taken the case, of course. I now rely on you to keep an eye on things, but he must never suspect you of working for me. Are you clear on that, Watson?

name: MRS WATSON
line: You can rely on me, Mr Holmes.

name: WATSON
line: You don’t suppose ...

name: HOLMES
line: I don’t, and neither should you.

name: WATSON
line: You don’t know what I was going to say.

name: WATSON
line: But the Bride! Holmes, Emelia Ricoletti, again. A dead woman, walking the Earth!

name: HOLMES
line: You amaze me, Watson.

name: WATSON
line: I do?

name: HOLMES
line: Since when have you had any kind of imagination?

name: WATSON
line: Perhaps since I convinced the reading public that an unprincipled drug addict is some kind of gentleman hero.

name: HOLMES
line: Yes, now you come to mention it, that was quite impressive. (He looks down thoughtfully for a moment, then raises his eyes again.) You may, however, rest assured there are no ghosts in this world.

name: WATSON
line: Ghosts we make for ourselves? What do you mean?

name: SIR EUSTACE
line: Somnambulism.

name: WATSON
line: I beg your pardon?

name: SIR EUSTACE
line: I sleepwalk, that’s all. It’s a common enough condition. I thought you were a doctor. The whole thing was a bad dream.

name: WATSON
line: Including the contents of the envelope you received?

name: SIR EUSTACE
line: Well, that’s a grotesque joke.

name: WATSON
line: Well, that’s not the impression you gave your wife, sir.

name: SIR EUSTACE
line: She’s an hysteric, prone to fancies.

name: HOLMES
line: No.

name: SIR EUSTACE
line: I’m sorry? What did you say?

name: SIR EUSTACE
line: My wife sees terror in an orange pip.

name: HOLMES
