line: She married you.

name: HOLMES
line: I assume she was capable of finding a reason.

name: HOLMES
line: I’ll do my best to save your life tonight, but first it would help if you would explain your connection to the Ricoletti case.

name: HOLMES
line: Yes. In detail, please.

name: HOLMES
line: Interesting. I didn’t mention she was a woman. We’ll show ourselves out.

name: HOLMES
line: I hope to see you again in the morning.

name: SIR EUSTACE
line: You will not!

name: HOLMES
line: Then sadly I shall be solving your murder. Good day.

name: WATSON
line: Well, you tried.

name: HOLMES
line: Will you see that Lady Carmichael receives this?

name: HOLMES
line: Thank you. Good afternoon.

name: FOOTMAN
line: Yes, sir.

name: WATSON
line: What was that?

name: HOLMES
line: Lady Carmichael will sleep alone tonight, on the pretence of a violent headache. All the doors and windows of the house will be locked.

name: WATSON
line: Ah, you think the spectre ...

name: WATSON
line: ... er, the Bride will attempt to lure Sir Eustace outside again?

name: WATSON
line: Well, he won’t follow her, surely?

name: HOLMES
line: It’s difficult to say quite what he’ll do. Guilt is eating away at his soul.

name: WATSON
line: Guilt? About what?

name: HOLMES
line: Something in his past. The orange pips were a reminder.

name: HOLMES
line: Not at all. Orange pips are a traditional warning of avenging death, originating in America. Sir Eustace knows this only too well, just as he knows why he is to be punished.

name: HOLMES
line: I presume. We all have a past, Watson.

name: WATSON
line: Hmm.

name: HOLMES
line: Ghosts – they are the shadows that define our every sunny day. Sir Eustace knows he’s a marked man.

name: HOLMES
line: There’s something more than murder he fears. He believes he is to be dragged to Hell by the risen corpse of the late Mrs Ricoletti.

name: WATSON
line: That’s a lot of nonsense, isn’t it?

name: HOLMES
line: God, yes. Did you bring your revolver?

name: WATSON
line: What good would that be against a ghost?

name: HOLMES
line: Exactly. Did you bring it?

name: WATSON
line: Yeah, of course.

name: HOLMES
line: Then come, Watson, come.

name: HOLMES
line: The game is afoot!

name: s note
line: At this point, one of my betas made some positively filthy suggestions about what Watson had been doing in that lower position. I’m so proud of her. ;-)  ]

name: HOLMES
line: Get down, Watson, for heaven’s sake!

name: WATSON
line: Is the, er, lamp still burning?

name: HOLMES
line: There goes Sir Eustace.

name: HOLMES
line: And Lady Carmichael. The house sleeps.

name: WATSON
line: Mmm, good God, this is the longest night of my life.

name: HOLMES
line: Have patience, Watson.

name: WATSON
line: Only midnight.

name: WATSON
line: You know, it’s rare for us to sit together like this.

name: HOLMES
line: I should hope so. It’s murder on the knees.

name: WATSON
line: Hmm. Two old friends, just talking, chewing the fat ...

name: WATSON
line: ... man to man.

name: WATSON
line: She’s a remarkable woman.

name: HOLMES
line: Who?

name: WATSON
line: Lady Carmichael.

name: HOLMES
line: The fair sex is your department, Watson. I’ll take your word for it.

name: WATSON
line: No, you liked her. A “woman of rare perception.”

name: HOLMES
line: And admirably high arches. I noticed them as soon as she stepped into the room.

name: WATSON
line: Huh. She’s far too good for him.

name: HOLMES
line: You think so?

name: WATSON
line: No, you think so. I could tell.

name: HOLMES
line: On the contrary, I have no view on the matter.

name: WATSON
line: Yes you have.

name: WATSON
line: Well, why not?

name: HOLMES
line: What’s the matter with you this evening?

name: re wearing
line: there’s a photograph inside it. I glimpsed it once ...

name: WATSON
line: I believe it is of Irene Adler.

name: WATSON
line: Yes, I did.

name: HOLMES
line: You seriously thought I wouldn’t notice?

name: WATSON
line: Irene Adler.

name: HOLMES
line: Formidable opponent; a remarkable adventure.

name: WATSON
line: A very nice photograph.

name: HOLMES
line: Why are you talking like this?

name: WATSON
line: Why are you so determined to be alone?

name: HOLMES
line: Are you quite well, Watson?

name: WATSON
line: Is it such a curious question?

name: HOLMES
line: From a Viennese alienist, no; from a retired Army surgeon, most certainly.

name: WATSON
line: Holmes, against absolutely no opposition whatsoever, I am your closest friend.

name: HOLMES
line: I concede it.

name: WATSON
line: I am currently attempting to have a perfectly normal conversation with you.

name: HOLMES
line: If you are referring to romantic entanglement, Watson – which I rather fear you are – as I have often explained before, all emotion is abhorrent to me. It is the grit in a sensitive instrument ...

name: WATSON
line: Yes.

name: HOLMES
line: Well, there you are, you see? I’ve said it all before.

name: WATSON
line: No, I wrote all that. You’re quoting yourself from The Strand Magazine.

name: HOLMES
line: Well, exactly.

name: WATSON
line: No, those are my words, not yours! That is the version of you that I present to the public: the brain without a heart; the calculating machine. I write all of that, Holmes, and the readers lap it up, but I do not believe it.

name: HOLMES
line: Well, I’ve a good mind to write to your editor.

name: WATSON
line: You are a living, breathing man. You’ve lived a life; you have a past.

name: HOLMES
line: A what?!

name: WATSON
line: Well, you must have had ...

name: HOLMES
line: Had what?

name: WATSON
line: You know.

name: HOLMES
line: No.

name: WATSON
line: Experiences.

name: WATSON
line: Damn it, Holmes, you are flesh and blood. You have feelings. You have ... you must have ... impulses.

name: WATSON
line: As your friend – as someone who ... worries about you – what made you like this?

name: HOLMES
line: Oh, Watson. Nothing made me.

name: HOLMES
line: I made me.

name: HOLMES
line: Redbeard?

name: WATSON
line: Good God!

name: WATSON
line: What are we to do?

name: HOLMES
line: Pleasant night for the time of year, is it not?

name: WATSON
line: It cannot be true, Holmes. It cannot!

name: HOLMES
line: No, it can’t.

name: WATSON
line: Is it locked?

name: WATSON
line: That was a window breaking, wasn’t it?

name: HOLMES
line: There’s only one broken window we need concern ourselves with.

name: HOLMES
line: Stay in here, Watson.

name: WATSON
line: What? No!

name: HOLMES
line: All the doors and windows to the house are locked. This is their only way out. I need you here.

name: WATSON
line: But the sound was so close, it had to be from this side of the house.

name: HOLMES
line: Stay here!

name: LADY CARMICHAEL
line: You promised to keep him safe. You promised!

name: LADY CARMICHAEL
line: You ...

name: LADY CARMICHAEL
line: You promised!

name: WATSON
line: You’re human, I know that. You must be.

name: WATSON
line: Little use, us standing here in the dark.

name: WATSON
line: After all, this is the nineteenth century.

name: HOLMES
line: Watson!

name: HOLMES
line: Don’t tell me you abandoned your post.

name: WATSON
line: What? Holmes, she’s there! (He points with his revolver.) I saw her!

name: HOLMES
line: Empty, thanks to you! Our bird is flown.

name: WATSON
line: No! No, Holmes, it wasn’t what you think. I saw her – the ghost.

name: WATSON
line: What happened? Where is Sir Eustace?

name: HOLMES
line: Dead.

name: LESTRADE
line: You really mustn’t blame yourself, you know.

name: HOLMES
line: No, you’re quite right.

name: WATSON
line: I’m glad you’re seeing sense.

name: HOLMES
line: Watson is equally culpable. Between us, we’ve managed to botch this whole case. I gave an undertaking to protect that man; now he’s lying there with a dagger in his breast.

name: LESTRADE
line: Anything you can tell us, Doctor?

name: WATSON
line: Well, he’s been stabbed with considerable force.

name: LESTRADE
line: It’s a man, then.

name: WATSON
line: Possibly.

name: LESTRADE
line: A very keen blade, so it could conceivably have been a woman.

name: HOLMES
line: Watson.

name: WATSON
line: You said yourself: I have no imagination.

name: HOLMES
line: Then use your brain, such as it is, to eliminate the impossible – which in this case is the ghost – and observe what remains – which in this case is a solution so blindingly obvious, even Lestrade could work it out.

name: LESTRADE
line: Thank you(!)

name: LESTRADE
line: They did leave a note.

name: LESTRADE
line: What other broken window?

name: HOLMES
line: Precisely. There isn’t one. The only broken window in this establishment is the one that Watson and I entered through, yet prior to that we distinctly heard the sound of What did you just say?

name: LESTRADE
line: Sorry?

name: HOLMES
line: About a note. What did you just say?

name: LESTRADE
line: I said the murderer did leave a note.

name: HOLMES
line: No they didn’t.

name: LESTRADE
line: There’s a message tied to the dagger. You must have seen it!

name: LESTRADE
line: Yes!

name: HOLMES
line: There was no message when I found the body.

name: WATSON
line: Holmes?

name: WATSON
line: What is it?

name: MYCROFT HOLMES
line: Do you?

name: HOLMES
line: Do I what?

name: HOLMES
line: Moriarty is dead.

name: MYCROFT HOLMES
line: And yet.

name: HOLMES
line: His body was never recovered.

name: MYCROFT HOLMES
line: To be expected when one pushes a maths professor over a waterfall. Pure reason toppled by sheer melodrama: your life in a nutshell.

name: HOLMES
line: Have you put on weight?

name: MYCROFT HOLMES
line: You saw me only yesterday. Does that seem possible?

name: MYCROFT HOLMES
line: You’re in deep, Sherlock, deeper than you ever intended to be. Have you made a list?

name: HOLMES
line: Of what?

name: MYCROFT HOLMES
line: Everything. We will need a list.

name: MYCROFT HOLMES
line: Good boy.

name: HOLMES
line: No. I haven’t finished yet.

name: MYCROFT HOLMES
line: Moriarty may beg to differ.

name: HOLMES
line: He’s trying to distract me, to derail me.

name: MYCROFT HOLMES
line: Yes. He’s the crack in the lens, the fly in the ointment ... the virus in the data.

name: HOLMES
line: I have to finish this.

name: MYCROFT HOLMES
line: If Moriarty has risen from the Reichenbach cauldron, he will seek you out.

name: HOLMES
line: I’ll be waiting.

name: s note
line: thanks to Swissmarg for squinting her way through the above reports. Also click here for a transcript of another of the articles.]

name: MRS HUDSON
line: Two days he’s been like that.

name: LESTRADE
line: Has he eaten?

name: LESTRADE
line: Press are having a ruddy field day. There’s still reporters outside.

name: MRS HUDSON
line: They’ve been there all the time. I can’t get rid of them. I’ve been rushed off my feet making tea.

name: LESTRADE
line: Why d’you make ’em tea?

name: MRS HUDSON
line: I don’t know. I just sort of do.

name: LESTRADE
line: He said there’s only one suspect and then he just walks away, and now he won’t explain.

name: MRS HUDSON
line: Which is strange, because he likes that bit.

name: LESTRADE
line: Said it was so simple, I could solve it.

name: MRS HUDSON
line: I’m sure he was exaggerating.

name: LESTRADE
line: What’s he doing, do you think?

name: MRS HUDSON
line: He says he’s waiting.

name: LESTRADE
line: For what?

name: MRS HUDSON
line: The devil.

name: MRS HUDSON
line: I wouldn’t be surprised. We get all sorts here.

name: LESTRADE
line: Well, wire me if there’s any change.

name: MRS HUDSON
line: Yeah.

name: MORIARTY
line: Like a bullet.

name: MORIARTY
line: It’s a dangerous habit, to finger loaded firearms in the pocket of one’s dressing gown. Or are you just pleased to see me?

name: HOLMES
line: You’ll forgive me for taking precautions.

name: MORIARTY
line: I’d be offended if you didn’t.

name: MORIARTY
line: Obviously I’ve returned the courtesy.

name: MORIARTY
line: I like your rooms. They smell so ...

name: MORIARTY
line: ... manly.

name: HOLMES
line: I’m sure you’ve acquainted yourself with them before now.

name: MORIARTY
line: Well, you are always away on your little adventures for The Strand. Tell me: does the illustrator travel with you? Do you have to pose ...

name: MORIARTY
line: ... during your deductions?

name: MORIARTY
line: I know you are.

name: HOLMES
line: Yes.

name: MORIARTY
line: Doesn’t taste the same, though. You want your skin fresh ... (he waves the licked hand in the air as if trying to describe the flavour of his favourite recipe) ... just a little crispy.

name: MORIARTY
line: That’s all people really are, you know: dust waiting to be distributed. And it gets everywhere ... (he sticks out his tongue and waggles it as if trying to shake off the dust he just licked) ... in every breath you take, dancing in every sunbeam, all used-up people.

name: HOLMES
line: Won’t you sit ...

name: MORIARTY
line: D’you mind if I fire this, just to clean it out?

name: MORIARTY
line: Exactly. Let’s stop playing. We don’t need toys to kill each other. Where’s the intimacy in that?

name: HOLMES
line: Sit down.

name: MORIARTY
line: Why? What do you want?

name: MORIARTY
line: Not true. You know that’s not true.

name: MORIARTY
line: What do you want, Sherlock?

name: HOLMES
line: The truth.

name: MORIARTY
line: That.

name: MORIARTY
line: Truth’s boring.

name: MORIARTY
line: You didn’t expect me to turn up at the scene of the crime, did you? Poor old Sir Eustace. He got what was coming to him.

name: HOLMES
line: But you couldn’t have killed him.

name: MORIARTY
line: But she did it, and you need to know how. How ...?

name: MORIARTY
line: ... don’t you? It’s tearing your world apart not knowing.

name: HOLMES
line: ... to distract me, derail me.

name: MORIARTY
line: Because doesn’t this remind you of another case?

name: MORIARTY
line: Hasn’t this all happened before? There’s nothing new under the sun.

name: MORIARTY
line: What was it? What was it? What was that case? Huh? D’you remember?

name: MORIARTY
line: Ed ith the noo thethy.

name: MORIARTY
line: Dead ...

name: MORIARTY
line: Well, I’ll tell you what: that rather blows the cobwebs away.

name: MORIARTY
line: How do I look, huh?

name: MORIARTY
line: Huh?

name: HOLMES
line: I saw you die. (He narrows his eyes.) Why aren’t you dead?

name: DIAMOND
line: We’ve landed, sir. We’ve landed.

name: CAPTAIN
line: I trust you had a pleasant flight, sir.

name: MYCROFT
line: Well, a somewhat shorter exile than we’d imagined, brother mine, although adequate given your levels of OCD.

name: SHERLOCK
line: I have to go back!

name: MYCROFT
line: What?

name: SHERLOCK
line: I was ... I was nearly there! I nearly had it!

name: MYCROFT
line: What on earth are you talking about?

name: JOHN
line: Go back where? You didn’t get very far.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Ricoletti and his abominable wife! Don’t you understand?

name: MARY
line: No, of course we don’t. You’re not making any sense, Sherlock.

name: SHERLOCK
line: It was a case, a famous one from a hundred years ago, lodged in my hard drive. She seemed to be dead but then she came back.

name: JOHN
line: What, like Moriarty?

name: SHERLOCK
line: Shot herself in the head, exactly like Moriarty.

name: SHERLOCK
line: I’ve been in my Mind Palace, of course ...

name: JOHN
line: Of course(!)

name: SHERLOCK
line: ... running an experiment: how would I have solved the crime if I’d been there in 1895?

name: MYCROFT
line: Oh, Sherlock.

name: SHERLOCK
line: I had all the details perfect.

name: JOHN
line: No, he can do this. I’ve seen it – the Mind Palace. It’s like a whole world in his head.

name: MYCROFT
line: The Mind Palace is a memory technique. I know what it can do; and I know what it most certainly cannot.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Maybe there are one or two things that I know that you don’t.

name: SHERLOCK
line: You’ve put on weight. That waistcoat’s clearly newer than the jacket ...

name: SHERLOCK
line: Of what?

name: MYCROFT
line: Everything, Sherlock. Everything you’ve taken.

name: JOHN
line: No, it’s not that. He goes into a sort of trance. I’ve seen him do it.

name: MYCROFT
line: ... there will always be a list.

name: JOHN
line: He couldn’t have taken all of that in the last five minutes.

name: MYCROFT
line: He was high before he got on the plane.

name: SHERLOCK
line: I’m not an addict. I’m a user. I alleviate boredom and occasionally heighten my thought processes.

name: JOHN
line: For God’s sake! This could kill you! You could die!

name: SHERLOCK
line: Controlled usage is not usually fatal, and abstinence is not immortality.

name: MYCROFT
line: What are you doing?

name: MARY
line: Emelia Ricoletti – I’m looking her up.

name: MYCROFT
line: Ah, I suppose we should.

name: MYCROFT
line: I have access to the top level of the MI5 archive ...

name: MARY
line: Yep, that’s where I’m looking.

name: MYCROFT
line: What do you think of MI5’s security?

name: MARY
line: Emelia Ricoletti. Unsolved ...

name: MARY
line: ... like he says.

name: JOHN
line: ‘Yapping’? (Sarcastically) Sorry – did we interrupt your session?

name: MYCROFT
line: I’m not angry with you ...

name: SHERLOCK
line: Oh, that’s a relief. I was really worried. (He opens his eyes.) No, hold on. (He looks at Mycroft.) I really wasn’t.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Realised what?

name: MYCROFT
line: That in your case, solitary confinement is locking you up with your worst enemy.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Oh, for God’s sake.

name: SHERLOCK
line: What did you say?

name: JOHN
line: I didn’t say anything.

name: SHERLOCK
line: No, you did. You said ...

name: JOHN
line: Which is it today – morphine or cocaine?

name: WATSON
line: Holmes?

name: HOLMES
line: Moriarty was here.

name: WATSON
line: Moriarty’s dead.

name: HOLMES
line: I was on a jet.

name: WATSON
line: A what?

name: WATSON
line: You haven’t left these rooms, Holmes. You ... haven’t ... moved. Now, tell me, morphine or cocaine?

name: HOLMES
line: A seven percent solution.

name: HOLMES
line: Would you care to try it?

name: WATSON
line: Then you would be reminded ... quite forcibly ... which of us is a soldier and which of us a drug addict.

name: HOLMES
line: You’re not a soldier. You are a doctor.

name: HOLMES
line: My dear Watson, you are allowing emotion to cloud your judgement.

name: HOLMES
line: No, I just said that in one of your stories. (He smiles.)

name: WATSON
line: Listen. (He points at Holmes, breathing rapidly.) I’m happy to play the fool for you. I will run along behind you like some halfwit, making you look clever, if that’s what you need, but dear God above ... (his voice rises angrily) ... you will hold yourself to a higher standard.

name: HOLMES
line: Why?

name: WATSON
line: Because people need you to.

name: HOLMES
line: What people? Why? Because of your idiot stories?

name: WATSON
line: Yes, because of my idiot stories.

name: BILLY
line: Mr Holmes! Telegram, Mr Holmes!

name: WATSON
line: What is it? What’s wrong?

name: HOLMES
line: It’s Mary.

name: WATSON
line: Mary? What about her?

name: HOLMES
line: It’s entirely possible she’s in danger.

name: WATSON
line: Danger?

name: HOLMES
line: There’s not a moment to lose.

name: WATSON
line: Is this the cocaine talking?

name: WATSON
line: What danger could Mary be in? I’m sure she’s just visiting with friends.

name: WATSON
line: What is happening?

name: WATSON
line: Are you even in a fit state?

name: HOLMES
line: For Mary, of course. Never doubt that, Watson. Never that.

name: WATSON
line: Holmes!

name: WATSON
line: This one.

name: HOLMES
line: Why?

name: WATSON
line: You’re Sherlock Holmes. Wear the damn hat.

name: WATSON
line: Cab? Cab!

name: WATSON
line: So, tell me. Where is she?

name: WATSON
line: You must tell me. What’s going on?

name: WATSON
line: Holmes! Where is she?

name: HOLMES
line: A desanctified church. She thinks she’s found the solution, and for no better reason than that, she’s put herself in the path of considerable danger.

name: HOLMES
line: What an excellent choice of wife.

name: WATSON
line: What the devil?!

name: MRS WATSON
line: This is the heart of it all, John, the heart of the conspiracy.

name: MRS WATSON
line: I’ve been making enquiries. Mr Holmes asked me.

name: WATSON
line: Holmes, how could you?!

name: MRS WATSON
line: No, not him. The clever one.

name: MRS WATSON
line: It seemed obvious to me that this business could not be managed alone. My theory is that Mrs Ricoletti had help – help from her friends.

name: HOLMES
line: Bravo, Mary. (He looks at her, finally catching up with what she just said.) ‘The clever one’?

name: MRS WATSON
line: Oh.

name: WATSON
line: I thought perhaps we were neglecting each other.

name: HOLMES
line: Well, you’re the one who moved out.

name: WATSON
line: You’re working for Mycroft?

name: MRS WATSON
line: He likes to keep an eye on his mad sibling.

name: HOLMES
line: And he had a spy to hand. (Glancing towards Watson) Has it never occurred to you that your wife is excessively skilled for a nurse?

name: MRS WATSON
line: Of course it hasn’t. (She smirks.) Because he knows what a nurse is capable of.

name: HOLMES
line: Only now, I’m afraid.

name: HOLMES
line: Time I sped up. Enough chatter. Let’s concentrate.

name: MRS WATSON
line: Yes, all right. What’s all this about? What do they want to accomplish?

name: HOLMES
line: Why don’t we go and find out?

name: MRS WATSON
line: Never have guessed(!)

name: HOLMES
line: Excellent.

name: HOLMES
line: Superlative theatre. I applaud the spectacle.

name: HOLMES
line: Emelia Ricoletti shot herself, then apparently returned from the grave and killed her husband. So, how was it done? Let’s take the events in order.

name: BRIDE
line: You?! (Softly) Or me?

name: RICOLETTI
line: Who are you? What do you want?

name: RICOLETTI
line: Emelia?!

name: EMELIA
line: Swiftly now. No tears.

name: MRS WATSON
line: But why would she do that – die to prove a point?

name: HOLMES
line: Every great cause has martyrs; every war has suicide missions – and make no mistake, this is war. One half of the human race at war with the other.

name: HOLMES
line: The invisible army hovering at our elbow, attending to our homes, raising our children, ignored, patronised, disregarded, not allowed so much as a vote.

name: HOLMES
line: ... but an army nonetheless, ready to rise up in the best of causes, to put right an injustice as old as humanity itself. So, you see, Watson, Mycroft was right. This is a war we must lose.

name: WATSON
line: She was dying.

name: HOLMES
line: Who was?

name: WATSON
line: Emelia Ricoletti. There were clear signs of consumption. I doubt she was long for this world.

name: HOLMES
line: So she decided to make her death count. She was already familiar with the secret societies of America and was able to draw on their methods of fear and intimidation to publicly – very publicly – confront Sir Eustace Carmichael with the sins of his past.

name: HOOPER
line: ... marriage, position – and then he had his way with her and threw her over, left her abandoned and penniless.

name: HOLMES
line: Hooper!

name: WATSON
line: For the record, Holmes, she didn’t have me fooled.

name: JANE
line: Why do you never mention me, sir?

name: JANINE
line: Emelia thought that she’d found happiness with Ricoletti, but he was a brute too.

name: s note
line: in the cast list for this episode, she is credited as ‘Janine Donlevy.’ People with sharp eyes noticed that in “His Last Vow” her newspaper interviews about her relationship with Sherlock named her as ‘Janine Hawkins.’ It may be that this Victorian version is – or was – married.]

name: WATSON
line: But ... the Bride, Holmes. We saw her.

name: HOLMES
line: Just an old theatrical trick.

name: WATSON
line: It cannot be true, Holmes! It cannot!

name: HOLMES
line: No, it can’t.

name: HOLMES
line: The avenging ghost – a legend to strike terror into the heart of any man with malicious intent; a spectre to stalk those unpunished brutes whose reckoning is long overdue.

name: HOLMES
line: This is the work of a single-minded person, someone who knew first-hand about Sir Eustace’s mental cruelty. A dark secret, kept from all but her closest friends ...

name: HOLMES
line: ... including Emelia Ricoletti ...

name: HOLMES
line: ... the woman her husband wronged all those years before. If one disregards the ghost, there is only one suspect.

name: HOLMES
line: Isn’t that right, Lady Carmichael?

name: HOLMES
line: One small detail doesn’t quite make sense to me, however. Why engage me to prevent a murder you intended to commit?

name: HOLMES
line: Hmm?

name: s VOICE
line: It’s not real.

name: s VOICE
line: Oh, Sherlock.

name: MORIARTY
line: Peekaboo.

name: HOLMES
line: No. No, not you. It can’t be you.

name: MORIARTY
line: I mean, come on, be serious. Costumes, the gong. Speaking as a criminal mastermind, we don’t really have gongs, or special outfits.

name: WATSON
line: What the hell is going on?

name: MORIARTY
line: Is this silly enough for you yet? Gothic enough? Mad enough, even for you? It doesn’t make sense, Sherlock, because it’s not real. (In a whisper) None of it.

name: WATSON
line: What’s he talking about?

name: s VOICE
line: Sherlock.

name: s VOICE
line: Holmes!

name: MARY
line: Is he dreaming?

name: May I just check
line: is this what you mean by “controlled usage”?

name: MYCROFT
line: What, a hundred and twenty years ago?!

name: MYCROFT
line: That would take weeks to find, if those records even exist. Even with my resources ...

name: JOHN
line: I don’t get it. How is this relevant?

name: SHERLOCK
line: I need to know I was right, then I’ll be sure.

name: MARY
line: You mean how Moriarty did it?

name: SHERLOCK
line: Yes.

name: JOHN
line: But none of that really happened. It was in your head.

name: SHERLOCK
line: My investigation was the fantasy. The crime happened exactly as I explained.

name: MARY
line: The stone was erected by a group of her friends.

name: MYCROFT
line: I don’t know what you think you’ll find here.

name: SHERLOCK
line: I need to try!

name: SHERLOCK
line: Mrs Ricoletti was buried here, but what happened to the other one, the corpse they substituted for her after the so-called suicide?

name: JOHN
line: They’d move it. Of course they would.

name: SHERLOCK
line: But where?

name: JOHN
line: Well, not here!

name: SHERLOCK
line: But that ... that’s exactly what they must have done. The conspirators had someone on the inside. They found a body, just like Molly Hooper found a body for me when I ...

name: JOHN
line: You’re not seriously gonna do this?

name: SHERLOCK
line: It’s why we came here! I need to know.

name: SHERLOCK
line: John ...

name: JOHN
line: Moriarty’s back. We have a case! We have a real-life problem right now.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Getting to that! It’s next on the list! Just let me do this.

name: JOHN
line: When you’re ready to go to work, give me a call.

name: JOHN
line: I’m taking Mary home.

name: JOHN
line: Mary’s taking me home.

name: MARY
line: Better.

name: MYCROFT
line: He’s right, you know.

name: MYCROFT
line: Cherchez la femme.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Urgh!

name: MYCROFT
line: Oh dear. The cupboard is bare.

name: SHERLOCK
line: They must have buried it underneath. They must have buried it underneath the coffin.

name: LESTRADE
line: Bad luck, Sherlock.

name: LESTRADE
line: Maybe they got rid of the body in another way.

name: MYCROFT
line: More than likely. At any rate, it was a very long time ago. We do have slightly more pressing matters to hand, little brother. Moriarty, back from the dead?

name: MORIARTY
line: Too deep, Sherlock. Way too deep.

name: MORIARTY
line: Congratulations. You’ll be the first man in history to be buried in his own Mind Palace.

name: MORIARTY
line: For you and me? (He looks up at the spray splashing over him.) Not at all.

name: HOLMES
line: What are you?

name: MORIARTY
line: You know what I am. I’m Moriarty. (In a slightly sarcastic voice) The Napoleon of crime.

name: MORIARTY
line: Not in your mind. (He shakes his head.) I’ll never be dead there. You once called your brain a hard drive. (He starts to walk forward.) Well, say hello to the virus. This is how we end, you and I. Always here, always together.

name: HOLMES
line: You have a magnificent brain, Moriarty. I admire it.

name: HOLMES
line: I concede it may be even be the equal of my own.

name: MORIARTY
line: I’m touched. I’m honoured.

name: HOLMES
line: But when it comes to the matter of unarmed combat on the edge of a precipice ...

name: HOLMES
line: ... you’re going in the water ...

name: HOLMES
line: ... short-arse.

name: MORIARTY
line: Every time you STUMBLE, every time you FAIL, when you’re WEAK ...

name: MORIARTY
line: I ... AM ... (he bends and punches his chest again) ... THERE!

name: MORIARTY
line: No. Don’t try to fight it. LIE BACK AND LOSE!

name: WATSON
line: Professor, if you wouldn’t mind stepping away from my friend. I do believe he finds your attention a shade annoying.

name: MORIARTY
line: That’s not fair. There’s two of you!

name: WATSON
line: There’s always two of us. Don’t you read The Strand?

name: WATSON
line: On your knees, Professor.

name: WATSON
line: Hands behind your head.

name: HOLMES
line: Thank you, John.

name: WATSON
line: Since when do you call me John?

name: HOLMES
line: You’d be surprised. (He smiles.)

name: WATSON
line: No I wouldn’t. (He smiles back briefly, then looks down towards Moriarty.) Time you woke up, Sherlock.

name: WATSON
line: I’m a storyteller. I know when I’m in one.

name: HOLMES
line: Of course. Of course you do, John. (He smiles again.)

name: WATSON
line: So what’s he like? The other me, in the other place?

name: HOLMES
line: Smarter than he looks.

name: WATSON
line: Pretty damned smart, then.

name: MORIARTY
line: Urgh. Why don’t you two just elope, for God’s sake?

name: WATSON
line: Impertinent!

name: HOLMES
line: Offensive.

name: WATSON
line: Actually ... (he lowers his revolver) ... would you mind?

name: HOLMES
line: Not at all.

name: WATSON
line: It was my turn.

name: HOLMES
line: Quite so.

name: WATSON
line: So, how do you plan to wake up?

name: WATSON
line: Are you sure?

name: HOLMES
line: Between you and me, John, I always survive a fall.

name: WATSON
line: But how?

name: SHERLOCK
line: Miss me?

name: JOHN
line: Sherlock? You all right?

name: SHERLOCK
line: Yes, of course I am. Why wouldn’t I be?

name: MARY
line: ’Cause you probably just OD’d. You should be in hospital.

name: SHERLOCK
line: No time. (He starts to get up.) I have to go to Baker Street now. Moriarty’s back.

name: MYCROFT
line: I almost hope he is, if it’ll save you from this.

name: SHERLOCK
line: No need for that now. (He drops the pieces to the floor.) Got the real thing. I have work to do.

name: SHERLOCK
line: What are you still doing here? Shouldn’t you be off getting me a pardon or something, like a proper big brother?

name: MYCROFT
line: Doctor Watson?

name: MYCROFT
line: Look after him ...

name: MYCROFT
line: ... please?

name: JOHN
line: Sherlock, hang on. Explain. Moriarty’s alive, then?

name: MARY
line: So he’s dead.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Of course he’s dead. He blew his own brains out. No-one survives that. I just went to the trouble of an overdose to prove it.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Moriarty is dead, no question. But more importantly ...

name: SHERLOCK
line: ... I know exactly what he’s going to do next.

name: WATSON
line: What sort of lunatic fantasy is that?

name: HOLMES
line: It was simply my conjecture of what a future world might look like, and how you and I might fit inside it.

name: HOLMES
line: From a drop of water, a logician should be able to infer the possibility of an Atlantic or a Niagara.

name: WATSON
line: Or a Reichenbach.

name: HOLMES
line: Have you written up your account of the case?

name: WATSON
line: Yes.

name: HOLMES
line: Hmm. Modified to put it down as one of my rare failures, of course?

name: WATSON
line: Of course.

name: HOLMES
line: “The Adventure of ... the Invisible Army.”

name: HOLMES
line: “The League of Furies”? (He leans forward, smiling.) “The Monstrous Regiment.”

name: WATSON
line: I rather thought ... “The Abominable Bride.”

name: WATSON
line: It’ll sell. It’s got proper murders in it, too.

name: WATSON
line: As for your own tale, are you sure it’s still just a seven percent solution that you take? I think you may have increased the dosage.

name: HOLMES
line: Perhaps I was being a little fanciful ...

name: HOLMES
line: ... but perhaps such things could come to pass.

name: HOLMES
line: In any case, I know I would be very much at home in such a world.

name: WATSON
line: Don’t think I would be.

name: HOLMES
line: I beg to differ.

name: HOLMES
line: But then I’ve always known I was a man out of his time.

name: MYCROFT
line: Is that quite clear? (He looks towards the elderly lady.) Don’t minute any of this.

name: MYCROFT
line: Once beyond these walls, you must never speak of it. A D-notice has been slapped on the entire incident. Only those within this room – code names Antarctica, Langdale, Porlock and Love – will ever know the whole truth.

name: MYCROFT
line: As far as everyone else is concerned, going to the Prime Minister and way beyond, Charles Augustus ... Are you tweeting?!

name: SHERLOCK
line: No.

name: MYCROFT
line: Well, that’s what it looks like.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Of course I’m not tweeting. Why would I be tweeting?

name: MYCROFT
line: Give me that.

name: SHERLOCK
line: What? No. Get off. What are you doing?

name: SHERLOCK
line: Get off. What ...?

name: MYCROFT
line: “Back on terra firma.”

name: SHERLOCK
line: Don’t read them out.

name: MYCROFT
line: “Free as a bird.”

name: SHERLOCK
line: God, you’re such a spoilsport.

name: SHERLOCK
line: I am taking it seriously. What makes you think I’m not taking it seriously?

name: SHERLOCK
line: Love ginger nuts.

name: LADY SMALLWOOD
line: Our doctor said you were clean.

name: SHERLOCK
line: I am, utterly. (He turns and looks at Mycroft as he walks back towards his chair.) No need for stimulants now, remember? I have work to do.

name: SIR EDWIN
line: You’re high as a kite!

name: SHERLOCK
line: What shall we do next? (He points at the elderly woman.) What’s your name?

name: SHERLOCK
line: What would you do, Vivian?

name: VIVIAN
line: Pardon?

name: SHERLOCK
line: Well, it’s a lovely day. Go for a stroll?

name: SHERLOCK
line: Make a paper aeroplane? Have an ice lolly? (He takes another bite of a biscuit.)

name: VIVIAN
line: Ice lolly, I suppose.

name: VIVIAN
line: Do they still do Mivvis?

name: s note
line: They do, Vivian. See here.]

name: LADY SMALLWOOD
line: We do need to get on.

name: SHERLOCK
line: I see. Who is supposed to have shot him, then?

name: SIR EDWIN
line: Some over-eager squaddie with an itchy trigger finger, that’s who.

name: SHERLOCK
line: That’s not what happened at all. (He takes another bite of biscuit.)

name: MYCROFT
line: It is now.

name: LADY SMALLWOOD
line: Remarkable. How did you do it?

name: SIR EDWIN
line: We have some very talented people working here. If James Moriarty can hack every TV screen in the land, rest assured we have the tech to, er ... doctor a bit of security footage.

name: SIR EDWIN
line: That is now the official version; the version anyone we want to will see.

name: LADY SMALLWOOD
line: No need to go to the trouble of getting some sort of official pardon. You’re off the hook, Mr Holmes. You’re home and dry.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Okay, cheers.

name: LADY SMALLWOOD
line: Obviously there’s unfinished business. Moriarty.

name: LADY SMALLWOOD
line: You say he filmed that video message before he died.

name: LADY SMALLWOOD
line: You also say you know what he’s going to do next. What does that mean?

name: SIR EDWIN
line: Perhaps that’s all there is to it. (He points towards Sherlock.) Perhaps he was just trying to frighten you.

name: SHERLOCK
line: No, no. He would never be that disappointing. (He gazes into the distance.) He’s planned something; something long-term; something that would take effect if he never made it off that rooftop alive. Posthumous revenge. No – better than that. Posthumous game.

name: LADY SMALLWOOD
line: We brought you back to deal with this. What are you going to do?

name: SHERLOCK
line: Wait.

name: LADY SMALLWOOD
line: “Wait”?!

name: SHERLOCK
line: Of course wait. I’m the target. Targets wait. Look – whatever’s coming, whatever he’s lined up, I’ll know when it begins.

name: SHERLOCK
line: I always know when the game is on. D’you know why?

name: But tell me
line: why did you look surprised when you saw me this morning in Baghdad?” “Because,” said Death, “I had an appointment with you tonight – in Samarra.”

name: SHERLOCK
line: If this gets any better, I’m gonna get two knives.

name: JOHN
line: It pays to advertise.

name: MARY
line: So, what about Moriarty, then?

name: SHERLOCK
line: Ooh, I have a plan.

name: SHERLOCK
line: I’m going to monitor the underworld – every quiver of the web will tell me when the spider makes his move.

name: JOHN
line: Basically your ‘plan’ is just to sit there solving crimes like you always do.

name: FEMALE CLIENT
line: He drowned, Mr Holmes.

name: FEMALE CLIENT
line: That’s what we thought but when they opened up his lungs ...

name: MARY
line: Yes?

name: FEMALE CLIENT
line: Sand.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Come back! It’s the wrong thumb!

name: MARY
line: Sherlock ...

name: DIMMOCK
line: Bloody hell! Is that a guess?

name: SHERLOCK
line: I never guess.

name: MARY
line: Sherlock ...

name: HOPKINS
line: So he’s the killer? The canary trainer?

name: SHERLOCK
line: ’Course he’s the killer.

name: HOPKINS
line: Didn’t see that coming.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Hm, naturally.

name: JOHN
line: Sherlock, you can’t go on spinning plates like this.

name: SHERLOCK
line: That’s it! The place was spinning.

name: SHERLOCK
line: The heart medication you are taking is known to cause bouts of amnesia.

name: Mr FENTIMAN
line: Yes, um ... I think so. Why?

name: JOHN
line: A jellyfish?!

name: SHERLOCK
line: I know.

name: JOHN
line: You can’t arrest a jellyfish!

name: JOHN
line: We did try.

name: JOHN
line: Oh God.

name: JOHN
line: Fifty-nine missed calls.

name: SHERLOCK
line: We’re in a lot of trouble.

name: MARY
line: Ow! Oh my God. Oh my God!

name: JOHN
line: Relax. It’s got two syllables ...

name: MARY
line: I’m a nurse, darling. I think I know what to do.

name: JOHN
line: Come on then, come on.

name: MARY
line: Re...

name: JOHN
line: ...lax. (He blows out the breath.)

name: SHERLOCK
line: That’s it, Mary. Re... (He purses his lips and sucks in a breath.)

name: MARY
line: John? (She braces her other hand against Sherlock’s head.) John, I think you have to pull over.

name: JOHN
line: Mary, Mary ...

name: MARY
line: Pull Over!

name: SHERLOCK
line: Oh my God.

name: MRS HUDSON
line: Has that come out?

name: MRS HUDSON
line: They never come out when I take them!

name: MRS HUDSON
line: Aww. She’s so beautiful.

name: MOLLY
line: Have another go.

name: JOHN
line: Catherine.

name: MARY
line: Uh, yeah, we’ve gone off that.

name: JOHN
line: Have we?

name: MARY
line: Yeah.

name: JOHN
line: Oh.

name: JOHN
line: Molly, Mrs H. We would love you to be godparents.

name: JOHN
line: If you ...

name: MOLLY
line: Really?

name: MRS HUDSON
line: So lovely!

name: JOHN
line: And, uh ...

name: JOHN
line: ... you, too, Sherlock?

name: JOHN
line: Godfather? We’d like you to be godfather.

name: SHERLOCK
line: God is a ludicrous fiction dreamt up by inadequates who abnegate all responsibility to an invisible magic friend.

name: JOHN
line: Yeah, but there’ll be cake. Will you do it?

name: SHERLOCK
line: I’ll get back to you.

name: VICAR
line: Father, we ask you to send your blessings on this water ... (he leans forward and draws the sign of the cross in the water) ... and sanctify it for our use this day, in Christ’s name.

name: VICAR
line: Now, what name have you given your daughter?

name: MARY
line: Rosamund Mary.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Rosamund? (Frowning, he looks up briefly.)

name: MOLLY
line: Didn’t you get John’s text?

name: SHERLOCK
line: No. I delete his texts. I delete any text that begins, ‘Hi.’

name: MOLLY
line: No idea why people think you’re incapable of human emotion.

name: VICAR
line: And now, godparents ...

name: SIRI
line: Sorry, I didn’t catch that.

name: SHERLOCK
line: As ever, Watson, you see but do not observe.

name: SHERLOCK
line: To you, the world remains an impenetrable mystery whereas, to me, it is an open book. Hard logic versus romantic whimsy. That is your choice. You fail to connect actions to their consequences. Now, for the last time ... (he bends down and picks up a jingling baby’s rattle) ... if you want to keep the rattle ...

name: SHERLOCK
line: ... do not throw the rattle, hm?

name: s note
line: some of my beta team queried why I said this scene takes place ‘a few months later.’ To fend off further enquiries, I simply say that the fact that Rosie is now old enough to sit up and throw things suggested to me that she’s more than a few weeks old.]

name: JOHN
line: I’d better finish this, hadn’t I?

name: LESTRADE
line: Hey.

name: JOHN
line: Afternoon. He says you’ve got a good one, Greg.

name: LESTRADE
line: Oh yeah.

name: DAVID
line: God, fifty! Where did it go?! I know for a fact I was only twenty-one this time last week!

name: EMMA
line: Yeah, well that’s impossible, ’cause that’s before you met me and ...

name: DAVID
line: Well, no ...

name: EMMA
line: She’s looking at me disapprovingly again.

name: DAVID
line: No, she’s just jealous.

name: EMMA
line: Yeah, well, I think we both are.

name: DAVID
line: Ooh.

name: EMMA
line: No, no, David. Come on, you promised.

name: DAVID
line: Oh, it’s a Skype call.

name: EMMA
line: Oh, then, that’s ... must be Charlie. At least he’s phoning, I suppose.

name: DAVID
line: Oh, look! Hello!

name: CHARLIE
line: Hey, Dad!

name: CHARLIE
line: Happy birthday! Sorry to miss your party but, uh ... (he tilts his head towards the background) ... travel broadens the mind, right?

name: DAVID
line: Why-why is it rubbish? Where are you?

name: EMMA
line: How is he? Is he eating? Ask him if he’s eating.

name: DAVID
line: No, shh.

name: DAVID
line: So, Charlie, where are you? ... Are you there?

name: DAVID
line: You all right?

name: DAVID
line: Altitude?

name: DAVID
line: Look, never mind mountains. Your mother wants to know if you’re eating properly. (He laughs.)

name: DAVID
line: What?

name: DAVID
line: Er, yes, I can do that.

name: DAVID
line: All done. You got it? ... Charlie?

name: LESTRADE
line: A week later ...

name: LESTRADE
line: ... something really weird happens.

name: LESTRADE
line: Drunk driver – he’s totally smashed, the cops are chasing him ...

name: LESTRADE
line: ... and he turns into the drive of the Welsborough house to try and get away. Unfortunately ...

name: JOHN
line: Whose body?

name: JOHN
line: What?

name: LESTRADE
line: The son who was in Tibet. DNA all checks out. The night of the party, the car’s empty, then a week later the dead boy’s found at the wheel.

name: LESTRADE
line: Yeah, I thought it’d tickle you.

name: JOHN
line: Have you got a lab report?

name: LESTRADE
line: Yeah, Charlie Welsborough’s the son of a Cabinet minister ...

name: LESTRADE
line: ... so I’m under a lot of pressure to get results.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Who cares about that? Tell me about the seats.

name: JOHN
line: The seats?

name: SHERLOCK
line: Yes. The car seats.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Made of vinyl ... two different types of vinyl present.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Was it his own car?

name: LESTRADE
line: Yeah. Not flash – he was a student.

name: LESTRADE
line: Why?

name: SHERLOCK
line: Vinyl’s cheaper than leather.

name: JOHN
line: There’s something else.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Yes?

name: JOHN
line: The body in the car – dead for a week.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Oh, this is a good one. (He looks at Greg.) Is it my birthday? You want help?

name: SHERLOCK
line: One condition.

name: LESTRADE
line: Okay.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Take all the credit.

name: SHERLOCK
line: It gets boring if I just solve them all.

name: LESTRADE
line: Yeah, you say that, but then John blogs about it and you get all the credit anyway.

name: JOHN
line: Yeah, he’s got a point.

name: LESTRADE
line: Which makes me look like some kind of prima donna who insists on getting credit for something he didn’t do.

name: JOHN
line: Oh, I think you’ve hit a sore spot, Sherlock.

name: LESTRADE
line: ... like I’m some kind of credit junkie.

name: JOHN
line: Definitely a sore spot.

name: LESTRADE
line: ... thanks all the same. (He looks frustrated.) Look, just solve the bloody thing, will you? It’s driving me nuts.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Anything you say, Giles.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Just kidding.

name: JOHN
line: It’s obvious, though, isn’t it, what happened?

name: SHERLOCK
line: John, you amaze me. You know what happened?

name: JOHN
line: Not a clue. It’s just you normally say that at this point.

name: SHERLOCK
line: ... let’s help you solve your little problem, Greg.

name: LESTRADE
line: You hear that?

name: JOHN
line: I know!

name: JOHN
line: Oh, good, great! Yeah, amazing.

name: LESTRADE
line: Getting any sleep?

name: JOHN
line: Christ, no.

name: LESTRADE
line: You’re at the beck and call of a screaming, demanding baby, woken up at all hours to obey his every whim. (He looks pointedly at Sherlock.) Must feel very different.

name: SHERLOCK
line: I’m sorry, what?

name: JOHN
line: Yes, well, you know how it is. All you do is clean up their mess, pat them on the head.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Are you two having a little joke?

name: JOHN
line: Never a word of thanks. Can’t even tell people’s faces apart.

name: SHERLOCK
line: This is a joke, isn’t it?

name: LESTRADE
line: Then it’s all, ‘Ooh, aren’t you clever? You’re so, so clever!’

name: SHERLOCK
line: Is it about me?

name: s note
line: in this context, ‘winding’ means that he needs burping, like a fretful baby who has wind or colic.]

name: JOHN
line: You know, I think that really might be it.

name: SHERLOCK
line: No, don’t get it.

name: as suggested by SwissMarg
line: When Sherlock says this line, he’s reflected in the hall mirror and so obviously his image is reversed, which has caused much online confusion as to why his parting briefly appeared to be on the wrong side of his head.]

name: LESTRADE
line: Charlie’s family are pretty cut up about it, as you’d expect, so go easy on them, yeah?

name: SHERLOCK
line: You know me.

name: JOHN
line: Yeah.

name: MARY
line: And what does he think? Any theories?

name: JOHN
line: Uh, well, I texted you the details.

name: MARY
line: Yeah, two different types of vinyl.

name: JOHN
line: Hey!

name: MARY
line: Oh, you’d be amazed at what a receptionist picks up. (She leans closer to the phone and whispers loudly and dramatically.) They know everything!

name: SHERLOCK
line: Solved it, then?

name: SHERLOCK
line: Oh, Mary, motherhood’s slowing you down.

name: MARY
line: Pig!

name: SHERLOCK
line: Keep trying.

name: MARY
line: So, what about it, then?

name: MARY
line: What, an empty car that suddenly has a week-old corpse in it? And what are you gonna call this one?

name: JOHN
line: Ooh, the ... uh, The Ghost Driver.

name: JOHN
line: People like the titles.

name: SHERLOCK
line: I hate the titles.

name: JOHN
line: Give the people what they want.

name: SHERLOCK
line: No, never do that. People are stupid.

name: MARY
line: Uh, some people.

name: SHERLOCK
line: All people are stupid. ... Most people.

name: LESTRADE
line: Bizarre enough, though, isn’t it, to be him? (He looks at Sherlock.) I mean, it’s right up your strasse.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Mr and Mrs Welsborough. (He takes Emma’s hand to shake it.) I really am most terribly sorry to hear about your daughter.

name: LESTRADE
line: Mr and Mrs Welsborough, this is Mr Sherlock Holmes.

name: DAVID
line: Thank you very much for coming. We’ve heard a great deal about you. If anyone can throw any light into this darkness, surely it will be you.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Well, I believe that I ...

name: DAVID
line: But Charlie was our whole world, Mr Holmes. I ...

name: JOHN
line: Sherlock?

name: DAVID
line: Mr Holmes?

name: SHERLOCK
line: Sorry. You were saying?

name: DAVID
line: Well, Charlie was our whole world, Mr Holmes. I ... I don’t think we’ll ever get over this.

name: SHERLOCK
line: No, shouldn’t think so.

name: SHERLOCK
line: So sorry. Will you excuse me a moment? I just ...

name: JOHN
line: I’ll just, um ...

name: JOHN
line: Now what’s wrong?

name: SHERLOCK
line: Not sure. I just ... ‘By the pricking of my thumbs.’

name: SHERLOCK
line: Intuitions are not to be ignored, John. They represent data processed too fast for the conscious mind to comprehend.

name: SHERLOCK
line: What is this?

name: DAVID
line: Oh, it’s a sort of shrine, I suppose, really.

name: DAVID
line: Bit of a fan of Mrs T. Big hero of mine when I was getting started.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Who?

name: DAVID
line: What?

name: SHERLOCK
line: Who-who is this? (He gestures to the table.)

name: DAVID
line: Are you serious?

name: DAVID
line: It’s ... it’s Margaret Thatcher, the first female prime minister of this country.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Right.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Prime minister?

name: SHERLOCK
line: Right.

name: JOHN
line: For God’s sake. You know perfectly well who she is.

name: JOHN
line: Why are you playing for time?

name: SHERLOCK
line: It’s the gap. (He focuses on the space between the items on the table.) Look at the gap. It’s wrong. Everything else is perfectly ordered, managed ...

name: SHERLOCK
line: This whole thing’s verging on OCD.

name: SHERLOCK
line: My respects. This figurine is routinely repositioned after the cleaner’s been in. (He points to the official picture.) This picture’s straightened every day, yet this ugly gap remains. (He points to the vacant spot in the middle of the table.) Something’s missing from here, but only recently. (He squats down again to focus on the scratched leather.)

name: DAVID
line: Yes, a ...

name: SHERLOCK
line: ... plaster bust.

name: EMMA
line: What?

name: SHERLOCK
line: Well, how could it get broken? The only place for it to fall is the floor, and there is a big thick rug.

name: EMMA
line: Does it matter?

name: JOHN
line: Mrs Welsborough, my apologies. It is worth letting him do this.

name: EMMA
line: Is your friend quite mad?

name: JOHN
line: No, he’s an arsehole, but it’s an easy mistake.

name: DAVID
line: Look, no, we had a break-in. Some little bastard smashed it to bits. We found the remains out there in the porch.

name: SHERLOCK
line: The porch where we came in?

name: DAVID
line: How anybody could hate her so much, they’d go to the trouble of smashing her likeness ...

name: SHERLOCK
line: I’m no expert but, er, possibly her face?

name: SHERLOCK
line: Why didn’t he smash all the others? Perfect opportunity, and look at that one. (He points to the official photo.) She’s smiling in that one.

name: EMMA
line: Oh, Inspector, this is clearly a waste of time. I mean, if there’s nothing more ..

name: SHERLOCK
line: I know what happened to your son.

name: EMMA
line: You do?

name: SHERLOCK
line: It’s quite simple. Superficial, to be blunt. But first, tell me: the night of the break-in. This room was in darkness?

name: DAVID
line: Well, yes.

name: SHERLOCK
line: And the porch where it was smashed: I noticed the motion sensor was damaged, so I assume it’s permanently lit.

name: LESTRADE
line: How’d you notice that?

name: SHERLOCK
line: I lack the arrogance to ignore details. I’m not the police.

name: JOHN
line: So you’re saying he smashed it where he could see it.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Exactly.

name: JOHN
line: Why?

name: SHERLOCK
line: Dunno. Wouldn’t be fun if I knew.

name: DAVID
line: Yes.

name: SHERLOCK
line: No.

name: DAVID
line: No?

name: SHERLOCK
line: The first part of your conversation was, in fact, pre-recorded video. Easily arranged.

name: SHERLOCK
line: The trick was meant to be a surprise.

name: DAVID
line: Trick?

name: SHERLOCK
line: Obviously.

name: CHARLIE
line: Could you take a photo and send it? (He grins.)

name: SHERLOCK
line: There were two types of vinyl in the burnt-out remains of the car: one the actual passenger seat; the other a good copy. Well, good enough.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Effectively a costume.

name: DAVID
line: You’re joking.

name: SHERLOCK
line: No, I’m not. What he wanted was for you to get close enough to the car so he could spring the surprise.

name: CHARLIE
line: Surprise!

name: SHERLOCK
line: That’s when it happened.

name: SHERLOCK
line: I can’t be certain, of course, but I think Charlie must have suffered some sort of a seizure. You said he’d felt unwell?

name: DAVID
line: You all right?

name: SHERLOCK
line: He died there and then. No-one had any cause to go near his car, so there he remained in the driver’s seat hidden until ...

name: SHERLOCK
line: When the two cars were examined, the fake seat had melted in the fire, revealing Charlie, who’d been sitting there quite dead for a week.

name: EMMA
line: Oh, God!

name: LESTRADE
line: Poor kid.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Really, I’m so sorry. Mr Welsborough, Mrs Welsborough.

name: SHERLOCK
line: This is where it was smashed.

name: LESTRADE
line: That was amazing.

name: SHERLOCK
line: What?

name: LESTRADE
line: The car, the kid.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Ancient history. Why are you still talking about it?

name: JOHN
line: What’s so important about a broken bust of Margaret Thatcher?

name: JOHN
line: Yeah, doesn’t mean you have to pull on it.

name: SHERLOCK
line: What kind of a life would that be? Besides, I have the strangest feeling.

name: JIM
line: Miss me?

name: SHERLOCK
line: That’s mine. You two take a ... bus.

name: SHERLOCK
line: I need to concentrate, and I don’t want to hit you.

name: SHERLOCK
line: The Mall, please.

name: MYCROFT
line: I met her once.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Thatcher?

name: MYCROFT
line: Rather arrogant, I thought.

name: SHERLOCK
line: You thought that?!

name: MYCROFT
line: I know!

name: MYCROFT
line: Why am I looking at this?

name: MYCROFT
line: Oh, I see. (He looks at the picture.) Yes. (He smiles in a fake way.) Looks very ... (he pauses as he struggles for an appropriate term) ... fully functioning.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Is that really the best you can do?

name: MYCROFT
line: Sorry. I’ve never been very good with them.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Babies?

name: SHERLOCK
line: Moriarty. Did he have any connection with Thatcher? Any interest in her?

name: MYCROFT
line: Why on earth would he?

name: MYCROFT
line: In the last year of his life, James Moriarty was involved with four political assassinations, over seventy assorted robberies and terrorist attacks, including a chemical weapons factory in North Korea, and had latterly shown some interest in tracking down the Black Pearl of the Borgias – which is still missing, by the way, in case you feel like applying yourself to something practical.

name: SHERLOCK
line: It’s a pearl. Get another one.

name: SHERLOCK
line: I’m sure. Maybe it’s Moriarty. Maybe it’s not. But something’s coming.

name: MYCROFT
line: Are you having a premonition, brother mine?

name: SHERLOCK
line: The world is woven from billions of lives, every strand crossing every other. What we call premonition is just movement of the web. If you could attenuate to every strand of quivering data, the future would be entirely calculable, as inevitable as mathematics.

name: MYCROFT
line: Appointment in Samarra.

name: SHERLOCK
line: I’m sorry?

name: MYCROFT
line: The merchant who can’t outrun Death. You always hated that story as a child. Less keen on predestination back then.

name: SHERLOCK
line: I’m not sure I like it now.

name: MYCROFT
line: You wrote your own version, as I remember. Appointment in Sumatra. The merchant goes to a different city and is perfectly fine.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Goodnight, Mycroft. (He turns towards the door.)

name: SHERLOCK
line: Keep me informed.

name: MYCROFT
line: Of what?

name: VOICE
line: Ammo!

name: VOICE
line: Ammo!

name: LESTRADE
line: Oh, hi, Stella.

name: HOPKINS
line: Greg.

name: LESTRADE
line: You, uh ... you, um ... (He makes incoherent noises and points to the closed door.)

name: HOPKINS
line: Uh, yeah. He’s just got a client, so ...

name: LESTRADE
line: R-right, right, right.

name: LESTRADE
line: Uh, so see a lot of each other, do you?

name: LESTRADE
line: No, no.

name: HOPKINS
line: I just pop round every now and again for a chat.

name: LESTRADE
line: Yeah, ’course.

name: HOPKINS
line: I mean, he loves a really tricky case.

name: HOPKINS
line: Well, uh, Interpol think the Borgia Pearl trail leads back to London, so ...

name: LESTRADE
line: The Borgia Pearl. Are they ... they still after that, are they?

name: HOPKINS
line: Yeah. So how did, uh, you two first meet?

name: LESTRADE
line: Oh, it was a-a case about, um, ten years ago nobody could figure out. There was an old lady found dead in a sauna.

name: HOPKINS
line: Oh yeah? How’d she die?

name: LESTRADE
line: Hypothermia.

name: LESTRADE
line: I know! But then I met Sherlock. (His voice gets louder.) It was so simple, the way ...

name: SHERLOCK
line: Will you two please keep it down?

name: LESTRADE
line: Sorry.

name: HOPKINS
line: Sorry.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Now, you haven’t always been in life insurance, have you? You started out in manual labour.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Oh, don’t bother being astonished. Your right hand’s almost an entire size bigger than your left.

name: Glove Size
line: ” and superimposed above his hands are the numbers “10½” over the right hand and “9½” over the other.)

name: SHERLOCK
line: Hard manual work does that.

name: KINGSLEY
line: I was a carpenter, uh, like me dad.

name: SHERLOCK
line: And you’re trying to give up smoking, unsuccessfully, and you once had a Japanese girlfriend that meant a lot to you but now you feel indifferent about.

name: KINGSLEY
line: Ah. E-cigarettes.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Not just that – ten individual e-cigarettes. Now, if you just wanted to smoke indoors, you would have invested in one of those irritating electronic pipe things, but you’re convinced you can give up, so you don’t want to buy a pipe because that means you’re not serious about quitting, so instead you buy individual cigarettes, always sure that each will be your last. Anything to add, John?

name: SHERLOCK
line: John?

name: JOHN
line: Er, yeah, yeah, listening.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Don’t be so hard on yourself.

name: SHERLOCK
line: You know I value your little contributions.

name: JOHN
line: Yeah? It’s been there since nine this morning.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Has it? Where were you?

name: JOHN
line: Helping Mrs H with her Sudoku.

name: KINGSLEY
line: What about my girlfriend?

name: SHERLOCK
line: What?

name: KINGSLEY
line: You said I had an ex.

name: SHERLOCK
line: You’ve got a Japanese tattoo in the crook of your elbow in the name ‘Akako.’

name: SHERLOCK
line: It’s obvious you’ve tried to have it removed.

name: SHERLOCK
line: If she’d really hurt your feelings, you would have had the word obliterated, but the first attempt wasn’t successful and you haven’t tried again, so it seems you can live with the slightly blurred memory of Akako, hence the indifference.

name: KINGSLEY
line: Sorry. I-I thought you’d done something clever.

name: KINGSLEY
line: No, no. Ah, but now you’ve explained it, it’s dead simple, innit?

name: SHERLOCK
line: I’ve withheld this information from you until now, Mr Kingsley, but I think it’s time you knew the truth.

name: KINGSLEY
line: What d’you mean?

name: SHERLOCK
line: Have you ever wondered if your wife was a little bit out of your league?

name: KINGSLEY
line: Well ...

name: SHERLOCK
line: You thought she was having an affair. I’m afraid it’s far worse than that. Your wife is a spy.

name: KINGSLEY
line: What?!

name: SHERLOCK
line: That’s right. Her real name is Greta Bengtsdotter. (He goes into quick fire mode.) Swedish by birth and probably the most dangerous spy in the world. She’s been operating deep undercover for the past four years now as your wife for one reason only: to get near the American embassy which is across the road from your flat. Tomorrow the US president will be at the embassy as part of an official state visit. As the president greets members of staff, Greta Bengtsdotter, disguised as a twenty-two stone cleaner, will inject the president in the back of the neck with a dangerous new drug hidden inside a secret compartment inside her padded armpit. This drug will then render the president entirely susceptible to the will of their new master, none other than James Moriarty.

name: KINGSLEY
line: What?!

name: JOHN
line: Are you serious?

name: SHERLOCK
line: No, of course not. (He stands up and walks towards the door.) His wife left him because his breath stinks and he likes to wear her lingerie.

name: KINGSLEY
line: I don’t!

name: KINGSLEY
line: Just the bras.

name: JOHN
line: So. What’s this all about, then?

name: SHERLOCK
line: Having fun.

name: JOHN
line: Fun?

name: SHERLOCK
line: While I can.

name: JOHN
line: Mm-hm.

name: HOPKINS
line: Uh, Sherlock ...

name: HOPKINS
line: Uh, but, uh ...

name: SHERLOCK
line: Go!

name: SHERLOCK
line: Oh, this had better be good.

name: LESTRADE
line: Oh, I think you’ll like it.

name: JOHN
line: That is the bust, isn’t it? The one that was broken.

name: LESTRADE
line: No, it isn’t. It’s another one; different owner, different part of town. You were right! This is a ... this is a thing. Something’s going on.

name: LESTRADE
line: What’s wrong? I thought you’d be pleased.

name: SHERLOCK
line: I am pleased.

name: LESTRADE
line: You don’t look pleased.

name: SHERLOCK
line: And the game is on.

name: LESTRADE
line: Another two have been smashed since the Welsborough one: one belonging to Mr Mohandes Hassan ...

name: JOHN
line: Identical busts?

name: LESTRADE
line: Yeah; and this one to a Doctor Barnicot in Holborn. Three in total. (He looks at his watch.) God knows who’d wanna do something like this.

name: JOHN
line: Yeah, well some people have that complex, don’t they – an idée fixe. (Walking closer to the table he looks pointedly at Sherlock.) They obsess over one thing and they can’t let it go.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Ooh.

name: JOHN
line: What?

name: SHERLOCK
line: Blood. (He puts the plaster under the ’scope and looks at it through the lenses.) Quite a bit of it, too.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Was there any injury at the crime scene?

name: LESTRADE
line: Nah. (He looks at his watch again.)

name: SHERLOCK
line: Come on.

name: LESTRADE
line: Holborn?

name: SHERLOCK
line: Lambeth.

name: LESTRADE
line: Lambeth? Why?

name: SHERLOCK
line: To see Toby.

name: JOHN
line: Ah, right. Who?

name: SHERLOCK
line: You’ll see.

name: JOHN
line: Right. (To Greg) You coming?

name: SHERLOCK
line: No. He’s got a lunch date with a brunette forensic officer that he doesn’t want to be late for. (He gets up and starts putting on his jacket.)

name: LESTRADE
line: Who told you?

name: SHERLOCK
line: The right sleeve of your jacket ... (A close-up shows that there are long human hairs on the sleeve) ... plus the formaldehyde mixed with your cologne ...

name: SHERLOCK
line: ... and your complete inability to stop looking at your watch. Have a good time.

name: LESTRADE
line: I will.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Trust me, though, she’s not right for you.

name: LESTRADE
line: Well, thank you, Mystic Meg(!)

name: JOHN
line: How’d you work all that out?

name: JOHN
line: Are you just making this up?

name: SHERLOCK
line: Possibly.

name: JOHN
line: Who’s Toby?

name: JOHN
line: So, how does that help us?

name: SHERLOCK
line: What?

name: JOHN
line: Toby the hacker.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Toby’s not the hacker.

name: JOHN
line: What?

name: SHERLOCK
line: All right, Craig?

name: JOHN
line: So I see.

name: MARY
line: Hiya!

name: JOHN
line: Mary, what are you ...?

name: JOHN
line: No, we-we agreed we would never bring Rosie out on a case.

name: MARY
line: No, exactly, so ... (she hands the baby to John) ... don’t wait up. (She looks across to Sherlock.) Hey, Sherlock.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Hey.

name: JOHN
line: But ... Mary, what are you doing here?

name: SHERLOCK
line: She’s better at this than you.

name: JOHN
line: Better?

name: SHERLOCK
line: So I texted her.

name: JOHN
line: Hang on. Mary’s better than me?

name: SHERLOCK
line: Well, she is a retired super-agent with a terrifying skill set. Of course she’s better.

name: JOHN
line: Yeah, okay.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Nothing personal.

name: JOHN
line: What, so I’m supposed to just go home now, am I?

name: MARY
line: Oh, what do you think, Sherlock? Shall we take him with us?

name: SHERLOCK
line: John or the dog?

name: JOHN
line: Ha-ha, that’s funny.

name: MARY
line: He’s handy and loyal.

name: JOHN
line: That’s hilarious.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Mm.

name: MARY
line: Aww! (Smiling, she points to herself.)

name: SHERLOCK
line: Barnicot’s house, then. Anyone up for a trudge?

name: SHERLOCK
line: Keep up. He’s fast.

name: JOHN
line: He’s not moving.

name: SHERLOCK
line: He’s thinking.

name: JOHN
line: He’s really not moving.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Slow but sure, John; not dissimilar to yourself.

name: JOHN
line: You just like this dog, don’t you?

name: SHERLOCK
line: Well, I like you.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Fascinating.

name: H
line: GROUP A -VE.’ On they go, Toby now smelling the chemical elements of ‘WHISKEY’ as they run past a church.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Well? What do you make of it?

name: MARY
line: They were looking for something.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Yes, but it wasn’t a burglar. They came specifically for that Thatcher bust. Why?

name: SHERLOCK
line: Clever.

name: MARY
line: Well, if you were wounded and you knew you were leaving a trail, where would you go?

name: JOHN
line: Like hiding a tree in a forest.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Or blood in a butchers’.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Never mind, Toby. Better luck next time, hm?

name: SHERLOCK
line: This is it, though. This is the one. (He stands up.) I can feel it.

name: JOHN
line: Not Moriarty?

name: SHERLOCK
line: It has to be him. It’s too bizarre; it’s too baroque. (He continues to look around the area, his face alight with excitement.) It’s designed to beguile me, tease me, lure me in. At last – a noose for me to put my neck into.

name: MARY
line: You should have seen the state of the front room. It was like ‘The Exorcist.’

name: JOHN
line: Hm! Was Rosie’s head spinning round?

name: MARY
line: No. Just the projectile vomiting.

name: JOHN
line: Nice(!)

name: MARY
line: Hm! No, you’d think we’d have noticed when she was born.

name: JOHN
line: Hm? Noticed what?

name: MARY
line: The little ‘666’ on her forehead.

name: JOHN
line: That’s ‘The Omen.’

name: MARY
line: So?

name: JOHN
line: Well, you said it was like ‘The Exorcist.’ They’re two different things. She can’t be the Devil and the Antichrist.

name: MARY
line: Yeah, can’t she?

name: MARY
line: Coming, darling.

name: MARY
line: Mummy’s coming.

name: CRAIG
line: Have you heard of that thing, in Germany?

name: SHERLOCK
line: You’re going to have to be more specific, Craig.

name: CRAIG
line: ‘Ostalgie.’ People who miss the old days under the Communists. People are weird, aren’t they?

name: SHERLOCK
line: Mm. (He narrows his eyes momentarily.)

name: CRAIG
line: According to this, there’s quite a market for Cold War memorabilia – Thatcher, Reagan, Stalin. (He smiles.) Time’s a great leveller, innit? Thatcher’s like – I dunno – Napoleon now.

name: CRAIG
line: I’ve got into the records of the suppliers – Gelder & Co. Seems they’re from Georgia.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Where exactly?

name: CRAIG
line: Uh, Tbilisi. Batch of six.

name: CRAIG
line: One to Welsborough; one to Hassan; one to Doctor Barnicot. Two to Miss Orrie Harker ...

name: CRAIG
line: ... one to a Mr Jack Sandeford of Reading.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Lestrade, another one?

name: SHERLOCK
line: Harker or Sandeford?

name: LESTRADE
line: Harker. And it’s murder this time.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Hm, that perks things up a bit.

name: LESTRADE
line: Defensive wounds on her face and hands. Throat cut – sharp blade.

name: SHERLOCK
line: The same thing inside the house? The bust?

name: LESTRADE
line: Two of them this time.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Interesting. That batch of statues was made in Tbilisi several years ago – limited edition of six.

name: LESTRADE
line: And now someone’s wandering about destroying ’em all. Makes no sense. What’s the point?

name: SHERLOCK
line: No, they’re not destroying them. That’s not what’s happening.

name: LESTRADE
line: Yes it is.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Well, it is what’s happening, but it’s not the point. I’ve been slow; far too slow.

name: LESTRADE
line: Well, I’m still being slow over here, so if you wouldn’t mind ...

name: SHERLOCK
line: Slow but lucky; very lucky. And since they smashed both busts, our luck might just hold. Jack Sandeford of Reading is where I’m going next. Congratulations, by the way.

name: LESTRADE
line: I’m sorry?

name: SHERLOCK
line: Well, you’re about to solve a big one.

name: LESTRADE
line: Yeah, until John publishes his blog.

name: SANDEFORD
line: That’s enough now, love.

name: SANDEFORD
line: Daddy has things to do, I’m afraid.

name: SANDEFORD
line: And you need to get to bed! Come on!

name: SHERLOCK
line: Wouldn’t it be much simpler to take out your grievances at the polling station?

name: SHERLOCK
line: You were on the run; nowhere to hide your precious cargo.

name: SHERLOCK
line: You find yourself in a workshop. Plaster busts of The Iron Lady drying. It’s clever, very clever. But now you’ve met me, and you’re not so clever, are you?

name: THE INTRUDER
line: Who are you?

name: SHERLOCK
line: My name is Sherlock Holmes.

name: THE INTRUDER
line: Goodbye, Sherlock Holmes.

name: SHERLOCK
line: You’re out of time. Tell me about your boss, Moriarty.

name: THE INTRUDER
line: You think you understand. You understand nothing.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Well, before the police come in and spoil things, why don’t we just enjoy the moment?

name: SHERLOCK
line: Let me present Interpol’s number one case. Too tough for them; too boring for me.

name: SHERLOCK
line: The Black Pearl of the Borgias.

name: MARY
line: Everything about who I was is on there.

name: SHERLOCK
line: I don’t understand.

name: SHERLOCK
line: She ... she destroyed it.

name: THE INTRUDER
line: “She.”

name: THE INTRUDER
line: You know her.

name: THE INTRUDER
line: You do, don’t you? You know the bitch. She betrayed me; betrayed us all.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Mary. This is about Mary.

name: THE INTRUDER
line: Is that what she’s calling herself now, eh?

name: THE INTRUDER
line: Give it to me.

name: THE INTRUDER
line: Nobody shoots me! Anyone shoots, I kill this man!

name: THE INTRUDER
line: You’re policemen. I’m a professional.

name: THE INTRUDER
line: Tell her she’s a dead woman. She’s a dead woman walking.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Not a policeman.

name: AMBASSADOR
line: What do you think? Mate in two?

name: HUSBAND
line: Don’t antagonise them, darling.

name: AMBASSADOR
line: Oh, what else is there to do? Chess palls after three months.

name: AMBASSADOR
line: Everything palls.

name: HUSBAND
line: They’ll send someone soon.

name: AMBASSADOR
line: “They”? Who are “they”? Seems to me we’ve put an awful lot of faith in “they.” Well, I’ve got something “they” would dearly love if only we could get out of here.

name: AMBASSADOR
line: I’ve got Ammo.

name: HUSBAND
line: Ammo?

name: MARY
line: Madam Ambassador.

name: AMBASSADOR
line: What took you so long?

name: MARY
line: Can’t get the staff.

name: OPERATIVE
line: Everyone out! Now!

name: THAT MAN
line: What now? What do we do?

name: MARY
line: We die.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Well?

name: LESTRADE
line: He can’t have got far. We’ll have him in a bit.

name: SHERLOCK
line: I very much doubt it.

name: LESTRADE
line: Why?

name: GOLD TEETH MAN
line: Ammo. Ammo. Ammo.

name: GOLD TEETH MAN
line: Ammo. Ammo. Ammo-o-o-o-o.

name: GUARD
line: What would you do to a traitor?  Maybe we’ll tell him one day. If he lives that long.

name: s note
line: one of my beta team flailed over the fact that the unseen person being flogged was tall and thin and had long floppy hair. When she pointed it out to me I joined in with the flailing, remembering someone else of that description who got himself beaten in a foreign country. Additionally, during later footage of the same embassy firefight we see glimpses of both of the other team members, and each of them has short hair.

name: home
line: there’s a tatty sofa and a couple of hard plastic chairs, and a couple of desks, one of which has an open laptop and anglepoise lamp on it. A few other lights are dotted around the room but it’s still quite dark in there. The person pushes back the hood of their coat and we realise that it’s Mary.

name: SHERLOCK
line: I was so convinced it was Moriarty, I couldn’t see what was right under my nose.

name: SHERLOCK
line: I expected a pearl.

name: MARY
line: Oh my God. That’s a ...

name: SHERLOCK
line: Yes, it’s an AGRA memory stick like you gave John, except this one belongs to someone else. Who?

name: SHERLOCK
line: I glanced at it, but I’d prefer to hear it from you.

name: MARY
line: Why?

name: SHERLOCK
line: Because I’ll know the truth when I hear it.

name: MARY
line: There were four of us. Agents.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Not just agents.

name: MARY
line: Polite term. Alex; Gabriel; me; and Ajay.

name: MARY
line: There was absolute trust between us. The memory sticks guaranteed it. We all had one, each containing aliases, our background, everything. We could never be betrayed because we had everything we needed to destroy the other.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Who employed you?

name: MARY
line: Anyone who paid well. I mean, we were at the top of our game for years, and then it all ended. There was a coup in Georgia. The British embassy in Tbilisi was taken over; lots of hostages. We got the call to go in, get them out. There was a change of plan, a last-minute adjustment.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Who from?

name: MARY
line: I don’t know. Just another voice on the phone, and a code word, “Ammo.”

name: SHERLOCK
line: “Ammo”?

name: MARY
line: Like ‘ammunition.’ We went in, but then something went wrong. Something went really wrong.

name: SHERLOCK
line: No.

name: MARY
line: What?

name: SHERLOCK
line: I met someone tonight: the same someone who’s looking for the sixth Thatcher.

name: MARY
line: Oh my God. That’s Ajay. That’s him. What, he’s alive?

name: SHERLOCK
line: Yeah, very much so. (He touches his hand to the bruise under his eye.)

name: MARY
line: Where is he? I need to see him now!

name: MARY
line: Yeah, of course. It was our insurance. Above all, they mustn’t fall into enemy hands.

name: SHERLOCK
line: So Ajay survived as well, and now he’s looking for the memory stick he managed to hide with all of AGRA’s old aliases on it. But why?

name: MARY
line: I don’t know!

name: SHERLOCK
line: Tbilisi was six years ago. Where’s he been?

name: SHERLOCK
line: Mary, I’m sorry to tell you this, but he wants you dead.

name: SHERLOCK
line: I heard it from his own mouth. “Tell her she’s a dead woman walking.”

name: MARY
line: Why would he want to kill me?

name: SHERLOCK
line: He said you betrayed him.

name: MARY
line: Oh, no, no, that’s insane.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Well, it’s what he believes.

name: MARY
line: I suppose I was always afraid this might happen; that something in my past would come back to haunt me one day.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Yes, well he’s a very tangible ghost.

name: MARY
line: God, I just wanted a bit of peace, and I really thought I had it.

name: SHERLOCK
line: To look after the three of you.

name: MARY
line: Sherlock the dragon slayer.

name: MARY
line: There’s something I think you should read.

name: SHERLOCK
line: What is it?

name: MARY
line: I hoped I wouldn’t have to do this.

name: SHERLOCK
line: What are you ...?

name: SHERLOCK
line: Oh, no.

name: MARY
line: It’s all right. It’s for the best, believe me.

name: MARY
line: You just look after them ’til I get back. I’m sorry.

name: s note
line: a later episode confirms the lyrics of the song, which are:

name: MYCROFT
line: Agra? A city on the banks of the river Yamuna in the northern state of Uttar Pradesh, India. It is three hundred and seventy-eight kilometres west of the state capital, Lucknow ...

name: SHERLOCK
line: AGRA is an acronym.

name: MYCROFT
line: Oh, good. I love an acronym. All the best secret societies have them.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Team of agents, the best. But you know all that.

name: MYCROFT
line: Of course I do. Go on.

name: SHERLOCK
line: One of them, Ajay, is looking for Mary, also one of the team.

name: MYCROFT
line: Indeed? Well, that’s news to me.

name: SHERLOCK
line: He’s already killed looking for that memory stick. AGRA always worked for the highest bidder. I thought that might include you.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Well, I mean the British government or whatever government you’re currently propping up.

name: MYCROFT
line: AGRA were very reliable; then came the Tbilisi incident. They were sent in to free the hostages but it all went horribly wrong. And that was that. We stopped using freelancers.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Your initiative?

name: MYCROFT
line: My initiative. Freelancers are too woolly; too messy. I don’t like loose ends – not on my watch.

name: SHERLOCK
line: There was something else; a detail, a code word.

name: The overlaid text on the screen flips to show the letters in reverse
line: “OMMA.” Mycroft frowns at the notepad.)

name: MYCROFT
line: “AMMO”?

name: SHERLOCK
line: It’s all I’ve got.

name: MYCROFT
line: Little enough.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Could you do some digging, as a favour?

name: MYCROFT
line: And if you can find who’s after her and neutralise them, what then? You think you can go on saving her forever?

name: MYCROFT
line: Is that sentiment talking?

name: SHERLOCK
line: No. It’s me.

name: MYCROFT
line: Difficult to tell the difference these days.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Told you: I made a promise, a vow.

name: brother mine
line: agents like Mary tend not to reach retirement age. They get retired in a pretty permanent sort of way.

name: MARY
line: Pardon me. I can hear a squeaking. Can you hear a squeaking?

name: MARY
line: Only I watched a documentary on the Discovery Channel.

name: MARY
line: “Why Planes Fail.” Did you see it?

name: PASSENGER
line: Can’t say I did.

name: MARY
line: Oh, truly terrifying. Swore I would never fly again, yet here I am!

name: FLIGHT ATTENDANT
line: Everything okay, madam?

name: MARY
line: No! No, no, it’s not, but then what’s the use in complaining? I hear a squeaking. Probably the wing’ll come off, is all.

name: FLIGHT ATTENDANT
line: Everything’s fine, I promise you. Just relax.

name: MARY
line: It was okay, I guess, but did somebody hide the sun? (She takes off her sunglasses.) Did you lose it in the war?

name: MARY
line: I think I’m dying. I don’t feel so good.

name: MARY
line: Oh ... (she reaches out and cup’s the woman’s cheek) ... you’re sweet. (She strokes her cheek.) You have a very kind face. God will smile on you. (She grizzles, then raises her other hand towards her mouth.

name: s note
line: a million thanks to the two anonymous commenters who pointed out that the boat from which Mary disembarks is named “Flekkete Bånd” which deliciously translates from Norwegian to “Speckled Band”; and that the name of the boat behind it is “Løvens Manke” which translates to “Lion’s Mane.” Sometimes I could hug Mofftiss so hard that their eyes would pop out of their heads.]

name: KARIM
