line: Master Bun. It’s not a set without him. How many more times, Mr Sherlock?

name: SHERLOCK
line: Happy families.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Nice trip?

name: MARY
line: How the f...

name: MARY
line: How did you get in here?!

name: SHERLOCK
line: Karim let me in.

name: KARIM
line: Hello.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Karim, would you be so kind as to fetch us some tea?

name: KARIM
line: Sure.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Thank you.

name: KARIM
line: Nice to meet you, missus.

name: MARY
line: No, really, though, how? Every movement I made was entirely random; every new personality just on the roll of a dice!

name: SHERLOCK
line: Mary, no human action is ever truly random. (Quick fire) An advanced grasp of the mathematics of probability mapped onto a thorough apprehension of human psychology and the known dispositions of any given individual can reduce the number of variables considerably.

name: SHERLOCK
line: But they’re really difficult, so instead I just ... stuck a tracer on the inside of the memory stick.

name: MARY
line: Oh, you bastard!

name: MARY
line: You bastard!

name: SHERLOCK
line: I know, but your face!

name: MARY
line: “The mathematics of probability”?!

name: SHERLOCK
line: You believed that.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Yes. I started to run out about then.

name: MARY
line: In the memory stick!

name: JOHN
line: AGRA.

name: MARY
line: Yes.

name: JOHN
line: Mm-hm. You said it was your initials.

name: MARY
line: In a way, that was true.

name: JOHN
line: In a way?

name: JOHN
line: So many lies.

name: MARY
line: I’m so sorry.

name: JOHN
line: I don’t just mean you.

name: MARY
line: What?

name: JOHN
line: Alex, Gabriel, Ajay ... You’re ‘R.’

name: JOHN
line: Rosamund.

name: MARY
line: I always liked ‘Mary.’

name: JOHN
line: I used to.

name: MARY
line: I ju... I didn’t know what else to do.

name: s what couples are supposed to do
line: work things through.

name: MARY
line: Yes. (She nods.) Yes, of course.

name: MARY
line: All the time. You’re always a good man, John. I’ve never doubted that. You never judge; you never complain. I don’t deserve you. I ...

name: MARY
line: All I ever wanted to do was keep you and Rosie safe, that’s all.

name: SHERLOCK
line: I will keep you safe.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Come home and everything will be all right, I promise you.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Get down!

name: AJAY
line: Hello again.

name: MARY
line: Ajay?

name: AJAY
line: Oh, you remember me. I’m touched.

name: MARY
line: Look, I thought you were dead, believe me, I did.

name: AJAY
line: I’ve been looking forward to this for longer than you can imagine.

name: MARY
line: I swear to you, I thought you were dead. I thought I was the only one who got out.

name: SHERLOCK
line: How did you find us?

name: AJAY
line: By following you, Sherlock Holmes. I mean, you’re clever – you found her – but I found you, so perhaps not so clever. And now here we are, at last.

name: AJAY
line: Touché.

name: JOHN
line: Listen: whatever you think you know, we can talk about this. We can work it out.

name: AJAY
line: She thought I was dead. I might as well have been.

name: MARY
line: It was always just the four of us, always, remember?

name: AJAY
line: Oh yeah.

name: MARY
line: So why d’you want to kill me?

name: AJAY
line: D’you know how long they kept me prisoner; what they did to me? They tortured Alex to death. (He breathes out a brief sigh.) I can still hear the sound of his back breaking.

name: AJAY
line: But you, you – where were you?

name: MARY
line: That day at the embassy, I escaped.

name: MARY
line: But I lost sight of you too, so you explain: where were you?

name: AJAY
line: Oh, I got out ... for a while.

name: AJAY
line: Long enough to hide my memory stick.

name: AJAY
line: I didn’t want that to fall into their hands.

name: AJAY
line: I was loyal, you see; loyal to my friends. But they took me, tortured me. Not for information.

name: AJAY
line: Not for anything except fun.

name: AJAY
line: Oh, they thought I’d give in, die, but I didn’t. I lived, and eventually they forgot about me just rotting in a cell somewhere. Six years they kept me there, until one day I saw my chance. Oh, and I-I made them pay. You know, all the time I was there, I just kept picking up things – little whispers, laughter, gossip: how the clever agents had been betrayed.

name: AJAY
line: Brought down by you.

name: MARY
line: Me?

name: AJAY
line: I’ve dreamed of killing you every night for six years ...

name: MARY
line: I swear to you, Ajay.

name: AJAY

name: AJAY
line: Ammo. Every day as they tore into me. Ammo. Ammo. (His voice starts to tremble.) Ammo. (He takes in a shaky breath.) Ammo.

name: SHERLOCK

name: AJAY

s note
line: For the sake of completeness, I should add that an advertising hoarding on the bus stop shows something which is almost definitely a flag for something in one or both of the future episodes. If you’re avoiding potential spoilers, skip to the next paragraph.

name: LADY SMALLWOOD
line: This is absolutely ridiculous and you know it. How many more times?

line: Mycroft, we’ve known each other a long time. I promise you, I haven’t the foggiest idea what all this is about. You wound up AGRA and all the other freelancers. (Slowly, emphatically) I haven’t done any of the things you’re accusing me of. Not one. (Even more emphatically) Not. One.

name: TANNOY ANNOUNCEMENT
line: Ladies and gentlemen, the Aquarium will be closing in five minutes. Please make your way to the exit. Thank you.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Your office said I’d find you here.

name: VIVIAN
line: This was always my favourite spot for agents to meet. (She continues looking forward into a tank of sharks and other smaller fish.) We’re like them: ghostly, living in the shadows.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Predatory.

name: VIVIAN
line: Well, it depends which side you’re on. (She turns away to look into the shark tank again.) Also, we have to keep moving or we die.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Nice location for the final act. Couldn’t have chosen it better myself. But then I never could resist a touch of the dramatic.

name: VIVIAN
line: I just come here to look at the fish.

name: VIVIAN
line: I knew this would happen one day.

name: VIVIAN
line: It’s like that old story.

name: SHERLOCK
line: I really am a very busy man. Would you mind cutting to the chase?

name: VIVIAN
line: You’re very sure of yourself, aren’t you?

name: VIVIAN
line: There was once a merchant in a famous market in Baghdad.

name: SHERLOCK
line: I really have never liked this story.

name: VIVIAN
line: I’m just like the merchant in the story. I thought I could outrun the inevitable. I’ve always been looking over my shoulder; always expecting to see the grim figure of ...

name: MARY
line: ... Death.

name: MARY

name: SHERLOCK

name: SHERLOCK

name: SHERLOCK
line: Using AGRA as her private assassination unit.

name: VIVIAN
line: Why does anyone do anything?

name: SHERLOCK
line: Oh, let me guess. Selling secrets?

name: VIVIAN
line: Well, it would be churlish to refuse. Worked very well for a few years. I bought a nice cottage in Cornwall on the back of it. But the ambassador in Tbilisi found out. I thought I’d had it. (She looks towards Mary before returning her gaze to Sherlock.) Then she was taken hostage in that coup. (She laughs.) I couldn’t believe my luck! That bought me a little time.

name: SHERLOCK
line: But then you found out your boss had sent AGRA in.

name: VIVIAN
line: Very handy. They were always such reliable killers.

name: SHERLOCK
line: What you didn’t know, Mary, was that this one also tipped off the hostage-takers.

name: MARY
line: And you thought your troubles were over.

name: VIVIAN
line: I was tired; tired of the mess of it all. (She sighs.) I just wanted some peace, some clarity. The hostages were killed, AGRA too ... (she looks across to Mary) ... or so I thought. My secret was safe. But apparently not. Just a little peace. That’s all you wanted too, wasn’t it? A family, home. Really, I understand.

name: VIVIAN
line: So just let me get out of here, right? Let me just walk away. I’ll vanish. I’ll go forever. What d’you say?

name: MARY

line: I was never a field agent. I always thought I’d be rather good.

line: Can’t have been easy all those years, sitting in the back keeping your mouth shut when you knew you were cleverer than most of the people in the room.

name: SHERLOCK

name: too
line: the slight tremor in your hand ... (there’s a close-up of her slightly shaking gun hand, then a close-up of her mouth) ... the red wine stain ghosting your top lip. So yes. I say jealousy was your motive after all – to prove how good you are ...

name: SHERLOCK

name: MARY
line: So, this is in case ... (she smiles awkwardly at the camera) ... in case the day comes. If you are watching this, I’m ... probably dead. I hope I can have an ordinary life, but who knows? Nothing’s certain; nothing’s written. My old life – it was full of consequences. (She smiles briefly.) The danger was the fun part, but you can’t outrun that forever. (She gestures towards the camera.) You need to remember that, so ... I’m giving you a case, Sherlock.

name: MARY

line: Oh, I suppose I was just ... looking away. (He laughs nervously.)

name: THERAPIST

name: THERAPIST
line: Do you talk to Sherlock Holmes?

name: JOHN
line: I haven’t seen him. No-one’s seen him. He’s locked himself away in his flat. God knows what he’s up to.

name: THERAPIST

name: JOHN

name: IVAN
line: Something on your mind?

name: SMITH

line: Whatever you tell us stays in this room. I think I speak for everyone.

name: FAITH
line: Well? What is the worst thing you could do?

name: SMITH
line: Tell them your darkest secret. (He narrows his eyes.) Because if you tell them and they decide they’d rather not know, you can’t take it back. You can’t unsay it. (He smiles briefly.) Once you’ve opened your heart, you can’t close it again.

name: SMITH
line: I’m kidding!

name: SMITH
line: Of course you can.

name: SMITH
line: Well, everyone, please, roll up your right sleeves. Roll up your right sleeves. Come on.

name: SMITH
line: Oh, i-it’s, uh, it’s a bit of insurance.

name: FAITH
line: I don’t understand. (She points to the drug stand nearest to her.) What is that?

name: FAITH
line: One of yours?

name: IVAN
line: We make it, my company – TD12. Sells mainly to dentists and hospitals for minor surgical procedures. Interferes with ...

name: IVAN
line: ... the memory.

name: SMITH
line: I-I-I want to thank you, Ivan, for allowing me to use it.

name: IVAN
line: Well, I didn’t exactly know who you were going to be using it on.

name: FAITH
line: You mean you didn’t ask?

name: THE OTHER FEMALE GUEST
line: This is obscene.

name: SMITH
line: All I’m doing, Faith, dear ... (he walks behind her and turns her chair slightly so that she can look at him) ... is getting something off my chest ... (he bends and takes her right wrist) ... without getting it on yours.

name: SMITH
line: What you’re about to hear me say may horrify you, but you will forget it.

name: SMITH
line: These drip feeds will keep the drug in your bloodstreams at exactly the right levels.

name: SMITH
line: Nothing that is happening to you now will stay with you for more than a few minutes. (More quietly) I’m afraid that some of the memories you’ve had up to this point might also be ...

name: SMITH
line: ... corrupted.

name: SMITH
line: I’m going to share something with you now; something personal and of importance to me.

name: SMITH
line: I have a need to confess, but you – I think – might have a need to forget. (He chuckles.) By the end of this, you’ll be free to go. And don’t worry – by the time you’re back in the outside world, you will not remember any of what you’ve heard.

name: FAITH
line: Ignorance is bliss.

name: SMITH
line: Well, what’s wrong with bliss?!

name: SMITH
line: Please, be aware that one of you is a high-ranking police officer.

name: SMITH
line: One of you is a member of the judiciary.

name: SMITH
line: One of you sits on the board of a prominent broadcaster.

name: SMITH
line: Two of you work for me and one of you, of course, is my lovely daughter, Faith.

name: SMITH
line: You are the people I need to hear me. I have made millions, for myself, for the people round this table, for millions of people I’ve never even met.

name: FAITH

name: FAITH
line: No. Why-why do you ask?

name: SHERLOCK

name: s note
line: ‘dmellieon’ on Tumblr suggested that the way that the ‘chalk’ disperses looks more like salt or sugar or could even be cocaine or powdered meth crystals. While I’m thrilled with that deduction, I’ll continue to refer to it as ‘chalk’ simply to save repeating lots of possible alternatives.]

name: FAITH
line: Are you okay?

name: SHERLOCK
line: Cost-cutting’s clearly a priority for you. Look at the size of your kitchen: teeny-tiny. (He walks past her towards the right-hand window then turns back to her.) Must be a bit annoying when you’re such a keen cook.

name: FAITH
line: I don’t understand.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Hang on a minute ... (he turns to the window) ... I was looking out of the window. Why was I doing that?

name: FAITH
line: I don’t know!

name: SHERLOCK
line: Me either. Must have had a reason. (He shakes his head and turns around.) It’ll come back to me.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Presumably you downsized when you ... when you left your job ... (he raises the paper to his mouth and bites into the edge of it) ... and maybe when you ended your relationship.

name: FAITH
line: You can’t know that.

line: ’Course I can. There wasn’t anything physical going on, was there? (He holds up the paper and starts to run his fingers along the fold.) Quite some time, in fact.

name: SHERLOCK
line: There, see? It’s obvious.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Think I just did, didn’t I? (He nods.) I’m sure that was me. (He sniffs.)

name: SHERLOCK

line: My case.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Oh, it’s way too weird for me. Go to the police; they’re really excellent at dealing with this complicated sort of stuff. Tell them I sent you; that ought to get a reaction.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Night-night.

name: FAITH
line: Please.

name: FAITH
line: I have no-one else to turn to.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Yes, but I’m very busy at the moment. I have to drink a cup of tea.

name: WIGGINS
line: Is “cup of tea” code?

name: SHERLOCK
line: It’s a cup of tea.

name: WIGGINS
line: Because you might prefer some ... (he makes air-quotes with the fingers of his right hand) ... “coffee.”

name: FAITH
line: You’re my last hope.

name: WIGGINS
line: What’s bad luck?

name: WIGGINS
line: I always ’ave bad luck. It’s congenital.

name: WIGGINS
line: That’s not rude. Congenital: it just means ...

name: SHERLOCK
line: Handbag!

name: SHERLOCK
line: Off it. (Sternly, emphatically) Off it.

name: FAITH
line: Sorry? (She limps back towards him.) What? What are you talking about?

name: FAITH
line: My skirt?

name: SHERLOCK
line: Those markings. Do you see them?

name: SHERLOCK
line: You only get marks like that by trapping the hem of your skirt in a car door but they’re on the left-hand side, so you weren’t driving; you were in the passenger seat.

name: FAITH
line: I came in a taxi.

name: SHERLOCK
line: No, I didn’t, so thank you for confirming my hypothesis. Don’t really need to check that the angle’s consistent with self-harm, do I?

name: FAITH
line: No.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Then you can keep your scars. I want to see your handbag.

name: FAITH
line: Why?

name: SHERLOCK
line: It’s too heavy. You said I was your last hope and now you’re going out into the night with no plan on how you’re getting home ... and a gun.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Chips.

name: FAITH
line: Chips?

name: SHERLOCK
line: You’re suicidal. You’re allowed chips, trust me. It’s about the only perk.

name: SHERLOCK
line: I think I remember the way. (He points to the front door.) It’s through there, isn’t it?

name: SHERLOCK
line: Yeah, well, I’ve got a friend with me, so ...

name: MRS HUDSON
line: What friend?

name: SHERLOCK
line: ’Bye!

name: SHERLOCK
line: Come on.

name: SMITH
line: I’m Culverton Smith, and in this election year I’ll be voting ...

name: MYCROFT
line: For God’s sake. I was talking to the prime minister.

name: MAN
line: He’s left his flat.

name: SHERLOCK
line: You see the fold in the middle? For the first few months you kept this hidden, folded inside a book.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Must have been a tightly packed shelf, going by the severity of the crease.

name: SHERLOCK
line: So obviously you were keeping it hidden from someone living in the same house at a level of intimacy where privacy could not be assumed.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Conclusion: relationship.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Not any more, though.

name: SHERLOCK
line: There’s a pinprick at the top of the paper.

name: SHERLOCK
line: For the past few months it’s been on open display on a wall. Conclusion: relationship is over.

name: SHERLOCK
line: The paper’s been exposed to steam and a variety of cooking smells ...

name: SHERLOCK
line: ... so it must have been on display in the kitchen. (He lifts the paper to his nose and sniffs it.) Lots of different spices. You’re suicidal, alone and strapped for cash, yet you’re still cooking to impress. You’re keen, then. The kitchen is the most public room in any house, but since any visitor could be expected to ask about a note like this, I have to assume you don’t have any. You’ve isolated yourself.

name: FAITH
line: Amazing.

name: SHERLOCK
line: I know.

name: FAITH
line: I meant the chips.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Let’s go for a walk.

name: MARY
line: You should answer it.

name: JOHN
line: It’s Mycroft.

name: MARY
line: Might be about Sherlock.

name: SHERLOCK
line: By instinct we place them at eye level where there’s natural light.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Now look: the sun’s only struck the bottom two thirds ... (he draws his hand horizontally across the paper one third of the way down it) ... but the line is straight, so that means we know the paper is facing the window.

name: SHERLOCK
line: But because the top section is unaffected ... (he gestures to the piece of paper) ... we know the sunlight can only be entering the room at a steep angle.

name: SHERLOCK
line: If the sunlight was able to penetrate the room when the sun was lower in the sky ...

name: SHERLOCK
line: ... then the paper would be equally faded top to bottom.

name: SHERLOCK
line: But no. It only makes it when the sun is at its zenith, so I’m betting that you live in a narrow street on the ground floor.

name: SHERLOCK
line: The room’s small.

name: FAITH
line: Oh.

name: FAITH
line: Big Brother is watching you!

name: SHERLOCK
line: Literally.

name: LADY SMALLWOOD
line: We can keep tabs. You didn’t have to come in.

name: MYCROFT
line: I was talking to the prime minister.

name: LADY SMALLWOOD
line: Oh, I see.

name: MYCROFT
line: What’s he doing? Why’s he just wandering about like a fool?

name: LADY SMALLWOOD
line: She died, Mycroft. He’s probably still in shock.

name: MYCROFT
line: Everybody dies. It’s the one thing human beings can be relied upon to do. How can it still come as a surprise to people?

name: MYCROFT
line: I have, I think, apologised extensively.

name: LADY SMALLWOOD
line: You haven’t made it up to me.

name: MYCROFT
line: And how am I supposed to do that?

name: SHERLOCK
line: I’m sorry?

name: FAITH
line: Sex. How did you know I wasn’t ... getting any?

name: SHERLOCK
line: It’s all about the blood.

name: SHERLOCK
line: This one comes from the very first night. You can see the pen marks over it. I think you discovered that pain stimulated your memory, so you tried it again later. I’m no expert, but I assume that since your lover failed to notice an increasing number of scars over a period of months, that the relationship was no longer intimate.

name: FAITH
line: How do you know he didn’t notice?

name: FAITH
line: Would he?

name: SHERLOCK
line: Wouldn’t he? Isn’t that what you people do?

name: FAITH
line: Well, that’s interesting.

name: SHERLOCK
line: What is?

name: FAITH
line: The way you think.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Superbly?

name: FAITH
line: Sweetly.

name: SHERLOCK
line: I’m not sweet; I’m just high.

name: SHERLOCK
line: This way.

name: FAITH
line: What? We just came that way.

name: SHERLOCK
line: I know. It’s a plan.

name: MYCROFT
line: What is it? What-what now?

name: MYCROFT
line: Is he with someone?

name: AGENT
line: Not sure. We keep losing visual. Mostly we’re tracking his phone.

name: SMITH
line: Don’t call us; we’ll call...

name: JOHN
line: Sorry, what?

name: MYCROFT
line: Please phone me if he gets in contact. Thank you.

name: LADY SMALLWOOD
line: Do you still speak to Sherrinford?

name: MYCROFT
line: I get regular updates.

name: LADY SMALLWOOD
line: And?

name: FAITH
line: Are we gonna walk all night?

name: SHERLOCK
line: Possibly. It’s a long word.

name: FAITH
line: What is?

name: SHERLOCK
line: “Bollocks.”

name: EVAN DAVIS
line: Culverton Smith. All this charity work: what’s in it for you?

name: SHERLOCK
line: D’you know why I’m going to take your case? Because of the one impossible thing you’ve said.

name: FAITH
line: What impossible thing?

name: SHERLOCK
line: You said your life turned on one word.

name: FAITH
line: Yes: the name of the person my father wanted to kill.

name: SHERLOCK
line: That’s the impossible thing. Just that, right there.

name: FAITH
line: What’s impossible?

name: SHERLOCK
line: Names aren’t one word. They’re always at least two. Sherlock Holmes; Faith Smith; Santa Claus; Winston Churchill; Napoleon Bonaparte. Actually, just ‘Napoleon’ would do.

name: FAITH
line: Or Elvis?

name: SHERLOCK
line: Well, I think we can rule both of them out as targets.

name: FAITH
line: Okay, I got it wrong, then. It wasn’t only one word; it can’t have been.

name: SHERLOCK
line: And you remember quite distinctly that your whole life turned on one word, so that happened, I don’t doubt it, but how can that word be a name – a name you instantly recognised that tore your world apart?

name: FAITH
line: Okay, well, how?

name: SHERLOCK
line: No idea. Yet. (He draws in a breath.) But I don’t work for free.

name: FAITH
line: D’you take cash?

name: SHERLOCK
line: Not cash, no.

name: SHERLOCK
line: “Taking your own life.” Interesting expression. Taking it from who? Oh, once it’s over, it’s not you who’ll miss it.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Your own death is something that happens to everybody else.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Your life is not your own. (His voice becomes strained.) Keep your hands off it.

name: FAITH
line: You’re not what I expected. You’re ...

name: FAITH
line: Nicer.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Than who?

name: SHERLOCK
line: Sorry, I ...

name: MOLLY
line: Anyone.

name: s VOICE
line: Than who?

name: FAITH
line: And what’s that?

name: SMITH
line: I need to kill someone.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Who?

name: SMITH
line: Anyone!

name: SHERLOCK
line: Of course!

name: SHERLOCK
line: He doesn’t want to kill one person; he wants to kill anyone. (He stares at Smith, his eyes wide.) He’s a serial killer!

name: SHERLOCK
line: He could be.

name: SMITH
line: Anyone.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Why not? Why shouldn’t he be?

name: DRIVER
line: Hey, you! What’s the matter with you?

name: DRIVER
line: Do you know where you are? Are you drunk?

name: WIGGINS
line: Shezza.

name: SHERLOCK
line: What are you doing here?

name: WIGGINS
line: You’ve ’ad too much ...

name: WIGGINS
line: ... an’ that’s me sayin’ this.

name: SMITH
line: Kill.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Serial killers.

name: SHERLOCK
line: ... powerful and necessary.

name: THERAPIST
line: ... won’t you introduce me?

name: POLICE OFFICER
line: Right, you there. Stop right where you are.

name: MRS HUDSON
line: Huh? What? (She stops momentarily, looking at the officer, then turns and continues towards the front door, holding out a hand towards John.)

name: MRS HUDSON
line: Oh, John ...

name: POLICE OFFICER
line: Do you have any idea what speed you were going at?

name: MRS HUDSON
line: Well, of course not. I was on the phone.

name: MRS HUDSON
line: Oh ... (she holds out a mobile phone to him) ... it’s for you, by the way.

name: POLICE OFFICER
line: The what?!

name: JOHN
line: Look at the state of you! Mrs H, what have you been doing?!

name: JOHN
line: What’s happened?

name: WIGGINS
line: I’m out of ’ere.

name: WIGGINS
line: ’e’s lost it.

name: SHERLOCK
line: “... once more!

name: SHERLOCK
line: “Or close the wall up ...

name: SHERLOCK
line: “... with our English dead!

name: SHERLOCK
line: “... set the teeth and stretch the nostril wide.

name: SHERLOCK
line: “... to his full height!

name: SHERLOCK
line: “... whose blood is fet from fathers of war-proof!

name: SHERLOCK
line: “And you, good yeoman, whose limbs were made in England, show us here the mettle of your pasture!

name: SHERLOCK
line: “... which I doubt not, for there is none of you so mean and base ...

name: SHERLOCK
line: “... that hath not noble lustre in your eyes!

name: SHERLOCK
line: “I see you stand like greyhounds in the slips, straining upon the start!

name: SHERLOCK
line: Can I have a cup of tea?

name: JOHN
line: Did you call the police?

name: MRS HUDSON
line: These pictures ...

name: MRS HUDSON
line: ... they’re that man on the telly, aren’t they?

name: SHERLOCK
line: What pictures?

name: SHERLOCK
line: Oh, these pictures! (He gestures towards the fireplace with the pistol.) Oh, you can see them too. (For a second, he points the gun directly at her.) That’s good.

name: THERAPIST
line: This, I think, is relevant from this morning.

name: THERAPIST
line: He’s publicly accused Mr Smith of being a serial killer.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Oh, for goodness’ sakes.

name: MRS HUDSON
line: You need to see him, John. You need to help him!

name: MRS HUDSON
line: Because I tell you something, John Watson. You will not have me.

name: JOHN
line: Have you spoken to Mycroft, Molly, uh, anyone?

name: JOHN
line: Yeah, look, okay, maybe, if I get a chance.

name: JOHN
line: I’ll try, if I’m in the area.

name: JOHN
line: I promise.

name: MRS HUDSON
line: Thank you!

name: MRS HUDSON
line: Right, then, mister. Now I need your handcuffs. I happen to know there’s a pair in the salad drawer. (She shrugs.) I’ve borrowed them before.

name: SHERLOCK
line: The woman’s out of control. I asked for a cup of tea!

name: JOHN
line: How did you get him in the boot?

name: MRS HUDSON
line: The boys from the café.

name: MRS HUDSON
line: And d’you know why they dropped you, dear?

name: MRS HUDSON
line: Because they know you.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Who’s this one? (He points at her while looking at John.) Is this a new person? I’m against new people.

name: JOHN
line: She’s my therapist.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Awesome! (He walks towards her.) D’you do block bookings?

name: JOHN
line: Whose car is that?

name: MRS HUDSON
line: That’s my car.

name: JOHN
line: How can that be your car?!

name: MRS HUDSON
line: ... and for the last bloody time, John, I’m not your housekeeper.

name: THERAPIST
line: I’m so sorry. I answered your phone. You were busy. I think you’ll want to take it.

name: JOHN
line: Yeah. Who’s this?

name: SHERLOCK
line: Get me a fresh glass of water, please. This one’s filthy.

name: SMITH
line: I mean, I’m aware of this morning’s developments.

name: JOHN
line: Well, he couldn’t have given you this one. It’s ...

name: MAN STANDING OUTSIDE
line: When you’re ready.

name: JOHN
line: When did Sherlock give you this address?

name: SMITH
line: Two weeks ago.

name: SMITH
line: Yes. Two weeks.

name: JOHN
line: How did you know where to find me?

name: MRS HUDSON
line: Oh, Sherlock told me. He’s not so difficult when you’ve got a gun on him.

name: JOHN
line: Wednesday morning I booked today’s session. Now, today is Friday. So two weeks ago – two weeks before you were abducted at gunpoint and brought here against your will ...

name: MRS HUDSON
line: How?

name: SHERLOCK
line: Because Mrs Hudson’s right. I’m burning up.

name: SHERLOCK
line: I’m at the bottom of a pit and I’m still falling and ... (he shakes his head and clenches his eyes closed) ... I’m never climbing out.

name: JOHN
line: So what has all this got to do with me?

name: SHERLOCK
line: Look at me. Can’t do it, not now. Not alone.

name: JOHN
line: You lie all the time. It’s like your mission.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Well, you’re a doctor. Examine me. (He sits down on the chair again.)

name: JOHN
line: No, I need a second opinion.

name: JOHN
line: I need the one person who – unlike me – learned to see through your bullshit long ago.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Who’s that, then? I’m sure I would have noticed.

name: JOHN
line: The last person you’d think of.

name: JOHN
line: I want you to be examined by Molly Hooper.

name: JOHN
line: D’you hear me? I said Molly Hooper.

name: JOHN
line: Like what?

name: MOLLY
line: Um, hel-hello. Is, uh ... I’m sorry, Sh-Sherlock asked me to come.

name: JOHN
line: What, two weeks ago?

name: MOLLY
line: Yeah. About two weeks.

name: SHERLOCK
line: If you’d like to know how I predict the future ...

name: MOLLY
line: Oh, well ...

name: SHERLOCK
line: Just tell me when to cough.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Hope you remembered my coat.

name: MOLLY
line: Wh...

name: MOLLY
line: I... Sorry. I didn’t know that you were gonna be here.

name: JOHN
line: Sherlock’s using again.

name: MOLLY
line: Oh God. But, um, a-are you sure?

name: JOHN
line: No. It’s Sherlock. Of course I’m not sure. (He glares towards the ambulance then speaks more quietly to Molly.) Just check him out.

name: JOHN
line: Mrs Hudson. As ever, you are amazing.

name: MRS HUDSON
line: You know that, don’t you? The game is on!

name: MRS HUDSON
line: Anything you need, any time, just ask. Anything at all!

name: JOHN
line: Thank you.

name: JOHN
line: Sometimes, can I borrow your car?

name: MRS HUDSON
line: No.

name: JOHN
line: Okay.

name: MARY
line: He knew you’d get a new therapist after I died because you’d need to change everything. That’s just what you’re like.

name: JOHN
line: Thanks.

name: MARY
line: You keep your weekends for Rosie, so you needed to see someone during working hours.

name: MARY
line: Because you’re an idiot, you don’t want anyone at the surgery knowing you’re in therapy, so that restricts you to lunchtime sessions with someone reasonably close.

name: MARY
line: Who isn’t?!

name: MARY
line: So all he needed to do was find the first available lunchtime appointment with a female therapist within cycling distance of your surgery.

name: MARY
line: My God, he knows you.

name: JOHN
line: No he doesn’t.

name: DRIVER
line: You ready, sir?

name: JOHN
line: Yes, I am.

name: MARY
line: Yeah, okay, all right, he is. (She mock-shudders.) Urgh!

name: Along the bottom of the poster it reads
SMITH
line: You know I’m a killer.

name: SMITH
line: But did you know I’m a s...

name: SMITH
line: Oh, was that me? Er, was I too good, huh?

name: CORNELIA
line: He’s here.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Basically fine.

name: MOLLY
line: I’ve seen healthier people on the slab.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Yeah but, to be fair, you work with murder victims. They tend to be quite young.

name: MOLLY
line: Not funny.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Little bit funny.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Exactly, weeks. Let’s not get ahead of ourselves.

name: MOLLY
line: I’m stressed; you’re dying.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Yeah, well, I’m ahead, then. Stress can ruin every day of your life.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Dying can only ruin one.

name: SHERLOCK
line: When have I ever been that?

name: JOHN
line: Since the day I met you.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Oh, clever boy. I’ve missed you fumbling ’round the place.

name: SHERLOCK
line: What?

name: SHERLOCK
line: ’Course it’s not a trick. It’s a plan.

name: Thirty feet and closing
line: the most significant undetected serial killer in British criminal history.

name: JOHN
line: What ... what plan?

name: SHERLOCK
line: I’m not telling you.

name: JOHN
line: Why not?

name: SHERLOCK
line: Because you won’t like it.

name: SMITH
line: Mr Holmes!

name: SMITH
line: I don’t do handshakes. (He starts to walk towards Sherlock again.) It’ll have to be a hug.

name: SHERLOCK
line: I know.

name: SMITH
line: Oh, Sherlock.

name: SMITH
line: Oh, Sherlock! (Releasing him, he steps back.) What can I say? Thanks to you ... (he turns to his entourage) ... we’re, uh, we’re everywhere!

name: MALE REPORTER
line: Mr Holmes, how did Culverton talk you into this?

name: SMITH
line: Well, he-he’s a detective. (He fakes a startled look.) Maybe I just confessed!

name: SMITH
line: Come on.

name: MALE REPORTER
line: Mr Holmes, can you put on the hat?

name: JOHN
line: Yeah, he doesn’t really wear the hat.

name: SMITH
line: Kids will be getting two of their five-a-day before they’ve even left home!

name: CORNELIA
line: Sherlock’s been amazing for us.

name: SMITH
line: And you know what makes it cool when you’re a kid?

name: SMITH
line: Dangerous.

name: SMITH
line: I’m a killer.

name: SMITH
line: You know I’m a killer.

name: SMITH
line: But did you know ...

name: SMITH
line: ... I’m a cereal killer?!

name: SMITH
line: We should bag that up, sell it. (He spits a last bit of cereal into the bin.) Make money for that on eBay.

name: JOHN
line: Has it occurred to you – anywhere in your drug-addled brain – that you’ve just been played?

name: SHERLOCK
line: Oh, yes.

name: JOHN
line: For an ad campaign.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Brilliant, isn’t it?

name: JOHN
line: Brilliant?

name: SHERLOCK
line: Safest place to hide.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Plain sight.

name: JOHN
line: Hospital?

name: CORNELIA
line: Culverton’s doing a visit. The kids would love to meet you both. I think he sort of promised.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Oh, okay.

name: CORNELIA
line: If you’d just like to come this way.

name: SMITH
line: What do you think, Mr Holmes? ‘Cereal’ killer.

name: SMITH
line: See you at the hospital.

name: SMITH
line: Have what back?

name: SHERLOCK
line: Oh, I sent and deleted a text. You might get a reply but I doubt it.

name: SMITH
line: It’s password protected.

name: SMITH
line: We’re going to have endless fun, Mr Holmes, aren’t we?

name: SHERLOCK
line: Oh no. No, not endless.

name: JOHN
line: Need another hit, do you?

name: SHERLOCK
line: I can wait until the hospital.

name: NURSE CORNISH
line: You involved much?

name: JOHN
line: Sorry?

name: NURSE CORNISH
line: Um, with Mr Holmes – Sherlock and all his cases?

name: JOHN
line: Uh, yeah. I’m John Watson.

name: JOHN
line: Doctor Watson.

name: NURSE CORNISH
line: I love his blog, don’t you?

name: JOHN
line: His blog?

name: NURSE CORNISH
line: Oh, don’t you read it?

name: JOHN
line: You mean my blog.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Say what you like about addiction; the day is full of highlights.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Psychedelic!

name: NURSE CORNISH
line: I was just saying I love your blog.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Great. I ...

name: SHERLOCK
line: It is. He writes the blog.

name: JOHN
line: Yes.

name: NURSE CORNISH
line: You write Sherlock’s blog?

name: JOHN
line: Yes.

name: NURSE CORNISH
line: It’s ... gone downhill a little bit, hasn’t it?

name: NURSE
line: Oh, my God; I love your blog!

name: SHERLOCK
line: You’re welcome!

name: SMITH
line: You all know Sherlock Holmes!

name: SHERLOCK
line: Hello!

name: SMITH
line: Oh, and Doctor Watson, of course.

name: SMITH
line: Mr Holmes. I was wondering – well ... (he turns to the kids) ... we all were, weren’t we? – maybe you could tell us about some of your cases.

name: JOHN
line: Yes.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Yes! Absolutely, yes.

name: SHERLOCK
line: The main feature of interest in the field of criminal investigation is not the sensational aspects of the crime itself, but rather the iron chain of reasoning, from cause to effect, that reveals – step by step – the solution. That’s the only truly remarkable aspect of the entire affair. Now, I will share with you the facts and evidence as they were available to me, and in this very room you will all attempt to solve the case of Blessington the Poisoner.

name: JOHN
line: I think you slightly gave away the ending.

name: JOHN
line: One of them called Blessington.

name: JOHN
line: Poison?

name: SHERLOCK
line: Okay.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Drearcliff House. Remember that one, John?

name: SHERLOCK
line: One murder, ten suspects. (He excitedly holds up his hands and splays his fingers.)

name: JOHN
line: Ten, yeah.

name: SHERLOCK
line: All of them guilty.

name: JOHN
line: Sherlock ...

name: SHERLOCK
line: Uh, wh-wh-wh-what did you call that one, John? Um, something to do with murder at the zoo.

name: JOHN
line: Yeah, I called it Murder at the Zoo.

name: SHERLOCK
line: Or-or was it The Case of the Killer Orang-Utan?

name: MARY
line: He should be wearing the hat. The kids’d love the hat.

name: ONE OF THE KIDS
line: I don’t think so.

name: SHERLOCK
line: No?

name: SMITH
line: Mr Holmes?

name: SHERLOCK
line: Good, then I’ll ... (He trails off and turns to Smith.)

name: SMITH
line: How do you catch a serial killer?

name: SHERLOCK
line: Same way you catch any other killer.

name: SMITH
line: No, but m-most killers kill someone they know.

name: SMITH
line: You’re looking for a murderer in a tiny social grouping.
